There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  The Territory Account Manager is responsible for building Commercial and Mid-Enterprise level client relationships across the Singaporean and ASEAN market. Individuals who excel at this job have the ability to prospect, develop, and close business within a timely manner while focusing on the clients’ requirements. The Territory AE’s must have the confidence and ability to negotiate and close agreements with clients and support new customers through our on-boarding process.  This role is a unique opportunity to contribute in a meaningful way to high visibility, high impact projects at a very exciting time for the company. Snowflake is an innovative, high-growth, customer-focused company in a large and growing market. If you are an energetic, self-managed professional with experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities, we’d love to hear from you.  AS A TERRITORY ACCOUNT MANAGER, YOU WILL: Achieve sales quotas for allocated accounts on a quarterly and annual basis by developing a sales strategy in the allocated territory with a target prospect list, and a regional sales plan. Your primary market will be Corporate and mid-Enterprise accounts in Singapore and partner generated opportunities across ASEAN. Develop marketing plans with the marketing team to drive revenue growth. Be the trusted advisor to the customer by understanding their existing and future IT roadmap to drive the Snowflake solution within the marketplace. Prospect qualification and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams both directly and leveraging our partner ecosystem Arrange and conduct initial Executive and CxO discussions and positioning meetings. Sales process management and opportunity closure. Ongoing account management to ensure customer satisfaction and drive additional revenue streams. Be familiar with a solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities.  WE ARE LOOK FOR SOMEONE WITH: 2 to 5+ years of full-cycle sales experience selling software or cloud-based applications to the mid-market in Singapore and preferably other ASEAN countries Emphasis on cloud, databases, business intelligence software, data warehousing, SaaS is desired. Experience hitting quota of $750k+ of ARR per year selling both directly and with the channel A track record of success in driving consistent activity, pipeline development and quota achievement. Experience determining customer requirements and presenting appropriate solutions. A pro-active, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude. Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake. jobTitle: Sales Strategy & Operations Manager, APAC (Global Clients)
description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are looking for a Sales Operations Manager to support the growth of LinkedIn’s Global Clients Program (“GCP) Business. The role is part of a team that acts as an advisor to executives in the global sales and operations teams and is responsible for helping crack the most important strategic and operational issues facing the Talent Solutions business; and will be responsible for supporting GCP’s Sales teams in APAC, in addition to taking on global work on behalf of the global GCP business.  The GCP organization supports LinkedIn’s largest and most strategic clients worldwide. This position will offer a candidate an exciting and high-profile opportunity to influence the trajectory of a significant portion of LinkedIn’s overall business, interact with some of LinkedIn’s most senior sales professionals, and lead projects with key stakeholders and cross functional partners to make data-driven decisions.  The ideal candidate will have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and will be able to handle highly sensitive, confidential, and non-routine information. We're seeking a self-starter who can recognize suboptimal processes and who will take the initiative to improve them. Using strong communication skills, the Manager will effectively collaborate with a variety of people and job functions, accomplishing tasks of high complexity and scope in a challenging and extremely fast-paced environment. The candidate is expected to produce insights that will be utilized in executive level presentations and help drive critical business decisions.  This is a people manager role. This position is based in Singapore and reports to the Senior Manager of GCP Sales Operations.  Responsibilities Include  Play a pivotal role in our annual strategic planning process by making recommendations in areas such as go-to-market strategy, how to restructure/grow teams, and improve rep productivity Lead projects with key Sales stakeholders and cross functional partners to make data-driven decisions on topics including; forecasting, growth/churn strategy, territory optimization, process improvement, sales incentive design, and product mix analysis Partner with Sales executives on operational and analytical requests, e.g. team restructuring, quota setting, territory planning, business performance analyses, etc. Establish strong working relationships with Sales leadership, Business Operations, Finance, Systems, and other cross-functional teams to achieve objectives Gain direct exposure to senior leadership, including the opportunity to present insights / recommendations to executives Manage and develop junior Sales Operations teammates Some travel required  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: BA or BS degree 5+ years work experience in Sales Operations, Management Consulting, Sales, Strategy and/or Finance 2+ years People management experience  Preferred Qualifications  Advanced quantitative or business degree preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience working in high-growth, fast-paced, performance-focused environments Experience supporting global accounts teams in SaaS businesses Experience using and developing reports, metrics and dashboards Interest in analyzing data to drive sound decision-making  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal. Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Shopkeeper of the respective Home Furnishing department, the Sales Associate provides excellent sales service to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction, ensuring the IKEA basic merchandising standards are met to give customers a positive shopping experience.  Your job scope Ensuring high level of customers’ satisfaction by assessing customers’ needs, providing information and assistance when required. Ensuring your department is clean and tidy, with items properly displayed, priced and fully stocked. Actively steering top selling and prioritized products to maximize sales. Qualifications You are customer-service oriented and passionate about driving business You are a problem-solver, independent worker and a strong team player You have strong communication and interpersonal skills You are physically fit to handle physical work and retail hours You have passion for Home furnishing and Life at home details. Additional Information  Please apply by 31 October 2021

Position Requirements:  * University Degree Holder. * Minimum of 5 years sales / business development experience in Cold Chain Logistics, Pharmaceutical or Speciality Chemical Industries. * Proven track record of sales success. * A self starter, highly motivated to develop new ideas, strategy and markets. * Ability to cope with high pressure and strict deadlines. * Sound willingness and skills to solve problems. * Strong English communication skills (additional language is an added advantage). * Highly effective presentation skills. * Willingness to travel regionally (once Covid-19 pandemic and restrictions ease).

Job Description  The Cisco Global Account Manager (GAM) is Cisco's Global Accounts Customer's single point of accountability. The GAM has the India responsibilities for developing and driving a long term elevated and intimate customer relationship, which results in profitable and predictable revenue growth and high customer loyalty.  Role The Global Account Manager has India responsibilities for developing and driving a long term elevated and intimate customer relationship, which results in profitable and predictable revenue growth and high customer loyalty Work with the Headquarter & Regional Account Team to drive adoption and execution of the global/regional strategy. Responsible for the account planning process and execution against the goal and plan. Builds demand creation, sell, delivery and ongoing support plan based on comprehensive understanding of the customer and the industry the customer operates in. Establishes strong relationships within Cisco Global Account community and coordinates Cisco resources locally The role requires a highly driven sales representative who is successful at building LoB and senior customer executive relationships and partnering them to drive growth in their business. This position requires a strong aptitude for identifying customer business needs and for building relationships with decision makers and primary influencers in the purchasing decision process. An ability to understand and work with organizations at the local as well as global level is also essential. Skills / Qualification A minimum of 5 years successful sales experience managing a large strategic account, building and developing sales relationships to a CXO level in a growing business environment such as Cisco or in a previous technology sales organization that included account managers and systems engineers. A solid understanding of direct and indirect global distribution models with a strong track record in salesis essential. Demonstrated knowledge of a process for and success with managing large accounts, including forecasting, quota attainment, sales presentations, short term, mid term, and long term opportunity management. Experienced and successful with a team selling approach across business units is a must, including successfully diagnosing and proactively resolving potential team conflict. Must have the ability to deliver business value to the account and build on key customer relationships. Demonstrate the necessary skills to negotiate issues with peers, partners and customers using a Win/Win philosophy. Position "end to end" solutions and articulate Cisco strategies to senior customer executives. Prefer a bachelors or master s degree or equivalent with a strong technical and business knowledge with complimentary skills to understand the customer’s business drivers and align to Cisco solutions  Why Cisco  WE ARE CISCO  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.  We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!  But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take the difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Computer Networking

description: Description  Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers – isn’t that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.  Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.  We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!  If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment, apply! We’re just getting started...  What's it like to work here?  "Nowhere else in the tech industry can you find a role that puts you on the frontlines of digital transformation, speaking with the world's most exciting brands to help them build the online experiences of the future. As a bonus, we let loose with fun outings to awesome restaurants and activities." - Henry, Current Account Executive, former SDR  What you'll do: Help us bring the world’s most adopted digital experimentation platform to your assigned markets Become part of our proud front-line as the first touch-point for clients, establishing long-term relationships Collaborate with Account Executives and Marketing to further develop the territories Drive targeted customer engagements with senior marketing executives Educate businesses on the value of testing and personalization through experimentation Become a specialist in SaaS solutions sales Be part of an intercultural environment with inspiring and ambitious colleagues Great support for personal development and mentorship  Qualifications: Sales experience, customer service experience or another type of client-facing experience preferred Knowledge from and insights in tech/SaaS business is preferred You take ownership of everything you do You love making a direct impact You are a keen communicator and love to meet new people You are passionate about technology and online business You are a self-starter with a growth mindset You are solutions-oriented and not afraid to speak up or share an idea You are fluent in verbal and written English  Even if you meet 60% of these qualifications, we encourage you to apply! We are looking to create a diverse and multifaceted team. We embody inclusion, which is reflected in our company values where we embrace diversity and equal opportunities for everyone.  Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Improve business and family comfort, protection and productivity  Oversee new prospects and maintain existing customers to drive sales. Facilitate connection between channel partners, M&E Contractors, M&E consultants, architects, developers and users for specifications. Assess market intelligence support covering the developments going into the market place by competitors and their pricing.  Drive product sales that bring together both hardware and software products add value to the team with your expertise by driving ideas for new products, principles, theories and concepts. Help Honeywell be the customer's top choice by improving upon Product Sales solutions Work closely with the Sales Leader for the market development and growth of the Fire business in Singapore. This includes identifying & appointing key customers (Developers / Architects / Interior Designers / M&E Contractors) to increase pipeline. Manage the Fire business and the existing and new customers to grow the HBT business. Understand the local markets and identify opportunities where our businesses can succeed with current offerings in all relevant market verticals especially Residential, Data Center,Commercial, Leisure & Entertainment Hospitality, and Healthcare. Develop and execute an overall business plan with the team to achieve the growth targets set for the business in terms of Revenue and margin expansion. Coordinate sales opportunities with the correct engineering and product deliverable. Undertake regular consultant/customer visits for ongoing product and sales training, joint sales calls, and open project reviews Manage any channel/M&E contractors conflict that may arise Evaluating competitors in the local market Have the ability to execute the plans and strategies aimed at serving and expanding the customer base Accurate forecast of revenue and growth opportunities YOU MUST HAVE 3 to 5 years’ experience in Project related sales background (Fire Alarms, Public Address and Voice Evacuation Systems, Fire Suppression Systems). Bachelor's degree, or equivalent Service/ Project / Product Sales Experience would be beneficial Excellent written and oral presentation skills. Ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions clearly at all business levels. Ability to work in diverse cultural and multi lingual environments. Proactive mindset and able to work efficiently within virtual and distributed teams WE VALUE A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Product/ Project Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization Additional Information JOB ID: HRD132303 Category: Sales Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore Exempt Sales (HBT)

description: JOB PURPOSE    To be the "ambassador" who conveys the Brand's philosophy and values. As such, to be responsible to maximize the sales performance by fostering the relationship with the customers and developing their Brand loyalty, providing a unique experience in our store and guiding the client into our world.      RESPONSIBILITIES    Welcome and serve the customer providing an excellent in-store experience at all times. Maintain and develop client relationships through an individual approach, leveraging also on CRM and digital tools. Be proactively engaged in cross selling with all Departments and maximizes sales opportunity in order to achieve individual sales target and KPIs. Ensure to be up-to-date knowing fashion trends and competitors. Prove Brand and product knowledge. Deal effectively with customer complaints by liaising with the line manager when necessary. Ensure and maintain the shop floor and visual display high standard, complying with Company operational guidelines and stock procedures. Contribute to ensure a high level of security and is attentive to prevent product thefts.      KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS    Passion for human relations and sales  Problem solving, curiosity and interest in luxury/fashion, art and design  Experience of building a long-lasting relationship with clients  Being able to work in team as well as alone  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Passion and knowledge of the managed product category
industries: Apparel & Fashion and Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Job Description Account management In charge of a set of fashion accounts to groom their performance on Shopee Analyse accounts performance and operation metrics to provide solutions to optimise accounts performance Work with accounts to execute campaign and sales strategies to achieve category and accounts ambitions Work closely with internal teams including marketing, revenue, and operation teams to ensure all execution are completed successfully Engage accounts to participate in Shopee campaigns and work with them to execute and deliver campaign targets Category Management / Project Management Work with category managers to define, implement and execute growth strategy Lead in-team projects to set up improvement processes and execute new initiatives  Requirements Bachelor's degree in any field, coupled with 2 to 5 years of working experience Relevant account management and category management experience Experience in fashion industry and e-commerce industry is preferred Good communication capability and enjoy client facing work Good analytical skills A goal getter and a good team player, and not afraid to take challenges

description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market rapidly.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Acquire and Grow ShopeePay’s offline merchant network Cover end to end Merchant Acquisition cycle - from Lead Generation to Outreach, Pitch, Negotiation, Closure and Onboarding Develop and maintain a clear understanding of ShopeePay Create, maintain and manage the working relationship with merchants and collect data/feedback from merchants  Requirements A poly/university/college degree in any major At least 1-2 years of experience in sales Motivated, Resilient, Persistent Have a hunger for success Hardworking A team-player who can work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Excellent communication skills in English Experience/knowledge of the local F&B and/or retail industries will be a plus
industries: Internet

jobTitle: Account Manager, Global Client and Agency Solutions
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting or media. Experience with Google Ad products including Search, Display, Video, and Programmatic.  Preferred qualifications: Experience in discovery and management of Beta products and working with go-to-market teams. Knowledge of both brand and performance solutions, as well as familiarity with the App ecosystem in APAC. Knowledge of SQL and Data Studio. Ability to communicate Google Ads performance solutions clearly to a large team and conduct trainings independently. Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and be quick in execution.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As an Account Manager, you'll manage relationships with Google Marketing, as well as their digital agency. You will be a media advisor and consultant, developing and driving App Campaigns, Brand and Performance media strategies, and implementing robust measurement solutions to ensure success. You will help shape how Google uses Google Advertising Solutions and you’ll help establish the vision for our marketing efforts. You will be responsible for sharing approved learnings with our Sales team to help drive customer narratives in the market.  Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Manage and develop relationships with Google Marketing and Google Media Lab, and help them resolve their business challenges using Google Solutions. Support the agency in planning and execution of on-network (Video, Search, Display, Apps) campaigns. Develop forward thinking, data-driven analysis, and media recommendations that align with customer goals and quantify high-impact opportunities with clear recommendations to pitch to customers. Engage with Marketing teams to leverage learnings from Google’s campaigns to build thought leadership for our narratives. Engage with Google’s Media Lab to drive Google's Beta testing program and develop case studies.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: Hi, I’m Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative (Thai speaking) to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you’re applying, you’ll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio’s, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.   At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will:  Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers  Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors  Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there’s always something new to learn.  You are...  An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a team of high performers where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don’t throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable experiences and skills you’ll bring to Puppet  Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, but not required  Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai)  Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!  *Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you’d thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!  Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.  Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.

description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is an industry leading technology company that enables customers to go further, faster. With the industry’s most comprehensive portfolio, spanning the cloud to the data center to workplace applications, our technology and services help customers around the world make IT more efficient, more productive and more secure.  This is a great graduate opportunity for Sales Graduate to join HPE. As the Sales Specialist Graduate, he/she is passionate and interested in the channel and solutions ecosystem and how they are adapting to the big digital trends. Will work with guidance to build a strong programmatic framework for HPE and our partners.  Responsibilities Serves as the expert to the partner for standard information regarding product, services, and software transitions, promotions, and configurations. Supports sales by analyzing opportunities, and communicating sales collateral within their area of focus. Works with HPE Partners, System Integrators and Cloud Service Providers to build a strong program framework for HPE. Focus on Singapore, Korea, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Australia, NZ and ASEAN countries Knowledge And Skills Interest and passionate about technology industry Experience developing positive relationships and solving customer problems. Understanding channel sales dynamics with the ability to develop long term partnerships Education And Knowledge Experience University or Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience. Possess 0 - 1 years of selling experience. Technology Acumen: Basic awareness of current technology trends and related HPE strategy and ability to articulate same to Partner. Sales Acumen: Able to influence the partner to take actions that create increased value to HPE. Effectively exercises selling skills such as identifying potential opportunities, utilizing appropriate sales platforms and resources, and formulating and proposing solutions with the goal of expanding HPE's business. Acts with a sense of urgency to build strong customer relationships and drive solutions for the partner. Partner Industry Acumen: Basic understanding of Partner industry, trends, competitors, and the channel. Financial Acumen: Basic understanding of financial accounting concepts such as income statements, balance sheets, revenue projections, etc. to assess customer financial health, identify potential risks, and position value propositions of HPE solutions. If you are… Good at partnering, innovating, and making things happen. You are aligned to our core values. Holding an advanced university degree Established with management background, able to provide tough leadership and drive change across functions. Able to develop short-term strategies and partnerships by using market research and analysis Experienced in selling, negotiation, proposal development and account planning An exceptional communicator and presenter Join us and make your mark!  We Offer A competitive salary and extensive social benefits Diverse and dynamic work environment Work-life balance and support for career development An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it? Then let’s stay connected!  https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers  https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers  1100784  This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office  HPE is an equal opportunity employer/Female/Minority/Individual with Disabilities/Protected Veteran Status
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The Account and Partner Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.  Responsibilities Become an expert in Facebook’s digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships with senior stakeholders Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns Lead market wide programs such as strategic vertical or solution development and execution Minimum Qualification BA/BS degree 6+ years of experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Strong communication skills Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals
industries: Internet

description: Job Description Research and identify in trend products that will drive sales opportunities, and able to successfully execute and deliver according to campaigns set Selects and prioritises products based on data, timing, trend etc Modifies and reacts quickly to changing needs and business decisions Identifies continuous improvement opportunities to increase speed and collaboration across the team Analyse performance of platform and past curated collections Conducts research to understand trend for campaigns set Account managing for selected sellers  Requirements Strong interest to work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment Attention to details Ability to work independently, navigate ambiguities and problem solve Basic excel skills is a plus

description: Job Description  Procore is looking for a Sales Development Representative to join one of the highest-performing sales teams in the software industry. Our Sales Development team is an essential component of our sales model and has helped fuel our incredible growth for the past several years.  As a Sales Development Representative, you'll develop an understanding of the construction industry and Procore’s product to help improve one of the world’s largest industries. We pride ourselves on setting challenging goals and having fun achieving them together. We value our culture and are looking for optimistic and motivated people to join our team. Are you up for the challenge?  This position will report to the Senior Manager, Sales Development, and is based in Singapore. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.  What you’ll do: Create new business opportunities to fuel Procore’s growth Partner with Account Executives to achieve mutually aligned sales quotas each month Engage construction professionals through phone, email, and other channels to understand their challenges and identify opportunities to solve them Work with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to create opportunities for new business Conduct daily activities, including: Pre-call research and planning Making a high volume of calls per day Nurturing leads by following-up with previous contacts Maintaining Salesforce records What we’re looking for: Bachelor’s degree is preferred or a desire to pursue a career in Sales 1+ years of experience in software sales, specifically SaaS Will to achieve results—the curiosity and perseverance to push harder when the going gets tough Enjoy working in an ambitious collaborative environment—inspire your team to be better while achieving your goals Commitment to lifelong learning and continuous development Self-aware, reflective, and able to digest feedback critically and adapt to overcome challenges Demonstrate our core values of Ownership, Optimism, and Openness. Friendly, enthusiastic and demonstrate empathy and thoughtfulness in your work Construction industry experience, especially with a general contractor or subcontractor is a plus  Additional Information  If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.  About Us  Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  We will provide further details during the interview process on the proposed contractual arrangement and relationship you will have with Procore if you are successful in applying for this role.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Experience: 3+ years  Job Purpose  This role exists to manage the Sales Development/Lead Generation operations in Singapore. The role has ownership of generating and converting pipeline of customer for Anchanto's products.  Description  Sales Development Representative, Singapore  As a Sales Development Representative for Anchanto's products (OMS and WMS) focused on Enterprise segment, you will have the exciting opportunity to help promote the growth and shape the future of SaaS products for eCommerce players in the Retail and Logistics sector.  The ideal candidate will possess both business development and technical background that enables them to engage at with C-level executives as well as with software developers and IT architects. They should also be a self-starter, prepared to develop and execute to increase market penetration across Singapore.  Roles & Responsibilities Impact market share in the Singapore territory or industry vertical. Direct sales Development for software sales to enterprises (Brand Principals, Distributors, 3PLs, Warehousing Companies, E-distributors, Retailers) to build strong B2B SaaS business in Singapore Lead generation for a funnel pipeline: Manage entire sales cycle (as individual contributor) steps such as cold call, LinkedIn emails, personal networking etc Understand Customers' current Business and Operational processes to propose the right fit of SaaS products, Understanding the customer pain points, Map to Solutioning Demoing the Product/Solution : Product introduction SaaS platform demonstration, explanation of technical and functional capabilities, Understand and consult on a strategic and business level, available integrations and flows Assist with Contract Closure: follow-up call, sharing updates and assisting with proposal, pricing negotiation, contract signing, on-boarding and account handover to global account management teams Structured and organised to manage and update the CRM tool for effective Sales Pipeline management Business and Commercial Skills: Possess the technical ability to explain (not implement) Cloud/SaaS Solutions, Integrations, Retail, Omni-channel and eCommerce Fulfilment flows. Create & articulate compelling value propositions around Retail Solutions. Understanding of Value Based Selling and translate it into Commercial Agreements Work closely with the internal marketing team, PR team and top management to swiftly pickup lead/enquires / suspects to be put in sales processes. Other Skills: Proactive to source leads from partners, own research and other channels. Demonstrable research skills along with excellent Listening skills Self-starter and should be able to proceed with minimal supervision Excellent Verbal and written communication skills in English. Understanding and respect multi-cultural work environment Constantly give feedback to marketing on lead and funnel quality and re-align to target relevant segment Compile reports for management showing results (ROI) reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends for our products target segments Keep track of competition, pricing and promotions being offered by the competition in the market Exceed set business objectives. Work with partners (referrers, Sis, consultants, government agencies etc) to extend reach & drive adoption. Basic Qualifications: Ability to generate qualified leads and excellent cold calling skills to engage accounts The right person will possess 1-2 years of experience in B2B lead generation (IT and SaaS preferable) Prior experience in a revenue target holding role is absolutely necessity Direct field & management experience in working with corporate accounts. Would have consistently exceeded key performance metrics. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives. Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences. Excellent written, and verbal communication skills, data analysis and presentation skills in English. Experience with E-commerce Sellers, Brands and Retailer in Singapore is an added advantage Ability to work with the global team in different geographies, cultures and time zones to solve customer problems and escalate as necessary  Scope of the Role The role will have geographical coverage of Singapore
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Account Specialist/Manager  This position is accountable for execution of the sales plan / account plan developed by Division Sales Leader in order to meet set revenue and growth targets for the Oral Care Solutions Division (OCSD).  Role will report to Division Sales Leader, OCSD.  Job Responsibilities  This is a local role, where the Account Specialist/Manager is responsible to drive sales and spec-in to OCSD’s existing customers and develop new businesses. In this position, the Account Specialist/Manager will work very closely with the Business Team to deliver the following:  1. Achieve sales goals and year on year growth. 2. Initiates sales process by prospecting, scheduling of appointments, conduct clinical sales presentations, understanding business needs, develop proposals and sales closure. 3. Build customer relationships with the customers and develop these relationships in multiple levels of the organization. 4. Demonstrate a solution-oriented consultation approach to selling 5. Overcome price concerns and other objections by demonstrating value 6. Proactively identify new business opportunities and drive spec-in 7. Constantly provide Voice of Customer/Voice of channel and competitive intelligence 8. Ensures customer satisfaction standards are achieved and maintained 9. Maintain consistent communication and timely follow-up with customers and prospects and be available and responsive to customer’s real-time needs 10. Complete sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner 11. Organize in-services for customers 12. Work with distributors to achieve Sales Targets 13. Other duties may be assigned  Requirements: 1. Bachelor’s Degree or higher educational qualification from an accredited University with minimum 2 -3 years of experience in sales and preferably in a dental / healthcare setting 2. Experience with GPO’s contracts, including negotiation and distribution management is a plus 3. Must be self-motivated; energetic; results-driven and a team player 4. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills 5. Able to work under time pressure and work independently 6. Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills 7. Demonstrates impeccable sales acumen with passion and drive for success 8. Exhibits clinical and conceptual selling skills in a face-to-face and virtual settings 9. Exemplifies effectiveness in new business development and lead qualification 10. Proficient computer skills including MS Excel, PowerPoint and CRM programs 11. Ability to effectively utilize CRM to maintain and develop assigned territory or account 12. Oversees from preparation to end of dental events/exhibitions and hands-on workshops at all times, including weekends 13. Holds a valid class 3 driving license and possess own car. 14. Actively participating in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Lead, New Business Sales - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  The role: Regional Sales Lead, New Business Sales - Singapore  With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have knowledgeable, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.  Additional Role Description  New Business Sales is the high-value and strategic advertiser acquisitions team at Google, excelling in business excellence and operational excellence with an ongoing focus on customer success.  As a Regional Sales Lead, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative business skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. In this role, you'll help your teams and partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You will take an analytical approach to sales management.  You will report directly to the Director of New Business Sales, APAC, and lead the sales team focused on acquiring new advertisers in Southeast Asia.  Responsibilities Grow and develop the acquisitions business to maximize the potential of the entire organization. Drive and execute organizational strategy to grow customer acquisitions for Southeast Asia. Analyze market trends, team performance, and clients' performance to sustain high-growth aspirations and drive continued productivity and performance improvements. Conduct regional business forecasts, pipeline management, demand generation, and strategy development. Manage the sales team members of Sales Managers and Account Executives to exceed business growth goals. Provide strategic thinking and exceptional business skills. Develop strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure a One Google business plan, while also being the external face of Google in many customer-facing events. Communicate effectively with English-speaking stakeholders and clients. Work with cross-functional teams (e.g. marketing, on-boarding, agency) to align and meet regional commitments for the New Business Sales team. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 12 years of sales management experience in technology Experience in people management and team leadership Ability to speak and write in English fluently Preferred Qualifications Experience in sales coaching and mentoring, delivering strategic business goals Strong communication skills with the ability to engage C-Level and provide executive account coverage Possess entrepreneurial and strategic problem solving skills with the ability to initiate and lead a regional virtual strategic cross-functional project in support of mid/long term business goals Strong operational discipline to ensure appropriate focus on the aspects of the business most critical to driving sustained growth
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are currently looking for a Sales Account Executive with the right energy, competitive spirit, and personal drive to be the leading force that fuels our growing client relationships in our Australian & Singapore markets. Working in a defined geographic territory, you will proactively engage with targeted companies, as well as follow up and close on various sources of inbound leads.  The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities by using a consultative approach to selling and use their expertise to identify prospects, build meaningful customer relationships and drive momentum across multiple opportunities by guiding prospective clients on their Spend Management journey.  Key responsibilities:  Create client demos/ presentations, quotes/ proposals, and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) Craft an innovative sales pitch to explain product and service capabilities, and initiate the sales process by scheduling appointments and make initial presentations Represent Volopay in all customer-facing engagements, traveling to customers’ locations as required (post covid) and engaging at all levels of an organization Manage the complete and complex sales cycles often presenting to C-level executives the value and ROI/Business Case of Volopay Utilize Hubspot CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs understanding account requirements Educating prospective customers on the value of products and services to create growth & engagement opportunities Understand customer’s requirements accurately and communicate with the team internally stating needs, problems, use cases, more  Understand the competitive landscape. Identify new opportunities leveraging your own creativity to engage customer prospects for conversions Develop your own vertical/territory plan and a pipeline that will fuel the ongoing growth of your business Strive to continuously improve your sales process and demonstrate a willingness to learn and implement best practices Collaborating with management on sales goals, planning, and forecasting; maintaining short and long-term business development plans.  Qualifications:  Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience’s needs Minimum 2 years of quota-carrying SaaS / b2b software sales experience as an Inside sales representative selling into the SG market to SMEs & mid-market clients. Successful track record managing complex deals from demo presentation to closing and actively engaging. Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. CRM experience preferred. Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment. Strong customer references. Experience managing the sales cycle, closing the deal with the decision-makers with demonstrated skill at negotiating business terms.  If you enjoy solving complex problems, work effectively with cross-functional teams, and thrive in a constantly evolving landscape, then this opportunity will be exciting for you. Additional benefits with this role involve – Constant Learning & Development support towards individual needs, flexibility with timings, and opportunity to uncover emerging trends. We observe multiple industry players and their products, and thus you will be always working on some new challenge.

PSG is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro Systems, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com. PSG: Where Innovation Flows.  PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.   To develop and expand market coverage in the Asian semiconductor market with our Almatec brand we are looking for a Business Development Manager (f/m/d) – Semicon, Asia starting in September 2021, located in the Philippines or Singapore.  Your tasks: ·        Develop and execute a strategy to leverage commercial, operational, and organizational opportunities to deliver revenue synergies. ·        Drive revenue in the targeted market by identifying, acquiring, and managing new customers with focus on end-users, OEMs and other relevant semicon market participants. ·        Collaborate with account managers on account specific challenges and sales strategies. ·        Proactively understand the customer strategy and needs. ·        Develop, establish, maintain, and manage relationships with key influential contacts of customers. ·        Identify acquisition and product development opportunities within core and adjacent technologies. ·        Interface with product managers, engineering, and sales to develop new products, create business cases, execute field trial plans, and product launches that are aligned with overall product life cycle strategies. ·        Drive development of value-added customer materials and training. ·        Train and accompany new partners in their way to market.  Your profile: ·        4 year degree bachelors degree from accredited university. ·        Prior customer interfacing responsibilities (ex. sales, business development, technical service etc.) with strong communication and presentation skills. ·        Experience in selling the values of a premium product offering. ·        History of achieving sales goals using a collaborative, cross-functional team. ·        Deep knowledge of production technologies in general and of fluid handling systems in the Semicon market. ·        Ideally personal professional experience in the regional Semicon market. ·        Expert in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and experience with SharePoint. ·        Willingness to travel 50%, mostly Asia, occasionally EMEA or USA. ·        Fluent in English (written and oral).
industries: Machinery and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

jobTitle: Business Development Manager, Traditional Media Agencies
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience working in sales or marketing role in an agency, technology or media company.  Preferred qualifications: Sales experience in a technology, advertising, media sales and/or internet environment. Experience with Google Ads and YouTube account management, managing advertising and/or media campaigns. Media experience across a variety of platforms (TV, Radio, Print, Sponsorship, etc.). Ability to multitask; with experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously while paying attention to detail. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  The Agency Sales team is a high-performing sales team that drives customer success by partnering with media holding companies and large independent traditional media agencies in Singapore.  Business Development Managers (BDMs) are senior sellers who leverage their deep marketing expertise to partner with media agencies and drive transformational business conversations with their advertisers. BDMs primarily focus on C-level stakeholder relationships and co-create business growth strategies with a portfolio of agencies by identifying and executing opportunities for growth.  You will own strategic resource allocation for a portfolio of key agency client opportunities within traditional media agencies, while collaborating with account strategists and product specialists to deliver mutual business growth to our agencies, their customers, and to Google. Your deep knowledge of online and offline media combined with your communication skills, executive influencing skills and analytical abilities shapes how agencies’ new and existing businesses grow with Google.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage a portfolio of businesses by understanding growth drivers, identifying opportunities for growth, managing risks and building quarterly plans for achievements. Drive customer growth by delivering outstanding customer sales experience and achieving customer business and marketing objectives. Own end-to-end sales process, by driving customer outreach, sales pitches, solution implementation and performance evaluation. Work towards quarterly business and product growth goals.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: About Nimbly (hellonimbly.com)  A mobile solution that automates workflows, improving efficiency and generating cost savings by providing data-driven insights from field operations remotely and in real-time. Built by passionate founders and VC-backed, Nimbly enables best-in-class companies like KFC, 7-Eleven, Under Armour, and Cargill to be more agile, deploying digital routines for its front liners to deliver consistency of product quality and customer experience.  Nimbly is looking for a results-driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) and we are OPEN to experience.  Having recently secured Pre-Series A funding Nimbly is currently in a growth mode and is looking for hungry and high performing SDRs to join our growing sales team in Singapore, Jakarta and Bangalore, India and help us raise the bar on quality and gain more market share.   What you will do here?  Partner with the business to identify market potential by qualifying accounts Initiates sales process by scheduling appointments, making sales presentations, and understanding account requirements Conduct research on target markets to identify key players for new accounts Close sales by building rapport with the potential account, explaining product and service capabilities, and preparing contracts Maintain relationships with existing leads by and establish new engagement with prospects   Role Requirements  Minimum 1-2 years experience in any Sales Development Representative, Business Development, B2B Sales, or Inside Sales role Familiar with the F&B/FMCG/Retail/Manufacturing or Agriculture industries is ideal but we are OPEN to other industry experience Excellent presentation and communication skills Prior experience in SaaS/startup industry will be preferred Fluency in English is a must (both verbal and written) Fast learner and target-oriented mindset   Benefits at Nimbly  Competitive net salary and private insurance Remote work with flexible working hours Dynamic and fun working environment

jobTitle: Senior Corporate Sales Development Representative, APAC
description: About The Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated individual to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel. The right candidate isn’t afraid of cold calling or striking up a conversation with someone they just met. They think outside the box, by iterating on a pitch deck, crafting a convincing email proposal or supporting a teammate on closing a deal. This role is ideal for someone who has just started their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails Adapting a more targeted approach to more strategic clients Research, prospect and engage new corporate partners in ClassPass markets Continue developing understanding of HR/Benefits world and how ClassPass fits in Manage opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Regularly communicate successes and roadblocks to manager to better inform the team’s goals and targets Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways to connect and build out your relationships with potential partners and share across the team Set high quality meetings for the Corporate Sales Team Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics Skills & Experience Recently graduated or <1 year in sales A natural problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals Strong relationship builder with the ability to collaborate Willingness to make multiple phone and email contacts per day Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM preferred Right to work in Singapore Who We Are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What We Believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people.  ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

Regional Sales Manager, Japan and Korea Our mission is “…to safely deliver life-saving products” the products we make are geared towards healthcare companies who require the highest level of quality and care. As a result, we are looking for people who understand the importance of a higher purpose. The inside sales manager serves that function by ensuring our customers are getting the right service and products, specific to their needs. This role requires a good understanding of consultative sales, solution and interdisciplinary collaboration experience are a must to be successful. The role is responsible for developing cross-functional relationships with new and existing customers in a culturally and geographically diverse market. The inside sales manager must have an ability to consistently follow-up and bring multi-year projects to a close, while meeting quarterly and annual performance objectives. The primary role objectives are: Responsibilities: Sales Growth - Develop and maintain good relationships for given territory - Support global key accounts in territory and share insights and intelligence within global sales organization - Consistently update and work from customer relationship management (CRM) tool - Develop new customers and new business to meet territory sales growth objectives - Follow up quickly on marketing leads generated, ensure consistent messages and needs are addressed when leads are routed - Promote company products and capabilities via customer meetings, industry exhibitions and technical seminars - Develop adjacent industry relationships with companies serving healthcare manufacturers - Attend regional association meetings, networking and become member as necessary to expand Oliver’s presence in the region - Interface regularly with commercial leaders regarding new product and new market opportunities - Identify target accounts and create a strategy for closing new business - Uncover price targets and competitive information - Tailor conference calls and pitch to meet the needs of different buyer personas and market applications  Account Maintenance - This role covers Japan & Korea market - Understand the customer’s market, financial results, and buying cycles - Manage account forecasts and assist with budget process at year end - Capture and communicate competitor activities - Maintain great customer relationships and maintain high level of customer satisfaction - Maintain marketing databases including lead follow up and maintenance from existing accounts - Communicate customer specifications and requirements to manufacturing, process engineering, production planning, graphic production areas, etc. - Work internally to negotiate accurate ship dates that are close to the customer’s request date - Expedite all customer requests for rushed deliveries, and communicates schedule request changes to production planning and manufacturing departments - Captures all customer complaints and tracks them in accordance with established practices and procedures  Requirements: - Bilingual in English, Japanese and/or Korean to liaise with customers from Japan and Korea - B.S. in Marketing, Sales, General Business, Engineering or closely related field. - 4+ years of successful business development experience required - A record of building great customer relationships - Strong presentation skills required - Strong negotiating and closing skills - Computer and business writing competency - Ability to travel 50% of the time internationally
