description: Egencia is changing the way corporations manage their travel programs and is seeking a professional sales specialist to drive our leadership in corporate travel. The Global Sales Manager will be selling into global Singapore based companies with footprints across all regions; North America (NA) Asia Pacific (APAC), Latin America and European markets. The objective of this position is to develop multi-dimensional relationships with global customers and provide customized solutions for their worldwide travel needs.  This position requires a customer centric approach with tried skills in pipeline management, platform selling, negotiation; understand complex systems and processes. With effective communication and a strong knowledge of market trends, will assist to understand the impact on business needs and travel solutions. This position will be representing the Egencia brand through verbal, written and formal presentations to potential customers at all levels.  The individual must be a great teammate, biased to action, self-motivated, highly organized, high energy, integrity, humility and can function effectively in an un-structured environment.  Egencia makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.  What You’ll Do The ability to understand product capabilities and communicate the value and differentiation of a service offering in the market. Grow Egencia portfolio and revenue with new customers headquartered in Singapore by playing an active role in value proposition selling and contract negotiation Once requirements are clearly identified, promote competitive advantages and Egencia’s outstanding value proposition through proposal, RFI/RFPs and presentations Connect with prospects (from discovery meeting to closing) and build a high-level relationship with executives (CFOs, CEOs) Responsible for contract closing and implementation of customers with the implementation team Selling the right solution, to ensure that the customer transitions from implementation to trade Sign profitable business to meet quarterly goals, in line with Egencia’s pricing schedules Work collaboratively and establish relationships with internal teams Who You Are  You’ll be great for this role if you have the following: Excellent communication skills, including written and oral Strong listening skills with to interpret the customers’ needs Validated sales experience in pipeline management including negotiation skills Ability to effectively address key decisions makers in a very competitive and innovating environment Minimum 4 years Sales experience with a consistent track record in hitting quarterly sales targets Organized and structured High level of dynamism, drive, and energy - great teammate Strong commitment to both a high quality of work and service to customers in a fast-paced environment Proficient level of experience with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word Graduate level education is desired Position requires some travel, sometimes to international locations A good knowledge of the corporate travel industry and/or platform selling (desired but not essential) Egencia started out by disrupting the business travel technology industry and we haven’t stopped since. We are purpose-built to provide the industry’s best travel management experience – and we’re continually investing to make it even better, faster, and easier for people to connect with confidence. Learn more at egencia.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high performing teams.  Key responsibilities Manage and develop the relationship with the sub-entity of the contractual customer in line with Maersk/global strategy Develop local value proposition to be included on the global tender Develop local business plan for increasing overall supply chain Share of Wallet and position Logistic & Services products Grow local presence across products with the sub-entity of the customer through new opportunities–also through sub-suppliers. Define the local value proposition and work closely with local product organization to grow and deliver revenue growth supporting the local product P&L Develop account business plans that encompass ocean as well as Logistic & Services products on global scale (where relevant) Define the global value proposition and work closely with customer solutions to build E2E solutions supporting revenue growth across products (where relevant) Support the overall customer experience and support global value proposition Organize and connect the global Maersk team across functions, products and area for overall customer experience (where relevant) Ensure successful business onboarding and contract compliance Position Maersk towards the local influencers of the global tender success and towards local decision makers on country relevant products Position Maersk for access to the right stakeholders, influencers and decision makers throughout the customer organisation (where relevant)  We are looking for Logistics expertise Supply chain expertise (to optimize SOW across products), insight selling, connectors (stakeholder management, influencing skills) High-level product understanding including how it solves different customer pains Strategic influencing Negotiation skills/procurement tactics Strategic partnering, financial acumen, matrix management, value co-creator, presentation skills

description: Sales Development Representative - Remote (Singapore)  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Sales Development Representative in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  “I serve as the first point of contact of many of App Annie’s future clients across the mobile app industry to make sure they understand the value of our data, and how it can be applied to make better business decisions”.  This role reports to the Global Director in San Francisco. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with marketing operations, understand the importance of MQL (marketing qualified leads), and be fully committed to meeting SLA’s around responding to inbound leads. The ideal candidate should also have knowledge of outbound marketing, including familiarity with video pitches, building outreach sequences, utilizing LinkedIn, and other modern SDR tools. Comfortable working with inbound, and outbound in order to drive pipeline and drive growth.  You will be responsible for and take pride in... Passion for activity, and high energy Competitive spirit, and focus on winning Highly coachable, and passionate about learning and self-improvement Desires feedback, and passion to excel in customer facing role Maniacal focus on SFDC hygiene (calls, activity, lead disqualification, notes) Familiarity with google suite of tools, and outreach High volume of calls Creativity and execution of email drip campaigns as needed Willingness and desire to have and be part of global meetings and other time zones Consistently achieving and exceeding monthly goals High business acumen, passion to solve problems and understand why things matter for the customer You should recognize yourself in the following… Bachelor’s degree required Excellent communications skills both in native language & English, both written and oral Experience with Salesforce required Strong presentation skills Demonstrated success in achieving sales goals Must have excellent verbal & written communication skills Must be a creative solutions thinker who can drive sales success Must be detail oriented and flexible An entrepreneurial spirit with a can-do positive attitude Ability to adapt on the fly to new challenges Doesn’t take oneself too seriously, and have a sense of humor Bias for action, and results oriented Competitive, and highly positive attitude This is what we offer... We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!

jobTitle: Sales Development Rep or Inside Sales Rep, South Asia
description: Rackspace Technology is a leading end-to-end multicloud technology services company. We can design, build and operate our customers’ cloud environments across all major technology platforms, irrespective of technology stack or deployment model. We partner with our customers at every stage of their cloud journey, enabling them to modernize applications, build new products and adopt innovative technologies.  The Sales Development Rep or Inside Sales Rep is responsible for proactive outbound prospecting and inbound lead follow-up to generate new business opportunities. Reporting to Marketing, the candidate will work closely with Marketing, Sales and Alliance teams to identify targeted customers and develop effective messaging for prospecting.  Key Responsibilities Build sales pipeline and source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails.Proactively prospect for new business opportunities within a specific set of named accounts. Achieve monthly and quarterly sales bookings targets. Exceed monthly targets of new sales opportunities and meetings booked. Collaborate with Field Sales and Marketing and keep up to date with the local Go-To-Market and business priorities. Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities. Secures in person or virtual meetings for Field sellers; completes hand off of information to seller. Manage relationship-building activities to keep leads “warm”. Build and maintain a constant/future pipeline Research markets and industries to identify potential customers and makes first contact. Maintain up-to-date knowledge on the cloud computing market and maintain a thorough understanding of Rackspace Technology solutions offerings. Maintain records accuracy (account, opportunity and activity details) in Salesforce and frequently report on results and activities progress. Prepares and analyzes leads pipeline reports and dashboards. Knowledge/Experience Leads generation expertise to include the ability to identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including prospect lists, discovery and individual research. Conduct a needs analysis and determine prospects pain points to determine how the Rackspace solution will speak to those needs. Identify key buying influencers within these prospects to determine budget and timeline. Uses knowledge of how the team integrates with others to accomplish the team objectives. Builds and cultivates prospect relationships by initiating interactions and conducting follow-up communications in order to move opportunities through the sales funnel. Basic knowledge of simple configurations in cloud computing preferred. Uses communication skills to regularly exchange information, escalate issues and effectively share expertise within the team. Bachelor's Degree required; Sales, Marketing, Business or a related field. At the manager’s discretion a diploma or equivalent plus an additional 3 years of relevant call center and/or sales experience may substitute for the degree requirement. A sales management degree and internship may substitute for the relevant experience. Ability to perform at the proficiency and autonomy required of the role, typically found with 1-2 years of related experience, preferably in telemarketing and/or inside sales in an IT industry. Skills Self-motivated, sense of urgency and strong customer focus. Thrives in a fast-paced and evolving environment. Excellent negotiation, influencing, presentation and problem solving skills. Strong interpersonal and networking capabilities. Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload A good working knowledge of Salesforce.com or similar CRM as well as a marketing automation platform e.g. Marketo, Outreach, Salesforce Marketing Cloud. Team player – position is cross-functional and requires significant teamwork. About Rackspace Technology  We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.  More on Rackspace Technology  Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description: Black Box® is a trusted IT solutions provider delivering cutting-edge technology products and world-class consulting services to businesses across the globe in every industry. The breadth of our global reach and depth of our expertise accelerate customer success by bringing people, ideas, and technology together to solve real-world business problems.  We deliver technology solutions for our customers by harnessing technology innovation to digitally transform and accelerate their business in the areas of connected buildings (incl. IoT), digital workplace & customer experience, data centers, networking (incl. Wi-Fi, SD-WAN), in-building 5G/ONGO and cyber security.  With more than 80 years of technology excellence and thousands of team members globally, managing over 175,000 customers across 150 countries, we are uniquely positioned to build a global IT services brand that can deliver maximum value, world-class integrated solutions, deliver results, cultivate strategic relationships, and enable lasting relevance for our customers across six continents.  Position Summary: The Regional Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts to Black Box. Strategically-minded, the BDM will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  As this position is focused on the pursuit and acquisition of ‘new logos’, the BDM will cultivate the teams that will support the account beyond the initial opportunity wins, which will enable the BDM to pursue other new prospects for Black Box.  Job Responsibilities: Identify prospects, and establish relationships with new customers and dormant accounts. Specifically, the BDM will target larger organizations, with a primary focus on Fortune 1000 prospects. Seek opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell to the client by introducing additional solutions that will enable the customer’s success. Develop strategic pursuit plans. Engages with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering when appropriate to actively drive pursuit opportunities. Main focus SG & ASEAN region.  Skills, Knowledge, Abilities: Able to cultivate relationships with large enterprises, including Fortune 1000 targets that do little or no business with Black Box at the present time. Able to understand the customer’s business, and provide strategic insights to help the customer’s business will positioning Black Box solutions as a way to enable the customer’s business success. Encompasses strategic pursuit management skills from opportunity start to finish. Able to use Black Box CRM to own benefits in the business prospecting and sales processes. Able to work independently, as well as part of a team environment. Must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work effectively with minimal direct supervision. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office.  Qualifications: Undergraduate Business degree is required. MBA preferred. Must have more 10+ years of sales experience in developing new accounts within the technology/business IT services sector, preferable with leading system integrator (SI). Extensive, existing and relevant network of customers, OEMs, Distributors, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with one of the OEMs; Cisco, Aruba, Silver Peak. Minimum one or two valid Sales certifications in above OEMs is a pre. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with Professional and Managed Services solutions. Ability to travel 25% of the time.  Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

description: Job Title: Senior Channel / Channel Sales Manager, ASEAN & India As Splashtop continues our rapid growth and expansion, we are recruiting a Partner Sales Manager position for Southeast Asia and India. As the Senior Channel / Channel Sales Manager, you will be a crucial part of a growing Partner Sales Team and play an important role in Splashtop’s growth initiatives in the region.  Overview The Senior Manager / Manager for Channel Sales in Southeast Asia and India is responsible for developing, managing and ensuring the overall success of a portfolio of channel partners (resellers, system integrators, managed service providers, distributors) by designing and executing a plan to accelerate and scale the growth of indirect and channel partner sales for Splashtop in the region. You will function as part of a regional business unit to ensure achievement of business objectives and revenue targets.  You will report to the Regional Director, Asia Pacific.  Responsibilities l  Develop long-term strategic relationships with channel partners across Southeast Asia and India. l  Accelerate partner solution adoption by identifying specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a value proposition for using Splashtop’s portfolio. l  Adopt and execute a strategic solution approach based on individual partner needs to drive partner sales success. l  Drive and manage partner sales cycles from start to finish. l  Develop and maintain strong contacts and relationships with cross-functional teams (Sales, Support, Engineering, Services, Product Management) both internally and within the partnerships to ensure technical health of partners. l  Possess technical expertise and savvy to explain and architect the use of Splashtop’s portfolio to improve solutions offered by partnerships. l  Coordinate and oversee technical resources internally and within the partnerships to successfully close and deliver partnership opportunities. l  Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team.  Required Skills and Qualifications l  Minimum 3 years of experience in the following areas: Partner Alliances, Business Development, Channel and/or Direct Sales. l  Track record and demonstrated ability to recruit and develop capable, focused and scalable partners. l  Strategic thinker who is able to blend technology and business strategy to develop compelling plans for new partner initiatives. l  Demonstrated ability to engage and influence senior-level executives. l  Ability to create thoughtful and compelling business cases highlighting revenue growth opportunities. l  Capable of building and maintaining strong relationships with a diverse set of internal and partner constituencies including senior level executives, legal, finance, support, sales, and marketing experts. l  Demonstrated ability to build significant revenue stream through channel partners, with a track record of successful revenue goal attainment. l  Strong understanding of the IT Software Support / Collaboration industry. l  Ability to negotiate skillfully in tough situations. l  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to effectively present to all levels of management. l  Ability to influence functional groups to a shared vision. l  High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business. l  Excellent planning and time management skills. l  Bachelor's degree or other significant business experience.   Splashtop is an Equal Opportunity Employer

About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking license, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Acquire various offline merchants - reach out to them, understand their needs, and find a place for them in our ecosystem where we can have a win-win-win situation among Merchants, Customers and Shopee. Lead a team of field salespeople to source for merchants that have high potential to be attracted to ShopeePay’s consumers Construct, pitch and negotiate cooperation that meets expectations of merchants, customers and ShopeePay Be the point of contact for matters specific to your accounts and our merchants  Requirements Highly motivated and target-driven individual Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills Proactive and always push to deliver extra 1-2 years of working experience in sales or related field is a plus
industries: Internet

description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Department  Account Executives, Channel Account Managers, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.  Based in Singapore, you will drive sales into large enterprise/strategic accounts across India markets for Cloudflare’s solutions. Large enterprise accounts include, but are not limited to, MNC’s, G2000/CAC 40 companies, hyper-growth companies, and other organisations that have substantial requirements for Cloudflare solutions. Your strategic selling activities will include "hunter" type activities to proactively penetrate target named large accounts, detailed account planning, focused relationship building and leading effective sales campaigns to successful closure.  The ideal candidate will possess both a major account sales background in technology solutions, primarily software based, that enables them to drive engagement with senior level decision makers within Cloudflare’s target customers. Industry experience selling into Finance, Retail, Manufacturing and other Enterprise verticals along with Service Provider is desired in this role.  As a Strategic Account Executive, you'll be responsible for developing and executing against a Sales strategy/plan for Strategic accounts, as well as driving large account sales into India markets to achieve revenue targets. Therefore, you must have a strong network of contacts with decision makers in large enterprise accounts across the region, and have experience selling complex solutions to these accounts. You will have an intuitive understanding and experience with the key business and technical needs of these and large accounts and will create and deliver compelling value propositions to them for Cloudflare solutions.  Additional Responsibilities Will Include Manage contract negotiations Maintain a robust sales pipeline Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts < 50% travel Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Bachelor's degree required Fluent in both English and Hindi Relevant direct experience, track record, and relationships within largest corporate enterprise accounts in India markets 10-20+ years of direct B2B selling experience, 5-10+ years selling to large enterprise/strategic accounts Direct experience selling network security and/or CDN solutions and services preferred Prior experience being part of an early sales team helping drive traction in India markets for a US-based SaaS company highly preferred Experience managing longer, complex sales cycles Basic understanding of computer networking and “how the internet works” Aptitude for learning technical concepts/terms (Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus) Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Computer & Network Security

description: The Qualtrics XM PlatformTM is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can't imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  About The Team  Starting on the Sales Development Team, you will receive world class training on our products and sales process, get acclimated to the industry, and familiar with our client demographic. Those who exemplify exceptional performance, will be quickly promoted onto one of our Corporate Sales Teams across multiple product lines. Corporate Sales representatives have the opportunity to progress in sales or leadership positions.  The Purpose Of The Department Is To  The Sales Development team is an essential team in Qualtrics sales and marketing efforts and is responsible for a combination of demand response, demand management and demand creation. Generate qualified pipeline that progresses through the sales funnel, generating new closed revenue. To develop new quota-carrying Account Executives. This opportunity will be predominantly focussed on our new business expansion plans across the SEA region.  You will report to our Sales Development Lead for SEA and this role is to be based out of Singapore.  A Day in the Life Demand creation (cold calling), demand response (warm calling), demand management (managed follow up process). Effectively communicate value propositions across multiple product lines to secure initial meetings with prospects You work with Account Executives to discuss and strategize methods to penetrate targeted accounts with the goal of setting quality meetings. You work closely with our Marketing team to execute on personalized account-based campaigns You're the best with LinkedIn and Salesforce. You attend 1:1's, team meetings, trainings, sales calls, discovery calls, demos, etc. to develop your skills. You collaborate with your peers sharing standard methodologies, “oops moments,” and role playing to make sure you're focused on continuous improvement. Minimum Qualifications Bachelors Degree (or within 6 months of graduating) Reliable, confident, and articulate Ability to make a high volume of outbound calls and communicate well with VP level executives Highly motivated to accelerate your career in software sales Exceptional interpersonal ability Expectations for Success  As a SDR, you are responsible for contacting leaders and executives in organizations of all sizes across many verticals. Your focus is helping leaders gain insights around their market, customers, and employees, which allows them to make quicker decisions driven by data. You identify key decision makers and/or key influencers within an organization across many different departments You understand the impact our products have on our customers You articulate to prospects how our tools can help their organizations get to the next level with real-time data You work well with teammates, like to strategize, and plan out creative methods to generate more business opportunities You use rejection as fuel to motivate and push you to work harder and smarter You're a self starter, competitive, and driven. You see the bigger picture. You don't settle for mediocrity You don't hit quota because that is what is expected of you, rather you blow past quota because it's who you are Financial rewards, opportunity for growth, and promotions motivate you. What differentiates us from other companies We live by our cultural values: TACOS - Transparency, All In, Customer Obsessed, One Team, and Scrappy We hire the best with the intention of developing and promoting within. Our company success cannot be done without the success of our people. We lead from the front on important issues. We have several teams focused on Diversity and Inclusion (MOSAIQ), cancer research (Five For The Fight), WFH (COVID Taskforce), Women in Leadership (WLD), Veterans (QSalute)... the list goes on. We provide a very comprehensive benefits package with lots of opportunity to promote.

description: As the Business Development & Partnerships Manager, you will be crucial and central in building strong and long-lasting relationships to make significant inroads into new markets and business opportunities. You will work closely with Product, Sales & Marketplace, Marketing, and others in the team to achieve new partnerships, grow our footprint, and increase revenue.  Responsibilities Identify and develop Go-To-Market (GTM) partnerships within ComfortDelGro group and with external partners to grow new and adjacent businesses and revenues. Identify and engage partner decision-makers with support from fellow team members. Analyze opportunity requirements, and prepare content for proposals to be sent for RFPs, client proposals, and partnership opportunities. Work closely with fellow team members to collaborate on opportunities from early identification through to initial stages of client relationship management, and continued partner advancement. Create a systematic, data-driven approach to partner outreach and relationship management. Research, evaluate, and prioritize partners via balancing the management of strategic partnerships across our offerings. Be our eyes in the field and explore different ways to position and package our offerings, and share feedback and learnings with internal teams to strengthen our proposition. Produce and manage a robust pipeline of incoming partners and showcase the results via reports and updates. Gain deep understanding of partner needs, target audience, key players, and industry trends. Identify themes and trends to understand market needs.  Requirements At least 6 years of proven track record and relevant experience in business development and partnerships for mid-large matrixed organizations. Experience with bid writing and securing sponsors and partners. Strong ability to negotiate agreements. Experience in digital businesses is a must, and/or with mobility or sustainability would be preferred. Knowledgeable about e-commerce platforms relating to mobility, marketplace, lifestyle offerings. Ability to think through a long-term vision for a partnership, but realize and act on the small steps needed to get there. Highly motivated and adaptable to ever-changing client needs and expectations. Able to prioritise tasks and work to deadlines. Strong communication skills. Able to use own initiative and develop ideas with the team.
industries: Transportation/Trucking/Railroad and Information Technology and Services

description: As a Key Account Executive, he/she is responsible for detailing and selling Viatris portfolio of products to healthcare professionals within his/her designated territory. Key responsibilities for this role include: • Reports to Market Lead, Singapore • Responsible for delivering the sales target set for assigned Viatris business • Service accounts, develop prospects, executing sales and marketing initiatives, market data collection and customer insights gathering • Successful listing of new products into hospitals and clinics • Set clear objectives and develop strategies for each account to drive penetration and growth • Track account sales and provide accurate forecast (sales, penetration rates and market share) • Engagement with senior stakeholders eg. Key Decision Makers in the Key Accounts to build/ maintain business partnering relationships • Lead in the negotiation strategy and influence using compelling value propositions/ solutions that delivers a win/win outcome between Viatris and Key Accounts • Establish good rapport with decision makers (at all levels) • Service & maintain existing business (contracts, quotations, tenders, relationship management) • Develop deep understanding of the Key Account’s needs through information gathering through different sources • Using Key Account insights to co-create innovative solutions with internal and or external stakeholders that mutually benefits both • Establish sound understanding of customer needs, challenges, competition, key trends etc  The minimum qualifications for this role are: • Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Pharmacy, Business, Management or related field • 3 years sales experience in pharmaceutical/medical device industry. • Previous working experience in Oncology is desired • Functional knowledge of and exposure to sales and marketing • Proven track record in driving and exceeding sales targets • Self-starter, high level of personal motivation and results-oriented • A team player with ability to work effectively cross-functionally • Willingness to take on new pilots in the areas of marketing, digital and analytics and new ways of working • Strong interpersonal skills • Excellent planning, presentation and communication skills • Possess a class 3 valid driving license and preferably possess a car

jobTitle: Sales - Channel Sales Manager, Singapore (12-month program)
description: Summary  Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Every role at Apple is crafted around our intention to leave the world better than we found it. Our values and our actions tell the world who we are. When you join a company like Apple, these same values fuel your aim to change things for the better — to enrich lives.   Apple’s Sales organisation generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. A unique opportunity exists for an outstanding candidate to actively promote the sales of Apple products and services in retail sector, especially in the Consumer Electronics (CE), distributors and also online retail partners on a 12-month basis.   Your ‘can-do’ demeanor will be met with a supportive team to help guide your journey through Apple, and working with Apple’s valued partners to create the best customer experience in the Multi-brand environment. It is through your perseverance, strong social skills, communication skills, negotiation skills and your ability to deal with ambiguity which will see you not only throughly exercise these skills in the role, but develop them to strongly enable your personal growth ambitions by the end of this 12-month program.   Key Qualifications  Channel Management and Retail sales experience preferred (at least 8 -10 years and above). Experience with online retail industry would be a plus.  Consistent track record in the delivery of ambitious growth targets.  Sales management experience / Retail partnership management.  Aggressive focus on goals and continuous improvement.  Sophisticated communication skills (including English)  Direct experience with merchandising plans.  Professional manner, maturity and outstanding customer & partner skills.  Forecasting, prior quota management and partner management ability.  Good intuition for business skills in engaging senior partners’ management team.  Passion, personal drive and a sense of humour.  Ability to deal with ambiguity.   Description  - For this 12 month period, working with the Country Manager and Retail Lead to strategize, develop and execute sales initiatives that drive incremental business outcomes and outstanding Apple customer experience.  - To establish and lead close working relationship with the senior representatives of relevant multi-brand retail partners, distributors and online partners, to develop their sales efficiency and maximise the sales of Apple products to end-users.  - Act as a professional business personnel to develop and manage a reliable forecast and ensure the disciplined use of Apple sales forecasting tools and processes.  - Hold regular performance and planning reviews with channel partners.  - Keep it simple, and passionate about great outcome for everyone.  - Planning: Agree quarterly marketing and in-store activities, responsibilities and weekly sell through targets.  - Ensure all POS forecast from Partners are reliable and understand the weekly variance where applicable.  - Work closely with Reseller Operations to forecast and influence product supply to meet and exceed sales forecasts  - Provide input to the Channel Marketing quarterly activities and in-store programs.  - Analyse the strength and weaknesses of our current POS and be able to develop a strategy to address issues of coverage or quality (or both).  - Develop a strong working relationship, team-work and sense of mutual respect with in-store manager and members of the virtual team.  - Implement planogram programs with in-store managers, as prescribed by Apple.  - Working with the Apple training team, to ensure that the virtual team sales staffs are of the highest standard and quality  - Understand the market and stores on a deep level, spending time in doors and sharing insights to management  - Always represent the Apple brand to the highest level   Additional Requirements  KEY COMPETENCIES:   Persuasiveness/Sales Ability, Communication Skills, Customer Service Skills, Conflict Management, Leadership, Planning and Organising, Change Management, Performance Analysis  APPLE VALUES   - Ability to work well in groups and without routine direct supervision.  - Take initiative and challenge the status quo.  - Deliver more than the customer expects.  - Be conscientious and reliable – follow-up quickly and consistently.  - Demonstrate a positive and empathic demeanour.   Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation   Role Number: 200281931
industries: Consumer Electronics

description: Job Id: 21348588  The Business Development Officer is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.  Responsibilities: Utilize all possible channels to source quality new-to-bank clients with potential to generate business across lending, treasury, capital markets, cash management products. Responsible for the entire process of new client acquisition from identifying prospects, delivering customized financial service solutions to completing facility availment. Facilitate client on-boarding process by resolving operations and service issues that may arise. Work in preparing credit assessments and monitoring risk issues by liaising with clients on any document deficiency or requests for more information. Follow up with clients on offer acceptance and confirm the facility is successfully availed. Keep supervisor informed about key changes in market conditions, trend, clients information, etc., and escalate potential issues and concerns promptly. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, commerce, engineering or related disciplines 2-5 years relevant commercial banking experience Good record of proactively building relationships with product and credit review/approval partners Education: Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.

description: As Business Development Manager Synthetics, you are responsible for growing our client's Synthetics Business in South-East Asia. You forward this information internally to play an active role in the product and/or application development and synthetics segment strategies. - You report to the Regional Commercial Director Ropes and work closely with the General Manager Synthetics. In addition, you collaborate with the Innovation, the Customer service and Operations Teams. - Travel is needed; up to 25% of your time you visit customers and prospects in your region. description: Teltonika Asia PTE. LTD  WE ARE HIRING  B2B SALES REPRESENTATIVE  Teltonika Asia PTE. LTD is a representative branch of Teltonika, JSC – an European company, which is creating and manufacturing Internet of things (IoT) for over 23 years. From connected vehicles to networking, we seek our solutions to be used globally and become indispensable part in any business.  As we are constantly growing, currently we are looking for ambitious B2B Sales Representative to join our team in Singapore! Here you will focus on selling either GPS trackers, Networking Product or Personal & Asset trackers, oriented to business use cases.  ❗ ❗ ❗THE MAIN AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY ❗ ❗ ❗  Contribute to market research, including identify market potential and find potential leads, reach out new potential clients via cold calling, email, LinkedIn communication; Build and maintain long term relationships with new and existing customers through daily contact, making presentations, frequent visits; Prepare commercial offers and ensure contracts to achieve assigned sales goals; Attend exhibitions/meetings abroad to represent Teltonika and its products with solutions; Collaborate with technical support department and product specialists to address customer requirements.  💼 📈 THE EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND PERSONAL QUALITIES YOU WILL NEED 💼 📈  Fluent in English (both spoken and written) as it will be your primary working language; 2+ Years’ experience in B2B sales, with results that you are proud of, would be an advantage; An organized and results-oriented approach, challenge driven personality; The ambition to generate strong earnings by expanding local B2B opportunities in the market with an innovative product from Lithuania; Experience using CRM to manage the sales process and forecast sales; Video conference/client visit experience; Willing to travel abroad (when circumstances allow).  💡🚀WHAT WE OFFER 💡🚀  • Experience in working with International company and part of Global team; • Trainings that help you grow and gain experience; • IoT technology product that is changing Industrial business; • Flexible working conditions; • Job Type: Full-time, Permanent; • Pay: SGD4,000 - SGD5,500 depending on your experience + unlimited commissions.  ❗❗❗We kindly inform you, that your CV and other personal data will be processed in accordance with Teltonika Privacy Policy (https://teltonika-iot-group.com/policies-certificates/privacy-policy/). We will only contact selected candidates.

Join our team of 750 employees around the world who all help Advantek be the world’s leading provider of precision component delivery systems. Our customers are some of the biggest Microchip producers and automotive companies in the world.  We are looking for a Key Account Director to join our team! The Key Account Director is responsible for building relationships and providing their customers with solutions in order to meet sales revenue and profitability goals for those global key accounts. They build and expand relationships with strategically important global customers and represent the entire range of company products to customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met by the company.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop annual sales plan and long-term strategic plan for assigned accounts. Promote and sell existing and new products following the established plans. Achieve revenue and profit targets. Establish productive and professional relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers in assigned customer accounts following a periodic meeting plan. Coordinate the involvement of regional sales team and internal support functions such as Application Support, Customer Service and management resources across multiple locations in order to meet account performance objectives and customer’s expectations. Proactively lead a joint company strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for both short- and medium-term horizon. Proactively assess, clarify and validate customer needs on an ongoing basis. Lead solution development efforts that best address customer needs while coordinating the involvement of all necessary company personnel. Monitor and report all customer and competitive data.  SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE: 10+ years professional sales experience 5+ years of direct semiconductor sales experience University graduate in business administration or in any engineering discipline Advance degree in business administration preferable Work experience in an ISO certified manufacturing environment helpful LEAN programs or related process improvement systems knowledge helpful

description: As a SMB / Startups Sales Manager at Stripe, you will play an instrumental role in fueling Stripe’s growth through new customer acquisition. In this role, you will build and lead a team of high-performing Account Executives, helping them to develop their skills and deliver on their ambitious targets, as well as rolling your sleeves up to work directly with customers. We are looking for a proactive leader who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, managing high-performing teams and solving complicated problems with limited oversight. Ideal candidates will have management and leadership experience scaling a technology sales team and possess first-class analytical, communication and relationship-building skills.  You Will Recruit, develop and lead a team of Account Executives who focus on small and medium, high-growth, tech-forward businesses Work with senior leadership to develop the long-term vision and strategy for the team, and manage day-to-day operations with a focus on performance against key sales and growth metrics Be accountable for increasing revenue and new client acquisition at high rates of growth Coach and guide the team in developing consultative and solution-based sales skills Inspire, motivate and enable development of team members to promote career growth and impact for Stripe Work collaboratively and cross-functionally across the organization to help shape Stripe’s products and solutions to meet customer needs Play a personal and direct role in building and maintaining enduring customer relationships, up to C-level. Implement programs to improve pipeline generation efforts and improve overall efficiency for the team We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of relevant experience, with 4+ years of people management experience preferred Experience leading sales in an early stage, high-growth technology environment Ability to hire, train and coach a high-performance sales team Ability to build relationships with strategic client and industry thought leaders Demonstrated passion for start-ups and new technology businesses Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts, and translate them into industry- or business-relevant terms Strong understanding of the sales process, including prospecting, discovery, qualification, close plans, forecasting. Nice To Haves Prior experience at a growth stage internet/software company Prior experience forecasting and managing a high growth commercial business Prior experience running complex sales cycles, ideally with both commercial and enterprise size companies Prior experience leading a team in an office outside of the company headquarters Prior experience in the payments industry and/or fintech.

jobTitle: Social and Cross-Media Specialist, Large Customer Sales
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media. Experience with the display advertising ecosystem.  Preferred qualifications: Experience managing digital advertising campaigns for large, complex clients with proficiency in online measurement, operations, and ad networks. Expert understanding of Google Ads’ value proposition, targeting types and cross-devices abilities, including apps space. Deep understanding of social platforms. Ability to deliver high quality results quickly and under pressure. Excellent organizational, analytical, communication, and influencing skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As a Social and Cross-Media Specialist, you will be an integral player within the Large Customer Sales organization, leading discussions with key client stakeholders to drive in-quarter and future business growth. You will help clients drive success on performance objectives in a product-agnostic form. You will aim to understand business context of the client beyond stated media objectives and learn of competing social alternatives that clients might use to outline benchmarks. You will build robust understanding across Googles products to connect the dots in new ways and generate trust internally and externally to be seen as a strong collaborator.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Drive adoption of Discovery Ads and capture new business from social budgets from performance agencies and advertisers through excellent sales, service, and innovative problem solving. Build deep relationships with social buying department heads from agencies and client direct teams to understand their objectives and advise on their current and potential opportunity of expanding their social activity onto Google platforms. Pilot new narratives and product bundles to unlock new social budgets. Work in tandem with agency and in-country sales teams on account planning, quarterly business reviews, and the role Discovery Ads plays as part of Google’s wider offering to agencies. Scale best practices and successful pitches and help inform Go-to-Market teams via product feedback on how to improve social buyer experience for Discovery Ads as well as co-pitch solutions.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, this might be the place for you. We'll help you build your career in Sales while you collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals. You are a self starter who is deeply passionate about customer happiness.  We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Representative to join our fast growing Sales organisation.  What You’ll Be Doing … Work directly with Account Executives (Mid Market, Enterprise & Large Enterprise) to drive pipeline through personalized outreach to multiple stakeholders within Slack’s key prospect & customer accounts Providing a world-class prospect and customer experience through every interaction Become a product expert and learn Slack's selling practices Keep meticulous records of interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce.com) Help to build scalable demand generation campaigns based on data Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our process Who You Are … 2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in SaaS Fluency in English Commitment to pursuing a career in sales Consistent track record of overachieving Empathic listener and persuasive communicator Competitive, resilient, and highly motivated A great attitude and love for teamwork Bachelor’s degree required About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Job Description & Position Requirements  At Radware, we fight for the good guys to protect customers from the increasing sophistication, volume and severity of cyber security breaches. We combine leading technologies, a global footprint of high capacity scrubbing centres and the expertise of our managed Emergency Response team that can only come from 20 years of market experience.  We're and engineering led organisation, putting the time, investment and energy into the integrity of our solutions and adapting to customer needs - that's why IDC remarked that "Radware is ridiculously always accurate"  In any increasingly challenging threat landscape, customers need specialist skills to protect their digital assets.  A successful Regional Sales Manager is a challenger and possesses the creativity and ingenuity to open new doors, reach new prospects and be willing to fight for the good guys. This role is focused on new business development and customer acquisition across the markets. You will be supported by a strong technical and customer success team, as well as a generous compensation plan to support you while you build the new market.  Tasks And Responsibilities Accountable for achieving revenue consumption targets for Radware’s annual goals Demonstrate a robust weekly sales cadence and forecast discipline. A well-maintained sales pipeline and territory plans to reach your goals. Identify and nurture high propensity customers To develop and maintain customer relations, keep communication with, and be a constant sensor for customer satisfaction Consultative sales experience especially around the adoption of cloud services and network security in the infrastructure space Lead qualification for all the leads and sales opportunities for Cloud Services and network security within your territory Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and team Able to work across multi-functions/multi-individuals to achieve desired results Work closely with the Sales Leaders to ensure that Partner and Renewal Sales teams are providing sufficient support and on-track to contribute to achieving bookings and pipeline goals Qualifications Curious, resilient and passionate. You will bring a positive energy to the team and your territory A seasoned sales professional within the SaaS, Cloud , hosting markets and network security. You really know and can easily demonstrate an understanding of cloud consumption models and solutions We work and win as a team. Great teammate a requirement. Strong engineer team support. You love to tell a story. Articulating our capabilities and value in a customer’s own language Experience with new product introductions You build a balanced sales cadence to develop a robust territory while creating strategic opportunities You create and foster great customer relationships You feel comfortable in contract negotiations and deal forecasting Qualifications Minimum of 5years experience in Tech industry Proven track record in driving the business in territory Advantage: knowledge and expertise in Radware technology domains: Application and network security, Cloud security, Application delivery, Networking, , Virtualization. Private and Hybrid Cloud Experience in generating revenues through partners, alliances partnerships and direct sales Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Strictly follow company discipline and policy. Relevant academic degree Language And Communication Skills Excellent written and spoken communication skills Fluent in Mandarin & English written and spoken Presentation skills; high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences Exhibits good listening skills and comprehension Primary Location  SG-SG-Trivex  Work Locations  Radware Singapore, Trivex  Job  Sales
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security
