jobTitle: Business Development Executive with Intuitive Films
description: Influencing Positive Change through Creative Video Production  What Is The Opportunity?  Intuitive Films is looking for an experienced and energetic Business Development Executive who is driven to influence positive change through creative video production. The right candidate must share our core values and believe in adding value through purposeful work.  PEOPLE  You are a team player who can hold your own confidently. You are good with people and are great at bringing people together, through the good times and the challenging ones.  EXCELLENCE  You are driven to get things done and done right by setting high standards for yourself and the team - continually pushing the envelope while making a positive impact in all that you do.  GROWTH  You are dedicated to growth - both professionally and personally. You are committed to learning and expanding your comfort zone, while being generous in sharing what you know with your team members and helping them grow.  DO MORE WITH LESS  You are resourceful and manage time, energy, budgets and priorities well. You know what it means to leverage on what you have to create more than what might seem possible on first glance. Because you are outcome-focused, you know that everything you do is going into creating something by design.  Skills  If this environment sounds like a place you’d love to grow in and contribute to, here are the specific skills we need from you You must have at least 2 years of experience in a sales or business development role. Experience in a video, communication, media or advertising environment would give you a strong advantage, as with a proven track record of selling to B2B, G2B and G2C stakeholders. Someone who is an energetic, smart, confident and responsible go-getter with the desire and commitment to excel through negotiating win-win outcomes in a sales and marketing role. Someone who is an effective communicator with high professional competency in spoken and written English, plus a genuine sense of empathy, who connects and builds relationships easily with clients and partners from all levels. Someone who keeps abreast of the latest developments in diverse domains and is skilled in developing pitches and conducting consultative presentations with mid and senior level decision-makers. Someone with strong attention to detail and excellent time prioritization skills in balancing multiple tasks and accounts effectively. Someone who is nimble in using technology to achieve goals effectively and efficiently. Someone who is a positive team player with firm commitment towards the delivery of high-quality work and is accountable for our collective success. A recognised bachelor’s degree, with specialisations in mass communications or business as a plus. What Will You Be Taking Charge Of? Achieve revenue targets in a sustainable and value-driven manner, with a focus on generating new revenue streams and expanding our client base. Increase the company’s profitability and growth by researching trends, identifying and capitalizing on market opportunities; conducting competitor analysis; improving marketing initiatives and coordinating new product development. Capitalize on new business opportunities by working closely with the production and creative team to develop pitches and proposals in a responsive, detail-oriented and consultative manner with prospective clients. Interface between clients and our production and creative team to ensure high level of client satisfaction from pre-production to final delivery, with smooth and meticulous handovers of client relationships. Grow client relationships with key accounts by maintaining regular contact; exploring specific needs; and anticipating new opportunities. Contribute to the development and execution of the company’s long term strategic goals. Participate in the continuous development and execution of internal production systems, internal resources, best practices and marketing activities/material. What Can You Look Forward To When You Join Us? A people-focused working environment built upon respect, integrity and accountability. Being part of a team that is committed to personal, professional and organisational growth. An established company with a positive 14-year track record with clients, staff and collaborators. The ability to grow, shape and evolve with the company culture. Diverse clients and range of projects, with a focus on work that delivers positive impact and influences positive change. Continuous learning and training opportunities for both professional and holistic skills, with periodic performance reviews. Competitive pay package including performance bonus, CPF contributions, annual leave, sick leave, childcare leave and medical reimbursement. I'm interested!  Send us an email at hiring@intuitivefilms.com (Subject: ‘Intuitive Business Development Executive - [YOUR NAME]’) with the following: Your CV/resume Your availability Your contact number Your expected salary And tell us a bit more about yourself!  At Intuitive, we value and respect diversity - and we look forward to hearing from you. We will get in touch with shortlisted candidates for an interview within the next few weeks.  Find out more about us at: https://www.intuitivefilms.com We are currently only recruiting those who are already eligible to work in and located in Singapore.

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  About The Team  Starting on the Sales Development Team, you will receive world class training on our products and sales process, get acclimated to the industry, and familiar with our client demographic. Those who exemplify exceptional performance, will be quickly promoted onto one of our Corporate Sales Teams across multiple product lines. Corporate Sales representatives have the opportunity to progress in sales or leadership positions.  The Purpose Of The Department Is To  The Sales Development team is an essential team in Qualtrics sales and marketing efforts and is responsible for a combination of demand response, demand management and demand creation. Generate qualified pipeline that progresses through the sales funnel, generating new closed revenue. To develop new quota-carrying Account Executives. This opportunity will be predominantly focussed on our new business expansion plans across the SEA region.  You will report to our Sales Development Lead for SEA and this role is to be based out of Singapore.  A Day in the Life Demand creation (cold calling), demand response (warm calling), demand management (managed follow up process). Effectively communicate value propositions across multiple product lines to secure initial meetings with prospects You work with Account Executives to discuss and strategize methods to penetrate targeted accounts with the goal of setting quality meetings. You work closely with our Marketing team to execute on personalized account-based campaigns You’re the best with LinkedIn and Salesforce. You attend 1:1’s, team meetings, trainings, sales calls, discovery calls, demos, etc. to develop your skills. You collaborate with your peers sharing standard methodologies, “oops moments,” and role playing to make sure you’re focused on continuous improvement. Minimum Qualifications Bachelors Degree (or within 6 months of graduating) Reliable, confident, and articulate Ability to make a high volume of outbound calls and communicate well with VP level executives Highly motivated to accelerate your career in software sales Exceptional interpersonal ability Expectations for Success  As a SDR, you are responsible for contacting leaders and executives in organizations of all sizes across many verticals. Your focus is helping leaders gain insights around their market, customers, and employees, which allows them to make quicker decisions driven by data. You identify key decision makers and/or key influencers within an organization across many different departments You understand the impact our products have on our customers You articulate to prospects how our tools can help their organizations get to the next level with real-time data You work well with teammates, like to strategize, and plan out creative methods to generate more business opportunities You use rejection as fuel to motivate and push you to work harder and smarter You’re a self starter, competitive, and driven. You see the bigger picture. You don’t settle for mediocrity You don’t hit quota because that is what is expected of you, rather you blow past quota because it’s who you are Financial rewards, opportunity for growth, and promotions motivate you. What Differentiates Us From Other Companies We live by our cultural values: TACOS - Transparency, All In, Customer Obsessed, One Team, and Scrappy We hire the best with the intention of developing and promoting within. Our company success cannot be done without the success of our people. We lead from the front on important issues. We have several teams focused on Diversity and Inclusion (MOSAIQ), cancer research (Five For The Fight), WFH (COVID Taskforce), Women in Leadership (WLD), Veterans (QSalute)... the list goes on. We provide a very comprehensive benefits package with lots of opportunity to promote.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Because you belong at Twilio  The Who, What, Why And Where  Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Growth Account Executive (AE) to play a key role in further growing the business. As our new Growth AE you will be responsible for prospecting, solution selling, and closing our Growth accounts (1-100 employees) including some of the most successful startups!  This position reports to a Manager - Growth Sales, Rest of Asia and will be based in our Singapore office!  Who?  We are looking for a motivated Growth AE who possess a go-getter attitude and who want to grow their career in the fast-growing cloud market. 2+ years of demonstrated success in being responsible for your own book of business and directly selling a product or service in a technical SaaS/Telco space Experience outbound prospecting into install base, greenfield prospecting into new accounts, and executing strong QBR strategy for territory penetration within India/Asia. An understanding (or interest to understand) of the cloud computing/communications business model. You are passionate about the prospect of selling to a technical audience and have a passion for a solution and value driven approach to selling. You are able to easily lead complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple. You are technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility is a plus. What?  As a Growth AE, you will live the Twilio Magic values: BE AN OWNER: Responsible for new customer acquisition and driving new revenue for a specific territory while being assigned a quota for net new ARR and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction WEAR THE CUSTOMER’S SHOES: Work with customers across all verticals to understand their business and technical requirements. Understand the capabilities of Twilio’s communications API platform so that together you can craft a solution for their specific use case needs EMPOWER OTHERS: Work diligently with cross-functional teams in Accounting, Finance, Legal, Pricing, and Operations to design mutually beneficial contracts to address customer requirements and balance the needs of our business RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple project/deals at the same time. As an added bonus, you’ve previously sold cloud or B2B enterprise software. Why?  Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.  Where?  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  About Us  Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Telecommunications

description: THE COMPANY Singapore E-Business Pte Ltd ("SGeBiz") is a Fintech company incorporated in 2014. We believe in empowering businesses globally in the digital economy through innovative solutions, helping businesses accelerate growth through integrated payments, financing and our suite of value-added solutions.  EzyProcure is our proprietary one-stop procure-to-pay business solution for the F&B industry. This cloud-based platform has helped to improve the productivity of both buyers and suppliers through the automation of procurement, payments and reconciliation processes. EzyProcure also uses data analytics to highlight key patterns in the procure-to-pay journey, enabling more timely and informed business decisions. EzyProcure has recently been adapted and applied in the procure-to-pay journey for the hospitality, retail and education industries.   EzyPayment is a B2B payment solution which helps optimise cash flows for buyers and facilitating cash collection for suppliers. EzyPayment provides buyers up to 60 days’ of interest free credit for payments to suppliers, while suppliers can receive payments within 2 to 5 days. In the coming months, we will roll out more innovative solutions in integrated payments and financing.   THE Enterprise & Partnership Growth (EPG) TEAM The Enterprise & Partnership Growth team (EPG) is responsible for all partner-led projects and sales-led growth. As we are growing a new product segment in the electronic collection and payments space, we are expecting a strong sales pipeline of high-value deals with governments and enterprise clients.  The EPG team identifies key clients whom we can either find product and company synergies together, or high-value clients who needs a more curated product using our core offerings. This team encompasses high energy members with high expectations in quality output for their clients. The EPG team members focuses on cross industries clients, and have end-to-end skill sets to gap identification, creation of value to clients, negotiation, building relationship and managing key stakeholders.  THE ROLE As we are launching the new e-collection/ e-payment solution, we are looking for a team member to join our EPG team as a Senior Partnership Associate in a full-time role with responsibilities as follows:  RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for achieving sales & business development objectives / targets Plan and execute key account strategy, marketing activities and demand generation campaigns Identify client’s strategic priorities and interests Identify, negotiate and acquire new, high-value deals Identify, acquire & manage accounts (end-to-end CRM) for enterprise and/or government sales Ensure that the commercial terms for deals are in line with business objectives and strategy Manage existing key clients to sell, upsell, expand their sales volumes and maintain positive long-term relationships Develop innovative new methods of cooperation and sales acquisition Handle account management matters and be the point of contact for customers Work with cross functional teams to coordinate pre-sales, post-sales and support resources to drive successful closure and implementation for customers Coordinate and support communication plans for enhanced visibility and influence with targeted audiences. Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market and creative trends.  EXPECTED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: Degree in Business Administration/Financial Management/Economics or similar degree to understand complex and multi -level business lending dynamics 4-6 years of working experience in management consulting, management associate program, business development, enterprise sales, strategic partnership management or B2B sales, or Experience and proven track record successfully corporate business management with P&L responsibility/ entrepreneurial experiences Experience working with senior stakeholders to find win-win solutions. Proven track record of successful partnership management Demonstrate the ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization. Excellent interpersonal skills and entrepreneur mindset Strong business acumen and analytical skills – Complex problem solving skills Relevant industry experience in corporate banking, insurance, FinTech or Enterprise sales will complement the roles and responsibilities of the job Understanding of payments products and industry will be a plus
industries: Financial Services, Banking, and Information Technology and Services

The Challenge  Okta’s Business Development Representatives are high energy professionals that drive the demand, awareness, and interest for our market-leading cloud Security solutions. You will partner and collaborate closely with members of our Account Executive and Marketing teams to generate qualified sales leads, set meetings, and yield new deal opportunities.  We're an identity company. Identity matters because we’re all unique. We were raised in countries, cities, and towns. We have unique backgrounds. We’ve faced specific challenges. And we've learned a lot along the way. At Okta we believe those experiences equip us to look at the world with our own perspective. Our product protects your right to be you, and we want every single one of our employees to feel a sense of belonging, acceptance, and comfort to express their ideas, because ultimately our differences are what makes us great. Okta is rethinking the traditional work environment, providing our employees with the flexibility to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, no matter where they are located. We enable a flexible approach to work, meaning for roles where it makes sense, you can work from the office, or from home, regardless of where you live. Okta invests in the best technologies and provides flexible benefits and collaborative work environments/experiences, empowering employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. description: Our story  At Alight, we believe a company’s success starts with its people. It’s why we’re so driven to connect passion with purpose. Our team’s expertise in human insights and cloud technology, allows companies and employees around the world to transform and thrive.  With a competitive total rewards package, continuing education and training and tremendous potential with a growing global organization, Alight is the perfect place to put your passion to work.  Join our team. Because transformation takes a workforce. Learn more at careers.alight.com.   The APAC Growth Leader will significantly shape and determine Alight Go-to-Market strategy in the different markets where Alight operates in the region with the main objective to further expanding and strengthening its current market position and drive exponential growth in the next 3 to 5 years.  Main scope will embrace creating and executing the growth plan, leading the sales team, building a strong proposition for Alight customers, innovating to be ahead of the competition. To achieve this goal the APAC Growth Leader will directly manage a combined sales and account management function as well as the regional advisory function and provide local direction to the global functions supporting the region such as marketing, pre-sales, and delivery.  Responsibilities  Strategy: Defining regional growth plan to drive exponential growth in terms of financials and market positioning Determine right mix of markets, solution, partnerships, addressable market to execute on the growth plan and focus on launching new solutions and expanding current set of capabilities Lead the regional M&A strategy  Sales: Defining effective sales strategy for the complete variety of products and services portfolio of Alight including SAP, Workday and global payroll services. For that purpose, the APAC Growth Leader will work closely with international sales leadership team, to ensure growth and synergy effect for combined products and services offering Guaranteeing the sales execution to a profitable and sustainable growth and a market share increase Develop and implement agreed upon sales models and coverage strategies across multiple touch points and different routes to market. Serve as strategic advisor for the APAC market providing inputs and feedbacks to the global teams. Accountable for generating opportunities and winning large multi-year new business as a leader. Responsible for securing the strong pipeline of opportunities and ensure accurate forecasting of pipeline and revenues Ensuring a complete understanding of sales pricing and proposal models. Serve as the source for strategic advisory for the global teams in terms of trends and prospects for local and international market evolution and competition Building a top performing highly motivated team focused on sustainable growth, excellence in execution, customer centricity, accuracy, sense of urgency, planning and structure Fostering and influencing a winning and accountable culture based on; planning, structured approach, metrics and analytics, follow-up, business outcomes & consultative approaches, proactive approach and collaboration (internal teams, international teams, partners) Collaborate and build partnerships within Alight ecosystem to drive the agreed strategy, ensure consensus with the go to market and sales strategy overall Be responsible for the people leadership, team development and ethical behaviour by leading by example Create a trustful and respectful environment within the immediate team and the extended one. Be a collaborative member of the management team.  Customer management: Identify, develop and articulate the compelling value proposition to prospective customers and current end users Demonstrate the ability to carry on a business conversation with all potential clients and decision makers Being responsible for creating the highly efficient salesforce team involved in sourcing and bringing on board and maintaining the best quality of client relationships and referrals. Have a well-established and further expanding network within the representatives of top management     Key Competencies: Be Accountable and Inspirational Leader for the team Solve Problems Take Ownership Be Client Centric Be Effective and Proactive   Skills and Experience  Required 5 or more years of Enterprise level sales leadership experience Ideal candidate should have experience of sales / sales leadership across multiple APAC markets Minimum BA/BS or 4-year degree or equivalent experience Exceptional people management competences Proven experience in leading within a matrix organisation Several years of sales / business development experience in IT/ERP sector Experience in running complex sales processes and working with large international companies. Proven selling (mainly in solution selling), influencing, persuasion and negotiation skills Proven ability to develop and implement market growth strategies Strong client focus and outstanding capacity to work well with multiple clients Strong ability to share and communicate ideas both verbally and in writing in clear concise language Knowledge of HR organization and processes  QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Experience in developing and executing long-term sales and growth strategies, involving selling long-term (or multi-year) contract deals Human Capital Management Sales, HCM, HR Workforce Management Established track record of success leveraging a hunting mentality  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Alight believes diversity should be visible, valued, and sustained throughout the organization. And we’re committed to enabling an inclusive culture of belonging that engages all colleagues and grows the diversity of our talent to proudly represent the clients and communities we serve.  As an affirmative action employer, we adhere to the principles of equal employment opportunity in the workplace as defined in our diversity policy statement.    Diversity Policy Statement Alight does not discriminate against anyone based on sex, gender, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital or domestic partner status, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics or conduct covered by federal, state or local law. In addition, we take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified minorities, women, disabled persons, disabled veterans and other covered veterans.  Alight provides reasonable accommodations to the known limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants for employment with disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, practices and observances, unless doing so would result in undue hardship. Applicants for employment may request a reasonable accommodation/modification by contacting his/her recruiter.  Note, this job description does not restrict management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Alight business units.

description: The Business Development Manager is responsible for identifying and developing project opportunities for the Company. This role includes sourcing clients, structuring transactions, identifying and securing project rights. It involves addressing the client’s needs during the project development stage including project design and performance and coordinating with technical and account departments on project execution. This position reports directly to the Head of Project Development. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  Responsibilities Source and identify project leads, primarily in Singapore and potentially for South East Asia region Manage, review and coordinate bids, tenders and transactions that involve financing, structuring and securing projects Coordinate with design team and project management team for initial design and project schedules Prepare project cashflow forecast and IRR analysis from building owner & developer perspective Provide PV system performance analysis and options on impact on PV system energy outputs and financial returns Identify and coordinate any required project permits Participate with business development in opening new opportunities in niche markets – locate and analyse project opportunities for the Company to grow    Qualifications Bachelor degree in Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or equivalent experience Experience with sales acquisition, project development, tender preparation, project costing Experience in project financing and evaluating project returns incl. ROI and IRR analysis Network of contacts with commercial/industrial property owners  In addition to the above minimum listed requirements, candidates who have the following skills and capabilities may receive greater consideration during the evaluation process: Ability to speak more than 1 language Possession of a valid driver’s licence for Singapore

The Company: Preqin is an award-winning, independent, research company providing data and intelligence to the financial industry. Investment professionals use Preqin’s online products to obtain key information for business-critical decision-making. Preqin’s clients include fund managers, legal firms, institutional investors, financial advisors and placement agents.  Primarily a data company; Preqin is also a fast-moving fintech with a strong growth record and a world-wide staff base. Owned by our founder, directors and employee shareholders, we care passionately about our customers, brand and the employees that make it all happen.  Team Overview: ASA (ASEAN and South Asia) is Preqin’s second largest team in APAC. It is a dynamic territory with its longstanding prime markets in Singapore, Malaysia and India; emerging market potential in Thailand, Indonesia and Vietnam.   The team has seen double-digit growth in annual recurring revenue (ARR) in the last seven years with a stable and growing serviceable obtainable market (SOM), consisting of established fund managers, institutional investors and service providers (law firms, consulting firms, banks etc.). The existing team of 3 salespeople consists of highly motivated, energetic and achievement-oriented individuals; this regional territory has consistently been one of the top drivers for APAC’s performance. The team’s primary goal is to grow Preqin’s business, relationships and brand equity in ASA.      Role Overview: The business development manager will own a specific market segment within the ASA territory; their primary goal is hunting and selling to non-subscribing new firms in order to achieve monthly sales targets and quarterly milestone goals.    Roles and Responsibilities: Develop a pipeline of new business opportunities within a defined sales territory Achieve or exceed monthly net sales targets Employ a consultative approach to selling Preqin’s services to new clients – deep understanding of clients’ business models and problems, and identifying the appropriate Preqin solutions Manage the sales process from beginning to end – this includes securing introductions with decision makers, providing prospects with product demonstrations, detailed proposals and consultations    Face-face meetings at client sites, events and conferences within territory Work collaboratively within a team environment to prioritize the interests of our customers and the firm Accurately report internal administration: CRM activity log, sales pipeline forecasting, monthly reports to management, renewal planning and proposal preparation  Key Requirements for this Role: At least 4 years of sales and / or account management experience in a similar discipline (preferred: financial data vendor, financial services, alternative investments, business to business SaaS sales, solution selling) Consultative sales (e.g. SPIN selling) and negotiation skills and experience in a B2B ecosystem Proven track record in hitting sales and retention targets An additional Asian language would be advantageous Excellent interpersonal skills in written and verbal communications Organized, detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize and respond quickly Highly proficient in MS Office Suite and CRM systems. Experience with Salesforce is preferred Sales motivated, team-focused attitude, and willingness to collaborate with peers, product management, and internal key constituents at the firm Working knowledge of the financial market data space, alternative assets, and financial services industries Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business or related field required  Company Benefits: Competitive starting salary in addition to a quarterly performance incentive and discretionary annual performance incentive. Medical and dental benefits 21 days holiday We also sponsor employees to undertake professional training or to gain qualifications relevant to their career  Training and Development Preqin offers comprehensive Sales Training to all new members of the Sales and CS Teams. Our training is provided in the first few weeks of joining us and utilises powerful, up-to-date techniques along-side industry knowledge to create a truly bespoke training experience unique to Preqin. Individuals that complete our programmes are able to conduct more efficient prospecting, uncover more value within our prospects and clients, resist and overcome objections and achieve success in a shorter period. Once completed and an assessment passed, all Sales & CS reps will be fully certified in Preqin Sales Fundamentals and experience a reduced ramping period and earn more money, faster.  Covid 19 note During the COVID-19 pandemic, Preqin has closed its offices and moved staff to work from home. Our primary goals are to ensure the safety of our employees, and to keep providing our clients with the best-in-class support they have come to expect from us. However, we have not slowed our recruitment activity due to the outbreak, and have adopted a remote interviewing, onboarding and training process. Our growth plans have not stopped, and we anticipate onboarding a significant number of staff in the coming months.
industries: Venture Capital & Private Equity, Capital Markets, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Business and Sales Operations Lead -Southeast Asia, Korea & India
description: At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. In Consumer Channel Sales & Marketing (CCSM) our purpose is to create value with our partners, to market and sell innovative consumer solutions powered by Windows, Office, Surface, and Xbox. We’re positioned right at the intersection of customers, hardware partners, and channel partners. Our team works with ecosystem partners and internal business groups to drive digital excellence and e-commerce capability, as well as accelerate cloud and subscription adoption. Together, we win by delivering compelling at-home and on-the-go experiences combining intelligent edge devices and services that create Microsoft fans for life.  As a member of our team you’ll be part of growing a multi-billion-dollar business, charting new areas of innovation and impacting billions of lives around the world. You also will be a part of a culture centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. If that appeals to you, it’s an exciting time to be here in CCSM.  Responsibilities  The Sub-Region Business and Sales Operations Lead role is responsible for CCSM sales and marketing enablement by driving breakthrough improvements in operational excellence, compliance, and change management. This role’s main accountability is the operational excellence of the CCSM Sub-Region and to help ensure the quality, efficiency and impact of business process for both our internal people and external partners. In addition, the Business and Sales Operations Lead role in the sub-region is driving the people plan alongside the CCSM Sub-Region Lead, owning the communications for the Sub-Region, and managing the rhythm of business for both internal and external events including work back schedules, LT partner engagements and partner visits.  The Business and Sales Operations Lead constantly identifies areas to improve the impact and compliance of key partner sales motions, investment programs, processes, and account planning. This individual contributor role, who is part of the Sub-region leadership team, requires the ability to think both at a strategic and programmatic level, be able to effectively drive processes and consistency across the business of the whole region and deliver impactful business outcomes, and ensure effective running of business for the sub-region team. The individual needs to be comfortable engaging senior leaders while managing priorities with influencing skills and executive maturity while making decisions in a fast-paced, complex, and matrixed environment.  The Business and Sales Operations Lead role will report to the CCSM Sub-Region Lead and is one of only a handful of roles which will look left-to-right across the sub-region and all CCSM businesses in the sub-region - creating the contractual framework through which we sell 1st party and 3rd party physical and digital products through multiple partner channels to market and managing the related marketing and incentive programs. An affinity for learning, the ability to form educated recommendations and strategic thinking and an ability to influence at executive level are critical to this position. This role gives the opportunity to plan and build end-to-end processes, projects and programs with significant complexity and drive innovation and change for the consumer business. A positive attitude, a team mentality, growth mindset and adaptability creativity are crucial for success in this role. This role will also be responsible for the sub-region people plan initiatives, culture building and driving the sub-region rhythm of business to ensure we think people first while keeping the partner in the center.  Key Responsibilities Include  PLANNING Drives the partner onboarding process in the sub-region Managing the Region/Sub-Region ROB (Planning work back schedule, LT partner engagement, LT team meetings, strategic presentation management incl. agenda, stakeholders and action facilitation) Supporting the culture work in the Sub-Region through leadership team development and execution of the People Plan initiatives Drives partner engagement rhythm of business including corporate visits and virtual tours planning EXECUTION Driving account segmentation and profiling, and ensuring good CRM hygiene on the region level Driving regional reporting capability for account level, market data and insights, and owning partner reporting and data management platforms (1P/3P) Owning MS Sales and/or O2 account mapping and queries management (i.e. TPIDs) Overseeing of tools and processes, and driving readiness and adoption across the region Process management and change management excellence (new process requirements, process “fixing”, central point for all process and tool change rollouts, excellent communication skills) Driving awards nominations for the Sub-Region Owning onboarding of new hires to the team Driving Sub-Region communications plan including internal communications, external interview support for the leadership team, and communications related to the internal and external events MEASURE AND MONITOR Business compliance champion Driving CPE action planning with the account teams Qualifications  The ideal candidate is required to possess the following skills and competencies: 8+ years of experience within operations or partner facing sales and/or marketing roles Other Consumer/Retail sales and marketing or partner related background is preferred Experience with sales agreements and investment programs (e.g. rebates and marketing) preferred Proven track record managing inclusively in a highly diverse team with both direct and indirect reports Change Management certification or Project Management certification preferred Previous experience leading project teams and working with senior executives in fast paced, high pressure, often ambiguous environments Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  We are seeking proven sales performers to help us grow our loyal customer base for our Commercial division. This is a role for someone who is a hunter and eager for new business success. Responsibilities include generating new business in new accounts and also expanding the footprint inside existing customers, as well as playing a key role as you drive strategic CRM initiatives for our customers. This is a role for someone who can see the value of Cloud Computing and who can be a combination salesperson and evangelist to get the Salesforce penetration into the sector growing even more. On top of your own business development, we provide a range of support functions to help build and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre-sales so it is not just you against the world.  Responsibilities Developing and managing relationships within our Commercial segment focusing on customers in the Singapore market. Orchestrating complex sales-cycles and presenting to C-level executives the value of our enterprise suite of applications. Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in Salesforce while creating satisfied and reference-able customers. Demonstrating our product via the Web. Requirements 6-10 years of experience carrying quota and closing deals in software (business applications preferred) or technology sales. Extensive experience selling to customers in Singapore. Consistently over-achieved quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions. Successful track-record managing complex deals from lead to close. Business-level proficiency in Mandarin or local Asian language is advantageous Bachelor's level degree required. Desired Skills Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communications skills. Previous Sales Methodology training preferred. CRM experience preferred. Ability to work in a fast pace, team environment. Strong customer references. Strong digital literacy, including CRM, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  Business Integrity's mission is to ensure safe and trusted connections between people, businesses, and Facebook. Our team works together to anticipate and predict potential threats to our platform, design and build tools to protect against these threats, and then implement and enforce these systems at scale. We leverage data analysis, machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and data science, to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps. Successful candidates for this team are adaptable, creative, have a bias toward action, aren't afraid of being wrong, and can successfully work across various teams & countries. This role is based out of Singapore.The scope of this role is APAC region excluding China.  Responsibilities Manage a team that partners with cross-functional teams, in particular our Sales function to lead or contribute to large scale strategic projects as well as solving ongoing operational problems at scale. Build strong, strategic relationships with Leaders across the Sales and Business Integrity organisations. Build and manage dynamic teams, and coach for high performance. Identify and assess risks & opportunities to enable and maintain quality in the ecosystem by thinking of scalable processes and solutions. Develop goals & metrics to assess impact, Improve operational metrics and proactively communicate regular updates, trends and the impact to diverse stakeholders. Effectively communicate our broader policy approach to internal and external audiences, representing specific policy areas as required. Leverage data-informed insights to drive new products and initiatives Work with data and measurement partners to identify and track key program performance indicators, and ensure the results contribute to overall company, product, customer, and community experience goals Identify trends to enhance the support and detection processes and improve team efficiency. Develop domain expertise across Business Integrity, informed by trends in business and technology including knowledge of current/potential Facebook business models and evolving customer needs. Minimum Qualification Bachelors or Advanced Degree 10+ years of Experience in a role involving strategic initiatives (ie: sales support/enablement, operations, project management, consulting experience) in eCommerce / Internet-enabled service industry 5+ years of experience leading global teams Experienced at collaborating effectively with diverse cross functional teams Experienced at influencing and advising senior stakeholders Experience managing with ambiguity and principles in a high-pressure environment Experienced at shaping strategy and execute against that strategy, with appropriate prioritization of people and resources Experienced at communicating effectively with a variety of audiences (internal, external, 1:1 and at scale) Experience being a “connector” across teams and influencing data, business, and engineering teams through an understanding of business and ecosystem needs Preferred Qualification Understanding of relevant landscapes including ad tech, policy, and spam/fraud Experience in APAC online ecosystem
industries: Internet

description: Acquia is redefining the digital strategies of companies all over the world with our open cloud platform. We are passionate and relentlessly committed to helping our clients create digital experiences that are more relevant, personalized, and built for a constantly evolving, always-connected, mobile-first world. Headquartered in the US, we have been named as one of North America’s fastest growing software companies as reported by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, and have been rated a leader by the analyst community and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future of the web, and we want you to be a part of it!  The Enterprise Account Executive, will be tasked to develop, own and handle closing new business in Asia Pacific. Responsibilities include ensuring that prospective customers have the best possible experience and finding the right mix of Acquia offerings for their needs. The ideal candidate fosters deep relationships with prospective customers, partnering with them to resolve their needs and delivering elite service.  The ideal candidate will have deep experience with solution selling of sophisticated enterprise software with a background around web development, Cloud/SaaS, Web Analytics, Marketing Automation, Web Content Management or Social Software.  Responsibilities Develop and execute a go-to-market strategy for Acquia's offerings in the APJ region. Identify and establish relationships with key corporate C-level representatives through prospecting, marketing leads and expansion of existing contacts within accounts Build and maintain strong sales pipeline and forecast, through discovery calls and meetings Drive the sales process and handle the contract and approval process of new deals, including negotiating on price and getting approvals including contract terms Meet or exceed set Quota targets and Key Performance Indicators for sales based activities Completes required reports on time, maintains accurate forecast Coordinate all information in Salesforce.com Contribute to the development of sales strategy through input of ideas and suggestions to senior management team Build awareness for Drupal and Acquia within large Enterprises and System Integrators Build and foster positive relationships with new and existing Acquia partners Qualifications History of exceeding quota Experience with SaaS technologies. Preferably around website development or Web Content Management A clear understanding of current social media capabilities and their impact on businesses of all sizes Demonstrated ability to handle both direct and indirect opportunities Significant experience in a new business Sales role ideally within a similar start up and high growth organization Attributes Highly motivated, hardworking, outstanding teammate A high level of intensity to work with an experienced, motivated leadership team focused on creating a significantly sized company in a short timeframe A passion for excellence including an innate desire to build a metric driven business Excellent thought leadership traits with the ability to successfully drive fundamental changes in web strategies Strong analytical and writing abilities Outstanding presentation skills Ability to travel Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What we're looking for:  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Enterprise Account Executives to join our sales team and focus on enterprise customers in Singapore. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while supporting others in doing the same. You will be responsible for driving sales opportunities with prospective customers as well as expanding business within existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You'll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback.  If you're an established sales professional with a proven track record in helping customers achieve lofty goals, we should talk!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include …  Own the full sales cycle from lead to close Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers Help educate customers on the value of Slack throughout their adoption cycle Build Slack awareness at all levels of an organization Identify customer needs to ensure customer success with special emphasis on signup, upgrade, and renewal Collaborate with other members of the sales team (solutions engineers, customer success managers, leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Prepare and educate customers on new features and releases Monitor and identify adoption and utilization trends Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product Handle all customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to key accounts  Who You Are...  You have 5+ years of software sales experience, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-Suite You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions Ability to orchestrate and collaborate with cross-functional teams You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have a post-secondary degree, or equivalent experience Some travel required  About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

jobTitle: Mid-Market Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 11 years of experience in sales and delivering on business goals. People or team management experience.  Preferred qualifications: Experience creating and implementing sales strategies with customers. Passion for value-based solution selling with a drive to innovate. Track record of building top performing teams through coaching and frequent, high quality feedback, and role modeling a growth mindset. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills. Ability to take ownership for decisions, secures support, and remove key obstacles. Effective at influencing others, and driving cross-functional collaboration.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As the Manager of Google Customer Solutions (GCS) Mid-Market Sales (MMS) team, you will help to develop and maintain relationships with customers and internal Google stakeholders, design and implement partnership initiatives, grow and develop a team of MMS representatives, deliver on all business goals, and contribute to growth plan. With an inclination for strategic analysis and planning, you will conduct advanced analytical and strategic work within the Google Sales organization, identifying customer needs, and understanding how our range of product offerings can grow their business.  You will be central to setting the strategy for the Vietnam market and work with market teams to align on the vision for wider market. You will set high standards, define the business culture and be a thought leader in both Vietnam and Southeast Asia. You will define how to optimize growth and drive team performance and product/solution enhancements to deliver an excellent experience to Google's customers at scale.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage, inspire and motivate a team of client-facing and high-performing Googlers to create a goal-oriented culture with inclusivity and collaboration in mind. Coach your team on engaging with and influencing stakeholders across your team’s portfolios to deliver client success and shared business results. Lead your team in analyzing customer data and industry trends to develop strategic plans for customers and/or partners. Lead and strengthen executive-level relationships through key C-level meetings, business reviews and speaking engagements. Ensure team readiness to deliver digital complex solutions. Create a culture of sales innovation and customer success on the team based on diverse, equitable and inclusive team environment.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: Imply, founded by the original creators of Apache Druid, is originating and leading a new category of data analytics focused on analytics-in-motion. With analytics-in-motion, organizations can move away from analytics solutions that are static, difficult to scale, delayed and expensive, and towards analytics solutions that are interactive, highly scalable, real-time and cost effective.  According to our Series C lead investor, Bessemer Venture Partners, Imply is "upending the world of analytics, as it is now a competitive disadvantage to wait hours or days to iterate on insights, to make decisions based on stale data, or to leverage solutions that either crumble or cost a fortune at scale."  Every day, more and more established enterprises and digital natives realize the power of Analytics-in-Motion, and we are far ahead in this race to redefine analytics across the enterprise, with numerous marquee customers and demonstrated customer success worldwide.  Imply is Series C funded, with A16Z and Bessemer Venture Partners as our lead investors. Join our high-performing team!  The Role:  We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Development Representative to come aboard! Our SDRs generate leads and build customer pipelines. This is a role with a dedicated growth path and the training to be a great technical sales professional. We are looking for self-starters with a passion for technology and people. Preferred location Singapore but open to Hong Kong based candidates.  Responsibilities: Research heavily into accounts to maximize the value of outreach Generate appointments by means of proactive outbound prospecting and lead activity management in an effort to qualify and market our solutions to potential customers Work directly with marketing to discover opportunities from leads, and set appointments from those leads Use of strong selling and influencing skills to set up qualified appointments Understand Imply's technology enough to provide a high level introduction Leverage taught sales techniques to maximize customer interactions Log, track, and maintain outbound activity Work closely with Sales Directors and attend customer meetings as required Attend sales meetings, vendor training, and local trade shows to keep current with technology  Requirements: Four year college degree from an accredited institution 5+ years experience with 2+ in pipeline generation activities English/Mandarin bi-lingual requirement A passion for research as well as a strong in-person, phone, and written customer communication skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Ability to make formal and informal presentations to staff and clients Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals Strong PC skills required; knowledge of Salesforce.com a plus Ability to manage time effectively, work independently, and be self-motivated Prior track record of achievement in positions with significant accountability Interested in pursuing a career in technology Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment Proactive, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills  Imply is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Please note, applications and candidate submissions are subject to our privacy policy and, for California residents, the CCPA terms available at https://imply.io/privacy.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Bottomline is at the forefront of digital transformation. We are a growing global market leader uniquely equipped to address the changing needs of how businesses pay and get paid. Our culture of Working with and for each other enables us to delight our customers. We empower our teams to think like owners driving customer satisfaction, helping them grow their business and win in their markets.  We are looking for a Head of Business Development to innovate, win, and grow with us.  This role demands a qualification, or significant experience in the Financial Messaging and Payment solutions in a hosted environment. The candidate is expected to have qualification in Business Development, Economics, Finance or Marketing.  As Head of Business Development, the candidate should also possess the below soft skills: High-level communication skills Stakeholder management skills Proven ability to negotiate Experience with design and implementation of business development strategy Conflict resolution The ability to self-motivate and motivate a team Experience working to and exceeding target. Business Development Role Develop effective Sales strategy to acquire new customer for the Finance Messaging market in Singapore, Australia and South Pacific Region Build Strong Pipeline for the company hosted solution in Financial Messaging Account for at least SGD 500K in new business in each financial year Lead and managed large RFP responses to ensure corporate objectives for profitability, sustainability and operational delivery. Partner Channel Role Manage existing Partner/Distributor in setting sales quota and target. Supporting and assisting the Partners to achieve their sales target Cultivate new business partnerships and deepen existing relationships to drive business particularly in Australia, Malaysia and Thailand. Transform poor performing distributors into successful growing partners, through developing individual growth plans and participating in their execution. Bottomline is a participating employer in the Employment Verification (E-Verify) program EOE/AA/M/F/V/D/E-Verify Employer.  Bottomline Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  You’ll love Bottomline because in everything we do we seek to delight our customers and we are passionate about building a company of which we can all be proud, and this starts with building amazing teams filled with team members that challenge you every day.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail
