description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: We’re Fever!  Fever is the leading global tech-enabled entertainment discovery platform with a clear mission: to inspire through live entertainment.   Our mobile-first marketplace allows both discovery/inspiration and seamless 2-click booking. Fever has also created a media network where our online communities can look for inspiration and local information (Secret Media Network owner of media outlets like Secret NYC, Secret London or Madrid Secreto among others). Fever and its Secret Media Network inspires over 60 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities.  The preferences expressed by these communities allow us to create new experiences, which we call “Fever Originals”. These are proprietary experiences in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences, develop and optimize new formats. Some successful examples include the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 3 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience” co-produced with Netflix, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party”, all launched in multiple cities across the world.  Fever is a US company with a team of over 750 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in many exciting cities such as New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid, Barcelona, or Sydney, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, and Atresmedia among others.  In order to pursue this objective we are looking for bar-raisers, people that want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us.  ABOUT THE ROLE  Here’s what you’ll be doing:  Create and maintain direct business relationships with the best venues, bars, restaurants and organizers in the city. Meet your sales goals whilst maintaining a high bar of quality Expertly manage contract negotiations with potential and existing clients, ensuring sustainable economics and long lasting value for both parties Evidence strong organizational skills to effectively balance and grow a large base of clients  Collaborate closely with our marketing team to build the Fever brand and promote the partnerships you forge  Keeping up to date with everything cool that’s happening in your city; think of yourself as the expert for new and trending experiences ABOUT YOU  Here’s what you should bring to the table:  3 to 4 years track record of sales success in a fast-paced, quota carrying role Strong desire to bring on new businesses as well as grow and manage an existing book of business Self-starter mentality with an ability to work in a demanding, dynamic start-up environment Demonstrated data-driven approach to business and task prioritization Excellent communication skills both written and verbal along with strong attention to detail Comfort in working with Microsoft Office, Google docs, and a Sales CRM (Sugar CRM is preferred) Knowledge of the city’s entertainment, events, and lifestyle trends Experience in media/ad sales a plus but not required BENEFITS  Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Stock options are possible. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Home office friendly Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: Job Description: Drive increased trading volume to the OTC & Lending Desk by understanding clients' liquidity needs, proactively identify ways for high and low touch execution services to meet those needs, and provide client support for execution, liquidity, and market colour. Build and maintain relationships with clients both on OTC trading, Lending and the financing business through quality execution and service Work with the Client Services teams to identify, onboard, and monetize new client relationships and proactively identify new business opportunities Provide market colour to clients on market conditions with an emphasis on liquidity and flow thematics and build trust through daily interactions Maintain a pulse on the sentiment, trading activity, and provide feedback from client base and marketplace and keep relevant internal teams informed Assist Product Managers by providing feedback from clients to help guide new product development that meets client's needs in both the spot trading business and financing business. Requirements: Cryptocurrency trading experience Experience with daily execution of trading and asset lending department functions Experience in repo financing, prime services and/or securities lending Understanding of risk management and the ability to implement this knowledge well Entrepreneurial mindset with a desire to build businesses from the ground up Strong data analysis, relationship management, and interpersonal communication skills. Passion for markets and/or crypto and digital assets Open for business travel and weekend work Bachelor Degree (or Above)

The product provides threat-visibility, so that attacks can be predicted in real-time before they happen.  The Job  Both Hunting and Farming responsibilities – build new business relationships and expand current accounts of channel partners. Assist with the partner onboarding process Meet and beat sales targets and objectives with assigned partner accounts Based ideally in Singapore but open for the right person  About You  Previous experience as a partner account manager and channel sales Have previously built relationships with business in the APAC/APJ region Knowledgeable about the Cybersecurity space ideal but not essential - SaaS at least MUST have strong local relationships in priority countries ideally in Southeast Asia and ANZ, Japan and South Korea  Package  $130k - $140k US Dollars Up to $240k OTE Company benefits and equity

description: As a member of the OVH Cloud Sales team, the Inside Sales Representative is in charge of acquiring and growing customers. Based in our APAC Regional Hub, the Inside Sales Representative is a key actor of OVH international presence.  Dynamic, proactive and passionate by Sales and the Cloud Industry, the Inside Sales Representative works in a multi-cultural team which ultimate goal is the client’s satisfaction. You are the first point of contact between OVH and a prospective customer. Your role will be to assist new customers by answering sales requests through calls and emails, both incoming and outgoing. You are responsible for customer satisfaction and for revenue generation within a diverse set of prospects within the mid-market territory.   #Missions Contribute to OVH's growth on the APAC Cloud market by generating business opportunities with prospective and existing clients Work with various lead sources: inbound calls, tickets, contact form enquiries, promotional campaigns, events follow up etc. Help clients identify additional needs Identify and overcome sales hurdles Identify the right OVH product in order to meet customer needs Convert potential prospects into OVH customers Manage a pipeline of business opportunities and add them to our customer system (CRM), Reinforce the OVH.com brand while providing excellent customer service.   #Profile You have a sales mindset and the ability to handle technical conversations You have knowledges on Cloud products (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, Dedicated Servers, VPS...) You are able to work over the phone and to answer electronic tickets generated by customers through email You have excellente communication skills both written and werbal You are customer oriented and technical acumen You are someone rigorous, autonomous, resourceful, organized and proactive With a great sense of service, you want to have a positive impact on your internal and / or external contacts You are open to the world and working in an international context is an important aspect for you You are independent and able to work in a fast-paced environment.  Do you want to join a unique human adventure? Explore new avenues and use your talents and energy to support an ambitious project? You are in the right place. Do not hesitate any longer and join the OVHcloud adventure!

description: This is a career-defining opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing tech company that is successfully implementing key building pieces of the world’s blockchain infrastructure that will power the digital agreements of the future.  Our ambitions are limitless, and we believe this open source technology will change the world.  In this leadership position which reports to the Head of Sales, you will work directly with our CEO, CMO, and your BD and Sales colleagues to help grow the adoption of Chainlink's leading blockchain technology across DeFi, decentralized insurance, blockchain gaming, and other decentralized application verticals.  Manage a Time Zone Team That Is Responsible For Onboarding and growing quality blockchain projects to Chainlink solutions and services Providing post-sales account management to drive product usage and customer satisfaction Build a world-class sales pipeline; executing effectively on each phase of the process Close deals in collaboration with colleagues from legal, engineering, marketing and product Identify, negotiate, and sign deals with new partners ranging from emerging startups to multi-billion dollar organizations  Requirements Professional Sales Management or Business Development Management experience Experience in blockchain / crypto space and conviction that it has the power to change the world for the better Exceptional track record of meeting goals, closing partnerships and deals in the blockchain industry Skilled at communicating with senior executives Our Principles  At Chainlink Labs, we’re committed to the key operating principles of ownership, focus, and open dialogue. We practice complete ownership, where everyone goes the extra mile to own outcomes into success. We understand that unflinching focus is a superpower and is how we channel our activity into technological achievements for the benefit of our entire ecosystem. We embrace open dialogue and critical feedback to arrive at an accurate and truthful picture of reality that promotes both personal and organizational growth.  About Chainlink Labs  Chainlink is the industry standard oracle network for connecting smart contracts to the real world. With Chainlink, developers can build hybrid smart contracts that combine on-chain code with an extensive collection of secure off-chain services powered by Decentralized Oracle Networks. Managed by a global, decentralized community of hundreds of thousands of people, Chainlink is introducing a fairer model for contracts. Its network currently secures billions of dollars in value for smart contracts across the decentralized finance (DeFi), insurance, and gaming ecosystems, among others. The full vision of the Chainlink Network can be found in the Chainlink 2.0 whitepaper. Chainlink is trusted by hundreds of organizations—from global enterprises to projects at the forefront of the blockchain economy—to deliver definitive truth via secure, reliable data.  This role is location agnostic anywhere in the world, but we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).  We are a fully distributed team and have the tools and benefits to support you in your remote work environment.  Chainlink Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager with a strong background in business development and sales. This role will be based in our Singapore office, and will be instrumental in taking a dynamic organisation to the next stage of its growth. You will have significant experience of closing SaaS or software business into financial institutions and be an instinctive and natural ‘hunter’.  You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of key client accounts and establishing yourself as a ‘trusted advisor’. To be successful in this role, you will have experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders, feel comfortable with sales at an enterprise level, and have the gravitas, personality, and ability to represent Xceptor at the highest level.  This is an individual contributor role, demanding a high level of strategic thinking, autonomy, and the ability to be a part of an entrepreneurial business in significant growth mode. The right candidate will be open to the challenges that this ‘start-up’ mentality may present.  RESPONSIBILITIES Manage and strategically develop a portfolio of key strategic accounts (existing and target). Deliver an annual net revenue target of license sales, through upselling and new business. Establish fundamental account plans and go to market campaigns built around our value propositions. Drive all aspects of the sales process, including: relationship management, product demonstrations, client workshops, contract negotiation and sales closing. Qualify leads through the evaluation of requirements and the development of a concise understanding of any decision-making processes and criteria. Work closely with the wider team to drive the delivery of new business wins. Develop relationships with decision-influencing senior executives within prospect organisations, both within IT and the Business. Build and leverage a network of existing and prospective clients.  EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS Significant experience of Financial Services SaaS and/or software license sales. Demonstrated sales experience and a proven track record of winning business within Financial Services institutions. Solution driven sales professional with a proven record of achieving /exceeding annual quota target. Able to demonstrate an understanding of the dynamics involved in selling SaaS & software licenses. Independent in identifying, managing, and developing strategic accounts. Experience of sales processes involving multiple tiers of complex organisations, and where the sales cycles are long and consultative. High level of gravitas, with experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders. Highly competent in delivering product presentations, managing client workshops, and proof of concepts. Strong commercial awareness with a high level of EQ. Excellent client facing, communication and interpersonal skills. A self-starter, who is naturally driven, ambitious and tenacious. Familiar with smaller company mentality.  In return we will offer exposure to global, blue-chip clients and an unparalleled experience of best practice. This is a fast-paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative environment where there are significant opportunities for growth and development.  Xceptor is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion, or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic, or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

description: Hi, I'm Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you're applying, you'll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio's, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.  At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will: Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there's always something new to learn.  You are... An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You're looking to work with a team of high performers where you'll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren't in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don't throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable Experiences And Skills You'll Bring To Puppet Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, But Not Required Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai) Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we're particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you're not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! Visa Sponsorship  Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet  Puppet's core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn't stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet's open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you'd thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!  Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.  Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.  PM16

description: Enfusion is a pioneer in developing innovative, native cloud investment management software, analytics, and managed services for asset managers and hedge funds around the globe. We underpin the investment operations of fund managers from our global offices spanning four continents. Our unique, seamless, SaaS-based platform is reshaping the global investment operations landscape by removing traditional information boundaries and uniting the front-, middle- and back-office into one system, with one unified data set.  Passionate about client service, we complement our software solutions with expert middle- and back-office managed services. In fact, we've been recognized as Best Managed Services Provider at the HFM EU Services Awards. We help fund managers around the world streamline their operations, mitigate risk, and improve transparency and reporting so they can confidently focus on what they do best – invest.  As a company, we’re absolutely committed to the growth, development, and well-being of our people. Enfusion is where you can pursue your passion, showcase and further develop your skills, and launch a meaningful and rewarding career. If you're looking for a culture that is inclusive, collaborative, entrepreneurial, values diversity, fosters and rewards creative exploration, and strives to continually exceed client expectations then we're looking forward to hearing from you.  Learn more about Enfusion by visiting www.enfusion.com and apply today!  We are hiring for a Sales Development Representative and it is a vital role in the growth at Enfusion Systems.  In order to fuel growth, we’re building out a world-class Demand Generation team. That presents a unique opportunity for this role to become part of a dynamic team and learn one of the most in-demand skills in marketing. We are seeking a highly motivated and tech-savvy individual to join our team. The individual in this critical role is one of the first contact points for prospects and will set the tone for the sales cycle by setting appointments for Enterprise Sales Representatives.  Given a set of target accounts and verticals, the SDR will use a combination of research, personalized cold emails, and cold calls to connect with specified personas within targeted accounts and verticals. The Sales Coordinator will assure a firm handoff to an Enterprise Sales team member to achieve his or her monthly opportunity quota. You’ll learn about marketing automation, CRM’s, digital marketing, analytics and much more. In fact, joining the marketing team is an opportunity to fast track your career in sales or marketing with Enfusion systems.  What You'll Do Research targeted personas within the Enterprise sales team’s Top Accounts to ensure effective conversations Send personalized emails and make outbound calls to targeted prospects Achieve or exceed goal for sales qualified leads and sales accepted leads (in both quantity and quality) and ensure proper handoff to Sales to assist in growing the revenue of the company Proactively learn Enfusion products and services, competitor products, and industry Offer pertinent resources (white papers, e-books, infographics, relevant blog articles) to prospects in an attempt to foster a relationship and increase education in the early stages of the buying process Maintain strong relationships with sales team through clear communication and follow-up Support various marketing activities to contribute to strategic efforts Leverage Enfusion tech stack and other relevant tools such as LinkedIn and Pardot to keep track of targeted contacts and manage daily activities Meet with your assigned Sales Reps and establish expectations of your partnership Qualify outbound opportunities and collaborate with Account Executives for a smooth customer experience Who We Need 2-5 years of experience in a lead generating role or sales Bachelor's Degree in a related field A passion for learning A high work ethic Exceptional attention to detail Sales experience an advantage You’re entrepreneurial and highly commercial Knowledge of a CRM or database is an advantage Microsoft office / Google package Must have a good sense of humor Perks of working for Enfusion Competitive compensation and performance bonus 100% company paid health insurance premiums Entrepreneurial environment Global working exposure Personalized training and development plan Enfusion offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage (Enfusion covers 100% of the premiums for employees, spouses, domestics partners and qualified dependents); a 401(k) plan with a employer match; a generous Paid Time Off policy; and paid parental leave. Other perks include commuter benefits, an employee assistance program, and a Flexible Spending Account (FSA) program. All benefits and programs are subject to applicable eligibility requirements.  Enfusion is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity to job applicants and employees in recruitment, hiring, employment, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Enfusion will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by laws or regulations in the locations where we do business. We endeavor to maintain a drug-free workplace.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: We're Hiring!  If you aspire to leverage your capabilities and experience to join a Startup at the stage of exponential growth, this may be the right opportunity for you! Our software platform will revolutionalize the way buyers and suppliers in the supply chain connect, make payments, and link to financing in an end-to-end ecosystem across different industries. Be part of a fast-growing startup where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, and everyone is valued as an important contributor in the organization.  Sales & Business Development  Working closely with the entire company, you are the Sales’ first point of contact for our clients and prospects. Your mission is to demonstrate to potential clients how Doxa software and platform will be suitable for their business needs. A technical and entrepreneurial mind-set as well as a very strong motivation to seize a challenging opportunity and succeed are necessary to support sales development and be successful in this exciting role.  Job Responsibilities Seek out new opportunities and turn them into business, build a strong sales pipeline and achieve the company sales target and forecast Work Closely with Pre-Sales to understand customer requirements & develop Sales strategy Develop the company offer bringing expertise on products and technical solutions in order to optimize deals and sales according to actual and potential customers’ needs Present fitting products and services to clients and prepare commercial offers, including proposals and quotations Maintain and develop high-level prospect and customer relationships in order to retain existing business and develop new opportunities Intelligence gathering on customers and competitors Diligent Update of Sales Activities and Funnel into CRM System Job Requirements A proven successful sales experience with IT solutions, preferably B2B Sales. Knowledge on Construction, F&B, Wholesale, Manufacturing or Logistics industry will be a plus. Understand in detail technical and commercial characteristics of Doxa software and platform Established existing corporate network with SME and mid-market enterprises in Singapore will be highly advantageous Excellent communication skills in both technical & non-technical ways with all stakeholders Client orientated and very good inter-personal skills Relevant senior sales profiles will be considered as well Must be Singapore citizen or PR If the above fits what you’re looking for, contact Joseph at joseph.seah@doxa-holdings.com.  About Us  Doxa Holdings is a young startup that is developing a best-in-class enterprise platform that connects buyers, suppliers and financiers seamlessly. To learn more about Doxa please visit us at www.doxa-holdings.com.

Lucid is a research technology (ResTech) platform that provides programmatic access to first-party data. With respondents in more than 100 countries, Lucid enables anyone, in any industry, to survey online audiences and get the answers they need. These answers reveal the sentiments, motivations, and behaviors of target demographics – data that can be used to build business strategies, measure the impact of digital advertising, publish research, and more. Founded in 2010, Lucid is headquartered in New Orleans, LA with offices throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.  Lucid is looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our team. The Sales Development Representative is a client-facing role that will work closely with the entire Marketplace Supply team to identify, cultivate, and onboard new supply partners. The primary objective of the Representative is to proactively and systematically seek new relationships with prospective partners and effectively onboard them into our marketplace. Initially, the Representative will focus on generating new leads and be asked to meet expectations in that capacity before a territory is assigned. Most communication will be online, however, some amount of travel may be required.  This is a key role in the success of the sales team and a great opportunity to advance your career in sales, including account management and business development. The role will be based in London but remote candidates are welcome.  Responsibilities Work to identify and establish relationships with prospective new partners Understand prospective partner’s business model, technologies, users, and engagement practices Develop tailored plans that market Lucid’s solutions to prospective partners Organise and lead product alignment with leads Execute effective and actionable handoff plans for each client's account team Monitor and report on successful conveyance of new partners Qualifications B.A. or B.S. with interest in a sales career path in a fast growing New Orleans company 0-3 years of work experience preferred Comfortable working in a rapidly-changing, fast-paced environment Enjoys solving problems using analytical methods Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills Knowledgeable and curious about technology and it’s related industries Self-motivated and independent worker, who can thrive in a fast paced environment Additional Language skill preferred but not essential Lucid's Hiring Commitment  We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable – and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications.  We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.  At Lucid we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Lucid is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
industries: Computer Software and Market Research

description: CELLINK is the world’s leading bioconvergence company. As a global supplier of innovative life-science solutions, we strive to find synergies between the most recent findings in biology and the latest breakthroughs in mechanical and digital technologies. The best-in-class products we develop are also backed by our renowned support team of highly skilled application and technical specialists. We are committed to the highest quality because we know that our 3D bioprinters, bioinks, single-cell dispensers, imaging systems and liquid handlers are being used to solve today’s most pressing challenges in tissue engineering, cell biology, microscopy, drug development and healthcare.  Our three core values are passion, inspiration and persistence. We are passionate about what we do. We are inspired by, and work to inspire, today’s greatest scientific minds. We are persistent about going the extra mile to deliver the very best.  We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. As an equal opportunity employer, we do more than accept difference. We celebrate diversity, we support employees from a wide range of backgrounds, and we benefit from the added creativity and richness that these differences bring to our offices and community. We pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment where everyone’s talents and opinions contribute to the greater good and are always recognized.  We are looking for a Sales Manager SEA & Oceania for the Singapore office:  Responsibilities  You will be the face and spirit of CELLINK in the field You will be responsible for selling the Bioprinting products within the region Build the CELLINK brand through customer communication, organize workshops, and do live demonstrations for potential and new users Specify targeted accounts, identify business opportunities, close new business deals Develop and foster new relationships with local and international businesses and institutions Work with marketing to drive initiatives, enhance campaigns and build material for the SEA and Oceania market Arrange client meetings, identify opportunities, and generate leads with accounts in your territory. You will have individual responsibility for new business, and are expected to be autonomous; however, you will be part of a growing team of people focused on the European market. You will work in close collaboration with the management and internal teams for larger opportunities Partner with the application’s team in response to tenders and requests for information in a timely manner Work with our inside sales team to create campaigns targeting lead generating functions Confident negotiator and ability to ‘close the deal’ at all levels with the customer Travel requirements: up to 60%  Qualifications  Minimal 4-5 years of sales experience in laboratory/capital equipment or laboratory supplies fields Business experience in SEA and Oceania regions would be a plus Effective leader with an entrepreneurial mindset Minimum of Bachelor of Science degree preferably a background in Biomedical Engineering or similar Outside the box thinking, creative Proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite
industries: Biotechnology

description: Because you belong at Twilio  The Who, What, Where And Why  The Outbound Sales Development Representative role holds a key position in the growth and development of our sales pipeline. Success in this role directly impacts the evolution of how the company successfully engages and interacts with our customers, while helping to fuel the continued growth and success of Twilio.  At Twilio, you will be a part of a collaborative sales culture dedicated to the development and advancement of its team members, while maintaining a fun and rewarding atmosphere. You will have the chance to join a company that was just certified as a Great Place to Work! You will be provided a defined career path in sales and sales management depending on your performance.  Who?  They Also Have  Twilio is looking for an Enterprise Outbound SDR who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of being a team player and result oriented. 1-2 years sales experience in the PaaS/SaaS industries OR 2-3 years of closing experience in another industry. A go-getter attitude, who wants to develop new and innovative communications workflows. General understanding of Sales Enablement Platforms (Outreach), CRM and prospecting tools. Feels comfortable in any vertical and is technically curious. Thrives on helping customers solve their problems. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. Native or business level fluency in Mandarin is required What? DON'T SETTLE: Growth mindset of exceeding expectations and targets. DRAW THE OWL: Partnering with our Field Sales and Marketing teams to build creative outreach programs that build pipeline within your territory. RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Research and build new and existing accounts via adding contacts, outbound calling efforts and sending strategic email, video and social campaigns. WEAR THE CUSTOMER SHOES: Develop strong relationships (both internal and external), and really excel at building long-lasting partnerships with prospective customers. Why?  The Sales Development team is a strategic component to our go-to-market strategy. The Outbound SDR will look to capture the attention of enterprise level companies that have been around for many years. The Global Sales team plays an integral role in building out our customer base and bringing Twilio’s platform to developers, non-profits and enterprise to make an impact on their services.  Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications for customer engagement. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your career growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.  Where?  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  About Us  Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Telecommunications

description: Key Responsibilities  The Key Account Manager will be a key contact point for End to End process and services including, internal & External function. Internal function includes channel operation, Marketing, operation, Customer service, and Technology functions to manage aCommerce service to brand and improve the customer experience. Developing relationship with marketplace and new channel is also key part to drive client’s sales coverage and growth. Managing brand and channel portfolio to deliver growth to clients.  The ideal candidate would have key skills as fast learner, high interpersonal skill, logical thinking, problem solving, high responsibility, prioritizing and initiative thinking. The role will require a combination of financial, business development and account management skills.  Job Description  Performance Management Manage overall account profitability via P&L management Ensure all clients and channels are successfully on-boarded on time and deliver KPI on track Manage to maximize GMV with day-to-day collaboration with client and channels Customer budget management and P&L execution including reimbursement to deliver agreed GMV, Take Rate, and Profit Ensuring optimal product presentation and visibility on online channels Leading all initiatives Across different services Coordinating with internal cross function and external parties Establish and monitor progress against key performance indicators. Partner Service Responsible for client relationship and retain client satisfaction Serve as the “face of aCommerce” and primary point of contact for client executives and key stakeholders at each assigned account Advising clients on how to increase online sales through merchandising, promotion planning and onsite marketing activities Managing fast - growing e - commerce sales of large brand owners through their own webstore or other online channels and initiative channel Ensuring that regular reviews are carried out with customers, to ensure that their needs are being met and that excellent customer service is achieved and, developing future improvements/services for the customers. Ensure operational performance on all areas Identifies and anticipates additional opportunities for enhancements, improvements or new services with existing clients Inventory management including forecast, ordering and DOH controlling Works with other departments to ensure that everything is ready for go-live: warehouse, call center, web dev etc; Ensures that no processes or set up have been overlooked Present analysis and recommendations to key stakeholders both client-side and internally Leadership and team work Individual contributor in key account Able to lead project relating with responsible account and category Able to be mentor for key specialist that leads from account activities Able share knowledge and team player Business Development Contract Management by helping translate the outlined solution into a high level initial statement of work (SOW) and helps secure the client's agreement in sales meetings with the prospect or client (system & integration options, cost model, forecast value, activity planning, requirements definition, etc.) Working closely with Solution design and business development to manage key customers (existing and new), thereby improving turnover and profitability SOW & Trade Agreement management for existing account and input industry insight to SD for new customer. Key Qualifications 2 year++ working experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start - up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting Previous experience in trade marketing, brand management, merchandising would be a plus. Able to develop account plan Good knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint and ability to quickly adapt to new software and tools Proactive and problem - solving attitude Very strong commercial English as well as client - facing abilities Analytical, data driven mindset High interpersonal skill with problem solving About ACommerce  aCommerce is the leading ecommerce enabler in Southeast Asia, delivering retail solutions for global brands such as L’Oreal, Samsung, and Adidas, etc  Founded in May 2013, aCommerce has over 1,400 staff across offices and fulfillment centres in Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines.  The company is committed to equal opportunities for all of employees and to a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at aCommerce are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion or belief, gender, sexuality, age, family or parental status, or any other status that may be protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.  The aTeam is made up of highly ambitious individuals driven to innovate, build and succeed and is always looking for like-minded self-starters to join.

jobTitle: Head of Sales, APAC (Remote - APAC Region)
description: We’re looking for open-minded individuals who want to expand the ways technology can help people. We work fast, collaborate, and celebrate as a team. We’re united by a commitment to shaping Tile’s culture around the needs of our colleagues and customers, and by our desire to build a diverse and welcoming workplace.  We are looking for a Head of Sales, APAC to grow our Tile retail business in the Asia-Pacific region. This person will be responsible for achieving APAC retail sales targets by finding new business opportunities and driving our distributor and retail relationships. In this role, the APAC Retail Sales Leader will manage a small, but growing, team and work closely with our marketing and operations teams in the US to ensure optimal in-store and online experiences for Tile products. This leader must be willing to be involved with the entire sales process while we scale the business and the team. This position reports to the Global Sales Leader and requires regular meetings with executive level staff in the US (via zoom) and travel (when safe to do so) within the APAC region.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Direct sales efforts for APAC retail business, owning distribution relationships and developing key retailer relationships Meet/exceed sales targets while carefully tracking channel inventory levels Lead annual business planning and sales strategy for APAC Lead investigation and execution of new business opportunities for our hardware including partnerships, new retail channels and new countries Provide regular sales forecasting, updating twice monthly, ensure accuracy Ensure timely and accurate sell through and inventory data is provided to headquarters team Conduct QBR meetings with distribution partners and key cross functional partners internally to review business, priorities and opportunities Hire, develop and train a strong sales team. Ensure the team is executing on plans, discovering new opportunities and are developing in their careers Partner with the channel marketing team on in-store and online merchandising needs as well as budget updates for channel and promotional spends Provide competitive market and sales performance updates monthly during international monthly meetings with the headquarters team Partner with the marketing team to ensure we are appropriately building out awareness and consideration for the region. Advocate for what is needed, help make connections to in-region agencies or resources Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 10-15 years of APAC sales experience, as well as recent experience leading and driving a regional strategy Strong management and leadership skills leading a remote sales team Experience in Consumer Electronics, Consumer Goods, or Sporting Goods industries Experience working for a US-based company Experience managing retail and distribution partner relationships Strong relationships with retailers and distributors Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical approach Proven ability to operate well in a matrixed organization and with a Excellent communication skills - can communicate effectively with all levels of management Fluent in English required Location: Candidate must be located in the APAC region, potential locations (but not limited to): Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai Benefits Own equity in the company - every employee is a stakeholder in our future Work with an adept team of people who love what they do Flexible work program Remote work environment To learn more about Tile, click here to be directed to our careers page!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  ServiceNow is looking for a high achieving Commercial Inside Sales Representative ("Commercial ISR") to join our expanding Inside Sales team. You have a track record in new business pipeline generation through to close, over the phone. The Commercial ISR will produce new business sales revenue from software licenses within Small and Midsize Business (SMB) and Mid-Market accounts for clients with less than 1,000 employees in a defined geographic territory. This will be achieved through territory planning, including researching prospect customers, using business development strategies and completing field-based sales activities within an assigned territory.  Performers within the Inside Sales Team have gone on to excel in many different roles at ServiceNow.  What You Get To Do In This Role  The Commercial ISR builds relationships with clients while achieving quarterly and annual sales quotas for an assigned territory. Lead and nurture your sales opportunities and manage your territory Run sales from start to finish where the average sales cycle is 4-6 months Make a difference within a growing team and company Communicate accurate information to your management such as forecasting, territory plans, goals, etc. Build healthy business relationships to support customer adoption Partner with a team to collectively achieve success (solutions consultants, sales operations, field leadership and product line specialists) Qualifications  To Be Successful In This Role You Have 1+ years of experience in a direct or support role on a software or solution sales team Experience in Business-to-Business sales (B2B) Experience establishing trusted relationships with current and prospective clients and other teams An understanding of the sales process, with the ability to progress and manage complex sales cycles Experience communicating with CxO personas Travel for training or meetings may occasionally be required FD21  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance. description: We’re Fever!  Fever is the leading global tech-enabled entertainment discovery platform with a clear mission: to inspire through live entertainment.   Our mobile-first marketplace allows both discovery/inspiration and seamless 2-click booking. Fever has also created a media network where our online communities can look for inspiration and local information (Secret Media Network owner of media outlets like Secret NYC, Secret London or Madrid Secreto among others). Fever and its Secret Media Network inspires over 60 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities.  The preferences expressed by these communities allow us to create new experiences, which we call “Fever Originals”. These are proprietary experiences in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences, develop and optimize new formats. Some successful examples include the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 3 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience” co-produced with Netflix, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party”, all launched in multiple cities across the world.  Fever is a US company with a team of over 750 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in many exciting cities such as New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid, Barcelona, or Sydney, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, and Atresmedia among others.  In order to pursue this objective we are looking for bar-raisers, people that want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us.  ABOUT THE ROLE  Here’s what you’ll be doing:  Create and maintain direct business relationships with the best venues, bars, restaurants and organizers in the city. Meet your sales goals whilst maintaining a high bar of quality Expertly manage contract negotiations with potential and existing clients, ensuring sustainable economics and long lasting value for both parties Evidence strong organizational skills to effectively balance and grow a large base of clients  Collaborate closely with our marketing team to build the Fever brand and promote the partnerships you forge  Keeping up to date with everything cool that’s happening in your city; think of yourself as the expert for new and trending experiences ABOUT YOU  Here’s what you should bring to the table:  At least 5+ years track record of sales success in a fast-paced, quota carrying role Strong desire to bring on new businesses as well as grow and manage an existing book of business Self-starter mentality with an ability to work in a demanding, dynamic start-up environment Demonstrated data-driven approach to business and task prioritization Excellent communication skills both written and verbal along with strong attention to detail Comfort in working with Microsoft Office, Google docs, and a Sales CRM (Sugar CRM is preferred) Knowledge of the city’s entertainment, events, and lifestyle trends Experience in media/ad sales a plus but not required BENEFITS  Here’s what you can expect from us:  Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Stock options are possible. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Home office friendly Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020  What’s the role about? To foster and build good customer relationship at all levels for revenue growth and customer retention. To work with Solution Manager & Sales Specialists to propose relevant and cost effective ICT solutions for corporate customers, covering local, managed and hosting services. To understand and identify corporate customers’ ICT and hosting needs through regular engagement. To identify business opportunities and synergy with customers in areas of cooperation. To identify reciprocal businesses and areas of cooperation whenever there are opportunities. To provide one-stop ICT experience to customers covering related Singtel services. To ensure all support or tasks requested by Global Account Director are done timely and effectively. To ensure that all customers’ pre-sales & post-sales enquiries and works orders, commercial documents, dealings with customers are promptly attended to, documented and kept. To work closely with Singtel Global Offices to engage customers and to deliver services to customers. What do you need to succeed? A degree or higher with at least 5 years of relevant working experience in account management in various industries achieving an excellent sales track record. Experience in telco or ICT account management will be an added advantage Must be self-driven, energetic, resourceful, creative and good leadership. Must be proactive and have sense of ownership Able to project strong, positive image of self and company. Able to build good customer relationship at all levels. Able to deliver professional sales presentation, proposals and reports. Able to sell the full range of IT/Telecommunications solutions. High Proficiency in MS Word, Excel & Powerpoint

description: BigSpring is a mobile lifelong skilling platform with a mission to provide a direct path to employment for everyone. We empower people with the market-relevant skills they need to be gainfully employed and enjoy a high quality of life, and enable employers to measure ROI from learning to establish it as a core business driver - not a discretionary expense. BigSpring's reach extends globally across over a million learners with customers such as Uber, Google, United Technologies, Tata Steel, and others. The platform offers lifelong skilling for every worker and every job, with use cases including enhancing consumer financial literacy and driving sales channel productivity.  BigSpring was recently covered by Forbes and The Innovator and awarded as a "Technology Pioneer 2020" by the World Economic Forum for our cutting-edge technology and impact (past recipients included Google, Twitter, Spotify, Palantir Technologies, Airtable, and others).  About The Role  As a world-class Mid-Market Sales Representative, you will play a central role in scaling our Go-to-Market team by driving the full sales cycle from pipeline generation to winning new customers. You will build and close a sales pipeline by engaging in professional conversations with executives from targeted companies to drive interest, qualifying inbound demand, and demonstrating strong sales skills to drive the sales process to closure. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen and communication skills and be both persistent and resilient in striving to exceed goals.  As the first touch point with customers, you will play a key role in establishing BigSpring as a differentiated SaaS platform that focuses on creating value for each prospect & customer. You will need to partner cross-functionally with the Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to help build and execute repeatable sales plays.  For the right person that can bring passion, drive, and innovation to a fast-growing global company, this position offers the unique opportunity to have a considerable impact on the rapid growth of BigSpring. You can build your professional skills and develop an incredibly successful career at BigSpring.  In this role you'll: Engage and evaluate inbound leads with precise qualification Build and execute repeatable outbound prospecting sales plays to build pipeline with high velocity Research & track target companies to understand how BigSpring's solutions can add value to their organization Develop, test, and iterate messaging across multiple industries, use cases, and personas Codify and contribute learnings and best practices to the sales strategy Use a data driven approach to identify success criteria and accelerate sales cycles Leverage your sales acumen to identify decision makers early and progress the sales at each interaction Remotely deliver compelling product demos Track, report, and maintain prospects within CRM database to maximize productivity Consistently achieve weekly and monthly activity metrics & quota targets  What you'll bring to the team: 5+ years of work experience; Bachelor's Degree Quota carrying mid-market and/or enterprise sales experience at a technology company is a big plus You have the aptitude to quickly learn new technologies and industries Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional telephone presence Consistent track record of top performance in prior roles Thrive in high volume & high velocity environments Comfortable working with high degrees of autonomy in a global team. Self-starter with the hunger to be great Thrive in ambiguity and are able to create processes to drive productivity Singapore citizenship or Permanent Residence  Why you'll love working here: You'll be part of an innovation-driven, high-growth company on a mission to improve people's lives Competitive compensation package Flexible vacation and PTO Female Founder/CEO Supportive, highly collaborative team environment Bi-Weekly Learning Sessions  BigSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. BigSpring does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. You must have authorization to work in the location the position is posted.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Sift's Sales Development Team is looking for an eager & energetic new team member to join our APAC team in a remote working environment in Singapore.  As a Sales Development Representative at Sift, you will be responsible for generating a meaningful pipeline by driving interest with prospective customers on how Sift can positively impact their business. You will help identify and engage with future customers by outbound prospecting, social selling, networking, field marketing events, and any other sales activity that would contribute in expanding the Sift brand. Ultimately, booking qualified meetings for the Account Executive team while developing core sales skills and technical acumen in our career development program.  What you'll do: Handle all inbound leads by following up promptly to qualify, determine if there is a business fit, and set up calendar meetings for Account Executive. Identify Key Personas within your High Value Accounts and lay the foundation for a strong, long lasting relationship. Conduct high volume prospecting, sending personalized social & email touches, as well as 20-30 calls a day. Work closely with prospects and build out the APAC region with Account Executives in the region - aligning on strategy while setting up discovery calls with prospects for the Account Executive. Collaborate with Sales & Marketing to support successful campaigns. Represent the Sift brand at virtual events and industry conferences.  What would make you a great fit: Get Sift Done Attitude: You are self motivated and have the ability to thrive in a results-oriented environment. Win as One Team: You want to build a culture of collaboration and growth where you celebrate each other's successes. Start with the Customer: You are relentless in your goal to help prospects that can benefit from Sift, and will hustle and maintain urgency in all that you do. Courage Over Comfort: You are not afraid to ask hard questions, and strive to constantly reevaluate the status quo. Ever Better: You are constantly looking for growth opportunities and welcome feedback from your peers and managers.  Requirements: 1+ years of prior sales experience (SaaS, Tech, or Startup is a plus) BA/BS degree from leading university (Business or Technical major a plus) Excellent written/verbal communication and organizational skills Passion for sales and a desire to build a career in software and technology Experience with using Sales Tools (eg. Salesforce, Outreach, LinkedIn, etc) Proficient in English Bonus Points for Secondary language: Fluency in Mandarin, Bahasa, Vietnamese, or Thai  A little about us:  Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.  The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.  Benefits and Perks: Competitive total compensation package 401k plan Medical, dental and vision coverage Wellness reimbursement Education reimbursement Flexible time off  Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.  This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

description: About AVEVA  AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software, driving digital transformation and sustainability. By connecting the power of information and artificial intelligence with human insight, AVEVA enables teams to use their data to unlock new value. We call this Performance Intelligence. AVEVA’s comprehensive portfolio enables more than 20,000 industrial enterprises to engineer smarter, operate better and drive sustainable efficiency. AVEVA supports customers through a trusted ecosystem that includes 5,500 partners and 5,700 certified developers around the world. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, UK, with over 6,500 employees and 90 offices in over 40 countries. Learn more at www.aveva.com.  We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?  Responsibilities: You will work to develop new opportunities for AVEVA Account Managers. This will involve both working on Inbound leads created via marketing campaigns and leads created via your own research and Outbound prospecting. Within each sub-region you will work closely with local marketing, account management, and technical sales to generate new business and support the closing of business within the region. The role requires the candidate to have basic solution and service knowledge. Additionally, the role requires research, planning and production of simple business presentations for internal and external delivery. Utilize social media, email, and phone communication to deliver qualified leads for Sales Representatives and Account Managers to connect with. Meet and exceed monthly pipeline target. Maintain and develop leads in accordance with the AVEVA Lead Management process and maintain activity within AVEVA’s CRM solution. 1 Hour Service Level Agreement for Inbound Lead follow-up. Support Marketing activities, such as campaigns, events and seminars/webinars where appropriate. Comply with The ONE AVEVA Framework of Processes and Policies and other written and verbal communication from the management. It is expected that some travel to support Sales Representatives to clients, partners, prospects, AVEVA offices etc. will be a normal requirement of successfully executing this role.  Skills & Qualifications: Highly motivated, results-oriented with a positive and determined approach to researching and developing new Sales Qualified Leads. Passionate team player and a self-starter. Tackles routine tasks with energy and commitment. 5-6 years of Telemarketing Experience; previous Software Sales experience not necessary but an added advantage Quick to adopt new skills, motivated for career development, and able to develop an excellent understanding of the value proposition of AVEVA’s solutions. Commercial and analytical skills to identify market trends and opportunities for nominated territory, refining lead development plans to exploit such opportunities. Clear and confident in phone and e-mail prospecting. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong listening skills to logically determine the best solutions for prospect challenges. Understands the prospect’s business, and able to express that understanding accurately to the sales team. Bachelor’s Degree or professional qualification in related sales or marketing positions.  AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.  Concerning agencies: AVEVA does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
industries: Computer Software

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  Riskified is growing our Go To Market (GTM) team and looking for its first feet on the ground in our new APAC Office located in Singapore. This is a great opportunity to join an established, well-funded FinTech Company that is experiencing intense high-growth. You will be one of the first employees in Riskified’s Singapore office and play a key role in our APAC expansion strategy.  At Riskified, you’ll be generating leads (through creative and strategic research, networking etc.) and running early sales-cycle stages with enterprise and Fortune 500 companies.  Very successful candidates are able to identify a target’s needs and decision makers and then tailor their outreach accordingly. More than anything, we are seeking bright, driven people to join us and help drive revenue and make a direct impact on Riskified’s growth by becoming establishing members of our local operations in Singapore. If you’re the type of person who likes to figure out where problems exist and then solve them and take on unique challenges, we’d love to learn more about you!  What You'll Be Doing  Establish Riskified’s Presence and Brand in Singapore, and greater APAC, through all of the following: Identify partnership opportunities for Riskified in APAC, and constantly highlight new necessities in the region in order to improve the Company’s presence in APAC Work as part of team with Account Executives and other company resources to win new clients for Riskified Generate quality sales opportunities through proactive, strategic prospecting and networking Manage all sales and market growth opportunities - Create and execute a multi-faceted prospecting plan through research, cold outreach (calling and email), leveraging personal networks and following up on marketing generated leads Manage relationships with our partnerships in APAC to generate qualified leads Research industries and individual companies to find the best targets and establish and develop and nurture relationships with representatives at target companies through a variety of mediums Identify prospects’ key questions and pain-points Work closely with our marketing team to generate quality demand generation Represent Riskified at industry events in Singapore and the greater APAC Qualifications Fluent in English - strong verbal and written communication skills - MUST 3-5 years professional B2B tech sales/ BD experience / management consultancy experience - MUST International work experience - MUST Sales oriented and highly motivated Good analytical & research skills and ability to use both in an effective and relevant way in a sales process Strong interpersonal skills, approachable and able to build relationships with prospects Excellent public speaking skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organisation Ability to work in a fast-paced sales environment with minimum supervision Experience in payments and / or eCommerce - an advantage Technical experience - an advantage Consulting background - an advantage Additional local languages - an advantage In The News  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Fortune Magazine: 25 Best Workplaces in New York  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Built In NYC: 100 Best Workplaces  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Riskified is deeply committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
