jobTitle: Account Executive, Enterprise Corporate Sales - Singapore
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Position: Account Executive , Enterprise Corporate Sales - Singapore  The Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive is responsible for managing a large volume of smaller size opportunities within Enterprise clients. Partnering with our most seasoned sales executives this role will suit those who are looking to take their enterprise sales skills to the next level. With a sales model that fosters collaboration and supports your success, this is a great opportunity to forge a successful sales career.  With a business culture that has the customer's interests at the core of everything we do, we'll set you up for success by providing a comprehensive induction and on boarding to the business including a five day bootcamp in San Francisco. On top of your own business development we provide a range of support functions to help create and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre- sales so it is not just you against the world.  Responsibilities To exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling Salesforce solutions into ECS accounts within an assigned within a sub set of major account /customer or vertical market. You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales , while expanding existing accounts. Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Territory/Vertical identification and research, to formalize a go-to-market strategy and create qualified target accounts. Pipeline development through a combination of cold-calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated market sector(s). Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Executives, Partners, etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data. Required Skills Full accountability to deliver monthly forecasted/committed deals. Strong sense of urgency and always be ready to close deals. Strong drive with growth mindset to drive results and take on big challenges. Experienced and matured enterprise business sales personnel with proven track record of growing net new business and consistent delivery against sales targets. Extensive and relevant experience of selling enterprise software solutions gained within a major software vendor. Extensive experience selling to customers in Singapore. Compelling communication skill to articulate Salesforce Capabilities, Business Model and Advantages to C-Level and senior business decision makers. Credibility at all levels, including CxO. CRM application sales or vertical Industry sector experience would be viewed favorably. Strong tenure with previous employers. Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Vulcan Cyber is one of the fastest-growing cybersecurity companies in the world. We go one step further than typical Vulnerability Management companies by providing enterprises the only risk and vulnerability remediation SaaS platform. With Vulcan, Enterprises turn to us to do more than just find problems, they depend on us to fix them.  In our world, coming to work every day is fun because we love what we do and the people we do it with! We move fast, make it happen, stop for coffee, go strong, laugh a lot and learn something new every day.  We are now looking to bring on a hungry, determined sales person to be our first in the ASEAN region who knows the market and how to build out .  How You’ll Make An Impact Strategically identify, develop and close new business relationships with enterprise accounts at an executive level Using a disciplined approach, build a strong pipeline of qualified opportunities leveraging your own expertise to drive organic leads and through various Vulcan teams (i.e. Marketing, Sales Development, current customers, etc.) Effectively track and forecast pipeline/revenue through Salesforce Work with your sales engineer to deliver world class demonstrations and POCs that address our customers’ needs Completely own your territory by driving new business and building stronger relationships within the existing customer base focusing on retention, renewals and customer expansion What You Bring To The Table Proven experience exceeding quotas selling Security SaaS software to Enterprise Accounts A true determination and perseverance to exceed expectations no matter how many cold calls you have to make, no’s you hear or doors you have to break through Success within a fast-paced start up where you are used to rolling your sleeves up, taking the initiative and working in a fun, collaborative environment A Comfortability with penetrating, managing and closing Enterprise deals with complex sales cycles What’s in it for You?  Competitive compensation, including equity in one of the fastest-growing startups in the cyber security industry Extremely competitive benefits, including: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance; 3 Month Parental Leave, Generous PTO with an emphasis on work/life balance! Yearly stipend towards your own professional development and personal growth A close-knit team that is super supportive, smart and driven to build something great! An amazing opportunity to get in on the ground level, have your voice heard and make an impact across one of the top security companies!

description: The Role: With continuous field training, you will be assisting our Business Development team with campaigns to identify potential clients throughout Asia Pacific by reviewing their current market data strategy and trading solutions, and discussing how the features involved with our solutions could help improve their performance. You will also develop your domain and product knowledge with specific assignments with our Client Services team, supporting the maintenance of existing accounts.  The Impact: You will be helping in targeted campaigns planning to engage with prospects and existing clients to cover QuantHouse Solutions products and solutions. This will be done by working with marketing channels to help create targeted campaigns, both virtual and physical, and doing the follow-up.  You will also take advantage of incoming leads and be responsible for building on them and transforming them into qualified projects for the team or filing them for future efforts when you come too early in the project process. Identifying decision makers, maintaining and expanding the database of prospects and building standard quotations will also be part of your duties.  The Career Opportunity: The natural career path will be to grow into Sales, Pre-Sales and Project Management roles among others within the group.  The Skills: We want to hear from candidates who are highly articulate and able to demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills and are competent in excelling over the phone in a consultative environment. Looking for a challenging role, candidates must also be target-driven, highly motivated and excited about developing relationships over the phone and on the field. A concurrent interest and appetite to learn the technical aspects of capital markets technologies and market data systems is essential, with the capacity to handle level 2 support for our client within the first year an evidence of success.   Key Responsibilities will include but not limited to:  Prospecting and qualifying campaign related or inbound leads through calling and emailing campaigns Researching new prospective clients and carrying out proprietary email campaigns Creating and releasing targeted messaging through various media Calling “suspect” and prospective clients Maintaining and updating the corporate CRM Coordination of ongoing sales opportunities created by the Inside Sales Assisting in client support issues involving business analysis/market data analysis Maintaining client reports and providing a view on open activities as well as raising any potential issues for escalation in a timely manner Continuously growing technical product knowledge and understanding of global financial markets   Skills & Qualification:  Previous experience in the financial IT services industry is preferred. Previous experience in client services B2B or B2C is preferred Previous experience in trading solutions/support/operations would be advantageous. An undergraduate degree or equivalent is required; all degree subjects will be considered though Commerce, Business Administration, Marketing, Business Management or related degree will be a plus.  Highly autonomous, extremely organized and professional with superior written, verbal and non-verbal communications skills, you will ideally have previous experience with a CRM tool. This person will be focusing on the APAC market and Mandarin is required whilst Cantonese, Japanese or Korean would be a plus given our clients coverage in these areas.  About QuantHouse  QuantHouse provides end-to-end systematic trading solutions including ultra-low latency market data, algo trading development frameworks, proximity hosting and order routing to hedge funds, market makers, proprietary desks, brokers and sell-side firms. Related link: https://www.quanthouse.com  The firm is a wholly owned company of Iress. A market leading technology and software provider for financial markets and services listed on the ASX. Related link: https://www.iress.com

description: Job Title - Business Development Manager Job Code – TWSJD 05 Job Location - Woodlands, Singapore  About The Company: Twilight is a niche technology company specializing in providing Mobile, Web, Cloud, AI & next generation software development solutions. Being incorporated in Singapore with offshore development center in Pondicherry, India, we provide quality IT outsourcing services.  We work closely with global MNC’s, Enterprises, SME’s and emerging Startups fully empowering their digital transformation. Twilight has more than 200+ engineers catering the technology requirements of clients globally.  About the Role: Twilight Softwares is actively looking for energetic Business Development professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit, passion for sales and a proven track record of success, who take a hands-on approach to building business opportunities.  Requirements: • Degree / Diploma in computer Science or Information Technology / Marketing with minimum 5 + years in IT Sales, Marketing & Business Development functions. • Candidates with IT / Software / SaaS Business Development experience & Recruitment / Staffing Business Development experience would be preferred. • A strong passion for sales in IT Industry and able to drive the sales process from prospecting closing the deal. • Proactive and self -motivated, focused and goal oriented. should be able to work under minimum supervision. • A good hunting mentality and resilience towards rejection.   Roles & Responsibilities: • Responsible for all Business Development & Pre-sales activities in the SEA Region and global markets. • Work on all phases of the end-to-end sales cycle including pre-sales presentations, client persuasions, conducting negotiations, and contracting terms with clients. • Business Research to identify potential clients/ lead generation, and take all the required actions to convert the lead • Derive & define sales strategies / plans and work closely with the Management team to maximize the revenue of the organization • Use emails, phone calls, social media, and other channels to reach out to analytics decision-makers and generate interest • Evolve strategic thinking to introduce new/innovative approaches in acquisition of new clients. • Prepare high quality business proposals, elevator pitches and presentations whenever required to boost the sales cycle. • Experience and Knowledge on web / mobile app developments would be preferable as this role would involve engaging with clients of different level through technical solutions.

description: Keen to meet a fun group of hard working people?  Ready for a long term opportunity? You are just in the right place!   Vision Organisation is seeking a Sales Development Representative to join the family. We’re looking for an energetic sales professional who will not be afraid of a fast-paced, customer-focused sales environment. You will join a team of individuals from many different backgrounds who have one thing in common: The belief that sales can bring you the income that you want!    About the role: - Presentations and getting sign ups through events & roadshows - Coach individuals to greater heights  Who you are: - You are a people person, naturally competitive, and have a passion for sales.  - You love a challenge, and you’re not afraid to speak your mind, get stuck in and share your ideas. - You thrive in a competitive, dynamic and quota-driven environment (100% Performance based)  What’s in It for You? - Opportunity to join a growing team, in a fast-paced, high-growth company - Come together with a team of incredibly talented and forward-thinking people! - Strive with a team that values hard work, and knows how to celebrate the wins  In short, an opportunity to learn, expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Vision family. We're passionate about enabling people to do their best.  Be part of us and find out what you can do!

Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: Careers That Change Lives  As a global leader in medical technology, services and solutions, Medtronic improves the health and lives of millions of people each year. We believe our deep clinical, therapeutic and economic expertise can help address the complex challenges – such as rising costs, aging populations and the burden of chronic disease – faced by families and healthcare systems today. But we can’t do it alone. That’s why we’re committed to partnering in new ways and developing powerful solutions that deliver better patient outcomes.  Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services and solutions companies, employing more than 85,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals and patients in more than 160 countries. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.  A Day in the Life  Sales Operation Supervisor Manage overall Singapore commercial operations from order to cash effectively and successful. Enhance the operational procedure, systems and principles in the areas of information flow and management, business processes. Enhanced management reporting and looks for opportunities to expand systems Carry out supervisory responsibilities to the sales & operation team Organizing the budget of the Singapore businesses in collaboration with the Sales & Marketing directors Responsibilities: Enhances administrative support to the sales function such as preparing sales and/or expense forecasts, budgets and quotas; coordinating sales meetings; etc. Conducts statistical analysis on sales data and information to ensure optimal sales execution and attainment of growth objectives. Improve consignment management & field cycle count accountability Track & improve demo & loaner deployment efficiency Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer experience, including resolving problems and complaints Work closely with commercial leadership team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation. Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings Improving billing process and visibility Work closely with the inventory manager and team to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required Minimum of 1 year of relevant experience Nice to Have Bachelor’s Degree in business/marketing discipline 8 - 10 year sales & marketing experience with people management Postgraduate business qualifications will be highly regarded Some overseas travel may be required. Some out of hours work will be required. About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 23, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Job Description  Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!  F5 empowers creators of the new digital world  The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solution, now combined with NGINX, Shape Security and Volterra bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage.  The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 Networks to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation.  F5 Networks is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing sales team in China. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you!  This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the office. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates.  Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc). Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5’s message to our buyers. Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce’s High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts. Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline). Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings. Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts. Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction. Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional. Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude. Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day. Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes. Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members. Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing, and calling is a must. Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus. Fluency in English. F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We’re a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it’s our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that’s loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years.  Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Fast Track Your Career with FAM Management Associate (MA) Programme!  The Programme A 24-month programme, FAM Management Associate Programme is designed to groom budding talents to be future key pillars of FAM. The aim is to give the Management Associates (MAs) an accelerated career path with FAM and gain hands-on exposure across all aspects of asset management business. The four business rotations will give the MAs an all-rounded exposure to the industry, breaking boundaries of business verticals.  FAM MA Programme at a glance: 1.     Four Key Rotations: Rotation through different business functions (i.e. Sales & Marketing, Operations/Compliance, Investor Relations, Investment Research) 2.     Progression: Fast-Tracked & Accelerated Growth 3.     Exposure: Mentored by Senior Management & Key Leadership Staff, Solve real business problems 4.     Experience: All-rounded business experience, Comprehensive learning, Fulfilling & Purposeful 5.     Training: On-the-job training, Strengths-based Approach, Honest & direct conversations  What To Expect: ·     Intensive on-the-job training through our training system that is designed by key management team ·     Go through four business rotations that form the foundation of the industry, present and future ·     Shadow the Senior Management to gain first-hand knowledge and witness the heart and soul behind the running of the firm ·     One-on-one mentoring sessions with Senior Management & Key Leadership Staff to discuss work progress, career mobility options to open up new areas of growth ·     Be involved and lead strategic projects at the company level  We Want Determined Self-Starters Like YOU Who: Are hungry for growth, willing to learn and unlearn Are able to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment and cope well under pressure Have strong interests in personal development, and in pursuing a long-term career in asset management Demonstrate deep critical thinking, understanding, and curiosity of financial markets Are well versed in computer literacy to quickly learn and utilise new tools and processes Demonstrate positive work attitude, resourcefulness, meticulosity, and a great sense of responsibility  How To Apply: ·     Apply now or send your resume to hr@finexisam.com with the subject title: Job Application - Management Associate ·     University Fresh Graduates and Diploma Holders only We regret to inform that the MA programme is applicable to Singaporeans only, and only those shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  Disclaimer The above job description does not cover the comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of a Management Associate. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time according to the needs of the firm or the supervisor.

You will report to the Business Development Director and it will be your primary function to build and lead a sales team to sell products within the chosen division whilst maximizing the company’s sales opportunities for all products within your portfolio. You will also be directly responsible for the company’s revenue within your assigned region. The ideal candidate must be ambitious and career-driven as this is an ideal opportunity for an experienced Sales Manager to develop their career within a fast-paced and rapidly growing application development company that places a strong emphasis on professional development. Here is the basic role and responsibilities; Have full responsibility for overall performance in one of the assigned countries (Vietnam, Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Abu Dhabi, or Malta) regarding sales Build and manage a team of sales professionals Implement both short-term and long-term market development strategy Identify business expansion opportunities, analyze market potential, and target new business of the highest value Establish sales objectives and project expected sales volume and profit within the managed territory Maintain sales volume and adjust selling activities in line with the market situation Build effective networks across business areas

Summary  Apple Internet Software and Services (IS&S) is seeking an outstanding and highly driven Strategic Partner Manager. This team is part of Apple’s International Business Development team, which covers first party services like Apple Arcade, Apple Music, Apple TV+, Apple News, iCloud, Apple Fitness+ and Apple One businesses, across the Asia Pacific region. This is a really exciting time to join our fast-paced, fun and diverse team tasked with ensuring our partnerships deliver on their objectives whilst staying true to the Apple brand.   The Strategic Partner Manager will lead new key external partnerships across various verticals with a special focus on the carrier and retail channels across APAC. You will collaborate with cross functional teams and work with partners to understand their business objectives in order to grow Apple Services subscribers.   You will collaborate with regional and technical teams to successfully launch and handle partnerships. Aligning closely with Business Strategy and Planning teams you will develop key performance indicators, analyse opportunities and measure results. You will use data to modify and develop these programs to drive greater efficiency, scale and effectiveness.   Key Qualifications  Relevant industry work experience in handling relationships with telecoms, finance, OTT or other relevant partners.  Direct experience in growing subscription services.  A hands-on attitude and ability to work cross-functionally within a global organisation.  Extraordinary written, communication and presentation skills with a strong attention to detail.  A passion for the digital content space and entertainment industry.  A proven successful account management background.  Demonstrate the ability to work well with cross functional teams in an international and matrix structure.  Demonstrate a huge passion and energy for your work, that will enable you to help drive amazing partnerships and relationships.  Proficient in English with additional languages an advantage.   Description  You will be responsible for building and managing the day-to-day business relationships with Apple's partners.   Analyse sales and funnel performance to understand key drivers and instigate initiatives to drive attachment, activation, usage, conversion and retention.   Build annual and quarterly account plans to create calendars of activity, including launches of new value propositions, that maintain momentum and growth of the partnership.   You will drive day-to-day workload, resolving partner issues and executing new initiatives to target new customer groups or new services.   You will represent partner feedback to drive improved product and commercial programme development.   You will work with the Product and Operations team to optimise the customer onboarding experience and product lifecycle.   Work with the Operations, Finance and Legal teams to manage the efficient and timely integration and roll-out of new partners.   Work with the Business Development Manager to drive Monthly Reports, Quarterly Business Review and annual contract renewal process with existing partners.   Work with the Partner Programme team to implement regular and rigorous product and sales support activities, including training, merchandising and quality assurance programmes.   Work with the Marketing team to ensure that marketing campaigns of the highest brand standards are launched and align with the commercial strategy of the partnership.   Education & Experience  BA/BS degree in Business or related, MBA or equivalent degree preferred.   Role Number: 200269151
industries: Consumer Electronics

description: Job Purpose  Implement sales and marketing activities to positively influence key retail accounts and independent lab partners in promoting and selling Transitions lenses. In addition, manage new product introduction in the region and capturing and analyzing market intelligence.  The regionally accountability encompasses all of Asia (excluding Australia/NZ), Turkey, Russia.  This Includes Yet Is Not Limited To Develop close working partnership with key accounts (retail, buying groups and other groups) to improve engagement levels, in store visibility and recommendation of store staff of Transitions lenses; Develop close working partnership with defined labs (lenscaster partners and independent labs) to improve engagement levels, product range held and go to market strategies for Transitions lenses; Deliver educational programs to lab teams, key account teams and eye care professionals [ECP] to expand Transitions knowledge; Partnering with lenscaster teams for development of joint activities for key accounts and labs as required; Capturing, record and analysing market information; Implementing, monitoring and analysing trade promotional programs. Key Responsibilities of the Role Key account and ECP partnership Manage the relationship of defined key accounts labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands at head office and individual store level; Develop business plans for key accounts with opportunity, investment, ROI completed, pre, during and post programs, this may include partnership with lab(s) as applicable; Ensure all key accounts are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with corporate and store staff to increase Transitions penetration. Develops and manages trade promotional programs; Active role in special Transitions events such as new product launches, trade shows, and new communications programs; Actively supports ATL and BTL programs to ensure partners high engagement around the investment. Lab Partnership Under the direction of the General Manager AMERA (and alignment with regional Lenscaster Manager); Manage the relationship of independent labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands and products at state, rep and customer service levels; Ensure all independent labs are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with local sales and customer service teams to increase Transitions penetration. ECP partnership and market intelligence Ensure all targeted accounts (plus those requested through lenscaster & lab partners) have up to date demonstration tools including training on how to use, plus up to date POS materials place in prominent positions in store; Ensures the use & updates of the Transitions customers database; Analyze industry market trends (including competition) and work with management to develop appropriate marketing strategies, tactical programs and see through implementation of such programs; Creates and builds the image of Transitions as an industry leader. The incumbent will be responsible for maintaining the integrity of the brand and the trademark in all communications. Education Implements and/or develops education modules with insight from global teams to ensure understanding of performance and positioning of Transitions family of brands, recommendation processes and overcoming objections; Provide and lead dedicated training sessions, webinars and online education for all key stakeholders on Transitions technology. Education, Experience And Requirements Graduate in Degree / MBA in Business, Sales or any related course. Minimum of 8 years of relevant sales experience with sustained high performance. Results driven and exercise a high degree of ownership and initiative Previous experience with optical and/or retail is an advantage. Must have excellent strategic business planning skills with ability to do detailed analysis of opportunity, investment and ROI is necessary. Strong interpersonal and written communication skills. Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to effectively and professionally represent the Transitions® lenses image to customers and suppliers, and demonstrate the ability to act independently. Ability to influence and drive change within the organization. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Be financially astute, aware of budgets while attaining excellent margin results against plan. Able to travel up to 50% of the time. Highly competent in Excel, PowerPoint and CRM systems. Ability to plan ahead, handles multiple projects, set priorities and drive results. Demonstrate creativity and innovative thinking. Fluency in English language is essential Transversal Responsibilities  All employees have a responsibility to contribute to the Group’s sustainability and in doing so ensure that we can continue to fulfil our mission.All business decisions and actions must serve and be in line with the Group’s sustainability goals and mission.An employee must abide by the legal compliance policy in the performing of his/her duties.

description: Account Manager  Smile Makers is the first sexual wellness brand focused on bringing the topic of female sexuality to the mainstream space and shaking up how we think and talk about this category. Since the inception of the brand in 2012, our friendly vibrators have made their way to the shelves of the most prestigious fashion, beauty, and department stores around the world, from North America to Europe and APAC. Covered in Vogue, Elle, Marie-Claire, Coveteur, and more, the brand has sparked a conversation on the importance of vulva owners’ sexuality for their overall wellbeing. At Ramblin’ Brands, our retail partners’ success and relationships are our top priority. We’re looking for a dedicated, strategic, proactive, and service-oriented account manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our global retail partners. The Account Manager’s role oversees an international portfolio of assigned retail partners, develops new business from existing retail partners, and actively seeks new sales opportunities.  Our ideal candidate will have a passion for supporting our retail partners and a drive to provide exceptional service to them. The ideal candidate would strive in finding ways to drive growth for our brand in our retail partners.  Objectives of this Role  ●    Act as the main point of contact in all matters relating to client concerns and needs. Account set up and follow up. ●    Overseeing customer account management, including negotiating contracts and agreements to maximize profit. ●    Build and strengthen client relationships to achieve long-term partnerships. ●    Maintain accurate client records and keeping track of any contract updates and renewals ●    Work with other internal teams to develop strategic marketing plans and ensure KPIs are being met ●    Develop a thorough understanding of our products and service offerings to better upsell and cross-sell to retail partners. Daily and Weekly Responsibilities ●    Take inquiries and requests from our retail partners and address their needs. ●    Meet regularly with other members of the team to discuss progress and find new ways to improve business ●    Generate progress reports to give to clients and higher-ups within the organization ●    Identify upsell, cross-sell, and renewal opportunities and communicate with our retail partners regularly. ●    Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors. ●    Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to retail partners’ needs and objectives. ●    Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders. ●    Develop new business with existing retailer partners and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas. ●    Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts). ●    Prepare reports on account status. ●    Collaborate with retail partners to identify and grow opportunities. ●    Assist with challenging retail partners’ requests or issue escalations as needed.  Skills and Qualifications  ●    Have a flair for client communication. ●    Understand consumer behavior. ●    Experience in a sales or customer service role. ●    Ability to multitask and juggle several responsibilities simultaneously. ●    Strong written and verbal communication skills. ●    Good attention to detail and organizational skills. ●    Service-oriented – ready to go the extra mile for their retail partners. ●    Strategic – doesn't get trapped in the weeds, understands the bigger picture. ●    Proactive – doesn't wait to take action, is in charge.  Preferred Qualifications  ●    Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager, or relevant role in consumer goods online or offline retail. ●    Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation abilities. ●    Proven track record of meeting or exceeding quotas and receiving positive customer feedback. ●    Familiar with account management software (CRM), such as Salesforce, Slack, click up, Canva. ●    Advance proficiency excel

Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  What you get to do in this role: Responsible for the thought leadership, strategy and execution for the Malaysia business Lead, inspire and align the cross-functional team supporting Malaysia Be the de-facto face of ServiceNow in customer and partner C-suite meetings, and local media Actively manage a team of Enterprise Account Executives to deliver customer success and stellar business results, through proactive territory planning, account planning, and good execution of value-selling during opportunity management Recruit, coach and mentor team members to drive excellence and deliver the gold standard Manage and report accurate forecast and pipeline to the business Build effective cross-functional working relationships with Solution Consulting, Technical Support, Professional Services, Legal, Sales Operations, Marketing and the ServiceNow executive team Qualifications  To be successful in this role you have: Deep Malaysia sales leadership experience, including Direct and Channel At least 10 years of experience in sales leadership SaaS/Cloud and Solution Selling (Enterprise Apps) experience Extensive track record of new business sales success including presentation and negotiation skills within industry and at C Level Strong success in recruiting, coaching and managing an exceptional sales team Strong strategic thinking including analytical and financial planning skills to meet and exceed quotas and goals. Experience in driving sales process and drive effective working relationships with Sales Operations Ability to understand the 'bigger picture' and business drivers around IT Ability to build long term strategic and senior level relationships Ability to adapt and work effectively within a rapidly changing and growing environment Strong business and financial acumen JV20  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.  For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.  Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.

description: Job Description Position Overview We are hiring high-energy sales professionals with sound business acumen, natural sales instincts and strong technical aptitude. Primary efforts include responding to and qualifying inbound / outbound telephone inquiries for Autodesk solutions, as well as partnering with Digital Ecommerce teams to help generate pipeline and close sales opportunities. The role is based in Singapore. At Autodesk, we believe a salesperson's success depends on our customer's success - and we offer our clients technology solutions to help them grow their business and maximize the return on their software investment. This ability requires our sales team to have varied skills and talents, including thorough knowledge of the targeted business, understanding of complex technologies, and the ability to sell effectively. We also have a keen eye for new opportunities and a skill for presenting them effectively to our clients. This is what you get: Invaluable Sales experiences (hone your sales skills), Gain experience interacting with clients of all levels, in a variety of industries and across broad geographical area, Sales methodology, Salesforce.com and the power of CRM and how to leverage marketing campaigns for opportunity management and pipeline generation, Solution Selling: Learn how to create a great first impression to our prospects and customers by listening to their business needs and qualifying the appropriate Autodesk solutions to accelerate their business. Responsibilities  Work with key stakeholders and management to drive quarterly sales goals Engage in inbound and outbound calls to assist customers and prospects in choosing the right Autodesk solution and products, helping them to purchase over the phone or online, during ANZ business hours Create, build, close and transact a qualified pipeline of inbound/direct customers Create and manage a database of leads in Salesforce.com, efficiently processing all opportunities, tracking, reporting and maintaining to close Work with the Digital Ecommerce ecosystem to plan and execute promos to drive compelling reasons for closures  Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of work experience in Digital sales rep, with SaaS sales experience a plus Be highly motivated, tenacious, and a self-starter with a can-do attitude who want to be successful Strong desire to be in technology sales Experience in a phone-based role, making high volume of outbound calls, preferably in a sales environment Experience in SFDC Excellent English written and verbal communication skills with a confident and professional phone manner Ability to take initiative, prioritize, and manage time effectively is essential Ability to work both alone and as part of a team Drive to continually improve your sales skills through on the job coaching, self-learning and as defined by Autodesk sales capability and career progression framework  Only Singapore Citizen or Singapore PR's applications are considered.  Send in your updated profile to me on lakshmi.ramaraju@autodesk.com
industries: Computer Software

description: About Workato  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why: Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 large company for remote workers  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave  Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Commercial Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible to: Present, promote and sell products/services using well-formed arguments to existing and prospective customers; provide product demonstration to prospects Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs; proactively help customers to assess Workato throughout the decision process Regularly evaluate market potential, track sales and status reports; analyze market to formulate plans to win and grow new and existing businesses by working with Marketing, Customer Success and Product Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales potential; create detailed prospecting lists using various methods to identify and win new enterprise customers Establish and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Increase visibility of Workato across all departments within customer accounts Schedules customer onboarding calls; transitions the customer to Customer Success; expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Work effectively in teams to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service experience to Workato's customers Meet and exceed sales targets and outcomes within schedule Identify and leverage trends within industry of expertise/focus Continuously improve through feedback  Requirements  Qualifications and Experience At least 1 - 2 years of Commercial Software Sales experience in a technology space. Needs to be based in Singapore Has prior experience in closing deals in software or technology sales in Asia (Excluding Japan) Technical background or good understanding of technology and industry trends, especially in the app integration space preferred Experience in customer sales, account management or consulting preferred  Skills High level of comfort presenting key client issues, be the customer advocate within Workato Strong critical thinking, analytical skills with an entrepreneurial and proactive mindset Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time, even under high-pressure situations Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description  Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!  F5 empowers creators of the new digital world  The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solution, now combined with NGINX, Shape Security and Volterra bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage.  The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 Networks to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation.  F5 Networks is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing sales team in China. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you!  This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the office. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates.  Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc). Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5’s message to our buyers. Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce’s High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts. Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline). Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings. Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts. Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction. Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional. Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude. Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day. Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes. Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members. Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing, and calling is a must. Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus. Fluency in English. F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We’re a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it’s our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that’s loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years.  Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: ABOUT AUTO GERMANY  Auto Germany was established in January, 2012 to operate and manage the sole exclusive dealership for Opel passenger and commercial vehicles in Singapore. With the launch of its modern 3S facilities at Alpine Centre, Auto Germany embarked on a 5 year plan to energize the Opel brand and make it one of the top 5 European brand in Singapore.  In 2016, the European Car of the Year was awarded to Opel Astra. And by 2017, The Opel brand was acknowledged by local journalists as the 2nd fastest growing brand by unit sales. By end of 2017, Opel sales had increased by more than 300%. Today, the Opel brand has firmly established itself as a top performer in the mainstream continental market segment, consistently achieving top 3 positioning amongst its competitors.  Auto Germany continues to be a major player in the complex and competitive automotive market in Singapore. Forging forward and embarking on the journey toward electrification, Auto Germany continues to win industry trust and partnerships from Banks/Financial Investors, Insurance Corporations, and Government Regulatory bodies and most importantly it’s ever expanding consumer base.  SALES EXECUTIVE, OPEL SINGAPORE  RESPONSIBILITIES  • Drive sales of Opel vehicles by conducting focused customer presentation and effective test-drive experience to highlight the product features, functions, and benefits of the Opel vehicle. • Provide professional and high-quality customer service in accordance with Opel standards to improve customer satisfaction and promote brand loyalty. • To follow up on all leads provided diligently and effectively to maximize conversion to physical showroom walk-in and test drive. • To be an Opel brand ambassador for our products which also includes being involved in production of media content for communication purposes. • To attend all needed training sessions internal/external and to actively participate in training to ensure maximum learning.  REQUIREMENTS  • Have a passion for cars and the automotive industry. • To be a highly self-motivated individual with ability to find solutions effectively. • Team player. • Right aptitude and has excellent communication skills. • Possesses selling and negotiation techniques. • Experience in handling and managing customers needs and expectations. • High customer and service orientation. • Able to work in rostered shift including weekends. • Must possess a valid Class 3 driving license minimum.

Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer’s day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is part time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS…  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  About The Role…  Job Description  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering our customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them to create great outfits Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor Stock replenishment Selling to customers at the cash desk, fitting room and on the shop floor About You...  Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. Instead we look for people with the qualities below Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Considerate Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Additional Information  Why choose COS?  When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan and pay you an hourly rate of SGD up to $9 . In addition to this you will also receive: 25% staff discount Up to SGD 520 per year clothing allowance Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: Responsibilities  Present, promote and sell IT Services solutions and related offerings to existing and prospective customers. Grow customer pipeline by identifying potential business opportunities and prospecting new customers through cold calling.  Achieve sales targets associated with the territory. Establish a deep understanding of IT Services portfolio with adjacent offerings and solutions and be able to position the value of the Services package to clients within the context of each client's business. Tailor Services scope definition, including client specific project plans, cost benefit analysis, resource requirements and contract related documentation to suit customer’s business strategies. Collaborate closely with various teams, such as product, channels, pre-sales, finance and service delivery to develop business relationships and achieve sales goals. Accurately forecast sales prospects according to services, timeline, and value. Prepare sales reports to management to update customer needs, problems and interests, sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed opportunity. Maximize customer satisfaction through timely communication and follow up to expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints.    Requirements  Minimum 2 – 3 years software or services sales experience and customer management experience in IT industry Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales Excellent selling, communication and negotiation skills Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs Diploma or Degree in IT / Engineering / Business IT or equivalent

description: OVERVIEW  The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for developing new accounts within assigned territory (Indonesia, Philippines & Vietnam), with a clear set of growth targets to achieve. You will also maintain and grow revenue from existing accounts.  You will be a champion of our CDN and cloud security solutions, providing strong service and support to our existing customers’ needs at every interaction and to lead the resolution of their issues within the company. You will also be orchestrating direct sales engagements, win competitive opportunities, as well as establish and collaborate with channel partners in a fast pace for sell-to and sell-through strategies to reach a high and continuous growth.  The ideal candidate should be a tenacious, results-oriented sales professional, with a passion for nurturing strong relationships with customers, passionate about the industry and possess excellent communication skills. Success in this position will require a positive attitude, great time management, strong work ethic, and a passion to build solid and sustainable relationships with customers.  RESPONSIBILITIES:-  This position will prioritize more on Business Development and Hunting responsibilities.  Drive new business directly from customers, identify and develop effective and scalable channel partners based in respective territories for building robust sales pipelines. Oversee and manage a portfolio of assigned accounts, seek additional revenue opportunities through up-selling and renewals. Accountable for owning all aspects of the sales cycle, whilst consistently generating pipeline to meet and/or exceed quota. Create and maintain all major customer deliverable (proposals, statements of work, etc.) to provide over-the-top customer service and support. Understand the value proposition of our CDN and cloud security solutions and more productively, communicating all offerings to C-level executives and decision makers. Continuously keep abreast of industry and market trends, whilst building strong knowledge in our products and services. Drive business cadence for weekly team meetings on pipeline update, opportunities review, customer account reviews, etc. As CDNetworks country representative, to present on external symposium, conferences, media and industry events.   REQUIREMENTS:- Bachelor’s degree required. Proven track record of exceeding sales goals/quotas. Good key account management skill and business acumen. Ability to gain access and interact with C-level executives with effective interpersonal and presentation skills. Minimum 3 years of relevant sales management experience, preferably in IT solutions/Cloud or similar Hi-tech environment, with Indonesia Market Experience. Knowledge of Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), internet and Cloud Infrastructure, Media and Cyber Security Services is highly desired. Energetic, self-motivated, result-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic growth environment. Familiarity with CRM platform especially Salesforce is highly desired. Possessing of experienced and resourceful channel partner such as Systems Integrator, Value Added Resellers in network and security field will be a plus.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: As the lead for sales and partnerships you will be accountable for leading the business development efforts for South East Asia. You will be responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities and building upon existing relationships within, FMCG, e-commerce, and marketplaces while working with key stakeholders to deliver long term regional success.  This Company is a series C funded start up with backing from some of the largest VC's in Asia   Responsibilities Hands-on sales leader who will manage their own deals as well as hiring and onboarding others Acquire, build and cultivate relationships with client's and senior leadership Work cross-functionally with marketing and partnership teams to cultivate targeted accounts the ability to sales SaaS platforms by walking through detailed demonstrations of the product Build strong relationship with existing & prospective clients to create more business opportunities Participate in product road map build out discussions based on client needs with leadership, product & engineering Develop industry partnerships to enhance outreach and value proposition Work closely with product, marketing to constantly optimize efforts relating to company-wide goals Identify and close strategic up-selling opportunities by understanding core client business needs Using knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop the company’s selling propositions and differentiators  What you should ideally have Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field is required 6+ years of professional Sales/Partnership experience, including experience in sales management Demonstrated success in technology B2B sales role preferably with SaaS     Existing relationships with decision-makers within Marketing functions is a plus Strong communication skills with the ability to speak with C-level clients Proven track record of driving sales and partnerships across SEA

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Responsibilities A focused strategic selling role, identifying and driving qualified opportunities from pre-sales to close of business contracts whether it is a master agreement or a single mobile line & equipment contract Close businesses (whether new, win-back or renewal) that will add and maintain overall business and account top line revenue growth while managing and up-selling customers to avert revenue erosion Identify, lead and drive sales focused activities in scoping (prioritizing) and communicating the account opportunities, objectives, strategy and resource requirements (whether new, win-back or renewal businesses) with colleagues like Account managers and marketing managers to achieve a healthy revenue stream for Singtel from the business won or maintained Work with Account managers to identify and qualify to develop an account To lead and conduct regular account discussions with the account managers and account directors to ensure alignment in customer experience To lead and drive the sales process from meeting the customer to scope, prepare sales proposals, conduct presentations, negotiate up to the closing of business with qualified customers Proactively monitor market changes and competition and feedback on important activities (e.g. technical developments, industry trends, new features and services etc.) to Sales and Marketing teams Requirements A diploma or degree is preferred At least 5 years of enterprise sales experience in telco/IT industries, with experience in opportunity and account leadership and a track record of successful sales in complex environments and solutions
