description: Summary: The Account Development Representative (ADR), India is for developing business in India Market and establishing and developing new customers for PEI Genesis, as well as maintaining and enhancing existing customer relationships. Reading, writing, and communicating effectively in English.  The ADR must be able to identify customers with high potential for growth, know how PEI’s product offerings can be used to provide solutions for customers, and be knowledgeable and persuasive in selling those solutions to customers. The ADR will make outgoing calls for the majority of his/her workday and must be organized, disciplined, able to work at a quick pace, able to multi-task and be self-sufficient in carrying out his/her job responsibilities. Ultimately, the ADR must meet published KPI’s, including exceeding the budgeted sales and Gross Profit targets for his/her assigned accounts and/or territory, and convert leads into sales.  Education/Experience/Skills: Diploma or equivalent in any field; or minimum of three years sales experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with knowledge of telesales/telemarketing and customer service best practices, working in an outbound sales environment. The candidate must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English and Hindi. The candidate should be goal oriented, possess outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with emphasis on excellent telephone etiquette.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: Proactively generating. qualifying sales leads opportunities, negotiation and sales close Establish and develop new customers for the company in a defined geographic, market or industry; utilizing cold calling, lead follow-up, lapsed customer activation, sample follow-up, PEI-Genesis literature mailings, etc. Maintain and enhance existing customer relationships to increase the amount of business and the diversity of products that PEI-Genesis sells to these customers by pursuing possibilities and opportunities beyond those initiated by the customer. Meet or exceed outbound call KPIs, and quote follow up requirements. Understand the potential of each account to maintain or grow sales and communicate potential to management. Be responsive to customer calls and inquiries in a timely manner, consistently follow up on all outstanding quotes, and communicate feedback to the management team to assist in closing the business Understand all pertinent government regulations and customer terms and conditions and how they relate to PEI-Genesis’s processes and capabilities. Ensure that all price, delivery, quality and special handling requirements requested by customers are met in a timely and satisfactory manner. Coordinate large bids, quotes, orders and opportunities with your Manager, and appropriate people at PEI Work with available resources not only within PEI, but Manufacturers’ Representatives, Factory Representatives, and other outside sources to assist customers and expand personal knowledge of product capabilities and solutions. Participate in annual budgeting process, providing suggested customer or geographic sales dollar budget, GP dollar budget and GP percent  Expected Outcomes: Discover accounts within our existing data base, with large potential growth. Excellent collaborative communication with internal and external resources on large quotes, bids, and opportunities, will result in more large orders. Ability to communicate PEI-Genesis’ value proposition to capture more business, repeat orders with existing and new accounts. Ensure customer data and segmentation for the geography is maintained to enable accurate analysis of trends and to maximize Marketing campaign outcomes. Delighting customer always, thus building long term customer loyalty Deliver sales growth by exceeding sales, GP and active customer targets  Requirements: Microsoft Office (including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) Experience using any ERP system (eg ASW, SAP, Oracle) Experience using any Customer relationship management software (eg NetSuite or Salesforce) Must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English Enjoy learning about prospects and customers to find innovative ways of engaging effectively with them to drive sales Ability to handle rejection, objection, difficult prospects or customers, yet remain driven and positive even in the face of adversity to transform leads into sales Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both over the phone and in writing. Basic math skills for accurate pricing and quotes

description: At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.   The ideal candidate is experienced with business planning globally across various verticals and sales channels to manage pricing, lifecycles, promotional calendars in the technology or consumer electronics industry. We are looking for someone who is resourceful, adaptable, team-oriented and the ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You should have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.  Responsibilities Manage financial analysis, pricing and promotional calendar to ensure that we increase our leadership and market share position Conduct and run competitive benchmarking and product price comparison Work with the Head of Sales & Marketing to ensure regional sales teams are guided in terms of product knowledge, pricing and promotional planning Drive product lifecycle planning for peripherals Responsible for developing and maintaining tools to track, measure and share sales data on Razer and competitive offerings Manage the internal pricing approval system  Requirements Degree in Business / Marketing with 5 years of product marketing or business analyst experience with consumer / lifestyle products Proven business planning background with excellent understanding of sales channel management Good analytical and high adaptability skills Excellent interpersonal, communication, and time management skills Possess strong people skills, with the ability to work with the regional Sales & Marketing Teams to bring about increased sales to the market  Be part of a phenomenal team today!

description: Do you want to have an opportunity to learn new skills and with career advancement?  Take your career to the next level by joining our supportive team-based environment. Mentorship and coaching provided if you are shortlisted.  Pick up some sales, communication, team building and management skills to enhance your resume today!  What’s in for you? -No experience required -Mentorship provided -Personal development -Advancement opportunities -Fun environment  *Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Swapcard digitalizes events while preserving the magic of real-life interaction. Behind this dream, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities. We've even managed to revolutionize our industry through true teamwork, sharing our ideas and listening to each other!  With 39 nationalities amongst a team of more than 168, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely in order to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We’ve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That’s when the real magic occurs. We’ve made some incredible memories around the globe together so far & it's only the beginning!  We've opened offices in Paris, Montreal, Dubai, Seattle, London, and New Delhi. Where's next for us? Singapore!  Prior to the pandemic, our team supported remote-work. This has helped us transition smoothly to a full-remote company this year. We'll be keeping our HQ in Paris as home base while staying flexible to see what the future holds for our growing team. Currently, we're spread out throughout the world. Experience in CRM technology or proven software usage capabilities Desire to learn and grow professionally within a sales environment Sales administration and pipeline management are critical for effectiveness in this role Experience in SaaS and the event technology industry preferred Reasons to join us International Team with 39 nationalities (more on the way!) 🌍 Paris HQ with offices in USA, UAE, CA, UK, & IN 🇫🇷 🇺🇸 🇦🇪 🇨🇦 🇬🇧 🇮🇳 🇸🇬 Fast-growing startup with many opportunities for growth 🌱 Open-minded culture that appreciates differences 👽 Feedback driven, supportive & curious team with DIY mindset 🤔 🛠 Family Leave & remote work to ensure you have time for what matters most ❤️ 🏡 Team that seizes every opportunity to celebrate success 🍾 🕺🏼💃 Learning support & sponsorship 📚 WFH Budget to help you feel comfortable 😊 Generous Paid Time Off program to ensure your happiness 🎁 Team Vacations to celebrate our achievements ✈️

description: Job Description  Sales Development Representative (Bahasa Speaking- based in Singapore)  Are you passionate about the customer experience? Are you seeking a sales career that allows you to work with the world’s fastest growing mid-market and Fortune 500 leaders?  Zendesk is hiring! Zendesk builds software for better customer service. We enable millions of users around the world to interact more directly and openly with their customers.  What We Look For People not afraid to take a risk! Individuals that are passionate about SaaS, Customer Service & high-tech Self-starters with track records of success in their professional and personal or collegiate lives Responsibilities Generate new business opportunities to fuel the Zendesk New Business Sales Pipeline for Indonesia market. Work closely with Account Executives to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in target accounts Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails and qualifying opportunities into the Account Executive/Account Manager’s pipeline) Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of qualified opportunities Requirements Past experience in high-volume outbound sales prospecting Speak Bahasa to for business opportunities in Indonesia Ability to understand customer requirements and identify potential Zendesk solutions to fulfill requirements Ability to multitask, prioritize, and balance time effectively Excellent written skills and naturally articulate 1-2 Years of Sales Experience Bachelor’s degree Proven success in meeting monthly targets About Zendesk - Champions Of Customer Service  Zendesk started the customer experience revolution in 2007 by enabling any business around the world to take their customer service online. Today, Zendesk is the champion of great service everywhere for everyone, and powers billions of conversations, connecting more than 100,000 logos with hundreds of millions of customers over telephony, chat, email, messaging, social channels, communities, review sites and help centers. Zendesk products are built with love to be loved. The company was conceived in Copenhagen, Denmark, built and grown in California, taken public in New York City, and today employs more than 4,000 people across the world. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.  We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations.  Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.  Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to benefits@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.  By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

description: DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is currently recruiting for a Business Development Manager for the Joint reconstruction and Sports medicine portfolio. DePuy Synthes provides one of the most comprehensive orthopaedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide.  The individual is responsible for overseeing the capital sales and digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint Reconstruction and Sports Medicine. A key priority of the role is to launch and lead the capital equipment portfolio within Sports medicine, and to equip the sales team with capital-selling capabilities to drive growth. The individual will also lead the digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint reconstruction in the space of hip and knee surgery, and engage both clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of the solutions in partnership with the sales team.  In addition, the role will be heavily involved in strategic business planning, launching new products and devising solutions to meet healthcare needs of the patients. At this level, the role has increased responsibility including, but not limited to, additional skills, multiple lines/products, diverse teams, etc. This job is eligible for sales incentives/sales commission.  Critical to this role’s success will be the individual’s leadership skills and the ability to communicate and work well with all levels of internal and external partners.  Reporting line  This position reports to Franchise Manager (Joints, Mitek and Extremities), Johnson and Johnson Singapore.  Job Responsibilities  Sports Medicine Capital Sales Launch and lead sports medicine capital equipment portfolio Understand and analyze market dynamics and competition to develop business opportunities Develop effective contracts and financing schemes to grow customer base Participate in national tender negotiations and evaluation placements Lifecycle management of capital equipment including after-sales support Training of team to improve capital selling capabilities and case support Engage external partners including clinicians, procurement bodies and healthcare institutions  Digital Surgery Solutions Lead strategic marketing and drive growth for portfolio Collect competitive insights on product portfolio to recommend and develop marketing programs to adjust product positioning Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and non-clinical partners to facilitate buy-in and launch of digital surgery solutions Manage strategic accounts identified with creative solution-selling and market business development Establish and improve relationships at CXO level and build long-term strategic alliances with the portfolio of accounts to continue to add value Subject matter specialist including technical matters Conduct training for healthcare professionals (HCPs) Assists sales team with questions and supports customers requiring additional support Enable and train sales team to ensure uptake of solutions Hold stretched sales targets for portfolio  Qualifications University/Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent in Engineering or Business At least 8 years of selling and/or marketing experience in the medical devices industry with consistent track record, preferably in Orthopaedics. Strong understanding of the Singapore capital healthcare market and buying groups Excellent presentation, negotiation and closing skills Strong relationship-building skills Outstanding influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels Strong business acuity, strategic and critical thinking skills with understanding of healthcare ecosystem trends Exposure to new product launches valued Strong, demonstrated leadership skills, driven by a passion to excel in a customer-centric organization.  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-  Organization  Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105953947W
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: MariaDB is making a big impact on the world. Whether you’re checking your bank account, buying a coffee, shopping online, making a phone call, listening to music, taking out a loan, or ordering takeout – MariaDB is the backbone of applications used every day. Companies small and large, including 75% of the Fortune 500 run MariaDB, touching the lives of billions of people. With massive reach through Linux distributions, enterprise deployments, and public clouds, MariaDB is uniquely positioned as the leading database for modern application development.  The Opportunity Business Development Representatives play a key role in our growth by producing qualified sales opportunities.  MariaDB has a consistent track record of promoting BDRs, and we are looking for candidates who are excited about advancing their sales careers by revolutionizing the way data is stored and accessed.   Responsibilities Follow up with, qualify, and develop inbound leads via phone, email, and social media Set up sales discovery calls with prospective clients and MariaDB Account Executives Respond to website instant message chats and our sales phone line Develop Asia-Pacific territory with outbound (“cold”) prospecting Promote MariaDB via social media Collaborate with our marketing team on campaigns, messaging, and prospect feedback Record and manage daily work in tools such as Salesforce and Salesloft  Qualifications Must-haves are: A relentless work ethic: you’re a hustler and committed to aggressively prospecting. A great attitude: you’re positive, coachable, adaptive to change, and a great teammate. You take full ownership of your quota and monthly performance. You can brush off the feeling of rejection that happens in sales. Organization and quality: you are process-oriented and take pride in the quality of your work. Your emails and presentations are polished. Your verbal communication is concise and precise.  Preferred are: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Ability to read/write Korean, Mandarin, or Japanese - this may provide more opportunity for territories you cover Previous sales experience with a technology company  Location Singapore  What’s in it for you? Impact the world of technology by pushing the boundaries of technology and business models, working at MariaDB. Be part of a game-changing organization that encourages outside-the-box thinking, empowerment, and is truly shaping the future of the software industry. You’ll be collaborating with high-caliber colleagues around the world, offering unparalleled learning and growth opportunities. We provide a very competitive compensation package, 25 days paid annual leave (plus holidays), stock options, a massive degree of flexibility and freedom, and more.  +++++  MariaDB does not sponsor work visas or relocation.  MariaDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  MariaDB is an equal opportunities employer.

description: About Aspire: Aspire is the leading all-in-one business banking platform in South-East Asia. We are on a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, empowering startups to realise their full potential.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has raised over USD 200M+ across equity and debt from world-class investors. To power our solutions we have partnered with some of the best companies in the world such as Visa and Wise.   In 2020 we were awarded Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Finalist MAS Fintech Awards, and in 2021 were named in LinkedIn’s Top 5 Startups to work for in Singapore. We currently have over 170 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and a flexible working culture.  You will be amazed by the energy and experience of our team. We are a team of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders, and high-achievers with international backgrounds. We team up to reach the highest standards in what we do, and don’t take NO for an answer.  We are expanding rapidly. Are you a top talent? Are you passionate about entrepreneurship? Join us and create the future of banking with us.    About the Role: You will be reporting to the Sales Manager. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team into 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure they fully utilize their account.    What will you be doing?  Hunt startups in APAC that are raising capital and who are in need of a corporate account to receive funding Perform prospecting activities such as cold calling and networking Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Drive referrals by your exceptional work  Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Keep all records in our CRM  Report to Sales Manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  Bachelor’s degree OR at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience Hunting new opportunities is in your blood  Possess a track record of being a top producer in your previous companies  Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills via phone (cold calling) and email Experience with a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard/CardUp) is a big plus (Commercial Card) & knowledge of the commercial card market in Singapore (and SEA ideally)  OR Experience with a remittance company (WorldFirst/Wise/Instarem/Wallex/SingX) is a big plus (FX) Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization

description: Do you want to kick start an exciting career in Oracle? Apply now and be part of the GBUs!  We are looking for people who are passionate and keen to be a Business Development Consultant for the Construction & Engineering Global Business Unit.  Our Mission – Transforming the world by helping Organizations plan, build & operate critical assets to deliver successful projects and innovate with industry leading project management tools and software.  Be part of a team that help shape digital transformation of the 21st century Construction & Engineering demands where we are involved in over 20 different industries. Check us out at: https://www.oracle.com/industries/construction-engineering/  As a Business Development Consultant, your focus is to generate demand for Construction & Engineering unit through a mix of outbound/inbound prospecting activities for an assigned territory. description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses - small, medium or large - thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow’s world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Opportunity  WeWork All Access allows you to hot desks, conference rooms and private offices worldwide. It is redefining how businesses manage their workspace, and the All Access team is at the forefront of this flexible working revolution.  This role will be pivotal in the success of WeWorks hybrid work solution in the Pacific area, contributing to its development, its growth and ultimately its success.  In This Role, You Will  We are looking for an Account Executive, All Access to be the main point of contact for All Access sales in Pacific.  Drive all 10+ All Access card deals Partner with the International Accounts and Leasing teams on their All Access requirements Shares best practices in selling strategies and operations with the other International All Access sales teams (MLB, Unnamed Accounts and Named Accounts) Execute net new and upsell bookings for the All Access product to companies with 500+ FTEs Position the value of All Access and the future of flexible work Serve as a bridge between sales and the All Access product team, constantly looking to improve the product and customer experience Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to members Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience  About You  Does the below sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!  A relevant Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years of professional experience in sales, account management or related industry Comfortable using CRM platforms – Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating and closing sales Experience in high growth SaaS is highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skills  Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you—because together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: ­  TraceLink has built the world's largest cloud-based network dedicated to protecting patients, ensuring compliance and growing profits across global life sciences. The TraceLink Life Sciences Cloud is our network, our platform, and the community that we’ve built, that links life science people, processes and information everywhere, from ingredient to patient. Over 1,000 businesses across the globe, from the largest drug manufacturers to small street corner pharmacies, trust us to help them manufacture and deliver safe, secure medicines to the patients who need them, anywhere in the world.  The Sales Development Representative position is perfect for someone that wants to quickly grow a (or build upon an existing) solid foundation in one of the country’s fastest growing companies. Promotion into leadership and quota-carrying Account Executive roles will be swift for top performers. The criteria for upward advancement will be outlined for you from Day 1. As a Sales Development Representative, you will proactively generate new business opportunities for TraceLink’s Essential Supply Chain Service Platform.  ­ Meet and/or exceed daily, weekly, and monthly performance targets for number of outbound calls, qualified sales opportunities passed and pipeline contribution. Work within an assigned territory to qualify, develop, and mature marketing supplied leads resulting in high quality sales opportunities for Account Executives. Uncover needs at each level of an organization, and match with well-articulated value proposition. Perform research on companies as a component of opportunity qualification and creation activities utilizing various prospecting technologies that the company has invested in. Develop concise and detailed summaries of qualified potential opportunities for Account Executives, focused on an acute understanding of the prospect’s business pain and infrastructure. Update prospect database with conversations, competitive intel, company size, decision making criteria and other pertinent information. Attend and participate in weekly/monthly assigned Sales team meetings. Provide feedback and improvements to Sales Development program and Marketing process. Provide qualitative and quantitative feedback to marketing, sales, channel partners and Executive Team. ­ Keen interest in learning a process-oriented, consultative sales approach Desire to establish a rewarding career in Sales that facilitates achievement of personal goals and objectives Excellent experience in both challenging the status quo and developing relationships that result in change Excellent verbal and written communication skills Professional Business Acumen Perform research and intelligence gathering on cold prospect accounts Strong people skills/team skills, with an ability to work with cross-functional teams Experience with Salesforce CRM, Google Apps, LinkedIn, and any other Sales prospecting tools preferred Passionate about working in a collaborative team
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

As part of a fast-paced global sales and sponsorship team at ONE ChampionshipTM, you will be responsible for driving commercial partnerships across the ONE group - analysis and business development of potential brands and organizations to secure ongoing sales and partnership deals.  Responsibilities Own and hit/exceed annual sales targets within assigned territory Develop and execute strategic plan to achieve sales targets and expand client base Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships Develop long term strategic deals that re-shape the current business needs and product Partner with clients and brands to understand their business needs and objectives Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations Understand category-specific landscapes and trends Reporting on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction of accounts Identify key trends in business sectors’ advertising and marketing strategies and provide solutions and strategy Analyse and utilise category data to aid in pitches and proposals  Requirements  Proven sales experience, meeting or exceeding targets Strong local market business knowledge, contacts and extensive Rolodex is crucial Interest in the sport of Martial Arts Able to communicate, present and influence all levels of the organization Proven ability to drive the sales process from start to end Proven ability to position products against competitors Excellent listening, negotiation, pitching and presentation skills Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment independently with strong decision-making abilities A background in Sports Marketing or Sponsorship Sales Media sales background or a history of working with media agencies would be a plus   Willing to travel frequently (when possible again)

description: Business Chain: Dura-Line Position Title: Regional Sales Manager Reports to: Commercial Director, Emerging Markets East Location: Singapore. Penetration into new business opportunities in the South East Asia Region  As this is a newly created role, we are looking for an individual who has the mindset of an entrepreneur, understand the culture and have the experience in doing sales in the South East Asia Region.  MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES  The Regional Sales Manager position will be responsible for developing, growing and managing a team of direct and indirect reports including Account Managers across SEA.  The position will be accountable for an annual booking/revenue quota / budget, with significant growth in subsequent years. This management position is responsible for driving overall growth in regional market, she/he will have overall sales leadership responsibilities for the business in both across segments / industries.  The key performance traits for this role include • Local market knowledge across SEA. • Go to Market Sales Model - Leading /coaching teams through transformation with Account Planning/Opportunity Identification, Business Relevant / Customer Value Selling and Business Disciplines. • Financial Performance - Exceeding booking goals (by geography, solutions and vertical), managing Opex goal, profitability, and maintaining forecast accuracy; providing in depth knowledge into numbers (customer insights, macro/micro trends, consumption models) • Team Development - Attracting, developing and retaining high performance Account Team talent (career development, coaching, performance management and hiring). • Building a Winning Capability and Leading Change - Strategically leading and influencing his own team along with an integrated cross-functional team, Services, Operation, Partners, Marketing, and others.  Desired Skills  This Regional Sales Manager, SEA is expected to strategically drive the organization’s end-to-end vision for our customers, as well as maintain an in-depth understanding of competitive conditions, industry practices, market opportunities, and customer requirements. This key leadership role will develop the sales delivery model through coaching and motivating the talented sales organization. Setting a vision and building strategic business decision-making capability to the next level will be a major success factor for this position.  This person will motivate, inspire, and continually develop his/her teams and channel partners while taking on new competitors as the organization continues to gain market share outside its core business. He/her will need a strong background in executive-level communication with experience building customer and partner relationships, and territory planning and segmentation. This person ought to possess both the sales skills and technical knowledge to make presentations and lead customer discussions to advance the sales process. This role involves positioning and promoting the partner value proposition, leading sales specialists in the development and expansion of opportunities, and reinforcing existing relationships.

description: Company Description:  Flashpoint delivers actionable intelligence that empowers organizations of all sizes to take rapid, decisive actions to protect against threats. The company's technology, advanced data collections, and human-powered analysis uniquely enable teams to mitigate threats related to cybersecurity, fraud, insider threats, corporate and physical security, executive protection, and third-party risk. For more information, visit https://www.flashpoint-intel.com/ or follow us on Twitter at @FlashpointIntel.  What we are looking for:  The Business Development Representative position is an integral part of our company's growth strategy in the APAC region . The main objective of the Business Development Representative is to evaluate and qualify prospects through multi-channel efforts, resulting in highly qualified meetings and contributing in building pipelines for our team.  This role reports into the Revenue Operations team, and will be tightly aligned with sales. The person in this role will have tremendous opportunity for growth within the sales organization from this starting point. This particular Business Development Representative will focus on prospecting and outbound activities to help fuel the sales pipeline, and will use data procurement tools to source contacts that meet target profiles in order to drive engagement and support sales opportunities.  What you will do: Source contacts through procurement and social platforms for outbound meeting scheduling for Generate appointments for insides sales and field sales organizations focusing in APAC Region Work directly with marketing and sales leaders on messaging, positioning, and best content for meeting procurement Use of strong selling and influencing skills to set up qualified appointments Log, track and maintain all contact records in Salesforce Maintain and nurture the lead generation funnel from the first touch point to conversion Collaborate with the APAC team in Singapore and Australia on regional strategic and tactical outreach.  What you will bring: Minimum 1-2 years of experience in B2B prospecting Self-motivated, future sales leader that takes personal satisfaction in every meeting booked Proficient in using Salesforce.com (required), LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Salesloft (preferred) Ability to work remotely on a full-time basis Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Strong in-person, phone, and written external communication skills. Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals. Previous experience with technology or cybersecurity background is a plus Having selling and cultural experience in the APAC region is a plus, including managing outreach in different time zones.  Why Flashpoint is a Great Place to Work: Diversity. Flashpoint is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, inclusion, belonging, and equity. We recognize that diversity is key to achieving our vision. We believe that every person and their experiences contribute to building a work environment and a product that will change the world. Culture and Belonging. Our company's culture isn't something you join, it's something you build and shape, and each person's unique backgrounds and experiences contribute to who Flashpoint is and will become. You will have ample opportunities to connect with coworkers through various communication channels and company-funded events: dietary & allergy conscious catered lunches, book clubs, happy hours, committees and much more. Benefits. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including unlimited PTO, 401(K), mental health and wellness benefits, commuter benefits, and generous parental leave policies. Perks. Flashpoint understands that personal wellness is one of the keys to a happy, healthy and productive work environment. That's why we also prioritize health and wellness perks like gym reimbursements and daily meditation, well-stocked kitchens, cool cultural initiatives and inclusive employee events. Career Growth. Flashpoint is invested in the growth of our team members and understands that frequent, two-way feedback is critical to that growth. We encourage regular one-on-ones with your manager, a regular schedule of performance reviews, learning and development opportunities, and guidance through formalized career paths; whether that be towards being a great manager, being a great individual contributor, or a lateral move to gain breadth of knowledge and experience. A Great Place to Work. Literally. According to the 99% of employees surveyed, Flashpoint earned designation as a Great Place to Work-Certified™ Company for 2021. 100% of employees agree that new hires are made to feel welcome and appreciated. If you are interested in learning more, please check out our Certified Profile.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Segment: Financial Services Industries  Domain Expertise  The Strategic Account Executive should possess deep Financial Services industry knowledge in combination with outstanding customer management experience at the VP and C-level.  The incumbent will maintain and expand relationships with large and strategic enterprises. Assigned to 1-5 named customers, they are responsible for developing a plan to achieve sales quota.  Working closely with the account team to drive the customer relationship and alignment at all levels in order to implement the account strategy is key to your success.  Partnering with Salesforce partners and ISVs is critical to the role. Key to this role is your ability to inspire, build a vision, and articulate business value to sell the Industry Cloud future in a Cloud Computing world.  Responsibilities Establish professional and deep relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts. Orchestrate account planning process that develops account strategy, financial targets, and critical milestones for 1-3 year period. Leads cross-functional team within Salesforce to meet customer accounts performance objectives and expectations. Manage sophisticated sales cycles, leveraging internal and external resources as appropriate Deep understanding of customer's business environment, proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis. Proven consultative sales solution skills, including the ability to articulate a clear, concise return on investment value statement. Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, ROI review, references, and analyst data. Orchestrate the end-to-end sales process and improve business impact through the orchestration of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Success services, Solution Specialists, Business Value Services, Executives, Partners, etc. Generate short-term results whilst maintaining a long-term perspective to maximize Customer success and overall revenue generation. Accurate quarterly forecasting and revenue delivery. Required Skills Proven experience in solution selling within major services or software vendors. Must have experience selling to large banks or insurance in Singapore and ASEAN. Successful history of net new business (direct) sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. Credibility at all levels, including CxO. Strong customer service orientation and a desire to help others succeed CRM/application sales, relevant enterprise experience preferred. Experience in managing key accounts preferred. Candidate with extensive experience selling into APAC markets preferred. Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Site Name: Singapore - Field Based  Posted Date: Oct 5 2021  Job Purpose  We have an Account Manager opportunity available for an experienced pharmaceutical sales professional within our innovative Respi portfolio. Reporting into the Sales Manager, you will have full ownership and accountability for managing accounts within your territory; providing a consistent, science-led and value-added service for health care professionals that supports best public health outcomes for people.  Responsibilities  Sales Developing and executing a comprehensive and strategic account plan to drive value and deliver growth. Establishing and developing effective commercial relationships to promote and competitively sell products. Supporting the implementation of key marketing campaign in the assigned accounts which differentiate and enhance GSK’s standing in the healthcare market. Ensure that key accounts and stakeholders are engaged, educated and informed to drive growth. Continuing to expand your knowledge in the respiratory portfolio. Territory Management Continuously identify and profile key target customers and find the opportunities to drive performance. Identify business opportunities within territory and be able to execute and follow up on progress and outcome. Stakeholder management Demonstrate the ability to manage relationships with Healthcare Professionals, key institutions, professional associations, decision makers and other key stakeholders Maintain high level of customer service with identifying and resolving customer queries and problems proactively. Working in partnership with GSK commercial, medical and sales teams to deliver objectives in line with GSK strategic priorities. Basic Qualifications Preferably a degree with relevant science or business background. Preferably with 3-4 years of established experience in a pharmaceutical sales role with an understanding of the complexities of working in the dynamic environment. Experience in Govt Hospitals/Primary Care and drugs listing will be an added advantage Demonstrated planning ability and strong organizational and executional skills. Clear and influential communication skills with the ability to work effectively with both internal and external stakeholders. An aptitude for science with the ability to relay complex information in a clear and tailored format. Demonstrated planning ability and strong organizational and executional skills Additional Qualifications Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Team orientation Ability to work independently, self-motivated and solution oriented. Demonstrated professional and ethical behavior. Strong stakeholder’s engagement skills are important to work across commercial teams. Ability to apply scientific and medical knowledge. Business Acumen Why GSK?  Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.  As GSK Focuses On Our Values And Expectations And a Culture Of Innovation, Performance, And Trust, The Successful Candidate Will Demonstrate The Following Capabilities  These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk. Managing individual and team performance. Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution. Implementing change initiatives and leading change. Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams. Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally. Developing people and building a talent pipeline. Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation. Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally. Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen. Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.  Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies  GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. description: About The Job  We are looking for an International Business Development Manager with relevant job exposure to join our team to help us on our mission. The manager manager should have experience in the food industry in FMCG and foodservice, including brand building with distributors or importers, especially Asia.  About The Company  Alchemy Foodtech is a Singapore-based food science company with a mission to “Empower Healthier Meals” to help reduce the incidence and improve the management of chronic diseases such as diabetes. Through harnessing the best from nature and combining that with the knowledge of food science, Alchemy Foodtech has developed Its key product, Alchemy Fibre™, a patented fiber blend that is proven to make carbs healthier. Alchemy Foodtech is currently working with marque food brands, such as Boon Tong Kee, Yu Kee, Yum Cha, Swee Heng, and Lim Kee to create healthier and better foods for consumers.  Responsibilities Develop, monitor and manage a portfolio of accounts / distributors / retailers. Develop and design go-to-market strategy of the products and brands in the respective market, both offline and online. Along with the partners, create and monitor the annual business plan/trade plan, to achieve brand results (sell-in, sell-out, market share) and the profitability of brands within the account. Lead or participate in the discussions with clients on key launches, space, location and stock. Work with Business Development Director to develop online e-commerce strategy. Manage an eCommerce plan, e-promotional calendar, product exclusivities, cross selling mechanisms, data ownership along with the eCommerce partner. Identify the potential for commercial development of existing customers and develop their loyalty. Help customers to develop their own business: sales, merchandising, technical assistance, coaching, training and team motivation. Visits customers and retail regularly to help develop the business while maintaining excellent relationships. Identify prospects within the industry and develop new business relationships. Work close with all functions marketing/ finance/ supply chain to ensure the strategic priorities are in line across functions. Job Requirements Candidate must possess good contacts and established working relationships with FMCG distributors in overseas countries in your current/previous roles. At least 5 years of working experience in similar role. Fluent and possess excellent communication and written skills in English and Mandarin. Entrepreneurial mindset and digital savviness are keys for this role to drive the Go to Market strategies for the multi divisions. B2C / eComm channels. Strong leadership & business acumen.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: At Aiven, we turn top Open-Source data technologies into frustration-free cloud services to serve the needs of customers of all sizes. Today, we offer eight fully-managed services - Apache Kafka, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis, InfluxDB and Grafana that work across major cloud providers such as Google, Amazon, Azure, Digital Ocean and more.  Aiven in a nutshell:   We are open-source and cloud experts Our platform delivers bulletproof data ops Global service footprint & support organization Security in our DNA 500+ customers in 50+ countries $150M in VC funding   We are now looking for a Sales Manager to join our newly-founded Aiven Sales team in Singapore.   Responsibilities:  Qualify new customers and prospects and sell the Aiven product suite to them Prospect and open new leads by identifying and qualifying opportunities for Aiven Become an expert on Aiven's services and conduct discovery calls, presentations, and demos with prospects and customers Articulate the business values your prospects can benefit from using Aiven services Support customers during the sales cycle and optimize the selection of Aiven's service offering in alignment with customer requirements Assist customers during the onboarding process and align closely with our Support Team to ensure a smooth transition to becoming an Aiven customer with a best-in-class customer experience Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product & engineering support Visit customers on site as appropriate in alignment with our Sales Enterprise Director Track all opportunity and customer details in Salesforce  Requirements:  3-5 years of software selling experience; SaaS experience preferred, familiarity with the Open-Source space is a major bonus Experience selling to Developers as well as Director/VP-level leaders Some basic IT education Outbound prospecting experience A consistent track record in meeting / exceeding quota Proficiency using Salesforce.com Skills in virtual presentations, online web demos, remote sales processes A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Extraordinary verbal and written communication skills The ambition to be an amazing salesperson (or maybe you are already - congrats!). As we are growing so fast - "the Sky's the Limit" for your own personal career here at Aiven.  Benefits:  We are proud of our supportive and pragmatic organizational culture. We are solution-oriented, and at the same time we cultivate an environment of trust and diversity where everyone can strive for excellence.    Besides our people and culture, at Aiven you'll have   A dynamic environment in a rapidly growing, international business Highly experienced colleagues from a variety of backgrounds Flexible working hours, including remote working when needed Ability to choose the devices and tools that make you work the best Mobile phone and subscription Participation in employee stock option plan  You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit and growing team, making your contribution essential to what is becoming a truly unique success story. If you're interested, send us your application and we'll take it from there.   Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes.   Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.

description: At Dornier MedTech, we believe in fostering a culture of science, innovation and reliability in our people, products, and services. These values serve as a compass that guides us towards meeting our everyday commitment to leading technology and improving life. We’re passionate about our products and our work and are looking to add you to our team.  You will play a key role in managing and expanding the distribution channels in assigned countries to drive business growth and to develop business relationships with end customers directly.  To be successful in this role, you should be independent and highly driven, demonstrate extensive experience in business development strategies, and the ability to adapt quickly in a dynamic environment. It is also important to take on a hands-on approach when required and willing to travel extensively.  Primary Responsibilities  Take ownership for assigned markets in the following areas : Achieve individual performance targets and meet specific goals and strategies Manage channel partners and develop distribution network   Negotiate and close business deals with channel partners Perform market analysis and develop suitable pricing strategies Develop and implement plans to be the brand champion for Dornier MedTech Understand market drivers & dynamics to craft relevant strategies to drive business  Secondary Responsibilities  Work with service team to meet service targets Develop client relationships and strengthen industry partnerships  Education/Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent  Experience  Minimum 2-3 years of relevant regional work in sales and channel management Possess 3-4 years of medical device sales experience is a plus  Aptitude  Keen to take on interesting challenges with limited resources Resourceful in utilizing existing structure & set up Able to adapt to diverse work environment Independent and takes ownership Strong collaborative mindset  Operational Skills  Able to view isolated & separate processes from a strategic viewpoint Must be able to do case support in the operating theatre  We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

description: Reports to: Managing Director Commercial Business, Asia Pacific  Job Summary  This is an experienced sales support role assisting Bell’s Asia Pacific sales region by developing product literature, proposals, purchase agreements and customer quotes. This position will also require organizing resources, presentation venues, preparing sales presentation materials, maintaining details on all contacts, preparation of sales reports and any other aspect related to the effective administration of the Sales Team. After a period of learning the business, the successful candidate may have the opportunity to take on increasing levels of responsibility.  Responsibilities Compare, differentiate and communicate product features based on customer needs and requirements. Advance into roles of increasing customer interface and responsibility Develop sales literature, sales proposals, and purchase agreements Coordinate delivery of marketing materials to Sales Managers Develop & implement plans for aircraft demonstrations, trade shows and sales meetings Forecast annual sales goals Ensure that Sales Force.com is current for assigned region Coordinate aircraft deliveries Support achievement of annual sales goals for assigned region Monitor budget for assigned region Work with Finance, Customer Support Services, Contracts and Legal to ensure compliance Potential growth into international role supporting region  Education Bachelors degree in business, engineering or related field. In lieu of degree, six years of closely related experience in aviation/aerospace industry may be considered. (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Position Requirements At least four years of experience in a Sales or Marketing capacity with two years being in the aerospace/aviation industry (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Fluent in English. Sales Representative handling Chinese speaking market, proficient in Chinese is required. Spoken and written fluency in an Asian language (Bahasa Indonesia, Thai) is beneficial. Previous Asia-based education or work experience is strongly preferred. Excellent relationship building skills Knowledge of aviation and in particular, Helicopter operations is preferred Demonstrated organizational skills, written/oral communication skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office software Position will require travel throughout the Asia Pacific Region Ability to grasp concepts and skills along with potential to assume more responsible role Job Field  Sales  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore  Recruiting Company  Bell Textron Inc.  Schedule  Full-time  Job Level  Individual Contributor  Shift  First Shift  Travel  Yes, 20 % of the Time  Job Posting  03/07/2021, 5:46:24 PM

description: About the job Join TechStorm to drive our brand further to 100 million esports and tech fans across the world. Be part of a vibrant start-up culture that is driven by passion to impact the world of Asian esports to a global audience.  Responsible for Proactive in identifying new business development opportunities and key areas of advertising growth to support the attainment of the quarterly financial goals Interact directly and build working relationships with media agencies, digital agencies & sales reps People-oriented to initiate, manage, develop relationships with direct clients & brands Grow key accounts across markets and industries Meet & exceed fiscal year net sales target Support sales head in identifying and sharing best practice across the territories  To qualify Must be ambitious, goal-driven, go-getter with proven tangible results and negotiation abilities Experience managing own workload and willing to do things differently in a Start-Up work culture Over 10 years of solid sales track record in media sales for director role and have working experience across a minimum 4 territories and have worked in multinational companies with no less than 100 headcounts in one location. Bachelor’s degree or above, strong written and spoken skills in English language plus one Asian vernacular  Successful candidates can look forward to a vibrant international start-up culture with business travels across 10 markets.  Successful candidates can receive an attractive 6-digit figure OTE.  Send your CV directly to recruit@techstorm.tv

Primary Responsibilities: Working closely with CEO and COO to identify new business leads aligned with company expansion plans. Researching on organizations and individuals to identify new leads, new markets and perform initial assessments for new projects and opportunities. Present companies’ projects and opportunities to potential partners, suppliers and distributors Follow-up on leads to prepare agreements and liaise with legal and compliance services to bring project to completion. description: At Genesys, a Sales Development Representative is a great way to kick start your tech sales career in a supportive, dynamic and fun sales environment. We have an amazing sales training program to ensure you are set up for success and have a clear sales career pathway for the right candidate who is hungry, motivated and a hard-working self-starter.  The Sales Development team is an essential team in Genesys’ sales and marketing efforts and is responsible for a combination of demand response, demand management and demand creation.  The primary charge of a Sales Development Representative is to fill and manage the top portion of the sales pipelines allowing Account Executives to focus on closing business.  What You Can Bring To Genesys Prospect and generate leads with companies throughout the SEA region. Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including LinkedIn, Demandbase and SalesLoft. Collaborate closely with Regional Sales Managers and Corporate Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk tracks. Conduct proactive research on accounts by using Google, LinkedIn and Salesforce. Set up new meetings to hand off to our Regional Sales Manager and Mid-Market/Enterprise Account Executive teams. Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process. Qualify opportunities and handle objections. Participate in regular training & informational sessions. Achieve or exceed quarterly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and associated Pipeline Value Conduct high-level conversations and needs-based analysis with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts through tailored lines of questioning Effectively communicate value propositions in line with the specific needs and requirements of the prospect Provide input to marketing including feedback on the quality of leads from marketing programs. You’ve been there and done this… 1+ year B2B sales experience in a prospecting role (Software sales is preferred but not essential) or, New to the workforce and keen to kick-start a career in Sales Strong passion for technology sales and hunger to achieve results Excellent written communication and grammatical skills needed; ability to craft strong sales and prospecting emails Ability to work in a high-energy metric-driven sales team environment Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong verbal communication skills Proficient in Bahasa Indonesia is advantageous Legal requirements to work in Singapore Able to travel internationally occasionally Please note that Genesys will not accept resumes from agencies at this time.  To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Singapore  Covid-19  Safety for our employees and our communities is a key priority for Genesys. We continue to experience rapid growth during the Covid-19 pandemic and are conducting remote hiring and onboarding processes. All hiring and onboarding processes are being conducted remotely at this time. We utilize Zoom video meetings and phone calls during the interview process. We will be working remotely through at least December 31, 2021, in most locations, and we are re-evaluating the opening date of all the Genesys offices on an ongoing basis.  About Genesys  Every year, Genesys® orchestrates more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service℠, our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.  Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
industries: Information Technology and Services and Computer Software

description: We are currently seeking a Sales Associate who will report to the Store Manager as part if our dynamic team in Singapore.  How you will contribute: Achieving monthly individual sales targets by embodying the brand and utilizing the BV way to sell Deliver a memorable retail experience through: initial contact (body language and greeting), assessing the client's needs, make the client dream (romance the product), offering excellent after sales service/follow up Learn from Boutique Manager and store team how to maximize business opportunities      Establish and nurture strong and trustful relationships with all the clients to surpass their expectations. Perform with energy, is proactive, does not give up and actively researches ways to improve results/solve problems. Collect the feedbacks from customers on the collection and provide them to the Boutique Manager Gather information on competitor activity, visiting competitors, read editorials, magazines etc Contribute to team work, adapts to different personalities, is flexible, seeks support from and provides support to colleagues Ensure interior and exterior of store is maintained to company standards  Who you are: Minimum 2 years relevant experience in the luxury retail industry Possess initiative, meticulous and details oriented Demonstrate enthusiasm and exhibit passion for the brand and retail industry Able to work independently with minimum supervision and guidance Prior working experience in the luxury industry preferred but not mandatory Ability to communicate in English & Chinese Team player with ability to perform in fast pace environment  Why work with us? This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibility to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.  Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms - gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation - enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications form all  qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

description: About DTEN DTEN, a developer of enterprise collaboration solutions, that is changing the way teams connect, communicate and collaborate. With highly integrated, AI-powered technologies, DTEN helps teams bridge global organizational challenges of time and place. DTEN solutions provide high quality real-time, interactive, face to face experiences for teams to work together, from anywhere in the world, in the most creative and efficient ways.   Overview  DTEN is looking for an experienced Regional Sales Manager with a strong sales pedigree and general management skills to drive revenue and build the DTEN business in the SEA Region. You will need to closely engage with channel partners (resellers, distributors, strategic partners), and end customers to maximize DTEN opportunities across the region. This is a strategic region for DTEN, and this will be our first person on the ground. It will require an entrepreneurial / start-up attitude and approach to deliver on the company objectives. The ability to build strong relationships, prioritize and get things done is vital for success in this role.  What You'll Bring Knowledge and relationships within the channel ecosystem of distributors, re-sellers, integrators in the collaboration and/or AV space is strongly preferred. Knowledge of the following spaces: Video, collaboration and AV hardware / Web & Video Conferencing / Collaboration required Excellent communication skills (for internal and external relations) Proven experience of success delivering strong revenue growth in a technology market Ability to engage, capture the attention and motivate the regional teams of our key strategic partner to introduce DTEN into their opportunities and accounts. Highly collaborative, with ability to work cross-functionally and provide insight to various internal stakeholders across the business Confidence to engage with customers at senior management level and be able to work with smaller companies through to large global enterprises Prepared to perform a wide range of activities, to get things done, go above and beyond, and always showing a positive attitude to move with speed and professionalism  Responsibilities  Meet and exceed overall business and revenue goals and targets Regular sales engagement with our distribution partners in the region: supporting their needs to optimize sales opportunities and drive increased awareness of DTEN across SEA and beyond Supporting dealer network of resellers & integrators to develop the channel opportunities across the region Engage with end customers by providing high touch sales support and especially managing engagement with larger enterprise opportunities Strong focus and ownership of customer success, ensuring every customer is fully satisfied and willing to refer DTEN to other associates Building the brand and reputation of DTEN across the SEA region Close collaboration across the DTEN team to develop and evolve the sales approach in region and provide feedback on what is needed to deliver success Providing accurate, timely reporting to Senior Management as required. Salesforce is used as central CRM platform Taking personal responsibility to remain up to date and informed regarding company products and services, market knowledge, industry trends and competitors. Representing the company and its interests in a professional manner at all times.  Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience involving channel sales, direct sales, territory management Experience in any of the following sectors is preferred (especially in Hardware) - Video, UC, Collaboration Business-related Bachelor Degree / MBA preferred but not required
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
