description: Zebra Insights Group serves clients in financial services, law, insurance, diverse corporate sectors and strategy consulting. We design innovative and differentiated content ideas for our clients' worldwide conferences and events of all sizes.   On behalf of our clients, we build relationships with senior executives, industry experts and keynote speakers across diverse sectors. We invite them to share their strategic insights and knowledge at our clients' events globally. The speaking engagements comprise a variety of formats including video calls, virtual roundtable discussions, keynote presentations at conferences, etc.  Zebra Insights Group seeks a Sales and Business Development Manager for its Singapore office in a full-time job role. Working closely with the management team, you will be the face of the company and will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities to generate revenue, improve profitability and help the business grow.    If you have an innovative mindset that enables you to come up with unique ideas to elevate company sales, if you have a passion for sales and have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy, to dive right in, take the lead and use initiative, then this role is for you.  Your responsibilities:  ·       Research and identify new sales opportunities as a hunter in client sectors such as banking, large corporates (industries such as pharma, tech, property/real estate, insurance, etc), management and strategy consulting firms and non-profits ·       Building relationships with partner companies who bring you deal flow ·       Develop and implement your own outbound sales and business development strategy, and sales pipeline in accordance with your targets that will deliver results ·       Be cognizant of market trends and customer needs, using them to uncover sales opportunities  ·       Screen and qualify potential opportunities, selecting those with high likelihood of winning the deal  ·       Meet with prospects and clients face to face, via video call or over the phone ·       Foster and develop relationships with prospects with the goal to turn them into long term clients ·       Create informative presentations and deliver information to potential clients at sales meetings ·       Create and maintain list/database of prospects and current clients in CRM tool ·       Cold calling: making multiple outbound calls to prospects to uncover new buyers ·       Warm calling: leverage existing relationships to approach new buyers in the same organization and through referrals ·       Managing the sales process from A to Z ·       Constantly check business news and be knowledgeable about market trends & changes ·       Communicate daily with colleagues in Asia and Europe                         What we are looking for:   ·       Proven working experience as a business development manager, sales executive or a relevant role involving proactively hunting for new sales opportunities  ·       Successful track record in B2B sales and negotiation ·       Complete fluency in both written and spoken English is mandatory ·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills needed for communicating with a range of people, both internally and externally, as well as presentation skills ·       Interpersonal skills for building and developing relationships with clients ·       Experience working with people across different markets and countries ·       Experience cold calling is a must ·       Experience in customer support or account management is a plus ·       Tenacity and drive to seek new business and exceed targets ·       Ability to pivot and flourish in an environment of fast and frequent change (adaptability) and minimal guidance ·       Ability to act in a tactful and diplomatic manner and work on sensitive issues with a diverse group of individuals ·       Initiative and the confidence to explore new avenues ·       Strong business acumen; ability to understand the interests of a market ·       A bachelor's degree preferred ·       Familiarity with using LinkedIn as a sales tool   What we offer:  ·       Competitive salary for full time role  ·       Career development opportunities within the company ·       Position related on-and-off-the-desk training  ·       A great team dynamic in a corporate environment   To apply, please provide:  ·       CV and cover letter explaining in detail your skills for this position ·       Desired salary ·       Employment availability date  Please send your CV to: careers@zebrainsights.com until October 21, 2021.  www.ZebraInsights.com/careers

At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.  Responsibilities P/L responsibilities with sales and revenue target ownership for key merchant with multiple markets in Southeast Asia Formulate and implement an account penetration, management and growth plan that maximizes sales and profits Develop growth strategy and business partnerships pipeline that drives ROIs for the product annually Identify business opportunities and partnership opportunities with the Development team to develop product requirement specifications to capture the business opportunities Responsible to identifying, developing, expanding payment merchant/channel and relationships with potential payment partners and banking institutions in Southeast Asia Drive the business development team to develop performance targets for potential payment partners in Southeast Asia Collect and analyze revenue and expenses report to be presented regularly to Management  Negotiate agreements with merchant/channel/partner and manage, review, and renew such agreements as required to maximize business interests for Razer Develop long-term partnerships with the existing partners for the benefit of both companies Responsible for building a company’s brand in the region through devise advertising, promotional plans and positioning marketing brand development in Southeast Asia  Requirements Degree with 8 - 10 years of experience in the acquirer or payment gateway company with exposure to regional merchants with multiple market in Southeast Asia Owned and maintain P/L responsibilities Demonstrate experience with a successful track record in managing accounts, building partnership relationships, and driving revenues In-depth knowledge of the payment industry and its competitive background Excellent understanding of payment development processes, pipelines, workflows, and tools Good analytical skills, capable of doing in-depth analysis, to provide business insights and develop strategic to counterchallenges and grow new business Own and maintain an extensive partnership, merchant & channel network in payment industry Experience in working with international partners and multi-countries partnerships Experience of managing a diverse set of stakeholders  Be part of a phenomenal team today!
industries: Consumer Electronics

description: Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-driven global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world.    As the leader in the Employer of Record industry, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries.   With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done.    Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing!   About the position: As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.   What you will do:  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle, reaching out and follow-up on both incoming and self-generated leads, proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the phone, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners. Your responsibilities include: Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc.  Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges  Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution  Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target  Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics  Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc.  Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive  Maintain high quality data in Salesforce   What we are looking for:  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in the role, we look for the following:  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline  2-4 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and selling to C-Level  Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus, is a plus  Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies is a plus  International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a startup environment, an advantage  Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal, with excellent English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred  Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships   About Globalization Partners Hire anyone, anywhere, quickly and easily. Globalization Partners AI- driven, automated, fully compliant global Employer of Record platform technology is transforming how companies hire talent around the globe. Our industry-leading proprietary technology simplifies onboarding and managing employees anywhere in the world. With easy-to-use dashboards and a mobile-ready payroll authorization system, our customers can safely and securely access crucial HR documents and authorize and approve global payroll faster than ever. Globalization Partners: Breaking Down Barriers for Everyone, Everywhere
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description:  Babel Finance is expanding its international Business Development business to help achieve aggressive business growth goals in onboarding clients to our Enterprise-grade custody and execution services offerings. As a member of Singapore Business Development team, your primary objective will be increasing asset under management (AUM) and revenue. You will collaborate with product manager, sales support, and other Babel Finance teams to support our clients’ activities and the growth of our business.  The Purpose of Your Role  As part of our International Business Development team, you will interface with internal & external stakeholders to identify, develop, and execute strategies that create deep and lasting partnerships with high-net-worth (HNW) individuals and institutional clients. As we continue to explore opportunities in crypto assets, you must be able to represent the voice of the client while continuing to achieve our business goals.  The Expertise We’re Looking For    3-5 years’ experiences in forex trading or sales role in a bank, trading funds, broker-dealer, or other financial institutions. Good knowledge on fx trading or market making is a big plus. Understanding of one or more of the following marketplaces: cryptocurrencies, blockchain. Experienced in sales, business development and/or relationship management, with strong hunting drive Ability to conduct market research independently and present deal opportunities. Exceptionally strong interpersonal skills in managing internal and external relationships in a proactive, energetic, and customer-oriented way. Comfort managing concurrent priorities across a diversified workload and ability to drive results in a thoughtful and collaborative way. Experience with the sales toolkit, including experience with CRM systems and development of pitchbooks and sales materials.   The Value You Deliver  Manage our high-touch client pipeline from lead generation to implementation Build strong relationships with clients, prospects, and other market participants, to drive new revenue and ensure customer retention. Develop presentations and sales materials for audiences with varying levels of seniority and understanding of finance, cryptocurrencies. Represent the voice of the market and the client with internal stakeholders in product, marketing, legal, risk, compliance, relationship management, implementation, operations, and client service. Identify opportunities for internal process improvement within the Business Development team, present such opportunities and drive change Monitor, evaluate and improve your sales toolkit on market trends and signals, including competitor business models, industry news and regulatory developments. Contribute to a corporate climate that values and rewards contributions, drive, initiative, and achievement of results.   Company Overview ·      Aiming to be the most prestigious institution in crypto finance, we're committed to offering our clients full crypto financial services. By offering an easy, smooth, and secure experience, we're building a solid crypto financial infrastructure for the world. Learn more at https://www.babel.finance
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Account Strategist, Managed Agency, Google Customer Solutions
description: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 3 years of experience in Digital Media and/or Advertising Sales  Preferred qualifications: Sales experience in a technology, advertising, media sales and/or internet environment. Experience with Google Ads and YouTube account management, managing advertising and/or media campaigns. Media experience across a variety of platforms (TV, Radio, Print, Sponsorship, etc.). Ability to multitask; with experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously while paying attention to detail. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  The Managed Agency Sales team is a high performing Sales team that drives customer success by partnering with a wide range of independent agencies in Singapore, Malaysia, and Philippines.  Our Agency Account Strategists are ambitious and customer focused front-line sellers who serve as the face of Google, promoting and cross-selling the best solutions Google has to offer. As an Account Strategist, you will activate initiatives across both agency and end customers via improving account and campaign performance, driving thoughtful Google product adoption, and designing short, medium, and long-term strategies to meet customer business objectives. You will collaborate with our teams of technicians, analysts, and solution specialists to analyze and solve customer challenges, capitalizing on industry opportunities, and delivering great sales experience.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage a portfolio of businesses by understanding growth drivers, identifying opportunities for growth, managing risks and building quarterly plans for achievements. Drive customer growth by delivering outstanding customer sales experience and achieving customer business and marketing objectives. Own end-to-end sales process, by driving customer outreach, sales pitches, solution implementation and performance evaluation. Work towards quarterly business and product growth goals.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: ‘Looking for a hard core senior sales professional who can work tirelessly to join the mission to create a global company. The person will be responsible for generating sales leads and converting them into sales in South East Asia. Prior experience of selling financial market data platforms in Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Singapore and Thailand is a must.

Oversee and accelerate our growth in Emerging Markets i.e., Sri Lanka and two other Southeast Asian countries.  Key responsibilities include (1) overseeing channels development, partnership, identifying and exploring new market opportunities (2) building strong team and sustainable business model in each respective markets and (3) manage business unit that covers 3 markets to: Oversee and accelerate growth for the territory Optimize opportunities in channel development and partnership; develop local GTM strategies Strategize market entry mode, build local operations, and groom local team Build strong partnerships with local retailers and brand principals Deliver and drive Net Sales and NPBT targets for perimeter Ensure that all legal and fiscal entitles are in place  We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
jobFunction: Management, General Business, and Business Development
industries: Retail and Consumer Goods

description: ·        Achieve personal sales commitments and targets; . To generate revenue for selling the Company’s range of services and products by way of telecommunication sales. Telecommunication sales include sales via emails, faxes and telephone. ·        Selling the full range of intelligence-based products and business propositions for the    Company’s training and conference business including research reports to clients of the Company within assigned budgets and sales targets; .  Promoting the products, services, activities and general reputation of the Company in such a way that will build goodwill in the marketplace and result in strong sales revenues; .  Ensure the timely submission of sales pipeline report for the products and services; ·        Building networks and relationships with third parties and other intermediaries and potential clients of the Company; ·        Initiate and execute marketing and sales program that will result in successful sales and revenue contributing to the company’s bottom-line; ·        Continuously be able to establish rapport in the industry; ·        Representing the views of the Company to the public accurately and professionally.  We are also interested in candidates who have managerial skills to ·        Manage a regional sales team, including sales pipelines ·        Grow the sales team and sales figures in new geographies as well as into new digital product lines;   Requirements  ·           Ability to close sales mainly in the banking and fintech community; . Previous experience in publication sales is an advantage; ·           Excellent communication skills both written and verbal is preferred; ·           Experience working with remote sales teams in a fast-paced environment; ·           Strong business acumen and execution skill; ·           Mature executives with the ability to interact with top level management in the industry face-to-face; ·           Leadership capability and good team player; ·           Pleasant personality; ·           Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Zoho; ·           Bachelor Degree in related fields will be useful; Fresh graduates/Entry level applicants are encouraged to apply for Junior Sales Executive.

jobTitle: Part Time Sales Advisor (Jem, Jurong East)
description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: Job Requisition ID #  21WD50588  Position Overview  The Territory Sales Representative is responsible for hunting new business from both existing and new customers within a given sales territory. Candidates will be responsible for achieving their targets by managing, building, and developing a pipeline of sales opportunities. This will be accomplished through following on qualified leads generated by the Demand Generation and/or Sales Development organization as well as outbound lead generation from targeted prospect and customer lists. Candidates will also be expected to cold call and prospect to achieve their targets. You will gain experience interacting with clients of all levels, in a variety of industries and across a broad geographical area. Autodesk offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources, and outstanding leadership to sell market-leading design software to take your career to the next level. Candidates for this position must be highly motivated, tenacious, and self-starters. Territory Sales Representatives will strategically develop and qualify opportunities within their assigned territory. TSRs work closely with Sales Development reps, field-based Partner Managers, Sales Development Executives, and License Compliance teams as well as with channel partners.  Responsibilities Prioritise the highest opportunity target accounts within a defined territory Work closely with Sales Development Representatives to ensure smooth and timely follow-up on sales leads Generate and close new business opportunities to fuel the sales pipeline within an assigned sales territory Quickly identify decision-makers and influencers along with their corresponding business needs, timeline, and budget Ensure that prospect and customers’ needs are understood and addressed by articulating how Autodesk solutions will accelerate their business Utilize telephone, email, and web-based communication as the primary means of connecting with customers Manage in-person sales meetings with decision-makers to close some of your largest deals Leverage field-based Territory Sales Executives as appropriate Develop and leverage relationships with channel partners to improve all territory performance to exceed customers’ expectations Build the appropriate team for each opportunity coordinating Autodesk personnel including presales, consultants, and services to drive value into the client base Provide accurate and timely billings forecasting and updates to sales managers Consistently meet or exceed monthly sales targets/quotas and KPIs Minimum Qualifications Inside sales/office-based sales experience Polished professionalism with above-average organizational, planning, communication, and problem -solving skills Strong presentation skills for online presentations Proven ability to manage multiple concurrent sales cycles Proven ability to collaborate with virtual team members Proven ability to collaborate on deals with channel partners Excellent written and verbal communications skills Drive to continually improve your sales skills through on-the-job coaching, self-learning, and as defined by Autodesk sales career progression framework Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Proven track record of exceeding sales targets/quotas and KPIs Fluent in English & native Korean speaker to manage stakeholders / customers from South Korea market Background in Manufacturing will be a plus At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.  Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers .    With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.
industries: Computer Software, Design, and Information Technology and Services

jobTitle: Sales Executive II, Key Account Management, Singapore
description: Location:  Singapore, SG, 903132  Brand: RS Components  Function: Sales  Lead management; to generate and qualify sales lead opportunities to drive profitable sales growth Customer qualification; to identify sales opportunities within Portfolio, ensuring that the largest opportunities for growth are prioritised accordingly Account Development Plan; to create a specific plan of action for managing Portfolio customers that is maintained on a quarterly basis, relating to the local business strategy Calls and visits; deliver sales, leads, margin growth, insights and contact acquisition through telephone conversations and face to face visits. Quotations and discount investment; demonstrate strong commercial awareness, ensuring that sales targets and business needs are aligned with customer expectations Use of initiative to identify and develop opportunities with companies not currently on the database Contribute to a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement through regular one-to-ones, team meetings and ad hoc feedback Liaise effectively across functions to ensure customers are delighted Achieve sales targets and other specified metrics To effectively use the RS value proposition to differentiate RS from our competitors in the minds of their contacts Prefer candidate with experience in Offshore & MRO industry. Work closely with other functional business areas, and supplier partners to achieve synergy.  Competency & Skills  Customer Focus:  Ownership of customer enquiries, make decisions with the customer in mind, exceed customer’s expectations, keeping the customer informed/updated. Constantly seeking to delight our customers!  High Performance:  Exceeding KPIs and deadlines, able to work under pressure, target driven, takes accountability and initiative, innovative problem solving skills, independent. Strives to be the best!  Working Together:  Collaborative, exceptional communicator, proactively builds relationships to deliver excellence, drives a culture of excellence.  Respect:  Consummate professional, active listening and questioning skills, respectful at all times, passionate about providing and requesting excellent feedback.  Dynamic:  Welcoming and encouraging of change, natural inquisitiveness, drives continuous improvement, works well under pressure.  ESSENTIAL:  Proactive and driven in all aspects of work and be able to operate without daily supervision Target-driven and competitive by nature Highly motivated with probing tenacity to achieve and exceed objectives Naturally strong interpersonal skills forming and maintaining positive relationship at all levels Proven ability in delivering a great customer experience Effective negotiator and influencer with outstanding written and verbal communication skills Ability to simply and concisely communicate complex solutions Disciplined analytical approach to problem solving Shows respects to others and values differing opinions and perspectives Seizes on opportunities to create a high performing culture Shows a desire to continuously learn and develop Takes ownership and is confident to take risks and learn from them Strong planning, prioritisation and time management skills  DESIRABLE:  Proven experience of working in an outbound sales environment Knowledge of SAP and Microsoft packages

description: We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!  What We're Looking For  At Citrix, our 18-month Sales Development Program nurtures future leaders through holistic training. You’re an exceptional, enthusiastic, university student working toward your degree. You have a passion for technology, selling, and a can-do attitude. In addition, you will need to have the creativity, “think out of the box” mentality, not afraid to challenge the norms, enjoy working with people, strong will for success are some of the desirable personal attributes.  Roles & Responsibilities  You will be working with real clients to gain the knowledge and skills required to provide innovative products and services to clients. This opportunity is the perfect launch pad to a successful career in sales.  You will go through an 18-month structured program which includes: Training on Citrix technology Sales training Job rotation to various sales units Job shadowing Education And Experience Required Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university universitygraduate  What You’re Looking For  Our technology is built on the idea that everyone should be able to work from anywhere, at any time, and on any device. It’s a simple philosophy that guides everything we do — including how we work. If you’re driven, passionate and curious, we invite you to make a difference with a brand you can believe in. We want employees to do what they do best, every day.  Be bold. Take risks. Imagine a better way to work. If we just described you, then we really need to talk.  Functional Area  Consulting  About Us  Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.  Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.  If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.  R28932

description: As a Business Development Manager – Consumer Services in Singapore/Australia, you have a win-win opportunity: Use your skills to sell integrated solutions, then grow your own career through a variety of paths inside one of the world’s leading technology companies.  What a Business Development Manager – Consumer Services does at HP: Develop & Drive new business development plan to grow Consumer services in the greater Asia Markets. Coordinate and Lead internal/cross functional alignment of the plan Promote and Develop partnership with retail/e tail and Distributors to promote Personal Systems Services of HP Build/Leverage processes and tools for services sales enablement programs and initiatives To lead and coordinate the business development and joint offerings for the market by ensuring alignment with hardware category and their planning Work along with HP Online Store team for end to end demand gen and close loop sales programs for Services Be instrumental in the launch of New Service Introductions and promotions to drive growth in key product lines as part of the category strategy Tracking of current and ongoing business on a monthly, quarterly and bi-annual basis with corrective actions as required in the enterprise and channel space. Tracking of promotion effectiveness in liaison with the country BD’s and category sales enablement team. To stay updated and understand market trends, category dynamics and product solutions as a platform for innovation To collaborate well within HP teams as well as various partners in all the countries to maximize the consumer business. Lead market intelligence by identifying untapped potentials and capture opportunities with the various Channels (Online or offline). To bring together business synergies across markets, clients, categories through leveraging on multiple markets adaption, wherever possible. Individuals who do well in this role at HP, usually possess: University or Bachelors degree in Marketing or Finance; advanced degree or MBA preferred. Typically 8-12 years of professional experience with a combination of Marketing, Sales, Business Planning experienced preferred. Consumer and/or Commercial Partner management expertise essential. Experience in Retail/e-tail sales will be beneficial. Financial planning and modelling skills, comfortable to manage high complexity business planning and reporting. Strong communication skills at senior management internally and externally. Knowledge of promotional marketing processes and practices. Negotiation skills and ability to frame the product value proposition to customers/partners. About The Team  This role is a newly created position and will be part of the Greater Asia Personal Systems (PS) team  Sustainable impact is HP’s commitment to create positive, lasting change for the planet, its people, and our communities. This serves as a guiding principle for delivering on our corporate vision – to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.  HP is a Human Capital Partner – we commit to human capital development and adopting progressive workplace practices in Singapore. (this is only for Singapore reqs)  About HP  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.  So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.  HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.  Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.  From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

description: Do you believe that all restaurants should be safe and clean for their customers? Do you want to grow with the company together? Do you want to learn sales?  If so I might want to meet you.  I am looking for a Sales assistance, who will help me to find potential clients (our clients are restaurants).  You don't have to be in the office all the time, you will need to walk around and meet people and bring in new clients so we can serve them to our best ability.  If you do not know sales and you do not have experience, it is ok. We will teach you and guide you.  It is not easy and it is going to be challenging. However, if you are willing to learn new skills and have the right attitude you will be good.  Our clients are restaurants so you will help them to succeed in a market by helping to increase the cleanness level and make them safe for the guest.  You can apply for a part-time or full-time job. For full-time will be different salary and schedule.

The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $89B+ by 2024!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.  MongoDB is the top tier modern, general-purpose database platform, crafted to ignite the power of software and data for developers and the applications they build. Developers around the world are using MongoDB to build software to create new businesses, modernize existing businesses, and transform the lives of millions of people around the world.  Headquartered in New York, with offices across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific, MongoDB has more than 17,000 customers, which include some of the largest and most sophisticated businesses in nearly every vertical industry, in over 100 countries.  We're looking for hardworking Corporate Account Executives who will be responsible for prospecting within an assigned territory to uncover new opportunities. The CAE will identify, nurture, and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, run forecasts, and supervise customer data.  The CAE will be responsible for quarterly and annual sales targets in the designated region. They will work in concert with the Enterprise Account Execs, designated partners/resellers within the region to improve the velocity of business and to build solutions that serve the best interests of our customers at MongoDB.  Responsibilities Develop new business by driving sales in their existing accounts as well as new Accounts Developing and executing account plans to achieve targets: Cold calling, prospecting, qualification, account mapping, and presentations Effectively utilize sales tools for pipeline development, tracking opportunity progress (Forecasting), developing monthly, quarterly level forecasts Responsible for all aspects of the selling process - Identity, Qualify, Sell, Close, and Coordinate for all volume business in a designated territory Generate leads by using networking and other sales tools Qualify, Sell and Close Identify key steps to close the sale, identify the decision-maker and influencers, etc Resolve Availability needs and Objectives Gain agreement of proposed solution / Services, tying back to customer business drivers Close significant sales across multiple Accounts across assigned territory Accurate Forecasting of business, previous experience with Salesforce.com ideal Requirements 6+ years of sales experience in selling software/technology solutions Native-level proficiency in Chinese, Thai, Bahasa, or Vietnamese Ability present & excellent listening skills Daring selling approach | consultative selling A strong network of relationships with key decision-makers in small/medium & large-sized companies in the respective territory Demonstrate current / running customer contacts and be able to generate revenue within the first 45 days Experience with Lead generation and sales closure Strong exposure to handling the assigned Market Track record of maintaining relationships with accounts Experience working with Channels & Ecosystem of ASEAN Perseverant with the ability to meet deadlines and targets Bachelors degree or equivalent from a reputed institute with a good academic record Do you know why MongoDB is a phenomenal place to work and build your career? Disrupting a $89B+ billion market Top NoSQL database in the world The largest Ecosystem and the fastest growing database in the world Close to 22,600+ customers in over 100 countries and over 130MM+ million downloads >120% net ARR expansion rate over each of the last twenty quarters Sequoia Capital and a number of other Top VC firms have invested in MongoDB. Sequoia Capital calls us out as one of their flagship portfolios; Sequoia has also invested in Apple, Google, YouTube, and WhatsApp 9-figure revenue company, with very high double-digit growth rates Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused Work with talented people around the globe Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing an encouraging and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!  MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  This role is remotely optional until November 1, 2021, we are looking to speak to candidates who plan to be available in Singapore for when we introduce our hybrid model.  *MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer*

description: Job Description  At Cloudera, we believe that data can make what is impossible today, possible tomorrow. We empower people to transform complex data into clear and actionable insights. Cloudera delivers an enterprise data cloud for any data, anywhere, from the Edge to AI.  Powered by the relentless innovation of the open source community, Cloudera advances digital transformation for the world’s largest enterprises.  Are you able to quickly understand where individuals are and where they want to go and build trust and lead them down a specific path to generate big results? Are you able to challenge the status quo, engage customers in new ways and earn their trust and business? Are you ready to be intellectually stimulated and earn financial rewards along the way? As Sales Account Manager based in Singapore, your primary markets will be Malaysia & Emerging Markets.  Responsibilities Align with company’s strategic objectives, handle and grow revenue and market share at designated accounts to improve customer success at all levels in the customer organization. Develop and deliver business plans to address customer and prospect priorities and critical needs. Convey public and acquired intelligence about customer technology footprints, strategic growth plans, technology strategies and competitive landscape and trends Introduce domain product and service experts/specialists while maintaining account oversight. Own account relationships and drive overall customer success for assigned accounts. Build consensus and develop relationships at multiple levels – executive sponsors, influencers and decision makers. Lead large scale transactions to close large scale deals Build pipeline, forecast business, lead the internal team, communicate key updates and competitive intelligence. Exceed quarterly and annual new and expansion software subscription, renewals, professional service and training business goals. About Our Top Sales Performers Minimum 8+ years of exceeding enterprise software sales targets Fast moving start-up and vertical use case driven experience Data management or Data warehousing experience Containers, Kubernetes and public cloud infrastructure technology knowledge and experience BA/BS or equivalent educational background Excellent English written and verbal communication skills The right person in this role has a huge opportunity to make an impact to our business. If you clearly match the above criteria - we invite you apply! An adventure in data awaits.  Cloudera is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. The applicant will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

description: Regional Head of Sales – Middle East (based in Singapore)  A leading global player in online payments, seeks an experienced, driven, and ambitious sales leader to oversee their team focused on the Middle East market.  You will be responsible for building and managing a team, and growing the business - identifying and developing new business opportunities, and negotiating agreements with key external stakeholders , merchants, and business partners. You will be expert in the Middle East region and be able to draw upon and demonstrate a proven track record of revenue growth through direct sales and capturing market / growth opportunities. You will be work cross-functionally with other senior stakeholders and leaders in the organization and take a leading role in building strategic relationships with key leaders in merchant organizations and partners at the C-level and driving pipeline activity in the region for both sales and market development. The business and e-commerce landscape across the Middle East is experiencing hypergrowth, and the role presents an opportunity to drive growth in the region.  Responsibilities: Define and implement the business strategy to drive and maximize growth for the Middle East market and establish the firm as the leading PSP in the cross-border payment space. Identify new business growth opportunities and clearly articulate the benefits which can be driven. Take responsibility for the overall P&L of the business including establishing business and revenue goals and strategies. Build a high-performance sales team capable of delivering and exceeding targets.  Manage the sales pipeline and drive discipline around prospecting and onboarding new customers, as well as relationship -based growth of existing portfolio.  Drive “operational excellence” by leveraging regional infrastructure to maximize efficiency and synergy of the organizations. Represent the company both internally and externally to communicate key business objectives, build partnerships and seek resources. Partner with all affiliates to cross/up-sell user for merchandise as well as payment volume.  Qualifications & Experience: An experienced “Hunter” with a proven track record of commercial success, both individually and as the developer and leader of teams. Direct sales focus from working for Payment Gateways, Wallets, or Merchant Acquiring in Banks/ Financial Services. Experience of growing Sales teams within a start-up / scale-up business is advantageous. You should not have sold through partners or channels, rather you will be able to demonstrate a history of closing deals with merchants directly. Appropriate industry knowledge of payments and eCommerce. People leadership experience leading and building high-performance sales teams Must have an excellent command of both verbal and written English. Proficiency of one of the commonly used languages in the region is highly desirable, but not necessary.  Interested?         Please contact me to talk in strictest confidence - Andrew Cook | +44 (0) 7801 953 663 | andrew.cook@head-count.com
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: Your Team  You will be part of a commercial team managing client relationships and new business developments activities globally.  Your Mission  You will be responsible to manage and further develop the business in APAC of one of our largest and key strategic customers, a leading global financial institution having outsourced key business processes and IT operations to Avaloq.  Your role will be to manage and coordinate all commercial and contractual aspects between Avaloq and the customer. This includes mastering the upselling process for products and services, ensuring compliance with the various contracts, overseeing financials, acting as an escalation point for all matters relating to the delivered services and ensuring highest client satisfaction.  Other responsibilities include:  Build and maintain effective long-term relationships with key stakeholders of this highly complex account to ensure a high level of satisfaction, profitable account and increasing revenues by upselling activities Build up in-depth knowledge of the customer’s business, build up and maintain a network within the customer on various levels (IT, Business, team-leader, management leads, upper Management). product sales, application management services or IT infrastructure to ensure an aligned approach to customer topics/issues/requests and address inefficiencies or failures in service delivery in tight collaboration with service management Ensure consistent communication to each of the client stakeholders as first point of contact and serve as escalation point and primary interface for all products and services Manage commercial discussions, handle contract negotiations and billing/ invoicing control Ensure projects follow-up with the client Increase actively the share of wallet by promoting Avaloq products and services (offers preparation) and identifying opportunities, promoting and proposing new products or services to the existing clients Ensure opportunity management and customer account plans are updated regularly in Avaloq’s CRM  Qualifications  What you need  At least 5-6 years of relevant sales experience in financial institutions Have been a client partner or customer success role in a services or consulting business Prior experience in managing and selling banking software packages Bachelor's/Masters’ from a recognized institute, preferably specializing in Business / Banking / Computer Science related disciplines Strong in creating trustworthy long-term relationships with demanding stakeholders in situations of conflicting interests Savvy in networking Exceptional problem-solving skills Experience in several banking domains Ability to maximize customer value and embrace intrapreneurship Strong in communication, presentation and conflict management skills Capable in generating trust and manage resources effectively Process competence and adherence Prior work experience in South East Asia markets  You will get extra points for the following  Knowledge and experience in the wealth management industry Experience in selling large IT and business outsourcing / operations engagements  Additional Information  Now let's talk about perks and compensation  We offer high flexibility in regards to working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out “Success Share Units” depending on its performance in a given year.  At Avaloq we embrace diversity, we embrace difference. We are whole-heartedly committed to equal employment opportunities and we foster an inclusive culture where everyone’s' contributions are valued and their voices are listened to. We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Please note that our job descriptions are intended to be written in an inclusive and gender neutral language.  Don’t be shy – apply! Please only apply online, preferably with pdf documents.  Note to Agencies: All unsolicited résumés will be considered direct applicants and no referral fee will be acknowledged.

Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store, Commercial, Operations, IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.  In your role as Sales & Service Generalist, you will ensure end to end shopping experience and apply home furnishing knowledge to provide relevant solutions to customers.  Your assignment To know and understand the customers’ shopping behaviour, retail trends & life at home and use this knowledge to provide the relevant solutions for our customers; To ensure that sales and profitability is secured through sales steering and range efficiency to maximise growth; To know the importance and actively work with replenishment proposal- securing the right parameters to ensure product availability ; To ensure that my area of responsibility is in excellent shape as new, fully stocked and that a high level of merchandising basics is always in place; To contribute towards improving the customer experience in the store and maintain a high level of service standard with a “First time right” mindset; To support a customer-friendly and efficient execution of the payments, exchange & returns and click and collect process. Qualifications  Your profile You have the ability to make things happen by championing flexibility, speed and simplicity; You have the ability to align customer needs and expectations with business needs. You have the ability to communicate with various levels of co-workers from different functions; You have the ability to work on agreed working methods independently and reliably You have the ability to find solutions for customer and operational issues. Additional Information  Please apply by 15 September 2021

description: Meero’s core mission is to empower photographers to focus on what they love: photography! We take care of the rest by relying on tech and AI.  Started in 2016, Meero is on a mission to make life easier for photographers and customers alike by bringing the top-name brands directly to image creators all the while expediting all of the tedious work. From its state-of-the-art image editing technology to our teams positioned around the world, Meero is helping creators do what they do best: create.  Meero is always looking to add fresh new talents in an already amazing team. Have a look if you needed more reasons to become a Meeronaut: https://bit.ly/2UDSXiJ  Check Out This New Position  What You'll Do Based in Singapore, you will develop our global marketplaces business (Deliveroo, Just Eat, Airbnb type of clients). Good awareness of the startup / tech / digital ecosystem (e-commerce, B2B / SAAS companies etc). You have a closer mindset. Ability to think out of the box. Bold ideas and big laughs make everyday exciting, so we never get complacent. We are a family that loves each other, pushes each other, and laughs with each other.  Champion creators - Creatives are the architects of our visual world. We work tirelessly to support their skills and business, so they can feel inspired to create.  Rise faster than you fail - We celebrate resilience in the face of failure. We truly support one other, so we’re free to fall, but quick to get up and try again.  Give a shit - Success doesn’t happen by accident. We work with focus, determination, and pride towards our goals. We care deeply about each other, our clients, creatives, and our impact on the world.

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The Account Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.  Responsibilities Become an expert in Facebook’s digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships Demonstrate vertical expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns Minimum Qualification BA/BS degree 0-2 years of work experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Strong communication skills Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals

description: Full Time Position, Sales and Marketing Executive, KiteSense  About KiteSense KiteSense is a learning analytics company. Our mission is to empower educators to shift from a one-size fits all approach, to provide personalised learning experiences. Our proprietary software modules – Student 360, Learning Journey, MyKiteSenseBot, Grader, Insights and Worksheets, provide a seamless and complete system for the littlest of learners to those in higher education, and empowers educators to effectively integrate learning data, educational interventions and curriculum development. KiteSense is dedicated to making the best learning systems in order to empower teachers, through data analytics, to be better educators. We care a lot about personal development and will lend emphasis on your growth and development.  Job Brief We are looking for a talented Sales and Marketing Executive with an analytical mindset. You will work closely with the Marketing Director for generating, managing and executing sales and marketing initiatives for our products. This includes running experiments across the funnel, improving conversion rates and working cross-department to collaborate on new initiatives.  Responsibilities: ● Identify and contact potential customers to market solutions provided by KiteSense.  ● Handle ad-hoc enquiries from potential customers.  ● Support management for strategic meetings with potential customers  ● Create, manage and experiment with new user acquisition and lead generation campaigns. Conceive and execute on a wide range of content campaigns to drive education and engagement.  ● Manage the company’s digital marketing platforms, including the company’s website, social media, email marketing etc.  Benefits  ● Flexible working hours  ● Competitive salary.  ● Fun, positive and great learning environment.  We are looking for someone who is a self-starter with a can-do attitude and welcomes the opportunity to roll up their sleeves to get things done and drive results.  About you We hope you’re excited about the position! To make the most of the role, you would have to be: ● A graduate holding a Bachelor’s Degree in Business/ Marketing/ Communications or a degree in a related field ● Comfortable with digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Mailchimp, Hootsuite, Squarespace. ● Proficient with Analytics.  If the above description sounds somewhat like you, we strongly encourage you to apply by sending your resume and cover letter to shiting@kitesense.sg. All applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We look forward to learning more about you!

Are you up for an entrepreneurial challenge? As our first Business Development Rep in our Asia-Pacific team, you make a very serious impact on the growth of ChannelEnginge. Next to chasing leads, you’re also expected to think strategically about creating effective sales funnels. You'll work for the South-East Asia, Australia and New Zealand market.  In this role, you work closely together with our Partner Manager and Account Executive to grow the APAC market for our fast-growing Software as a Software (SaaS) company. We have a proven go-to-market strategy in Europe and a team of 100 ChannelEngineers in Europe, America, Asia, and the Middle East and we have the ambition to grow even more! Therefore we are looking for innovative sales talent that can help us drive our growth even further. Your focus will be on brands and retailers, you will engage and educate cold and warm leads to schedule qualified demos for the Account Executive. Set yourself up for a successful career by learning the necessary fundamentals from an experienced closing team to be a great salesperson, leader, and executive!  Your Challenges You are responsible for top-of-the-funnel customer acquisition by building a robust pipeline of qualified client leads, uncovering new businesses to go after and building relationships with prospective customers You identify potential prospects generated through targeted lists created by self-directed online research, email campaigns, and events Proactively address incoming inquiries and leads generated through online advertising and marketing campaigns You effectively pitch ChannelEngine to key decision makers, leveraging a consultative selling approach, via phone, online meetings and events You will become an expert on industry trends that are relevant to targeted vertical markets, staying up-to-date with technology and news You maintain a steady sales pipeline and report periodically to management  What does ChannelEngine have to offer you? Training: Individual coaching from experienced tech sales professionals A steep learning curve with sales skills development you will profit from the rest of your life! We will help you in recognizing buying signals, applying proven sales techniques, and discovering your own potential pitfalls and opportunities. An interesting industry: We offer the opportunity to start your career in the exciting, fast-growing world of online marketplaces We are a company with ambitious plans and a fast international growth rate. Flexible and entrepreneurial culture: As this is a new role; you'll make a lot of impact from the moment you start You can work flexible hours, according to your own schedule Great colleagues in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia who are very knowledgeable in the e-commerce field Work from our flex office in CBD, and work from home whenever you want Monthly lunch, (online) social activities Growth possibilities into a more international (sales) role  Who are you? You have a commercial growth mindset and want to perform better every day. You show some experience with telephone or online sales; e.g. during an internship, (student) job or via a student committee / board membership You can handle a few no’s before receiving a convincing yes. You are eager to learn and love receiving and giving feedback. You want to become a great salesperson, leader, and executive! Must: you show a proficient level of both English, both in spoken and written form If you have some marketplace experience, you can start on Monday!  Do you like change and innovation? Are you looking for high-energy and driven people to work with and achieve ambitious goals together while having fun? Are you ready to grow with us? Don’t hesitate to send in your application!

description: What's the Role:  We're looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Singapore office, the newest addition to our expanding global presence.  You will learn how to achieve your sales goals while building the most essential skills for a long, successful career in sales and marketing.  What You'll Do: Rapidly learn the essential skills and strategy and be ready to start identifying and contacting new prospects. Use research and lead generation tools to build targeted, accurate lists of strategic contacts Execute sales development best practices with email, phone, and social drips Utilize smart, targeted questions and speak knowledgeably with decisions makers - like VPs of Marketing Evangelize Blueshift and build interest and opportunities with new prospects Partner with your assigned Account Executive to intelligently and strategically develop new opportunities and achieve a successful territory penetration plan Manage meetings on account executive's calendar and log activities in CRM Exceed quota of qualified appointments by 2nd full month  We're looking for someone who has: A minimum 1-3 year of sales experience (1 year of selling in tech or selling to marketing preferred) A fervent focus on solving customer problems/challenges Demonstrated track record of success Over-the-top work ethic and "hustle" Strong written communication, phone, presentation, and interpersonal skills Ability to work in fluid environment that is extremely dynamic; self-starter Fast learner; "student mentality" Strong time management skills Detail oriented with a focus on accuracy of data management Simultaneously and equally humble and self-confident  You might also have experience in one or more of the following: College degree is preferred Naturally interested in technology and marketing  Who we are:  At Blueshift, our vision is to be the global category leader in the SmartHub Customer Data Platform (CDP) space by delivering AI in the hands of the marketer. We believe that every brand will move away from one-way conversations (batch and blast or "one size fits all" type experiences) to two-way conversations with every consumer & we can make it happen. We are a leading SmartHub CDP that empowers consumer brands to leverage their first-party data to deliver one-to-one personalized experiences at scale. Our clients include some of the top brands around the world including Discovery, Udacity, LendingTree and more. We're backed by top tier VCs, have been named to Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 and have been recognized as a "Cool Vendor for AI in Marketing" by Gartner.  Why Work Here! World-class commission plan; uncapped Clearly laid out and communicated career progression and promotion plan Fast career growth and development Work/partner with a world-class sales professionals Represent one of the most exciting movements in the marketing technology space Represent the company as the first point of contact (including working trade shows!) Receive best in class onboarding and long-term training and development; build the skills that will set up your career for a lifetime of success Competitive salary and meaningful equity, including medical insurance Unlimited PTO, and friendly work from home policy  Are you ready to make the SHIFT?

Track record of existing successful project deployments  YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Work with Business team on strategising necessary sales & marketing materials and campaigns Handle prospects and close sales through meetings, presentations and follow ups  Set up meetings with potential clients, partners and listen to their wishes and concerns Prepare and deliver presentations & demonstrations on our hardware/software systems Prepare sales proposals and quotations Constant follow up with leads through calls and emails to ensure project closing Negotiate & Close deals in collaboration with our Business team Propose ideas and strategies for our Business and Marketing teams to assist you in generating leads and closing deals  YOUR CHARACTER: Self-starter, able to research on industry players and outreach to them Thick-skinned, without any fear of making cold calls or knocking on doors Competitive and aggressive sales nature Professional attitude and appearance Strong understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques Fast learner and great passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Aptitude in delivering attractive presentations  BENEFITS: Negotiable compensation and commission Significant career growth opportunities- we award equity to core members of our team Opportunity for expansion globally- we already have existing global clients (although our current focus for these 2 years would still be Singapore due to travel and logistics issues caused by COVID)

Who we are: At Mitto, we’re on a mission to deliver reliable, high-quality communications between businesses and their customers, every time.   Our company was founded in 2013 with the specific aim of building a state-of-the-art Application-to-Person (A2P) SMS messaging platform, unrivalled in reliability, that could support the requirements of a new wave of A2P services. As the demand grew for enablement of omnichannel communications capabilities, we expanded our portfolio beyond SMS to now include voice, chat bots, all major chat apps (WhatsApp, Viber, Facebook Messenger, etc.), Google Business Messaging, RCS, myriad CRM and marketing platform integrations and, most recently, pre-built tools for bulk campaigns and conversational support chats.  Simply put, we make communication happen… and you can help.  We are looking for an ambitious and sales-driven Business Development Executive located in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore to work on identifying, opening, and growing new accounts in the telecoms, Internet, and mobile app markets across the region.  What you’ll do:  Be responsible for sales and closing of the new business opportunities in the region. Manage clients located in the APAC region and be responsible for their growth. Contribute by helping with a relationship with Mitto´s key accounts in the region Identify prospects, build pipelines, and close deals ensuring long-term revenue plans. Work together with the operations team to deploy the service offered to the client and manage the account according to the Mitto team strategy. Prioritise and deliver a superior customer experience to strategic customers in the region. Participate in answering global clients RFP for cloud telecommunications support. Continuously work with the client to identify needs and propose solutions making an impact on the Mitto product roadmap  You need to bring with you: University degree or equivalent practical experience. Fluent in English. Ability to work under pressure and quickly grasp a good understanding of trends driving innovation in technology, specifically in mobile, cloud and consumer areas. Willingness to work with an international team. Experience in building strong relationships with decision-makers. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent customer service skills with a customer-driven focus and the ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment. Ability to work cross-functionally both internally and externally to execute deals. Self-motivated with a passion for sales and the ability to thrive in a results-driven environment 3+ years of B2B sales experience in the mobile solutions sector (SMS, Voice, and similar)  What we offer: A fast-paced, start-up like environment where every team member makes a direct impact on our collective success Resources and leadership to help grow your skills and advance your career Collaboration with talented individuals in various locations throughout the world Access to cutting-edge technology and its application across global markets with leading brands Competitive benefits to ensure your health, wellness, and happiness so you can enjoy the full experience of life at Mitto. Freedom to work remotely from anywhere in the APAC region
