description: As part of the Customer Business Development team, you will help deliver retail sales target, optimize customer profits, manage inventory holdings to a mutually agreed target, and develop channel trade plans with customer to ensure timely execution of trade plans of the online boutique/s of the brand/s you manage. Equipped with enthusiasm and skill, you will be primarily responsible to:  Strategic account planning, leveraging our product and service capabilities, driving profitable business growth; Set sales growth targets with clients and ensure end-to-end account profitability and growth of key accounts assigned; Maintain as the main point of communication contact between clients and the various internal departments, in support of client’s specific e-commerce business needs, which includes channel distribution, creative and content creation, marketing support, other IT services related to e-commerce store management or website management; Daily management planning of inventory for both consignment and outright-purchase stocks, maximizing sales, while leveraging on e-marketplace campaigns and brand’s marketing, promotional campaigns, while minimizing stock-out and excess stockholding risk; Regular business reviews with key clients to ensure that key performance indicators are met and strategize to improve KPIs; Regularly present or consult with senior level management on business trends with a view to developing new services or introduction of new products or product categories; and Use knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and promote company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators to potential new clients  Synagie believes that you are a good fit for this role, if you: With at least diploma/bachelor’s degree in any discipline; With at least 2 years of relevant working experience; Keen to work in e-commerce Have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong commercial acumen; Possess good communication skills and able to work in a fast paced but nurturing environment; Hardworking with positive attitude; Are a team player   About Synagie Synagie is an eCommerce company that provides end-to-end commerce enablement solutions to businesses selling online and offline. Our mission is to simplify commerce and make it easier for brands and businesses to sell online. Established in 2014, our clients include some of the world’s leading MNCs in the consumer goods sector and SMEs who are looking to simplify the complex commerce process.  Why Choose to join Synagie:   The vision. Synagie wants to be the best. We thrive on innovation. We are competitive, but we compete only with ourselves. The feeling of working on something that will only get bigger and better is unparalleled.  The culture. We have and startup culture and everyone has a voice. We promote an environment of open discussions and we treat each other as a family.  The people. We have such an incredible and diverse mix of people from all walks of life. You will work with the smartest, warmest, and most talented people in this industry. Working with such remarkable professionals makes one beam with pride.  The expertise. The main thrust of Synagie is continuous improvement of talent through mentoring, testing & learning, and training. We make sure you grow where you want to. With us, you will be able to learn so much about products, processes and providing excellent customer experience - all of which may pave future opportunities to manage the company’s business while chartering the next chapter of Synagie’s growth and a lot more!  The E-Commerce. Be in the thick of the E-Commerce action where we work with FMCG and Prestige Beauty brands as well as Channel partners to drive business growth, consumers' penetration and enhance shopping journey.

description: We are looking for a Sales Associate to join us at our Cartier ION boutique to be a star player to the team and effectively contribute to the success of our brand. In a global environment that is hungry for innovation in the use and storage of energy, Tritium leads the way in the design, manufacture, and distribution of fast-charging infrastructure for electric vehicles.   The Sales Coordinator will be based in Singapore and report to Regional Vice President, APAC and Middle East. The sales coordinator will provide vital support to the front-end sales team. For example, handling critical back-office sales tasks, such as SalesForce administration, order processing, customer complaints and resolution, sales lead management and communication, delivery schedule management for internal and external.  You You are naturally an upbeat, positive person who is eager to learn as well as being customer-focused. Highly organized, with excellent attention to detail, you can work in a fast-paced environment and adhere to strict deadlines. You will also have the following skills and abilities:   The ability to multitask without losing the quality of work A dedicated team player  Ability to work under strict deadlines You thrive in an ever-changing environment. You love to keep busy and are always looking to find a way to help out Ability to work autonomously, within a team but not afraid to communicate your needs Strategic thinker with a solutions mindset  Role We require someone who can come in and make an impact, generate leads, and build up our brand awareness. Proposals – prepare proposals for given opportunities  Order processing – ensure sales order from conformity  Customers complain, and resolution – capture customer, complain and coordinate internally for an effective resolution  Sales lead management and communication – lead response and follow up  Delivery schedule management – ensure timely status updates and coordinate on-time delivery to all customers  Strategic presentation – ability to develop PowerPoint presentations   Qualifications & Competencies Degree/Diploma in Business Administration  5-10 years of proven work experience as a sales team administrator, proposals, and/or back-office sales support function Experienced with CRM software and M.S. Office. Ability to develop an executive-level strategic presentation based on market research and database.   Reward This is an incredible opportunity to join a thriving business that is just getting started. It is fast-paced, and Tritium is kicking some major goals within the industry and its sector. Offering competitive salaries and plenty of growth opportunities, joining is a no brainer.  Tritium is an equal opportunity employer. Therefore, we will not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender expression, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status.

description: We are looking for an Account Executive for Zoom Phone with the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive and track record of success in Sales. This position involves working with existing and new customers to provide them Cloud PBX services that meet their telephony and video needs. This position will be focussed on the Asean region.  Responsibilities Meet or exceed sales and product objectives Develop a strong understanding of key product differentiators, sales methodologies and processes Be an innovator that will help our global company discover new ways to sell our service and drive new business initiatives Partner with Account Executives to upsell current customers and assist in closing potential customers Conduct high-level conversations with C-Level and VP -Level Executives to address business needs Work closely with internal teams to drive customer feedback and improve product Utilize Salesforce CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates Work strategically with management to deliver forecasts, identify trending opportunities/challenges, and provide recommended solutions Requirements 7+ years of Account Executive experience at a technology company Direct Cloud PBX Product selling experience, required Direct CUCM, UCaaS, and SaaS selling experience, strongly preferred Experience selling in the Small Medium Business (SMB) and Commercial segments A proven track record of closed sales, client satisfaction, & team work Skilled in conducting presentations, online web demos, adhering and adopting a measured sales process Demonstrated ability to accurately manage a multi-channel pipeline and forecast in Salesforce.com Must have strong verbal skills with consultative professional business acumen Must be detail oriented, organized, ethical, responsible, & self-motivated Salesforce CRM experience preferred BA/ BS or equivalent experience Native/Fluent Asean language skills would be a plus (Bahasa, Cantonese, Mandarin) Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Zoom’s values. You’ll be the first point of contact for your customers, as you get them excited, handle objections, and move them through the sales pipeline. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a growing sales team and develop your selling skills! Your Role You will have the opportunity to work, collaborate and grow across a wide array of projects, including: Prospecting and generating leads Collaborating closely with our clients to develop strategies for target employers, prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Starting and establishing exciting new relationships, opportunities, and meetings with prospective customers Qualifying new opportunities and handling complex objections Creating significant outbound activity via prospecting, targeted cold-calling and emailing Always improving your approach by using data-driven solutions to track your results Meeting - and exceeding! - your weekly quota to help hit your own growth objectives Your Experience Energetic and self-motivated with the ability to work independently within a collaborative team environment Highly dependable with excellent time management skills You’re personable, professional and genuine Willing and coachable.  You’re open to new ideas and trying things out to see what works and what doesn’t.

description: Purpose  Reporting to the Sr. Vice President of Global Business Development, this position will oversee an Asian business development team of approximately 10 segment-oriented, Business Development Managers, and drive growth through building and mentoring a high-performance team. This leader will be tasked with creating a culture and infrastructure required for accelerated growth and value creation both strategically and tactically.  Key Accountabilities Scale and oversee the APAC BDM organization; Establish and define processes and standards and implement the necessary sales performance metrics in order to focus and accelerate the team’s ability to maximize market growth potential. Oversee the establishment of continuously improving sales processes and methodologies that will drive a robust stream of qualified new leads and the development of high-level relationships with targeted end users that will drive our future order backlog. Recruit, train, and mentor a high performing organization with a clear focus on accelerating company growth and performance. Manage, and develop an effective BDM team that scales with the business; create an effective onboarding process that accelerates the productivity of new team members. Identify and execute on effective marketing and lead development initiatives that will feed a funnel of new business leads for the PDM team to develop. In cooperation with the BDM, Develop and foster key customer relationships, and drive a mindset and processes that customer service. Maintains knowledge of AS/RS trends, by proactively searching for relevant knowledge and information, i.e., market analyses, industry trends, competition, customers segments, etc. Develops and implements a sales action plan with objectives and strategies to increase revenue and aggressively acquire new accounts. Develops, implements, and maintains procedures and programs that enhance the efficiency of the business development team. Attends conventions, conferences, and trade shows as needed; prepares post-event reports and analysis. Performs other related duties as assigned by management. Candidate Profile  The ideal candidate will be an entrepreneurial sales leader with experience in robotics, warehouse automation, industrial automation and/or related sectors. She/he will bring a proven track record of driving aggressive growth at a high velocity, NBA customer facing sales executive capable of building and elevating a team to outstanding levels of commercial performance, new business development and client servicing to ensure long-lasting relationships. She/he will be able to collaborate with key stakeholders both internally and externally. Furthermore, this leader will bring a commercial mindset with the ability to communicate across functions, regions and cultures. Importantly, the successful candidate will fit seamlessly into a transparent, pragmatic, and non-hierarchical management style, all the while with a solutions-oriented mindset.  The Ideal Candidate Will Possess The Following Qualifications 5+years’ experience successfully leading a business development organization during a period of substantial growth. Demonstrated success building and leading a process oriented, metrics driven, fast paced commercial organization. A proven “market-maker” with direct experience in building a sales and go-to-market playbook to support a process driven, disciplined, scalable growth model while managing flawless operational execution. Demonstrated accomplishments in organizational development, team building, mentoring, general leadership and revenue growth strategy development. Proven ability to motivate, influence and lead by example. A track record of building lasting relationships with the executive suite of key end users and integration partners. Demonstrated ability to innovate and encourage others to actively collaborate across a global organization and to look for new an unconventional solution to the business challenges we face. Flexible and comfortable dealing with a high degree of ambiguity and able to adapt rapidly as the business evolves Is a highly collaborative executive who leads by example and is able to generate respect and loyalty from peers, superiors, and subordinates. Emotionally intelligent, resilient and mature. Enjoys rising to new challenges and can handle multiple priorities simultaneously. Effective at creating consensus around strategic initiatives utilizing a collaborative, inclusive and engaging decision-making process. Competencies Results Orientation – the ideal candidate will have demonstrated the ability to consistently deliver outstanding operating and financial results. S/he will have introduced substantive improvements to processes, operations, or practices through a large portion of his or her business career. The candidate will also have created new approaches to existing problems that have had significant impact on his or her business. And will have implemented world class and leading-edge performance standards and processes. Team leadership – will earn respect and followership by virtue of “leading by example”, technical knowledge and demonstrated “roll up your sleeves” approach to working. This leader will have a strong track record as a people manager including team leadership and talent development. She/he will spend significant time with employees in the field and will routinely solicit ideas, suggestions, and help in order to arrive add a better solution while reinforcing the value of the group. Possessing strong communication skills, this individual will empower people and groups to take risks while measuring their performance and holding them accountable for results. They will routinely provide specific behavioral feedback and mentoring to encourage professional development of those on the team. Commercial Orientation – the successful candidate will have a strategic mindset and will look at business challenges and opportunities in a holistic way. She/he will understand how to integrate market information and competitive trends, organizational state, and other issues into a coherent vision for change and growth and link this vision into a series of initiatives and priorities that are compelling and logical. Possessing a highly customer centric outlook, they will pay a special attention to the interests of the customer and will identify and develop best practices for working with or adding value to a customer’s business while maintaining a balance with the needs of the business. Collaborating/influencing - the ideal candidate will put broad business objectives before personal objectives and will be a team player with an open management style. They will have a personal style that is viewed as low ego, open minded, and collaborative. While this individual will be encouraged to take bold actions needed to grow the business, the successful candidate will have a natural tendency to seek input and buy-in from key stakeholders across the team. Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.

jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Regional Market Sales & Management (Asia)
description: Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.   You will be an Assistant Manager in our Business Development (BD) team, responsible for the management and growth of key markets (Asia). In this role, you will be expected to work closely with in-country partners to drive Secretlab sales on marketplace platforms and identify new opportunities to grow in-country Secretlab brand equity in non-english speaking markets. This role reports to the Regional Market Management & Development Manager.   Our Business Development team is involved with all Secretlab’s D2C growth for non-English speaking markets, including collaborative efforts with world-renowned brands such as Game of Thrones, Batman, Cloud9, Team Secret, as well as international esports organisers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.    Your key responsibilities (but not limited to): • Be the key driver of sales and increased customer lifetime value (CLV) for the assigned markets through various means including (but not limited to): Sales planning, Joint Business Planning (JBP) discussions, and negotiations Plan & implement data-backed campaign mechanics to drive year-round sales performance Manage in-country local partners to execute market strategy Activate marketplace tools to increase user engagement, store followers, feed, chat, etc., to drive repeat purchase and higher cart check-out value. Gain favorable year-round exposure for marketplace & Mall stores across markets, especially for product launches, high-key, and tactical sales campaigns Research and recommend marketplace sales investment (e.g. paid media/ ad spend, sponsorships, giveaways etc.) based on projected sales returns and other KPIs  • Become a subject matter expert for the assigned markets, in the areas of: Local market sentiment, buyer demographics, and buy behavior Key competitors’ in-country strategy, business models, sales performance, pin-to-pin analysis SKU assortment based on market demand, especially for Special Edition chairs Market trends, consumer interests/ sentiment toward our relevant industries, including but not limited to gaming, esports, and pop-culture. Support internal marketing and in-country teams in the research, planning and execution of key launches and brand campaigns  • Manage seller centre operations for markets with Amazon as the main point of sales  • Collaborate with the wider Secretlab organization to manage end-to-end in-market operations (e.g. Marketing, Product, Customer Service and Finance)  • Identify new opportunities to grow Secretlab’s online & offline presence outside of key points of sales, for example, brand collaborations, bank partnerships, etc.  • Assist the Regional Market Manager in the planning and executing of new market entries.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business, marketing • At least 3 years’ sales experience in an e-commerce environment (Brand and/or marketplace)  • Strong working knowledge of seller centre operations for marketplaces including but not limited to Lazada, Shopee, Tokopedia, Amazon (good-to-have) • Strong ability to analyze, interpret and extract trends from data • Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills • Able to work in a fast-paced environment, while managing multiple projects.  Bonuses: • Additional language capabilities beyond English, preferred language(s): Thai, Japanese, Bahasa Indonesia, Tagalog (for localization of marketing content in Thailand, Japan, Indonesia, or Philippines). • Passion for and knowledge of the gaming & esports industries • Strong understanding of consumer psychology • Experience in working with multiple markets, preferably, non-English speaking.    For more details on this position and other opportunities, please refer to our careers page

In addition, a dynamic personality with a drive to reach decision makers is highly desirable! Strong communication and objection handling skills Sales experience in an IT software or solutions sales environment Proven sales track record Ability to develop sales strategy and identify key prospects Pipeline management and experience (Salesforce.com) Fluency in English is a must, additional ASEAN language is highly preferred (Bahasa Indonesia)

Finacle is the industry-leading digital banking solution suite from EdgeVerve Systems, a wholly owned product subsidiary of Infosys. Finacle helps traditional and emerging financial institutions drive truly digital transformation to achieve frictionless customer experiences, larger ecosystem play, insights–driven interactions and ubiquitous automation. Today, banks in over 100 countries rely on Finacle to service more than a billion consumers and 1.3 billion accounts.  Finacle solutions address the core banking, omnichannel banking, payments, treasury, origination, liquidity management, Islamic banking, wealth management, analytics, artificial intelligence, and blockchain requirements of financial institutions to drive business excellence. An assessment of the top 1250 banks in the world reveals that institutions powered by the Finacle Core Banking solution, on average, enjoy 7.2% points lower costs-to-income ratio than others. To know more, visit www.finacle.com  Responsibilities/Requirement  Master/Degree/Diploma in Business Management  At least eight years of prior relevant work experience in performing competitor analysis for the segment of account, client introduction, provide analysis and ground intelligence, prepare customer maps of named customers, support in contract negotiations, to identify right contacts in the client organizations and to inform about customer complaints on project delivery with the objective of leveraging first-hand experience against competitors, demonstrating business value to the client, growing accounts and minimizing revenue leakage WITHIN the boundaries of company policies and guidelines.              Knowledge of basics of outsourcing, cost & revenue drivers for an IT Software Products organization,  Should have excellent communication and analytical skills. The ability to display initiative and work in an unstructured environment is a must.  Prior sales and account management experience in BFSI vertical for an International Application Software company is a MUST  The role involves hunting for new logos as well as farming existing BFSI accounts of Infosys Finacle in the assigned territory. We are looking for success-oriented people who have proven track record and understanding of processes, solutions in the Financial Services area  Candidates with established market network in BFSI and a proven track record of closing Enterprise Application Software deals in South East Asia will be preferred.  Relevant Solution/Experience areas in Core Banking (Retail Banking/ Corporate Banking) , Digital Banking, Payments or Wealth Management  What will you do? Market Development Customer Prospecting Opportunity Identification & Qualification Proposal Development Proposal Negotiation & Closure Contracting & MSA Account Planning & Review Account Mining Account Operations Relationship Management Merger & Acquisition

With the Covid situation still ongoing in many countries, and many companies down-sizing or closing down, our client has done the opposite! Right now, we’re looking to expand on a couple of key projects, and are looking for new additions to the team!  Our Team Values:     •  Fun Loving: We are very serious about work and our goals, but beneath our professional exterior, we are really a bunch of people who love to have fun.      •  Resilient: We are a team of hard-working individuals that strive to get the job done in the best possible manner. Being open to changes & having the courage to step out of your comfort zone  What We Offer:     •  1 to 1 coaching     •  No experience required     •  Fun and enjoyable work environment     •  Traveling opportunities     •  Fast career progression & personal development

Job Description  Business Development Representative- Thai Speaking-for business generation in Thailand  Are you looking for a chance to continue and grow your Sales career in the tech industry?  Zendesk is the world’s leading Customer Support Platform and we are fast-growing quickly with a suite of products our customers love! We are looking for hardworking individuals - Our growth builds more opportunities to progress faster. We want to develop and support you in your career. You will be a key team member of the sales team, driving new business and delivering on the strategy for your region-Thailand. Run a busy outbound pipeline of leads and provide top class customer experience Use innovative prospecting cold accounts Generate high-value pipeline through both strategic and targeted prospecting into start-ups and unicorn, or enterprise businesses Show creativity that will flourish naturally in a Zen environment, actively source new leads through the use of social tools. We want your brains! Just not literally Be motivated to overachieve on daily, weekly, and monthly targets and metrics Be the face of the brand, 100% focussed on building an outstanding customer experience You Have Business Development experience within the Enterprise and Commercial segment, particularly managing prospects from Thailand Passion to kick-start or continue a career in consultative sales A minimum of 2 year of experience in a Sales related environment Solid business experience (SaaS sales preferred), curious, and customer-centric A “Can Do” / “Winner” attitude, with a hunger and 'self-starter' commitment to overachieve and succeed Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Thai for business communications in Thailand. Bachelor's degree is preferable. About Zendesk - Champions Of Customer Service  Zendesk started the customer experience revolution in 2007 by enabling any business around the world to take their customer service online. Today, Zendesk is the champion of great service everywhere for everyone, and powers billions of conversations, connecting more than 100,000 logos with hundreds of millions of customers over telephony, chat, email, messaging, social channels, communities, review sites and help centers. Zendesk products are built with love to be loved. The company was conceived in Copenhagen, Denmark, built and grown in California, taken public in New York City, and today employs more than 4,000 people across the world. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.  We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations.  Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.  Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to benefits@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.  By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Responsibilities Meet and exceed sales targets Successfully create business from new and existing customer accounts Manage complex negotiations with senior-level executives Build rapport and establish long term relationships with customers  Qualifications Have at least 2 years' quota carrying sales experience Strong written and verbal communication skills

Scandit is currently expanding our business development organization in Tokyo, London and Boston. You will focus on our target accounts in a region and vertical. You will play a key role in generating new business opportunities by offering Scandit's disruptive computer vision, augmented reality and machine learning solutions to enterprise and mid-sized customers.  Come join Scandit where you will enjoy success, develop your professional skills and allow your career to thrive within a fast growing entrepreneurial environment. We are looking for English and Korean speakers to join this expanding global team.  What You Will Do  Generate pre sale opportunities through targeted outreach via phone, email, social and others. Research named accounts based on quarterly performance, organisational challenges, executive personnel changes, market conditions, and existing technology. Orchestrate discussions with senior executives around their business needs Set up meetings and demos for Account Executives Maintain lead, account, contact, and opportunity data across multiple CRM platforms. Keep detailed and accurate notes of all sales related activities Work closely with the Account Executives by country and/or vertical.  Who You Are  You have between 0-18 months of experience in SaaS sales. (8+ months preferred) You have some experience in retail, transport & logistics, manufacturing or healthcare. You have a strong desire to learn and succeed in technology/software sales You have the ability to excel in an environment with multiple competing responsibilities. You have excellent interpersonal, written, and spoken communication skills You have energy, enthusiasm, commitment to detail and results oriented. You have the ability to think on your feet and display good judgement. You have native level fluency in English and Korean and other languages are an advantage.  Who We Are  Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones, and robots.  Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation and logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.  Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.  “Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.  At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.  All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

description: Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-driven global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world.  As the leader in the Employer of Record industry, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries.  With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done.  Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing!  About The Position  As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.  What You Will Do  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle, reaching out and follow-up on both incoming and self-generated leads, proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the phone, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners. Your responsibilities include: Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc. Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc. Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive Maintain high quality data in Salesforce What We Are Looking For  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in the role, we look for the following: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline 2-4 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and selling to C-Level Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus, is a plus Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies is a plus International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a startup environment, an advantage Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal, with excellent English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships About Globalization Partners  Hire anyone, anywhere, quickly and easily.  Globalization Partners AI- driven, automated, fully compliant global Employer of Record platform technology is transforming how companies hire talent around the globe. Our industry-leading proprietary technology simplifies onboarding and managing employees anywhere in the world.  With easy-to-use dashboards and a mobile-ready payroll authorization system, our customers can safely and securely access crucial HR documents and authorize and approve global payroll faster than ever.  Globalization Partners: Breaking Down Barriers for Everyone, Everywhere
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Employment Hero is one of Australia's fastest-growing tech companies. Our world-class software is the easiest way for small to medium-sized businesses to manage HR, payroll, employee engagement, and benefits. Having expanded globally in late 2020 we will continue to grow rapidly in 2021 and beyond.  We believe in distributed employment and take a ‘Remote First' approach with our team. We don't mind where in Singapore you're based, if you've got the skills for the role and the passion for our mission then we want to hear from you.  This position, based in Singapore, is a newly created role. Although working remotely, you'll be part of an engaged, high-performing and driven sales team of 50.  This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded. Uncapped Commission structure - OTE of $180k +  Want to know more about this role? Check out our hiring video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=elkXiSlEJjA  Employment Hero celebrates diverse perspectives and experiences, we invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.  Responsibilities This role is best suited to an experienced and self motivated Business Development Manager / Account Executive with an engaging personality and strong work ethic. You will be selling to SMEs (businesses with 10 - 120 employees) and speaking to business owners and C-Level Executives. Similar experience in this capacity, especially within a SaaS environment, would be well regarded. Your ability to learn quickly, take initiative and embrace technology will see you succeed. This is a high volume role, so a proven record in managing a large pipeline with a fast paced sales cycle will be highly beneficial. You will utilise warm leads from the marketing team and outbound SDR team to pitch, demo, present, and win new business. Lead generation has a hybrid model with a 70/30 split between your calendar already filled from our energetic SDRs and self-generated opportunities through cold calling, prospecting, networking and developing strategic partnerships.  Requirements 2+ years' experience in a B2B sales role (performing the full sales cycle) SaaS industry experience Experience selling to C-Level Executives and stakeholders within the SMB market Experience managing a high volume of opportunities and a fast sales cycle Proven sales track record Exposure to the Human Resources and/or payroll industry would be advantageous, but is not required Training in sales techniques including Challenger, SPIN, or consultative selling would be an added bonus!  Benefits Uncapped commission (OTE $180k +) Work from home Self, health, wealth and happiness programs Remote-first and flexible working arrangements A generous budget to spend on setting up your home office (if you need a desk, chair, screen? You name it!) We set you up for success with the latest and greatest hardware, tools and tech Virtual yoga classes Weekly virtual happy-hour and social events to get to know your new colleagues Quarterly & yearly team celebrations  Why join Employment Hero? description: Hire Digital is looking for an analytical and effective Business Development Director, Enterprise who is adept at driving key account revenue and growing our consultative sales. The Business Development Director, Enterprise will be responsible for owning the target accounts pipeline and driving our client acquisition programs, analyzing client acquisition metrics, and working with adjacent teams to develop strategies and campaigns to enhance client acquisition.  This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.  Responsibilities: Build a client acquisition pipeline, ranging from Fortune 500 companies to mature growth companies, as well as nurture and close client deals. Lead the day to day execution of consulting with clients and developing client engagement plans for key target accounts, advising them to utilize our talent network and build on demand teams. Develop a tailored plan to address current needs and create a roadmap for future growth opportunities. Analyze results, propose new strategies and implement them. Set up tools and applications required for the role and conduct new programs to optimize results. Train Business Development Representatives specialized in key channels to take on successful experiments and optimize them for performance.  Requirements: 5+ years of enterprise sales and account management experience in a reputed company. Proven record of high performance and outstanding achievements in past positions. Strong understanding of the digital transformation needs and challenges faced by clients in industries such as financial services, high-tech, telecommunications, manufacturing, energy, retail, pharmaceuticals, or travel and logistics. Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively. Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills.  About Hire Digital  Hire Digital is a freelance network of top talents in digital marketing, web development, and design. Our clients work with high-performing teams as well as individual talents who have gone through a rigorous screening process. Clients such as Shopify, Expedia, and Stripe have access to high-performing talents on-demand, with guaranteed performance.  Powered by JazzHR  B0zPhe7aIg

description: Description  Singapore based: The Regional Sales Operations role is responsible for the sales operations function within its regional location with Asia-Pacific. Sales operations is a set of business activities and processes that help a sales organization run effectively, efficiently and in support of business strategies and objectives.  Your Opportunity  This business function supports the company's End User Sales and Partner Manager teams works closely with the APAC Sales Operation handling Quote to cash on every opportunities, Deal desk functions and providing meaningful reports to business.  This role requires knowledge and experience in providing analytical reports, Deal desk function, Sales Force application and managing licensing.  The roles main objective is to bring and maintain a system to selling that supports and positively influence the organization behavior of the teams involved in the sales function. In true Blue Prism way this is expected to be achieved through collaboration, teamwork and constant support from teams such as Sales, Finance, Sales enablement and Business development etc. As a member of the APAC Sales Operation team, this role will be constantly supported by peers to learn new skills as the business grows.  Blue Prism is an exciting, fast-paced organization which is growing at an exponential rate with plans to continue this expansion. AS well as being the support of the sales function the key function of this role is collaboration. Therefore, the role requires an energetic and enthusiastic individual, who can embrace fast change with excellent but diplomatic communication skills. Highly organized with good Excel and knowledge and preferably experience of a CRM system and enjoys the reward of their role having direct impact on the success of the company in the region.  Requirements Experience of working in a busy sales environment (Sales Operations/Sales Administration) Administration around the Purchase Orders Process Sound understanding of organisational behaviour and culture. Experience in process design and documentation Experience of using a CRM database and finance system. Event Management experience an advantage. Good Excel knowledge Attributes Self-motivated, self-sufficient and results orientated. Proactive, reliable, enthusiastic Strong communicator with excellent relationship building skills who has tenacity, ability to influence whilst being diplomatic. Multitasker, juggling multiple projects all of which could have tight deadlines. Creative in problem solving and solution finding. High energy and shows passion and commitment. Credible and have gravitas to deal with C-Suite. Team player Capable to work with lots of different personalities. Additional Information The role is home based although travel may be required to regional offices and some wider travel will be needed from time to time. Some meeting attendance will be required outside of local time zone. This is to be monitored to stay in line with best practise work/life balance expectations. Opportunity to advance and progress within the organisation as the company continues to grow. Benefits Employee Share Scheme 25 days Paid time off Flexible working hours Remote working Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.

description: Job Description  Job Description  Cvent has been a leader in providing cloud based (SAAS) solutions to Fortune 500 and dominating the industry from many decades now. The growth of Cvent has been at its peak and this is owning to the talented Sales Team at Cvent .  Cvent has also won “Premier Sales Employer Award” annually across two consecutive years. We are hiring Sales Champions to support Events Cloud division in our mid-market team.  Our dynamic and entrepreneurial sales department taps into a booming $565 billion dollar market, both growing and nurturing business every day. Team members provide prospects a consultative sales approach, extensive product knowledge, and high-energy professionalism to demonstrate the value-add Cvent will bring to their respective businesses. We are in a business of selling solutions and alleviating pain!  What You Will Be Doing Owning the full sales cycle from lead generation to close, demonstrating Cvent solutions, advancing the sales cycle, and negotiating/closing deals. Quota carrying for NBB ( New Booked Business ) and team management of Sales Representatives who will be executing the sales funnel effectively and driving the Revenues . Develop and actively pursue list of targeted Key Accounts by creating individual plans of action to penetrate these accounts Accurately forecast sales opportunities in Salesforce.com Monitor and report sales activity within the system Collaborate internally with the Account Management and Client Services teams to ensure complete CSAT (customer satisfaction) . Must Have’s  What You Need for this Position Bachelor’s degree with qualified Sales experience. Relevant 5 + years of prior revenue generating software sales experience. Articulate, organized, detail-oriented, and the ability to multi-task in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment Commercial Sales exposure Knowledge of local territory ( SNG ) Sales acumen with strong industry relationships Good To Have Industry experience in one or more of the following areas is highly preferred: SaaS, mobile apps, and analytics Strong business acumen, ethics and high integrity Sales experience in hiring within APAC – MEA

description: Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2’s Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider’s co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  So… you’re wondering what is this role about?  To be honest, we are not looking for an Inside Sales Specialist, that’s merely a title. What we are looking for is Hunger! For people who are hungry to go out a play in the major leagues even though they have no name, to sit down and drive results that create an impact, and to go out of their way to get things done when it matters most. We’re looking for freshers who possess the energy, the passion, the drive, but most importantly, the desire to prove themselves and create an impact.  The Sales Development Specialist is a role that can be considered the backbone of sales at Insider. A crucial part of this role is to identify and reach out to prospective sales opportunities. This is where our ‘growth’ begins.  We also realize that most Job Descriptions almost always sound like the description of an A-380 but when you’ve arrived at the airport what you find is a Cessna twin-seater!  We want to write a JD that’s realistic and as close to the real thing as possible.  How can we do this? So, we thought about it and realized that the best JD for this role is one that comes from the insights of other Business Development Specialists.  Day in and day out a Sales Development Representative in Insider Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails; Understand customer needs and requirements; Research accounts, identify key players, and generate interest; Ability to multitask and manage time effectively; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Maintain and expand your database of prospects within your assigned duty; What we expect from you; New Graduates are highly encouraged; University degree in related fields; Inside sales experience is a plus; Good exposure to the e-commerce society will be an advantage; Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Should be creative about researching markets, identifying key players, and generating lead; You’re a natural around the phone and dialing dozens of numbers a day is a piece of cake for you; Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly in a fast-paced, start-up environment; Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills; Preferably digital marketing related experience in a customer-oriented position; While we are conquering the world, we are offering you: The chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment. The chance to become a Shareowner with the "Shareowner System" that we offer to all Insiders who meet certain criteria. Healthy lunches, dinners, and afternoon snacks. Upgrade, improve and challenge yourself with the many soft skills trainings that we offer. You’ll have access to Udemy’s business plan and Masterclass, where you can choose over 10,000 courses to satisfy your hunger for knowledge. You’ll have space to share your skills and even deliver trainings and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring! We’ll provide you with a paid Spotify account subscription, how do you fancy working to the beats of your favorite audio while blocking out the rest of the world? You’ll be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences. Still not sure? Just ask Google. No Dress Code! Occasional TGIF happy hours! We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!

jobTitle: Head of Business Development and Sales, Esports
description: As the Head of BD and Sales, Esports, you will drive new business opportunities with strategic partners and brand partners across our owned and operated esports properties in Southeast Asia and Globally . You will build valuable alliances and drive incremental revenue across esports, and co-marketing opportunities. As a member of the SEA leadership team, you will drive cohesion across our markets and act as a sounding board for all markets into the efficacy and potential of new business opportunities for MOONTON Esports.  Responsibilities Based in Singapore, you will join an internationally and culturally diverse team of professionals that share our goal of reinforcing and building on MOONTON Esports our market position and growth:  Lead a team of Business Development and Partnership Management professionals to achieve both MOONTON and partner objectives Drive the commercial and sponsorship sales funnel and pipeline, including sourcing new business, negotiating terms, executing contracts, and overseeing fulfillment of obligations. Produce MOONTON Esports regional and global sponsorship marketing and sales proposals and subsequent go-to-market strategies Collaborate across esports teams to identify new business opportunities, technologies, and assets to build unique and valuable opportunities for partner integration Identify opportunities to bundle MOONTON Esports properties together for higher impact Oversee partnership management across both sports, ensuring S-tier collaboration with partners and industry-leading activations Maintain a deep and current understanding of esports, sports and entertainment industries  Required Qualifications 6-8+ years of experience in partnerships or business development, successfully structuring, negotiating and closing deals and owning projects from inception through launch and ongoing execution You have experience working with partners, both internal and external, at all levels You have experience leading a team Have an existing extensive network of brands and advertisers across SEA Comfortable with ambiguity; you can effectively shift gears quickly and comfortably, decide and act without having the complete picture, and comfortably handle uncertainty  Desired Qualifications Comprehensive understanding of the players in the gaming, esports, technology and entertainment verticals Experience with product development and innovation; not only do you execute sales but you possess the creativity to design new and compelling products to sell Proven experience in partnerships and/or business development in gaming, esports, sports, content distribution, and/or live entertainment Significant contract negotiation and management experience in a wide variety of regional, international and local deal structures Excellent relationship management, communication, and project management capabilities Excellent writing and presentation building skills Track record of successful partnerships and deals with proven KPIs like high renewal rates Command of a relevant language preferred, but not required (Mandarin, Tagalog, Bahasa Malay/Indonesian)

jobTitle: Director of Sales and Business Development APAC
description: COMPANY  Janes enables militaries, governments and defence companies to make critical decisions. Our expert-driven tradecraft, developed over 120 years, combined with human-machine teaming, delivers assured open-source intelligence across military capabilities and order of battle, equipment, events, countries, companies and markets.  Linking millions of assured data points, Janes data model creates a framework of interconnected open-source defence intelligence. This allows our customers to integrate all relevant data and connections into a single intelligence environment to deliver a more complete and accurate answer. Using Janes, our customers can use their scarce resource more effectively, to get to better decisions with higher confidence, more quickly.   JOB PURPOSE  Janes is searching for a Director of Sales & Business Development for the APAC region. This is a key leadership role in developing and executing the Janes business strategy for the APAC region, and will be focused on managing a team of sales and business development executives.   The key mission of the team is to renew existing business with customers and grow revenue through upsells at existing customers and new customer acquisition. The leader will be responsible for providing cross-functional leadership and be able to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.   HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AT JANES  Develop and execute detailed strategy and business plan for retaining and growing Janes APAC business while understanding Janes overall strategic direction. Ensure the team is building and maintaining qualified pipeline of opportunities to hit targeted growth. Develop the sales team’s skills through active coaching, account and opportunity reviews, and participation in customer meetings. Establish consistent account management process to ensure high rate of retention and upsell for current customers. Screen and qualify opportunities to determine probability to win (PWin) and make Bid/No Bid decisions. Direct sales forecasting activities and set performance goals accordingly. Track, measure, and report progress and performance to Janes Senior Leadership team. Continuously analyse market strategies/efforts and pipeline opportunities to  develop strategic partnership relationships Supportive leader to get involved and coach to close/help team close new business.  THE IDEAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE FOR THIS ROLE ARE  Proven successful leadership experience within Sales/Business Development. Previous experience in Defence and/or Intelligence Community either selling to this customer base and/or being employed directly in the community. Strong knowledge of cultural norms across the APAC region.  Ability to coach and guide team on successful strategies to employ for success. Proven ability to work in cross-functional and resource constrained environment. Experience developing, managing, and leading sales and business development teams. Ability to coach and develop talent and create high-performing teams. Passion to succeed and achieve meaningful business results with a strong sense of accountability and ownership; strong organisation, prioritisation, and persuasive communication skills. Strategic thinker balanced with strong attention to detail. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.   For successful candidates, Janes provides a supportive, stretching and dynamic environment with the ability for you to grow rapidly both personally and professionally.   We value diversity at Janes and are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. We welcome applicants regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, race, colour, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation and age.
industries: Information Services

description: Want to be part of the fastest growing startup that is at the intersection of Retail, Fintech and Data?  Qashier is looking for an amazing Sales Coordinator to support our growth!  We are a dynamic and fast growing team that is excited about commerce, retail and payments, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology.  We are looking for a detail-oriented Sales Coordinator to contribute to the achievement of sales targets by supporting sales representatives and coordinating sales activities. The Sales Coordinator main responsibility is to act as a force multiplier to the sales team to improve their productivity. This is an exciting entry level role with a strong mix of sales, administrative and customer service responsibilities.  In short, you’ll be driving Qashier’s success in the following ways: Maximising the productivity of the Sales team by assisting with the generation of quotations/invoices and being the first point of contact with merchants regarding government grant applications and merchant payment account setups. Collaborate closely with Operations and Account Management departments to ensure that merchant onboarding, account setup and order fulfilment are handled accurately and efficiently. Assist with qualifying and nurturing potential leads that may enquire through the company’s sales hotline, emails and messages. Developing and maintaining proper documentation and systems so as to maintain sales records, prepare reports and provide financial information to the Finance department.   What you should bring along 0-1 year of experience in Sales, Business Development or Administration Diploma/Degree in Business Administration or a related field Strong interpersonal skills with good bilingual oral abilities (English and Chinese) A keen attention to detail and customer service oriented Excellent organisational and administrative skills with a strong ability to multitask Passionate about technology, Fintech and the retail space  Why join Qashier? Be at the forefront of a fast-growing startup in an exciting sector. Qashier’s innovative platform combines the latest developments in Cloud technology, Payments and Data to transform the Retail & F&B industries. You’ll play a crucial role on the growth of a revolutionary product that will become a key platform behind successful retail businesses in the region. Amazing growth and learning opportunities. We are a tight knit team where everyone grows together. We’ll continuously work with you to refine your strengths and strengthen your weaknesses to further your personal and career development. Make a strong impact with your work. You’ll be working directly with hundreds of small businesses across the region where the work that you do will make a direct impact to the success of these businesses. Attractive compensation and bonuses  ABOUT QASHIER Qashier (qashier.com) powers SMEs with a technology platform that combines a smart POS terminal and integrated payment acceptance with a diverse app store of both in-house and third party business applications. By pairing technology with a strong commitment to merchant success, Qashier helps retail and F&B businesses increase revenue, streamline operations, and create loyal customers.

description: Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.  With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.  Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further!  Responsibilities Support partners with client requests, handle client sales and onboarding Manage the sales pipeline by following up on leads coming from partners and closing them Communicate with the operational teams to ensure a high standard of service quality and coordination Collaborate with cross functional teams to escalate any issues partners might be experiencing Help us to advance our technical lead by providing input into our software development process Any other ad-hoc responsibilities as required  Requirements Recognized Diploma or Degree in relevant fields, but extensive relevant work experiences would make up for the lack in qualifications Relevant working experience in a similar role and/or industry is a plus Self-motivated and proactive, and able to work meticulously under tight deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills; independent yet be able to contribute in a team Positive attitude and willing to continuously develop and learn You are goal oriented and are driven to succeed and overachieve  Benefits Join a hyper fast growing company Experience the most exciting growth phase of a start-up first-hand – we are on an exponential growth path and providing each individual opportunity to change the way we do things Be on the forefront of development when it comes to accounting best practices Work closely with our tech team to help shape the face of corporate services in the future International environment Competitive remuneration package Flexible working arrangement; working from home Benefits: 18 days annual leave, study leave, cash incentives, medical benefits, etc.  To apply to OSOME, please send your CV, including potential start date and salary expectations.  Thank you for your interest in Osome. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Koble is a young and fast-rising smart home solutions provider.  As our Smart Home Sales Specialist, you will get the unique opportunity to direct the business development of Koble's smart home solution.  Being our smart home sales specialist, you will learn to tailor home automation products according to a homeowner's family needs. Equipped with smart home knowledge, you are the front person communicating to homeowners on how smart home brings unprecedented convenience and comfort to them.  As part of project management, you will be liaising with various stakeholders in the home renovation industry to incorporate smart home solution in a new house.  You will understand how to provide a fuss-free and functional smart home transformation experience and enjoy the fulfilment of giving homeowners unprecedented convenience, comfort, and security.  We are looking for independent, driven and innovative candidates who embrace leadership and are able to articulate effectively.  Be part of a team that transform homes into a fully functional and beneficial smart home! Commitment: Full Time

STEINWAY & SONS offers unique opportunities within our retail sales team for those who possess the desire, passion, and experience to join our organization selling the world’s finest pianos in our showroom at ION Orchard.   The right candidate has a passion for luxury and a love of music and arts. A proven track record in a competitive sales environment combined with past experience in business development and lead generating activities is key. In addition, the candidate must have an outgoing and engaging personality in order to build relationships with clients on many different levels. The ability to play piano is highly preferred as our clients often seek guidance and recommendations during instrument selections.  The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.  This position offers excellent earning potential and full and comprehensive benefits. If you are interested in learning more about becoming part of STEINWAY & SONS, apply now and send us your resume and cover letter.  Responsibilities Build strong customer relationships and generate new leads. Provide excellent customer service and recommend the right instrument that suits customer's requirement Develop new networks such as music teachers/friends of Steinway/VIPs/Steinway Owners database Maintenance and update of CRM database Handle and assist in store events, cross-branding collaborations and marketing initiatives Participate in off-site special events and other related activities outside store operation Inventory management  Qualifications Minimum 1 year of working experience Must have experience in sales, ideally for luxury goods or high-end services Willingness to take a long term view and building relationship with our customers Transport allowance will be provided. Piano playing and music appreciation would be an advantage  Others Overseas training opportunities Career development opportunities Attractive commission and incentives Working hours: 4 weekdays & 1 Weekend Shift: 10.30 a.m. to 7.30 p.m. (1 hour lunch break) OR 12.30 p.m. to 9.30 p.m. (1 hour dinner break)

jobTitle: APAC Senior Channel Strategy & Sales Planning Manager
description: Are you a strategic thinker with strong commercial and project management skills? Come join our customer development team and help us better analyse and plan our sales!  Core Responsibilities  Drive the development, review and governance of the APAC Channel strategy Lead the integrated commercial planning (ICP) process for the APAC Market group together with regional marketing, and in close collaboration with other various stakeholders; and drive the follow-up governance process Enable and govern integration of regional commercial directions into local Business unit (BU) plans and Customer business plans (CBP); successfully coordinate the BU ICP and CBP process to guide the local BU CD leads Regularly review our channel performance, working together with MCD and Business Intelligence (BI) to develop key insights for relevant stakeholders and to input into our strategic priorities Assess the needs of the Sales Department and proactively drive system, process, planning improvements including the necessary skill/capability development. This includes working closely with the global Sales Academy team to ensure relevant delivery of sales training to the APAC sales teams.  Play your part in our team succeeding The APAC Market Group is a diverse and rapidly growing within the LEGO Group, covering 6 Business Units and 12+ countries.  This position is very different from other roles due to the opportunity to have a diverse learning experience across different markets within the area of responsibility (APAC) as well as close interaction with Global teams. It offers in depth understanding of the LEGO Customer Value Proposition and our channel strategy, combining both long term strategic direction aligned to global / regional priorities while also considering local market needs to maintain flexibility and agility. This position provides an opportunity to engage with sales management in various areas (e.g. channel development, customer business planning), regional marketing and the global Market Commercial Development (MCD) and regional marketing to define strategic directions, and shape plans, processes, and initiatives to frame the course for the APAC region. This role provides exposure to holistic problem-solving driven by fact-based insights in collaboration with global, regional and local stakeholders and facilitation of decision-making with senior executives.  Do you have what it takes?  At least a Bachelor’s degree, ideally in business or commercial equivalent 8+ years experience in similar roles in FMCG/CPG company (e.g. sales strategy, sales planning roles) Strong strategic thinking, ability to think conceptually (critical to develop regional/global concepts and strategies such as channel strategy) Strong programme / project management skills with the ability to manage coordinate many stakeholders across multiple functions Proven ability to work cross-functional and cross regional (internally and externally). Proven broad stakeholder management, leadership and project management skills, regional role experience is an advantage Very strong communication skills Strong analytical skills with the ability to effectively analyse, draw insights from and present data Practical Sales experience (Key Account management or similar)  Join the global LEGO® family Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued, and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
