As a Sales Team Lead at Catalyst Marketing, we teach you all the skills required for sales and provide you with the support and guidance needed to grow and lead a team. You don't need anything other than discipline and hard work.  Job Responsibilities Liaise with new and existing clients Grow and lead a team Attend daily workshops for character development  Requirements Well groomed, passionate and enthusiastic Possess good communication skills 18 - 30 years old Fresh grads and ORD personnel welcomed No experience needed  Job Type: Full-time, 6 Days work week  Salary: $2,500 - $3,500 monthly

Unlock Better with TAIGER Everything we do at TAIGER is driven by a common belief that work as we know it can be done better. This is why at TAIGER, we develop hybrid artificial intelligence that understands language and logic, helping enterprises unlock better automation, better insights and ultimately better growth and human fulfilment.  Together with our clients and partners, we are solving challenging tasks in various industries. Tasks that involve billions of dollars of man-hours and infrastructure. Tasks that are thought to be impossible to apply cognitive automation and AI. Today, some of the world’s leading enterprises and government organisations use our technology for complex and high value work like digital non-client onboarding, fraud detection, customer service and engagement amongst others.   Our game-changing work on emerging technologies like Ontologies and Graphs, and Natural Language Technologies is featured on Gartner’s Hype Cycles in 2021. TAIGER is also named as an IDC innovator in AI in 2019, and we are proudly accredited by Singapore’s Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA).  TAIGER is looking for a Sales Manager to join our award winning team.  SALES MANAGER We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to being part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters.  Responsibilities Close business with new and established accounts: building a strong and sustainable business pipeline. Identify key decision makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence. Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities and upselling and cross-selling additional solutions. Solution-sell by mapping business challenges with technology solutions. Able to sell end to end solutions as part of digital transformation inside organisations. Lead generation, qualification and opportunity management to contract closure. Partnership with solution, marketing, business development, product, delivery. Past experience with working with IDP (Intelligent Document Processing) related solutions or AI sector. Forecast and pipeline management using CRM tools (Hubspot).  Requirements Demonstrated sales management with proven track-record of consistently exceeding quotas and performance targets. Strong account management successes in Singapore. Ability to sell new cutting edge technology solutions to clients: out of the box thinking, visioning, educating, consulting skills, customer success, etc. Effective account management skills in upselling solutions and making sure client implementations are successful. Experience developing new sales strategies. Ideal candidate will have strong experience of B2B direct and channel software sales, ideally in AI space. Consultative solution sales - hungry to drive and close business. Ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies. Strong collaboration and communication within departments with like-minded goal of achievement. Attention to detail. Execution excellence in using CRM and managing OKRs/KPIs.  You are right for the team if You have a good eye for business and excellent organisational, analytical, and influencing skills as well as strong business ties in our target region. Apart from being a savvy negotiator with competitive drive and determination, you should also be customer centric with good interpersonal and networking skills. You adapt to change well and are able to tackle complex problems using new and innovation solutions. You have a global mindset working in HQ in Singapore  You possess effective time management skills.  TAIGERs are different.  With a multinational and multicultural team headed by talents drawn from leading global companies, diversity is our strength. TAIGERs come from all walks of life, bringing to every piece of work varied experiences and expertise. Just as every TAIGER is unique, no two days at TAIGER are the same. Through working on diverse projects across geographies, every day is a new opportunity to master our craft and impact the future of work. Here at TAIGER, we share a common question—what else can we unlock better?  *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

description: (Ref No. 31750)  Our client, a notable Japanese multinational company is looking for a Manager - New Business Development, who will be responsible for the formulation and execution of the Healthcare’s new business strategy and mid-term plan, identify new opportunities to unlock business value to their end customers, and business partners and drive business development activities in the Asia Pacific region in liaison with local MDs. Position (Manager) Allowance  What will you be working on Formulate and drive mid-to-long term new business strategies focusing on data services and solutions for the Asia Pacific region including but not limited to Remote Patient Monitoring schemes. Develop and manage a mid-term (3-year) and yearly P&L and investment plan in line with the mid-term strategy which is reviewed and steered every year based on in-depth analysis of the market and business environment (PEST, 3C, SWOT, Value Chain Analysis, Competitor Analysis). What they are looking for Bachelor's Degree/Master's Degree in Business or a similar field. Minimum 7 years of working experience managing large-scale, business transformation and innovations programs/projects. In-depth understanding of sales and commercial practices and processes. Experience in risk management and driving organization-wide process improvement projects. Preferably a candidate with strong technical/technology/medical background.  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Registration No.: R1984607 (Radzi Barian Arlandito) Recruitment License : 12C5051

We are not accepting CVs from recruiters for this role. All direct applications are accepted only through the URL.

description: Company Description  MicroStrategy transforms organizations into intelligent enterprises through data-driven innovation. We match smart people to dynamic projects and technologies that truly challenge their talents. Curious and creative in outlook, our success is built on the talent and energy of smart and driven people. MicroStrategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) is a worldwide leader in enterprise analytics and mobility software. A pioneer in the BI and analytics space, MicroStrategy delivers innovative software that empowers people to make better decisions and transform the way they do business. We provide our enterprise customers with world-class software and expert services so they can deploy unique intelligence applications.  Job Description  The Account Executive is Key Account Manager and Territory Owner who will lead the winning strategy to Go-To-Market, identify opportunities, sell and maintain customer relationships within his/her assigned territory.  This position requires strong leadership to develop and drive successful sales strategy and activities via collaborate with internal departments such as Inside Sales, Sales Engineering, Sales Operations, and Customer Success.  Join an elite team of Sales Professionals that sell Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients!  Your Focus Develop Territory Business Plan and drive successful execution to achieve revenue target and long term business goal. Lead Account Strategy to achieve revenue target and long-term account plan. Work with sales consultants to discover, identify and meet customer requirements. Identify and qualify business opportunities. Sell MicroStrategy Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients . Cover C-suite and present Solution Value Lead Competitive Strategy to win Lead negotiations and overcome objections for deal closure Manage complex sales cycles and multiple engagements simultaneously Prepare accurate sales forecasts and sales cycle reporting Provide project management to ensure the success of the potential or current clients Leverage and enhance partner relationships to drive additional value and revenue Qualifications  Required experience and skills: Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience At least 8 years of professional selling experience in Software and solution sales In-depth understanding the Singapore and Malaysia market Fluent in English is a prerequisite, Mandarin, Cantonese and Malay are preferred. Experience with selling Analytics or Business Intelligence and Software Application Solution preferred. Additional experience with Cloud, Mobile, Big Data, Hadoop, or Social Media optional but preferred Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas Successful experience at new account development (Hunting) and large account management (Farming) Proven prospecting and sales cycle management capability Experience and training in a value-based enterprise sales methodology (Solution Selling, Customer Centric Selling, etc) Ability to track activity in Salesforce High levels of social perceptiveness and customer service Self-driven, motivated, well-structured, results oriented and integrity. Excellent communication, presentation, negotiation and collaboration skills

description: Job Title: Business Development Executive (New Business) – Growth & New Markets Team Place of work: Chai Chee, Singapore Reporting to:  Head of Sales ASEAN  About Orange Orange Business Services manages and integrates the complexity of international communications & the associated data journey of services, freeing our customers to focus on the strategic initiatives that drive their business. Our extensive experience and knowledge in global solutions, together with our understanding of multinational business and local support in 166 countries and territories, ensure that our customers receive a consistent, global solution wherever they do business. Orange is looking to expand and is looking for motivated & high-performing sales professionals to join the growing team in Singapore.    JOB DESCRIPTION: Business Development Executive (New Business)  If you are a Business Development Executive with experience selling technology transformation, solutions, and managed services that demonstrably solve client business issues then we are looking for someone like you!  This is an outstanding opportunity for the right type of assertive individual, who has an existing network and is also passionate about forging new relationships. You will be successful in this role if you have a creative streak and enjoy engaging in dialogue with clients that generate a shared narrative to solve a problem. If you are positive, achievement orientated, resilient, tenacious, and have an ability to think logically and be objective in your decision making then this role is for you.  Your sales territory will be predominantly Singapore-based. Your focus will be to target enterprise accounts that have a synergy with the wider Orange Business Services portfolio that includes Connectivity, Cloud, Cyber, IoT, and multi-domains managed services. You will be measured by successfully winning a business that acquires new clients for Orange.  Essential for this role is an ability to elevate the conversation away from commodity technology provision or point solutions. You have a challenger mindset and be in a position to understand what business drivers within the target client environment can trigger and create a sales opportunity using insight lead selling. These differentiated opportunities you create and execute will be transformational-sized engagements and will contribute to the growth of Orange.  This role is based in Singapore and will suit a person who has a strong history in new business/business development roles. Your success will be our success, and you will be supported in achieving our joint goals.  You can expect  that once you “peel back the layers” of the Orange value proposition, it is the best-kept secret that this market needs to hear…. We need more people to tell it! that you will get passionate support from the leadership team and the support functions for qualified opportunities and energy to support winning those pursuits a culture that values diverse opinions, supports excellence and drives for success with a passion for respect freedom to be creative and innovative about how you meet the goals set out for you an engaged leadership team that supports the growth of the individual be renumerated with a healthy base salary, as well as an attractive commission for any business acquired  Desired Skills & Experience  Sales experience with a track record of success selling technology solutions, generating pipeline, and closing opportunities A passionate pipeline creator – prospecting and opening up new business opportunities is part of your daily process to overachieve your sales quota An existing network of enterprise client contacts in Singapore Direct experience in enterprise sales as an individual contributor A confident communicator, comfortable speaking, and ability to build relationships with managers, executives, and peers. The role will suit a positive and energetic individual, a team player, self-motivated, results-driven, with excellent communications and organizational skills. Will hold a Bachelor’s degree or higher, and be fluent in spoken and written English (business level).  Note: Only shortlisted candidates with relevant skills & experience will be contacted for further process. Only those candidates who are currently in Singapore with relevant experience in the local market will be considered.

description: First Digital Trust is looking for an experienced Head of Business Development to lead our sales and partnership efforts. The role is responsible for leading and running all aspects of the business development process, from lead identification and qualification to developing deep market analyses, exploring new revenue models, and creating strategic business partnerships. Outstanding presentation and negotiation skills are required as well as the ability to close US$100k+ deals and maintain year-over-year growth of over 30%. Of particular interest are candidates with an excellent grasp of the blockchain and digital assets industry and the cultural trends of the crypto community.  Responsibilities:  Deliver and manage a sales and business development strategy that aligns with the company's direction for growth, revenue, and profit Lead the pipeline of opportunities, prioritize according to growth value, and deliver timely reporting on sales funnel and progress towards goals to the leadership team, broader team, and other senior leaders Produce incremental value from ongoing strategic relationships and identify, structure, negotiate and close significant new strategic partnership opportunities and sophisticated deals with strategic partners, such as (but not limited to) tech providers, banks, money service businesses, and other financial intermediaries Identify, lead and negotiate key deals from end-to-end (from due diligence to contract negotiations and post-deal management) with cross-functional input aligned to business/service strategy. Overseeing the day to day management and mentoring of the business development team Explore and implement new possible revenue streams as well as develop new business models Work closely with the CEO, marketing, and product teams on deal structures and product strategy. This will include an ongoing focus on discovery around the products, pricing, recurring revenue opportunities, and more Influence and connect with key internal partners, including regional country heads, brands, and the strategic team at HQ, including Finance, Legal, Marketing, and Product teams. Act as a brand ambassador - attend conferences, panels, and events where you advocate for FDT  Experience & Proficiencies:  University Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or Finance desired At least 5-10 years of deal-making experience, with a solid understanding of and exposure to the financial services industry or another high growth tech environment Business level proficiency in English and a second language Executive presence with outstanding presentation, communication, and consultative selling skills Experience working with financial institutions, Banks, and Broker/Dealers, Exchanges, and Asset Management partners is a plus. Excellent organizational and project planning/leadership skills coupled with the ability to operate in an ambiguous environment or unstructured situations with a high degree of autonomy People-oriented and a great teammate combined with entrepreneurial skills Excellent analytical and finance skills with a good understanding of contract law with the ability to work in a self-directed manner Proven track record of adapting to new environments and working effectively with people from all levels and from a diverse group of backgrounds through excellent influencing and adaptable communication skills – comfortable making pitches to the board and C-suite and skilled at developing relations with key stakeholders.

Description & Requirements  lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as a Key Leader on our team. The key objective of this position is to lead our retail floor and maintain amazing guest experience in stores.  What You Will Do  The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health, fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The key leader plays a key role in ensuring an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training, coaching, and developing a team of Educators that delivers the lululemon guest experience. Key leaders build capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business, today and tomorrow. Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager, the position supports in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations. Our Key Leader emanates the lululemon culture, is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors, and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.  The life of our Key Leader Passionately leads and educates on our product, community and culture on the retail floor and in the community Takes a stand as an advocate for lululemon athletica’s values and guest experience Oversees the execution of certain deliverables on the Manager ‘80/20 Checklist’, as delegated by the Store Manager or Assistant Manager. For example, Inventory, Product or Community Events Present on the retail floor encouraging and energizing staff Represents her/his store at all required meetings, events and conferences, under the direction of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager Acts as a coach to Educators and plays a hands-on roll in their development What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role? Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales leadership, or an equivalent role Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, retail or related field (preferred) Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects, plans and people development Love of brainstorming, problem-solving, being creative and resourceful Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon, community, and people Passion, knowledge and involvement in yoga, and/or athletics Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills Entrepreneurial, proactive and solution-oriented To Apply for this position  If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness, personal development, growth, change, responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.

description: BidFX is a FinTech start-up on a mission to disrupt the foreign exchange market, applying innovative technology to tap FX liquidity. Foreign exchange is the largest financial market in the world, with $6.6 trillion traded every day. We are a small but fast-growing company with big, global aspirations. We aim to connect the world of finance. We operate a successful core-trading platform, with direct connectivity to all major banks as well as non-banks, fronted by a sophisticated trading user interface. We seek candidates who wish to help us fulfil our vision and share in our success. We value diversity and offer equal opportunities to all. BidFX is a subsidiary of SGX Group.  Responsibilities Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with BidFX customers Grow revenue through identifying cross-selling opportunities and communicating these to sales Arrange and schedule onsite visits for relationship management and training Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Communicate clearly the progress of initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Forecast and track key account metrics including monitoring customers usage of BidFX Enhance department and organisation’s reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new requests Responsible for keeping current clients satisfied and delivering exceptional client service on a day-to-day basis Responsible for working with the Sales team to onboard and integrate new clients and developing existing client relationships  Requirements Proven client and/or account management experience from the intermediary space including brokerage, technology provider etc. Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of an organisation, including executive and C-level Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail Confident in meeting and liaising at client sites Excellent verbal and written communications skills EFX knowledge an absolute requirement, multi asset knowledge desirable Self-motivated with the ability to thrive in a result driven revenue-based environment Natural relationship builder with integrity and reliability Ability to prioritise competing tasks Critical thinking and problem-solving skills A desire to constantly seek improvement

description: About Have Halal, Will Travel (HHWT)  HHWT is the leading lifestyle and travel platform for Muslims, with a reach of almost 10 million monthly. Our ultimate vision is to foster peace between people through travel as we believe it is the greatest tool to break down stereotypes and biases.  We work with internationally renowned brands such as Google, Unilever, Nestle, Mitsubishi as well as government ministries such as the Health Promotion Board, Singapore Tourism Board & Malaysia Tourism Board.  We are a START-UP that embraces talent from diverse backgrounds. We hire regardless of race, gender, language, or religion. Be prepared to roll up your sleeves and work in a dynamic, multi-cultural, and exciting environment!  More about us: Forbes 30 under 30 award Our work with STB Our work with Microsoft  Key Responsibilities  This is a position based in Singapore. Ideal for people who are transitioning or looking for new opportunities!  Working closely with the team, your key responsibilities will be to: Go door to door to cultivate new leads Maintain records and client database of all sales leads and/or customer accounts Convert leads collected into sales by effectively communicating HHWT's value proposition (eg. proposals) Meet targets of 50 live leads collection and sales conversions of at least 20%  Requirements Preferred: At least 1 year in a sales-oriented role Highly organised with strong analytical ability and adaptable to changes Strong communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills Self-motivated and driven  Benefits Be mentored by an ex-listed company CEO with deep experience in media, publishing, & travel (Dow Jones, BBC, Lonely Planet, PropertyGuru) Work alongside Forbes 30 Under 30 winners Flexible working hours Great working environment and culture Allowance with very attractive commission & incentive structure  All shortlisted candidates will be invited to an interview. All the best!

description: Leadership & Sales Coaching Singaporeans/PR only.   Looking for an opportunity post covid?    We are in an unprecedented time , filled with uncertainty.   Hence, we are focused on helping others find certainty in improving their transferable human skills that can be applied through any industry and even in aspects of personal life.  Such as : • Business development and foresight to overcome business challenges (campaign management)  • Communication skills (sales)   • Leadership skills (training and leading a team)  • People skills (working within a powerful team environment)  • Management skills (opportunities to advance to the role of campaign manager)    Benefits  • Be in charge of your own time management / schedule  • Set goals and datelines that fit you best  • Qualify for advancement governed by performance criterias not seniority  •  Get what you give. Results is a reflection of your work.   Our goal is to develop LEADERS of tomorrow. To work with like-minded individuals who believe their future is their responsibility and are eager to improve through their own effort.   If you are such an individual, you are the one we are looking for.     #sales #leadership #coaching #success #marketing #motivation #management #salestraining #hr #employeeengagement #strategy #business #businessmanagement #businessdevelopment #teamleader #leader #positivechange

What We Offer  Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!  Role Description  The Next Gen Rise team is a central team acting as a deal support center for SAP Account Executives across Asia Pacific and Japan and supports and processes SAP RISE PCE deals by processing them in Harmony and CRM system. This team also provides support to all procurement processes like back to back contracting with premium suppliers and procure to pay process working along with Global Procurement organization, SAP partners and AEs to administer POs for partners. The team is expected to contribute to revenue growth and profitability by processing SAP RISE PCE sales opportunities for both existing and net new customers and achieve orders targets.  Responsibilities Responsible for execution of the SAP RISE PCE deals. Process customer requests for selling SAP RISE PCE deals and completing the required paperwork (CRM Opportunities, Margin Calculator, Quotations, Order Forms, Resource Requests) Responsible for procurement processes related to premium suppliers and Hyper-scaler partners Comply with operational procedures e.g. for sales, delivery, financial and legal requirements Become expert with SAP sales tools and processes Working with Industry AEs , support the overall relationship between the customer, the partners and SAP to ensure all opportunities are maximized and sales bids are successful. Create contracts for submission for SAP’s existing and potential new customers: Responsible for drafting, modifying and finalizing contracts, including new and add-on business for SAP RISE PCE. Contract Validation: Closely cross-collaborate with the Industry AEs, Pricing and Revenue Recognition teams in the local market units during the contract drafting and negotiation process. Verify customer, user and pricing information provided by Account Executives and Pricing teams, work  with the Revenue Recognition teams to prevent revenue deferrals and ensure final business and contract terms. Customer Support/Administration: Monitor contract cancellation dates, trial agreement dates, as well as provide contract amendments for non- revenue generating issues (Terminations, Service Level Agreements etc.). Archiving and maintaining all contractual documentation Provide active quarter-end and year-end close deal support to the sales community in a dynamically driven environment. Work Experience Preferably at least 3 - 4 year experience with Sales Operations or Deal Support Working experience within a shared service center environment (preferred) Experience with Harmony and CRM tools and experience with SAP systems is a plus Education And Qualifications / Skills And Competencies Proficient in written and spoken English Bachelor´s degree in any discipline Excellent communication skills are a must Team player Extremely detail-oriented, organized and with strong follow-up skills Ability to multitask, prioritize and solve problems with little direct supervision Good command of MS Office (Excel, word, PowerPoint and Outlook) Experience with SmartSheet application We are SAP  SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.  Our inclusion promise  SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. description: Business Development Senior Executive to Manager (Digital Marketing Agency) Responsibilities： • Solicit new clients, establishing and maintaining good client relationship • Explore the potential clients which cover business in local, oversea or Greater China market • Take the lead to contribute sales target achievement selling and providing an excellence service • Oversee and participate in each business process, including serving as a member of the pitch team, delivering strong analyses and completing other duties as necessary • Media planning, proposal development, and provision of professional account services The Ideal candidate will have the following background: • Bachelor Degree in Communications, Marketing, Business, Advertising or related disciplines • Over 2 years of experience relevant in digital marketing, Google SEM, Facebook Ads, Integrated digital marketing solutions etc. (Preferred ex. Digital Marketing Agency) • Passionate, result-oriented and positive • Preferred to have good networks in the media/ advertising field • Presentable, strong in communication and negotiation skills • Good command of both spoken and written English • Singaporean are welcome to apply You will be offer competitive package with bonus scheme along with fantastic professional development and career progression opportunities.

Job Description  Would you relish the opportunity to sell world-class technical products?  Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and ensuring customer success?  Join our Web Core Business team  Our team works with world leading companies in every major industry to make the internet fast and secure. As a partner to the Global 500, we collaborate with customers and prospects to align Akamai solutions to business needs. We build relationships and insights to maximize product value through the full scope of our global platform.  Successfully generate new business  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will successfully guide new customer sales over the phone and own the full sales cycle. You will be generating new business through outbound calling, email, inbound inquiries and marketing events. Articulating the Akamai value proposition, you will generate interest and enthusiasm for Akamais solutions in the market.  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be responsible for- Becoming a trusted advisor in ensuring customers get the most value out of Akamai platforms Generating new business through to contract negotiations to ensure customer satisfaction and adoption of Akamai technologies Creating and managing a full sales cycle and sales pipeline by articulating Akamai value to prospective customers Building customer relationships and engagement through events and training to encourage business growth Partnering with pre-sales to make recommendations for customers to expand the use of Akamai services and solutions Do What You Love  To be successful in this role you will- Have 2 years of relevant experience and a Bachelors degree or its equivalent Show proven experience of being persuasive, influential and professional on the phone, social media and email Have experience of meeting daily, weekly and monthly targets, and proven consultative sales skills and quota achievement Demonstrate excellent communication skills and be able to present to various stakeholders Show some experience with accurate forecasting and pipeline management Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone.  We are happy to discuss flexible working options in this role, please discuss your requirements with the recruiter when you apply.  Working with us  At Akamai, were curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, youll thrive here.  Working for you  At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life- Your health Your finances Your family Your time at work Your time pursuing other endeavors Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.  About Us  Innovating on a global scale, we deliver our customers a fast, smart and secure intelligent edge platform. Working against a backdrop of digital collaboration, our highly skilled teams build progressive solutions that have the scope to transform entertainment, business, and life in ways that we have yet to imagine.  Join us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

description: At Algolia, we are passionate about helping developers & product teams connect their users with what matters most in milliseconds!  We are looking for highly driven individuals with strong technical aptitude and natural sales instincts to join our growing sales organization. As a Business Development Representative (BDR) at Algolia, you will play a critical role prospecting and expanding business opportunities for our APAC Enterprise and Mid Market team. You will take part in a wide variety of responsibilities that will help foster, qualify, and mature our pipeline with high profile customers. We need someone with a hunter attitude who can take direction as well as have the drive and motivation to work autonomously. We expect a strong go-getter!  Are you a resilient problem solver who isn't afraid to think outside the box and get their hands dirty? We expect you to take ownership and be able to execute against best practices, as much as be creative in the way you reach out to your prospects. We're looking for candidates who raise the level of our teams. You should value and practice transparency, have the humility to accept your weaknesses and continuously strive to improve both personally and professionally. Are you ready for the challenge?  Your Role Will Consist Of Work closely with our APAC Enterprise or Mid Market teams to build global pipeline and strategize on how to approach targeted accounts Identify, prospect key contacts at target accounts and build the foundations for a strong, long lasting relationship Execute appropriate strategies by building out right content ie. case studies, screencasts, presentations, demo hacks. This is where we expect you to unleash your creativity! Be an active part of the team, sharing best practices and participating in the Sales Development organisation's projects Manage, track and report sales activities and results using SFDC A typical morning for Tristan looks like : "Every morning, my goal is to reach out to new people to raise their interest for Algolia. First, I would be looking for new companies to target and find the relevant people I want to reach out to. Then I would craft a personalized messaging to help them realize the value they would get from evaluating Algolia. Eventually, I would own the conversation with them and pass them over to a senior Account Executive when they'll be ready to evaluate Algolia."  You Might Be a Fit If You Have Prior experience in lead generation and sales (SaaS experience preferred, but not required) Highly motivated with a competitive edge Communication and writing skills are on point Strong ability to quickly learn and adapt to change Demonstrated success overachieving (professionally/ personally) You have a keen interest in the tech industry Experience at our current stage and beyond ($50-200M ARR range, high growth, lots of change and building internal infrastructure) We're Looking For Someone Who Can Live Our Values GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment. TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership. CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback. CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company. HUMILITY - Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside. _______  Remote Strategy  Algolia’s workplace strategy, Hybrid Remote , is designed to harness the power of the opportunities that remote work offers both employees and the company, while also providing an engaging in-office experience for the times when an employee is in an office. Our workplace approach reflects the belief that an employee’s impact, contribution, and output are more important than their physical location.  The majority of employees will be able to choose if, and when, they come into an office on a regular basis. There will be times when our people are asked to come into an office for “moments that matter:” activities like critical planning meetings and team social gatherings. Beyond those events, 80% of our workforce may choose the location from where they work in the country in which they were hired.  We have physical offices in San Francisco, NYC, Atlanta, Paris, London, Bucharest, and we will be opening a small office in Austin soon. https://www.algolia.com/about/  _______  About Us  Millions of developers around the world use Algolia to unleash the power of search across their digital properties. They use Algolia because we are API-first. We unlock incredible flexibility. We build blazing fast speed into our APIs. We do this because we know developers want to build cool things and innovate. Under Armour, Lacoste, Birchbox, Stripe, Slack, Medium, Zendesk and 10,000+ other companies use Algolia to build not just great search, but search that converts at higher rates because of the relevancy. We help their customers find the right goods, offers, and content really quickly. So quickly, in fact, that they don’t go anywhere else. Algolia helps businesses build and optimize the search and discovery experience resulting in significantly enhanced online engagement, increased conversion rates and enriched lifetime value that generates profitable growth. Today, Algolia powers 1.5 Trillion searches a year – that’s 4 times more than Bing, Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, Baidu and Yandex combined. Our amazing technology is used by one in eight online users.  Founded in 2012, we're backed by $184M in funding from Accel Partners, Alven, DAG Ventures, Founders Circle, Owl Rock Capital, Point Nine Capital, SaaStr Fund, Salesforce Ventures, Storm Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The team is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Paris, London, Tokyo, New York, and Atlanta. To learn more, visit www.algolia.com.  Who We're Looking For  We’re looking for talented, passionate people to build the world’s best search & discovery technology. As an ownership-driven company, we seek team members who thrive within an environment based on autonomy and diversity. We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We care about each other and the world around us, and embrace talented people regardless of their race, age, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, color, veteran status, disability and socioeconomic background.  READY TO APPLY?  If you share our values and our enthusiasm for building the world’s best search & discovery technology, we’d love to review your application!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are building out a team of Inside Sales i-Specialists across Asia Pacific based in the Inside Sales Team Hubs in Singapore.  The “Inside Sales i-Specialist” will be a core member of the team helping to grow VMware’s new businesses in the relevant solution segments. “Future Ready” solutions portfolio based on End User Computing, Cloud, Networking and Security areas & Customer User Case solutions. The i-Specialist will work in our Inside Sales hubs to generate demand, pipeline and revenue for our “Future Ready” solutions.  The i-Specialists will own a revenue quota number for a territory/region and the focus will be on net new acquisition accounts and be responsible for collaborating with our core Inside Sales teams, Partner Sales teams, and Solution Provider ecosystem. Knowledge of computer hardware and/or software sales is a must. An understanding of and passion for the Cloud or Software-as-a-Service marketplace is a requirement.  Key Job Responsibilities Will carry your own quota for assigned territory in addition to assisting the field sales team on some deals Identify and establish relationships with new business prospects Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities Sell/Market to large audiences (1: many) utilizing web conferencing technologies Manage and maintain accurate account and opportunity details in Salesforce. Accountable for helping create pipeline and establish opportunities with our customers and partners. Collaborate with Inside & Field Core sales, BU Specialists & SE’s and Partner sales leaders to ensure proper engagement on these solutions centric opportunities to ensure the best customer experience with VMWare across potentially multiple solutions teams. Drive the sales of add-on services and value services of existing customers. Support core Inside Sales enablement activities to drive further understanding of Solution offerings Requirements Passionate about technology Good written and verbal communication skills Korean and English Sales experience with VMware Horizon, Workspace ONE, Citrix Xen Desktop/XenApp and Microsoft SCCM/Intune highly desirable Experience with Endpoint security , NGAV or EDR technology will be advantageous Proven ability to assimilate into a team environment and works in challenging teaming situation Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage many diverse projects simultaneously The ability to develop in-depth knowledge of company infrastructure, operations, contacts, and buying cycles Experience with Salesforce preferred The ability to interact professionally and reliably with senior level executives within and outside the company, as well as with customers, vendors etc. Ability to work within a team environment and build rapport. Strong sense of urgency and efficiency in completing work Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload An open mindset to new ideas and suggestions. Demonstrates good judgment in analyzing information to make decisions. Proficient with digital technology and social media Exemplary verbal and written English communication skills and attention to detail Bachelor's degree or equivalent 4-6 years of sales experience in computer hardware, software, or online services is required SaaS selling experience is a MUST Self-motivated with a high attention to detail and ability to multitask Willingness to learn and attend bi-weekly solutions enablement sessions An unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to deal with ambiguity are a must Customer Satisfaction focused Attention to detail and understanding of subscription sales and ordering. Need to be familiar with computers and technology and comfortable using the Microsoft Windows operating system and Microsoft Outlook Must be open to receiving constructive criticism (feedback) and applying and integrating the feedback in an effort to improve their results Category : Sales  Subcategory: Inside Sales  Experience: Manager and Professional  Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time  Posted Date: 2021-09-15  VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

description: Job Description:  As a Business Development Representative (Customer-facing), you will play an essential role in DataRobot’s direct sales team. Your role will consist of conducting in-depth research into organisations and key decision makers across the region and proactively engaging them in discussions on how DataRobot’s platform can help them overcome some of their biggest challenges.  We are looking for exceptional candidates for our fast-growing team of young and ambitious people. This is an opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing software companies on the planet, in the technology field that will have the most impact on all of our lives for generations to come, whilst also developing your career as a world-class sales representative.  This is a perfect role for any hard-working and ambitious candidate. If you have a track record of making tough decisions and demonstrating the drive, grit and determination to achieve your goals, our development programs will provide you with the perfect opportunity to progress your career quickly.  The work environment is high-energy, performance focused, data-driven and demanding but also extremely rewarding (and fun) for high-performers. DataRobot invests heavily in developing our team and commits to promoting from within, based on merit alone.  Responsibilities :  Diligently research target accounts assigned to you and keep on top of new announcements, annual reports, press releases and other publicly available information that may be pertinent to the sales organisation. Map out the organisation structure and key influencers within each target account. Research areas of interest for key decision makers and potential routes to engage them. Craft well researched, creative outreach campaigns tailored to the findings of your research. Professionally and persistently follow up via phone, email, LinkedIn and other means identified from the research. Conduct initial introductory and discovery discussions to help qualify potential. Book qualified meetings and provide the sales team with detailed, well formatted handover notes from initial discussions. Consistently meet or exceed Key Performance Indicators and contribute to the continued hypergrowth of the region. Understand industry trends and show dedication to continuous learning on all professional fronts Provide feedback to peers and internal teams to help develop and improve marketing materials and messaging. Adapt messaging to suit the needs of the local market. Maintain up-to-date information in Salesforce.com and Outreach.io.  Main Requirements :  2-3+ years experience of qualifying and engaging with prospects in a B2B environment. Track record of consistently achieving targets. Strong academic background from a leading university. Excellent verbal and written English essential, other languages preferred. Ability to comprehend topics and translate them into easy to understand, concise explanations. Ability to conduct meaningful, rigorous research and distill findings into concise summaries for sharing with the sales organisation. History of high-achievement in any field with a demonstrable track record of making tough decisions to achieve your goals. description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Role  Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‘APAC’) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC.  In this role, you’ll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel’s indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements.  This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers’ needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're Looking For Someone Who Has  Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region.  Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred. Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Account Executive (Banking) (Director)  Account Executive develops and owns the relationship within assigned account to maximize Capgemini’s footprint within them. Incumbents routinely sell-to and interact with executive-level customer decision makers, to include up to CXO levels. Experience in selling Digital Solutions, Transformation / M&A projects, preferred Expert-level presentation, customer service, financial/business acumen, and negotiation skills at all levels of customer engagement. Complete, “big-picture” understanding of the business and technical contexts of the account. Driven, self-starter who exudes leadership on account set and compels others to get on board. Fully adept at consultative effectiveness and establishing trust with internal and external customers.

Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities!

description: The Dir – Business Development will find new and manage existing partnerships as well as coordinate our approach and sales strategy on large business opportunities. This role identifies, pursues, and secures business with new clients to meet or exceed individual and vertical sales goals within a geographical region, country, and/or territory. Identifies prospective clients through analysis of current marketplace data and a strong understanding of the industry, its challenges and opportunities. Establishes and owns relationships with key contacts at prospective clients, and develops prospects into becoming new clients. Owns client relationship from prospect stage to client stage. Builds and uses simple business models to analyze profitability of various business cases and make recommendations to next level management for approval to improve company profitability. Develops effective responses to Requests for Proposals (RFP) as needed. Participates in the Strategic Account Planning (SAPs) process; drives the growth required to meet financial goals by developing and executing the annual strategic Account Plans as it pertains to new clients. Participates in, and often leads, the development and delivery of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. Develops and implements the strategic and tactical plans (e.g., pricing, products, programs) for each major account and drives results directly through the District Sales Managers and Regional Managers. Takes best practices of Major Accounts and works to execute them within the Division’s smaller accounts. Collaborates with management of major accounts to develop sales programs/presentations, and marketing initiatives to be used by the major accounts. Develops sales tools and collateral materials for both internal & external customers. Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. Additional duties as assigned. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Development or related field Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred 10+ years progressive sales and business development experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Understand margin calculations, profit and loss. 8+ years in a leadership role (direct or indirect) Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a Regional Account Manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our customers. It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports.  As our team is currently expanding in various verticals, prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals would be advantageous.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within existing network Identify key account targets in ASPAC Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate in future tenders Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand customer base  Service support Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The ideal candidate  Essential: Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region)  Desirable: Prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Strong interpersonal skills Highly adaptable  Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.

description: Senior Business Development Executive  Senior Business Development Executive responsibilities include discovering and pursuing new sales prospects, negotiating deals and maintaining customer satisfaction. description: A Sales Manager analyses local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business.  What will I be doing?  Responsibilities  Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards  As Sales Manager, you will analyse local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business. Analysis local market trends and competitor activity to identify business leads Develop customer accounts and travel within the local area to drive business into the specific hotel/cluster and to increase market/customer share in all revenue streams Negotiate room rates/packages with corporate clients Prepare company contracts for the hotel in accordance with current business and pricing conditions Work within current business strategies and recognising potential opportunities Cooperate with other departments in the hotel to create an exceptional Guest experience and build strong, comprehensive sales programs Attend Sales events, as required Produce accurate and timely reports that meet the needs of the Sales Director and senior management to include the reporting of appointments, calls made and business leads Answer customer queries in a prompt and professional manner What are we looking for?  Skills  To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow  A Sales Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. Positive attitude and good communication skills Commitment to delivering a high level of customer service Excellent grooming standards Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations Ability to work under pressure and under own initiative Experience in a sales role with a proven track record to close a sale It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Knowledge of local market Knowledge of hospitality Passion for sales and for achieving targets and objectives Degree-level qualification in a relevant field What will it be like to work for Hilton?  Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!  Work Locations  Hilton Garden Inn Serangoon - Singapore  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Garden Inn  Shift  Day Job  Job Level  Manager  Job  Sales
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality

jobTitle: Regional Lead, Strategy and Operations, Global Strategic Initiatives
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 10 years of relevant work experience including experience building and executing strategic operational initiatives.  Preferred qualifications: MBA or Master's degree. Experience with Cloud business models and relevant experience partnering with Sales and/or Product Management in a B2B business. Experience creating and completing complex projects in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. Understanding of business processes with a focus on complex agreements. Understanding of analytics “basics” (i.e., spreadsheet modeling; financial and decision analysis; working with large datasets, basic probability and statistics) Excellent verbal, written, presentation, and communication skills with the ability to tailor communications to any audience.  About The Job  In this role, you partner with APAC Global Strategic Initiatives (GSI) leadership to create and manage the strategic initiatives and operational processes that support Google Cloud customer agreements.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  Responsibilities  Identify, structure, and lead strategic initiatives for the GSI team in alignment with Google Cloud Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations, Regional Sales Operations, Finance, Sales, and the broader Alphabet organization. Ownership of the APAC GSI operational cadence, including business planning, objectives and key results, and resource management, and preparation of business reviews and performance metrics. Manage initiatives that expand across Cloud and other Google and Alphabet businesses to ensure agreements are successfully executed. Collaborate with GSI leadership for strategy and operations, including analysis and content creation. Support the business cycle, including win strategy, solution strategy, and agreement reviews.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
