description: Cellebrite is the Global leader in digital intelligence, providing law enforcement, military and intelligence agencies, a wide range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics. With cutting edge technology, Cellebrite provides a one-stop shop for digital intelligence to Law enforcement and to the private sector, across the world. With high-energy and high motivation, here at Cellebrite we are creating a safer world day by day.   Role Description: Sales Operations is a key function in Cellebrite’s winning sales team. As such, the Sales Operations Specialist plays a pivotal role in the sales process, managing the back-office operations from End-to-End for a specified territory. The Sales Operations Specialist is a customer facing role, and as such, requires being Customer, sales and service oriented. As a member of the Center of Excellence, the Sales Operations Specialist is required to provide high quality support to both internal and external customers.  Responsibilities: Manage end to end support of the company’s customers. Build a strong, close relationship with the partners and end users, and be their focal point of contact Be the backbone of the sales team, providing support to Sales Directors and assisting in all Back-Office operations Manage all Opportunity-to-Cash activity. Lead the sales cycle from order to shipment Forecast management and data accuracy both in the CRM system (SalesForce), and in the ERP system (Netsuite). Be the company’s Gate Keeper. Work closely with Finance and the Legal department, and implement the company’s policies and procedures Oversee all processes to make sure we meet SOX compliance   Charged with managing all collection aspects. Build processes to improve collection rates, and customize them to the relevant customer type/ culture Manage company’s renewal sales. In a company of over 60K licenses, maintaining and increasing the renewal rate is an important step within the sales process Know and understand the Sales processes, understanding how to prioritize and differentiate between different assignments in a high- pressure environment  Position requirements: 5-year experience in a similar position in a High-Tech Global company- a must! English fluent speaker- a must! Full knowledge of SalesForce- an advantage Full knowledge of Netsuite- an advantage Knowledge of Microsoft Office – must, particularly advanced knowledge of Excel High energy and high motivation Creative thinking- ability to solve complex problems and think outside the box Attention to details Ability to perform in a multicultural environment Work in a high-pressure environment   Cellebrite: Digital Intelligence for a Safer World Digital data plays an increasingly important role in investigations and operations of all kinds. Making data accessible, collaborative and actionable is what Cellebrite does best. As the global leader in digital intelligence deployed in 150 countries, we provide law enforcement, military, intelligence, and enterprise customers with the most complete, industry-proven range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics.  By enabling access, sharing and analysis of digital data from mobile devices, social media, cloud, computer, cellular operators and other sources, Cellebrite products, solutions, services and training help customers build the strongest cases quickly, even in the most complex situations. As a result, Cellebrite is the preferred one-stop shop for digital intelligence solutions that make a safer world more possible every day.  Founded in 1999, Cellebrite is known worldwide for innovation, commitment to our customers’ missions, and technical expertise. With HQ in Israel the company has more than 750 employees across the globe, with dedicated Sales operations in the United States, Israel, Brazil, United Kingdom, Germany, Singapore and Australia.

description: Today, most countries across the world lack access to the internet and with that, the resources to do business, exchange ideas and learn.   Severe bottlenecks at all levels, what we call the Global Internet Distribution Challenge, has led to more than 50% of the world left unconnected entirely OR connected but with extremely poor access to the Internet. The outcome is that large swaths of the global population are hence prevented from accessing life-changing and economy-driving tools and services offered by the Internet.  What if you could really change the future?  We are building a space laser network to deliver the future of Internet Distribution worldwide. This will be the fastest way to bring the rest of the world up on the bandwidth and connectivity curve. Right now, we are using the same technology to provide a rapidly deployable, affordable, low cost and high speed Last Mile Connectivity solution, CENTAURI, which speeds up adoption of 4G and 5G globally, especially dense residential areas during COVID-19 period which require urgent bandwidth upgrades.  Join our team if you want to define the rules of how our civilisation communicates!  Global Sales Lead   RESPONSIBILITIES:  Drive the revenue generation & margin contribution for the CENTAURI product across all major markets and relevant industry verticals Full ownership for executing the sales strategy for driving growth in APAC, Oceania, EMEA and US, Canada & LATAM markets Lead the Growth (Product Marketing), Sales, Sales Engineering and Customer Success teams (which, together, form the entire Commercial team)  Improving and building the entire customer lifecycle from entry, to continued success Connect with global leaders in Telecommunications industry to build brand recognition and the disruptive nature of the technology Overall accountability for financial results including annual budget for the Global Commercial Team, bookings, revenue and margin contribution, cost center management, and incentive programs Working closely and collaboratively with the Product, Engineering and Finance team leads to ensure our commercial learnings are brought into the organization as soon as possible   QUALIFICATIONS:  Degree in Engineering or Business More than 10+ years of progressive sales leadership roles, including leading a direct sales organization in the telecommunications sector  PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  Track record of closing large deals consistently, including deals up to 100 million USD in size A demonstrable track record of building a multi-theatre sales team for both direct and channel sales while delivering budget expectations Experience selling wireless transmission products and solutions (including hardware, software and services)  Experience defining and executing GTM strategies for new products and new markets. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong business relationships with stakeholders at senior levels Strong business acumen coupled with the ability to understand pivots in bids and recommend to our customers and stakeholders the best solution that meets business objectives Executive presence with excellent written and verbal communication skills Consistent track record of building and scaling high achieving sales teams for long term success Demonstrated ability to build trust and relationships at senior levels across different customers, cultures and industries Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively across functions and geographies, and to influence and support beyond formal reporting lines World class understanding of sales and marketing in the digital world and proven experience in execution Creative and challenging mindset – Senior strategy or sales and marketing professional with strong business acumen   Building the Future of Internet Distribution  Founded in Dec 2016, the Transcelestial team is located in Singapore and is backed by major investors such as Wavemaker Partners, EDBI, Airbus Ventures, Cap Vista, SEEDS Capital (Enterprise SG), Entrepreneur First, Partech Ventures, 500 Startups, AirTree Ventures, Tekton Ventures, SGInnovate, SparkLabs Global Ventures, Michael Seibel (CEO of Y-Combinator, Founder of Twitch.tv), Charles Songhurst (Microsoft’s former Head of Corporate Strategy) and other investors.  Transcelestial has won numerous industry and global awards such as SPIFFY San Andreas Award for Most Disruptive Technology by Telecom Council, The Most Ambitious Start-Up in Photonics Award by The Optical Society (OSA), etc.   COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:  A monthly book and hobby fund 1 Friday for “Space Themed” personal projects Personal Office Computer Flexible work hours Best in industry health plans  JOIN US: You should include in your application  Your CV, and/or LinkedIn page Links to projects or other work which will definitely impress everyone  Email us at jobs@transcelestial.com

description: General Information  Ref #: 30734  Functional Area: Account Management - Client Servicing  Employee Type: Full Time  Location: Singapore  Experienced Required: 7 - 10 Years  Education Required: Bachelors Degree  Date published: 18-Jun-2021  About Us  We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $2.22 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 3,000 employees in 20 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.  PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.  Position Description  Account Manager, with the title of Vice President, within the South Asia team, to drive the offshore distribution business initiatives in South Asia ex-Singapore, and a secondary coverage on select institutional segments. This would include our intermediaries’ initiatives across the region, including Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia, Brunei, India and other markets where opportunities arise. This position is based in Singapore.  PIMCO is recognized as a leading fixed income and alternatives managers among institutions and wholesale platforms in South Asia. Backed by our well-established wholesale platform in the major APAC markets, we are aiming to expand our distribution franchise further in the region. As such, PIMCO has decided to recruit a seasoned business developer to grow our South Asia distribution presence outside of Singapore.  The Account Manager will report to the head of the South Asia, and work within a team covering this market to develop new business, both for new and existing wholesale clients.  Key Responsibilities Lead in building the intermediaries footprint in South Asia ex-Singapore - this would include but is not limited to driving, developing and executing a business development and relationship management strategy. Build and maintain a detailed knowledge of key business and strategic issues facing target channels. Acquisition and ongoing service of new and existing clients and mandates. Take ownership of the client relationships from front to back, ensure that all operational, compliance and legal requirements are met and business is conducted in line with practice. Marketing of the full range of PIMCO’s products and services to the assigned investor base with the assistance of senior investment professionals where appropriate. Development and implementation of a plan to identify prospects and raise assets across all PIMCO’s products. As secondary coverage, oversee select institutional segment outside Singapore. Ideal Experience Proven track record in growing the wholesale business in South Asia. The key markets would be Thailand, Philippines, Malaysia and India. Stature, gravitas and seniority to operate at the highest level – internally and externally. Outstanding sales closing, relationship management and negotiation skills. Capable of driving own agenda. Collegiate team player, experienced and comfortable working in an international operating environment. An understanding of the dynamics of investment management industry focused around meeting client demands. Ideally this should be at a relatively sophisticated level of knowledge. A significant understanding of economics, capital markets and investment concepts gained from 6-10 years’ experience within the asset management industry. Experiences in fixed income, alternatives, private credit and real estate are strongly preferred. Experienced business developer and servicer focused on meeting with clients very regularly and representing the firm at client meetings and key events. Language skill appropriate to the region Position Requirements  EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS Bachelor degree CFA, or progress towards attaining the designation Benefits  PIMCO is committed to offering a comprehensive portfolio of employee benefits designed to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Benefits vary by location but may include: Medical, dental, and vision coverage Life insurance and travel coverage Work/life programs such as flexible work arrangements, parental leave and support, employee assistance plan, commuter benefits, health club discounts, and educational/CFA certification reimbursement programs Community involvement opportunities with The PIMCO Foundation in each PIMCO office
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

description: One2Ten is looking for a Senior Sales Executive in the experience management solutions space.   One2Ten is an end to end Experience Management solutions provider which combines the power of Customer feedback, Employee feedback and Process feedback to truly understand friction points in an organisation and the impact to Employees and Customers alike.  This is a unique opportunity to join an exciting rapidly growing business which is fast becoming a market leader. You will spend your days developing and executing sales across the region and reporting directly into the MD for APAC. You will guide your clients through a consultative sales approach where you will learn about your prospect’s needs and then dive into the potential solutions fit. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products and building strong long lasting relationships.   The ideal candidate would have the following skills:  Minimum of 5+ years of solutions sales experience with a proven track record in achieving targets.  Network of relationships within the APAC market. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful. Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology and / or have a extremly strong network in one of the following industries: Industrial markets (shipping ideal), Consumer products and retail, Financial services, Public Sector, Healthcare or Education Pro active “Can Do” person - you take full ownership of your responsibilities Experience navigating through multiple decision makers and influencers within Enterprise environments including C-suite executives. Exceptional skills in building and maintaining long term relationships with prospects and customers.

Company Description  PowerAdvocate, a Verisk Analytics business, delivers data and insights that operators in the energy and natural resources industry use to improve business performance. Our core asset is our $6 trillion+ proprietary database and technology platform which we apply to solve some of the world’s most complex cost management challenges for our customers in the power, oil and gas, minerals, and renewable energy sectors.  Job Description  About the Role:  PowerAdvocate is a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology, big data, and the energy and natural resources industry. We are looking for driven, self-starting individuals to support strategy, sales, and marketing efforts in our global business.  Job Responsibilities  As an Associate, you will play a critical role in supporting our customer engagement efforts, go-to-market strategy, and aggressive future company growth goals. Unlike traditional roles at many other data and software companies, you will have the opportunity to work on projects across the customer relationship lifecycle – from strategy creation to lead generation to deal closing – gaining an unparalleled level of autonomy, responsibility, and client exposure.  Responsibilities  While Associates are responsible for a variety of tasks in the service of generating revenue and accelerating growth for PowerAdvocate, some common activities include Interfacing directly with clients via our consultative sales model Performing proprietary market analyses to provide unique data insights to the market Developing messaging to communicate the value of PowerAdvocate’s software and data products to the market, and managing content marketing campaigns Supporting new market entry efforts Qualifications  Who We Are Looking For:  Some Other Things We Are Looking For Include  Our Associates have come from a variety of professional and educational backgrounds, so we are not solely focused on a candidate’s experience. What we are really looking for are individuals who are smart, ambitious, hungry to learn, and who want to work in a collaborative, team-based environment. Degree from a top-tier undergraduate program 0 – 1 year of experience Strong analytical and communication skills – we want people who can tell a story with numbers, and who aren’t afraid of digging into data Preference for a fast-paced entrepreneurial culture Desire to tackle interesting challenges and unique opportunities with limited guidance What Else You Will Get  There are a lot of reasons to work at PowerAdvocate, but nothing is as impactful as the business training and professional opportunities you will receive from our team. From day one, you will get: The opportunity to learn foundational business skills that will help jumpstart a career in technology, energy, entrepreneurship, or sales and marketing Significant professional growth in an environment where personal development is a core tenet of the team’s culture The opportunity to take on an enormous amount of responsibility early on your career Vibrant, start-up culture! Additional Information  At PowerAdvocate, we celebrate differences and are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our workforce to provide opportunities for our employees, our clients and our business. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – F/M/D/V  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for this position will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.
industries: Oil & Energy, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: About EVFY: EVFY - An apt merger of logtech and traditional logistics businesses, with a mission to evfy delivery fleets, contributing towards the goal of the Singapore Green Plan 2030. Evfy is the first company in Singapore to own a 100% electric vehicle fleet, which at the point of writing is one of the largest EV fleet owners on the island. Proprietary logtech and crowdsourcing algorithms to enhance fleet management and operations for all last mile logistic needs. Evfy’s mission is zero carbon emissions and contribution to green logistic initiatives.  Vision - “To be the ‘best-in-class’ sustainable logistics company of the region by electrifying last-mile logistics through a driver-centric approach. We aim to be the thought leader in the green last-mile logistics sector, constantly staying ahead by pioneering sustainable initiatives that provide value for the environment, our drivers and our customers.”  Mission - “To make a social impact with businesses and consumers to adopt sustainable and environment friendly options, now.”  Job Description: • Identify new business opportunities via cold call, email, and other marketing channels • Engage prospects in discussions to discover their needs and propose relevant solutions • Develop and maintain good relationships with existing and new clients • Drive sales numbers through aggressive development of new opportunities, sales pursuits, including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability • Achieve monthly and annual sales target • Work with the operations team seamlessly to deliver desired results • Prepare and maintain accurate records for presentation in weekly sync  Requirements: • A proven track record in significant/complex consultative services-led sales engagements and negotiations with partners and clients • 2 to 4 years experience in sales and business development is preferred • Knowledge of the logistics and smart mobility sector is a plus • Driven with keen interest to learn new solutions, including performing presentations and demonstrations  Working Environment & Culture: • Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics! • Close-Knit Team • Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities • Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities, Covid Restriction Compliance • Inclusive & Enjoyable Company Culture

jobTitle: Regional Sales Director, Global SaaS Company
description: Our client, a global Software as a Service (SaaS) Company listed in Nasdaq is looking for a Regional Sales Director to look after the ASEAN region. This is a newly created role as part of the global expansion.  The Regional Sales Director will have full ownership and responsibility for managing sales activities and ensuring the achievement of significant new revenue growth targets. As a Sales Director, you will manage and grow a globally distributed team responsible for direct sales in the Asia Pacific region.  You must be able to articulate a clear vision and set the overall strategy and goals for the business. You will identify new opportunities in industry verticals and driving expansion into them. You will support your direct reports by participating and leading in some sales meetings and engaging other corporate resources as required.  Ideal candidates must have at least 14 years of proven software sales experience with expertise in sales management, territory management, and with proven ability in building and developing high-performance teams. You must have regional exposure with an excellent understanding of growing and sustaining businesses in a highly competitive and changing marketplace.  You must have sound business acumen skills; and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. You must have experience working within a high-growth technology company with the ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly.    Singapore Employment Agency License No: 16S8069 Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.
industries: Computer Software and Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description  Procore is expanding our international reach into the ASEAN market to help construction companies revolutionise and digitise their business. We’re breaching greenfield territories with tremendous market potential and are building out our team to lead this exciting endeavour. Are you up for the challenge?  We’re looking for an Account Executive, Majors to join Procore’s Sales Team. In this role, you’ll apply an understanding of Procore’s products, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques, and customer base while selling to strategic mid-market accounts. You’ll focus on companies that can benefit from Procore’s world-class project management tool for the construction industry. This position’s primary function is new account acquisition, where you’ll grow revenue with an emphasis on new product sales to our customer base. This includes following up on inbound leads, prospecting, qualifying, solution selling, negotiation, and closing.  This position is based in Singapore and will report to our Head of ASEAN, Sales. International travel may be required, specifically in the ASEAN territories, when borders reopen and travel safety improves. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.  What you'll do: Timely follow up and qualification of new prospects from either inbound leads or customer requests generated by marketing Develop prospecting plans for territory development to build rapport and create opportunities Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements Maintain accurate and up-to-date forecasts Provide sales management with reports on sales activities and projects as requested forecasts Pursue an increase knowledge of key competitors to ensure that our value proposition communicated effectively to customers Manage and maintain accurate leads, opportunities, and account information within Salesforce.com Achieve or exceed monthly and quarterly targets Obtain repeat business, referrals, and references by applying an understanding of the unique requirements of your customers Networking, relationship building, cold calling, lead follow-up through emails, product demonstrations, and execution of service agreements  What we're looking for: BA/BS or equivalent experience preferred 3+ years of demonstrated successful software sales, preferably B2B Desire to sell into a new market for Procore Experience using a consultative, solution-based sales methodology desired Proven record of success in an inside sales and or outside sales based selling model Proven ability to communicate effectively via telephone and email with customers Ability and resilience to work in a fast-paced sales environment Ability to develop trusted relationships Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and online collaboration tools Experience with CRM and opportunity management systems, preferably Salesforce.com Proven ability to build and manage pipeline and forecasting Successful candidates will share our Procore Values of Openness, Optimism and Ownership  Additional Information  If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.  About Us  Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  We will provide further details during the interview process on the proposed contractual arrangement and relationship you will have with Procore if you are successful in applying for this role.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Who are we?  HubSpot is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform for scaling companies. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world use our marketing, sales, and customer success software to grow their businesses. It's our mission to not just help them grow, but to help them grow better.  At HubSpot, we believe that our values live in our hearts, not our hallways. We want to build a company where people feel empowered to do their best work, wherever they are.  What’s the role?  As a Channel Account Manager (CAM), you will be responsible for building a long term successful strategy for HubSpot channel partners. Using strong consultative skills, you will work with partners (agencies, value added resellers, distributors, system integrators...etc) to sell HubSpot software and associated services to their clients. In addition, you will dissect their business goals and develop a better plan for achieving them.  What will I do? Close new business consistently at or above quota level by focusing on partners with the most potential while also building and advancing a channel pipeline Successfully onboard new partners with the goal of driving their first resell within the first 6 months of the partnership Co-sell partner services (e.g agency retainers, integration, migration, architecture mapping...etc) and HubSpot software with partners Provide sales training and deal-level sales coaching to help partner drive resell and advance in partner tiers Develop a long-term successful strategy for the partners in your book of business, focused around sales planning, sales execution, and business development Develop the ability to dissect a partner’s business goals and help them develop a better plan for achieving them Work collaboratively with marketing, sales, services, ops and technology departments to execute sales strategy as the firm introduces enhancements to existing solutions and/or releases new products Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future Who are you? Driven and committed to exceeding goals and driving success with partners in the India market. Ability to hold partners accountable and proven track record of exceeding revenue targets. Have extensive experience in onboarding and training partners ranging from agencies, value added resellers, distributors and system integrators. Familiar with co-selling with the direct sales team. A positive outlook and a strong ability to take responsibility for your successes as well as your failures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptional consultative selling skills and closing skills Accurate forecasting and pipeline management Evidence you are a Top Producer in your current role A sharp focus on your goals and a belief that your daily, weekly and monthly activities will help you achieve them. What are the benefits? Generous remuneration + uncapped commissions! Work From Home options available. You choose Home, Office or Flex! World Class New Hire Training Stock units - so that you can share in HubSpot’s future success An education allowance up to USD$5,000 per annum Unlimited Time Off Policy Private health insurance allowance Free books program Annual fitness reimbursement Five-year sabbatical - Paid 4 week sabbatical with USD$5k bonus! A clear career advancement path, with potential for global mobility opportunities Primary Caregiver Leave of 16 weeks and Secondary Caregiver Leave for 6 weeks HubSpot culture is driven by a shared passion for our mission and metrics. It is a culture of amazing, growth-minded people whose values include using good judgment and solving for the customer. Employees who work at HubSpot have HEART: Humble, Empathetic, Adaptable, Remarkable, Transparent.  We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Responsibilities Meet and exceed sales targets Successfully create business from new and existing customer accounts Manage complex negotiations with senior-level executives Build rapport and establish long term relationships with customers  Qualifications 2-5 years' quota carrying sales experience Experience and working knowledge in Oil and Gas sector Demonstrable track record of over-achieving quota Strong written and verbal communication skills

Job Description, Low-code Style  As the #1 low-code application development platform, OutSystems provides customers with everything they need to build apps incredibly fast. So, let’s cut to the chase: we are looking for an Sales Development Representative based in Singaporeto join our fastest growing region. In this role, you need to k now how to identify and research lists of companies to target, and how to develop email and telephone campaigns to generate new business opportunities. The SDR will conduct high-level conversations with C-Levels about their business, their IT Problems issues and their operations. The successful candidate will be a strongly self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical and tenacious, and can effectively interact with a team. This position has advancement potential within the sales organization, and the compensation package includes an uncapped commission structure.  The Longer Story  One of the fastest growing B2B software companies in the world, OutSystems is on a mission to enable every organization to innovate through the power of software. We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in empowering companies to build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that makes a difference to their business. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help our customers address some of the most strategic challenges in business today, from modernizing their business processes to transforming the customer experience.  OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 435,000 developer community members, 1,500 employees, 350 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 87 countries and across 22 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems is co-headquartered in Boston and Portugal, with offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.  Are you a Sales Development guru that finds your current employer is moving too slow for your taste?  Key Responsibilities  An OutSystems Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for: Executing outbound calling campaigns to targeted prospects to generate “sales ready” qualified leads and set appointments for the OutSystems sales team to close new business; Responding to inbound inquiries from prospective customers (phone, email, and web), attaining key data to qualify the prospect, generate “sales ready” leads, and set appointments for the OutSystems sales team to close new business; Learn and execute proven processes to generate new sales opportunities; Strategize with top-producing sales managers; Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people and existing technology; Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts; Orchestrate discussions with senior execs around their business needs; Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects; Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors. Key Requirements English fluent - mandatory; Min 2 year’s sales or related market/business experience; Understanding of the IT industry with a background of prospecting to IT decision makers; Strong cold calling skills with ability to maintain high volume of outbound calls per day/week/month; Software/SaaS experience, sales experience or other related business experience; Outstanding communicator via phone and email to both technical and non-technical audiences; Ability to promptly respond to a high volume of inbound leads via phone and email while maintaining outbound call volumes; Self-critical and eager to improve and optimize the sales processes and tools; Proactive in seeking new business opportunities; Ability to work in situations that can be unstructured and potentially stressful; Ability to change priorities quickly, and capacity to handle multiple tasks; Ability to do initial research on accounts prior to contact; Proficiency with Microsoft Office, WebEx or similar web conferencing product, and CRM or sales management tools (salesforce.com preferred); Demonstrate strong desire to keep up-to-date on technology trends, changes, & best practices; Singapore based Behavioral Requirements A desire to do and achieve brilliant things! Authentically curious, who love learning and improving yourself; Integrity is fundamentally important to you! You are naturally entrepreneurial; You are street smart. Working at OutSystems  We do not have many rules, but we have a lot of common sense. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture has landed us in the top six Forbes Best Cloud Computing Companies and CEOs To Work for three years running. Our culture is based on transparency, teamwork and excellence as promised in our Small Book of the Few Big Rules . We live it every day. We grow, change, and innovate, and give our teams the space to be proactive and creative. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is obvious, and we also encourage lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering new skills. Global colleagues who are as smart, hardworking, and driven as you. Our DNA is disrupting the status quo. It is why our company exists. We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and often uncovers a better, more agile way. https://www.outsystems.com/company/careers/
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We help brands win new fans - we're a content studio with offices in Singapore and London. We're looking for a new business executive to help win new fans for our business.  As our new business executive you'll be helping deliver our new business strategy across APAC. You’ll be supporting the implementation of our outbound marketing activities, managing our CRM, securing meetings with prospects and developing exciting marketing initiatives for our client servicing team.   This is an exciting role for someone who wants to work in a fast paced creative environment and build a career in business development, who has a passion for CRM management, email marketing, online marketing and client servicing.  RESPONSIBILITIES   As a new business executive, you will:  Manage our client data, both existing and set up new contacts  Create compelling email copy and other marketing collateral to secure new business meetings for our account servicing team Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Identify new business opportunities and growth opportunities within the existing organisations we work with, to support with business growth Work effectively with co-workers, clients and others by sharing thoughts and ideas in a constructive and positive manner  Must have  An understanding of the marketing/creative agency space The ability to understand our potentials client’s customers needs to generate enticing ideas and materials to secure meetings An understanding of CRM’s (Hubspot or Salesforce) to manage leads The ability to proactively research market trends and build compelling copy to drive interest in the business through email communications A passion for trends in the marketing industry and the ability to spot trends relevant to distillery’s core offering Confidence and creativity in selling our proposition A collaborative approach to work Excellent written and spoken English Highly organised, proactive and efficient using tools such as Slack and Asana Understanding of video production, social media and collaborating with social, video and content teams Interest in the tech space and B2B marketing Must be technically literate and proficient  Nice to have skills Experience of working in a startup or small business environment  REPORTING  Line Manager: Reports to the Account Management team  WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU We offer a collaborative, fun working environment with a great team (if we do say so ourselves!)  Please note we are currently working remotely and will be moving to a flexible working setup in the future when the time is right.  If this sounds like your ideal role, apply today. We value diversity and are committed to creating a “bring your whole self to work” culture.  Please note this is a full time role based in Singapore.  You can learn more about our work and culture here: www.wearedistillery.co

Compensation 3k to 3.0k  Introduction We are looking for a self-driven and multidisciplinary individual to join our expanding team. It's a good time to join us because we are still small (around 20 peeps), hence very close-knitted and vibrant; everything you do has discernible growth impact -- a rare and quite satisfying combination.  Founded in 2017, Grey and Sanders is a fast-growing Singaporean furniture brand. We carry high quality furniture that tells a story, which we hope can spark interesting conversations in your home. We don't aim to sell furniture for the sake of selling them for money. We aim to bring to our customers' homes unique, great-looking, and long-lasting furniture without breaking banks. We deliver satisfaction, honesty, and money's worth for our customers.  This management associate role is a preparatory position for bigger roles and responsibilities where performance requirements are met.  Requirements • Meticulous • Conscientious • Team player • Friendly • Responsible • Proactive, taking initiatives • Only Singaporeans / PR may apply  Responsibilities/Job Description • Learn on-the-job the various roles and requirements to run a sales team • Learn the essence of driving sales through handling customers and convert sales leads • Handle customers through online channels such as Whatsapp, Social Media etc • Identify areas of improvement and directly assist the management team with defining sales standards to drive higher sales • Work towards filling leadership roles by exhibiting proactivity, taking initiatives, and exercising leadership  You will like it with us if • You like fast career progression, through shorter performance review intervals, and an open culture on expectations. • You like to work in a flat hierarchy. • You like to propose ideas and be engaged in discussions to air your views. • You thrive in a collaborative environment with friendly competition.  Qualifications • Degree holder. Individuals without a degree but with relevant track record may be considered.  Other Details • 5-day work week: 4 Weekday + 1 Weekend • Working hours: 9am-6pm • Central location

Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Enterprise Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to enterprise companies? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As an Enterprise Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping our prospective customers navigate and enter the cryptocurrency market with your knowledge and understanding of our product and compliance and regulatory environments.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you’ll do: Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota  Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: Can understand the customer’s business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Our ideal candidate has: 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to Financial Services Borderline obsession with emerging technology  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Tableau, a Salesforce Company  Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  What You’ll Be Doing…  The Account Executive is responsible for driving sales of Tableau products within the Small and Medium sized businesses (SMB) in Singapore market. This role manages all aspects of the sales process including prospecting, lead management, qualification, product demonstrations, evaluation, close and account care. This is a quota‐carrying sales position that requires a high volume of activities and plays an integral role in the success of the overall sales team.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Define and execute territory sales plans and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the SMB business Develop and manage sales pipeline – prospect and assess new sales potential while moving a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline Conduct a high-volume of activities with customers including calls, emails, demos, webinars Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering Provide initial product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff Participate in team‐building and company‐growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care. Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts. Who You Are… Experienced. You have at least 2+ years of direct sales experience, preferably in high volume, transactional sales of technology or services in Singapore market. Amazing Salesperson. You have a desire, even an obsession, to bring / expand customers into the Tableau franchise and maximize revenue. You have the ability to develop and manage a sales pipeline with a proven track record of handling and closing a large number of transactions simultaneously. Technically Savvy. You don’t shy away from opportunities to get into technology – and you can learn it quickly. Go-Getter. You are willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful. Mission-Driven. You “get it” and understand Tableau’s mission deeply in some way. You believe Tableau will become one of the most important technology companies in the world, you want to be a contributing member of a winning sales team, and you want to have fun all the way. Effective Communicator. You are clear and persuasive in verbal and written English communications with highly effective use of email and telephone. Cross-Cultural. You have experience relating to customers from a variety of countries. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world. Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc.  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

We are expanding our presence across AMEA (Asia Middle East and Africa) and we are looking to hire for Sales Lead/ Senior Sales Lead in the following regions: Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and Singapore.  Job Description: Responsible for revenue targets on a quarter / annual basis for the assigned portfolio and territory Establish and maintain current and new customer relationships and work closely with internal stakeholders to facilitate a positive customer experience Work closely with Commercial Director and / or distributors to develop and implement selling strategies to win greater market share for assigned portfolio. Engage key customers on through technical discussion, presentations etc to win deals and accelerate revenue growth for the portfolio Provide accurate forecasting of revenue on a monthly / quarterly / annual basis Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing activities and expand current customer base in assigned territory to drive revenue growth Support the marketing team in the planning and implementation of relevant campaigns, promotions and events to drive greater awareness and generate leads for our portfolio  Requirements: Master degree or PhD major in Medicine (preferred), Biology, Biotechnology or equivalent. Minimum 2 years-experience in academic research area. NGS industry experience is a plus. Familiar with Australia, Japan, Hong Kong and Singapore market will be treated as value add. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Alliances & Channels Job Details  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work for six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  We are looking for a highly motivated team leader to join the Alliances and Channel Sales Go-To-Market team to work with all partner types Global SIs, Regional SIs and Resellers in the ASEAN region and will be responsible for delivering revenue growth, leading and growing a high-performing organisation, and owning the development of the partner ecosystem in support of customer outcomes. As a key member of the ASEAN Alliances and Channels leadership team, this role will partner closely with Salesforce’s direct sales, marketing, customer success, solution engineering, services, and partner enablement teams to drive market coverage, new growth opportunities, co-selling, reselling and co-delivery to scale customer success and adoption.  The ideal candidate will have a track record of delivering new business growth through alliances and channels partners while continuously scaling the caliber and quality of the Salesforce ecosystem practices. Expectations include providing leadership and management of the diverse ASEAN partner sales team including hiring, coaching, mentorship, and performance management.  Key Responsibilities The RVP Partner Sales, ASEAN will be responsible for setting and executing Salesforce’s partner strategy in the region. Report directly into the ASEAN Alliances and Channels leader and be an active member of the A&C ASEAN leadership team. Lead the ASEAN partner ecosystem vision and strategy, including go to market, practice enablement, hiring and development, and operations in support of Salesforce’s growth and customer success goals. Thrive in challenging and unprecedented times; motivate and inspire a team that is temporarily working remotely; anticipate market changes and act on them quickly. Manage joint business territory plans with our Sales Teams to maximise partner impact in the market. Build sufficient partner pipeline to meet the partner growth and partner contribution targets. Ensure partner coverage and capacity in the market. Evangelise internally and externally of partner leverage model, co-sell, resell and joint go to market. Maintain key senior relationships with the Sales team to develop and implement strategies for expanding the company’s customer base. Provide leadership and strategy with internal cross-functional stakeholders to create synergies with sales, marketing, partner enablement, services, customer success. Establish trusted relationships across executive leadership functions including; product management, industry marketing, recruiting, and finance. Manage a dispersed and diverse partner team, including frequent travel (as appropriate/allowed). Qualifications & Experience 2nd line leadership experience leading teams in strategic partner/customer engagements Strong track record of managing developing and retaining a high performing, sales-driven organization Proven relationships with key stakeholders in the ASEAN ecosystem Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals with great success in driving sales growth 10+ years in technology software and/or applications sales (ideally in a CRM, ERP and/or B2B software company), engaged at the CxO level Ability to provide thought leadership on the APAC partner team Proven track record of building satisfied, loyal and referenceable customers in both sales and partners Proven success working within a highly matrixed organization and establishing strong relationships across all functions Strategic enterprise experience and revenue achievement selling multiple enterprise software offerings Experience selling cloud-based enterprise applications is strongly preferred Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Reporting directly to the Marketing Manager, he or she will work closely with the sales team to achieve top line sales and bottom line profitability of agency lines.  Responsibilities:-  Principal management, including attending and presenting business reviews with Principals agencies and portfolio management. Implements and drives brand/segment strategies to optimize sales, margins, market-share, and penetration, in line with overall strategic business objectives. Develop and execute brand plans for all assigned brands / products to achieve growth objectives and financial targets; communicate brand objectives, strategies, and activation plans through active coordination with eCommerce partners, internal and external stakeholders. Creates and drives effective channel and field force strategy and plans with direct collaboration with the Sales Manager Ability and agility to take on new product ranges, new product launches and business expansion opportunities, as deemed fit for market expansion. To work closely with regulatory team to ensure product information on marketing collaterals are compliance to company guidelines and principal requirements. Prepare and plan product forecasts and constantly monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal supply  To ensure SOP and compliance guidelines are followed by all personnel concerned. To ensure KPIs are met and reports are submitted timely. To ensure speed to market for new launches as well as distribution expansion. To achieve departmental and company’s objectives.  Requirements: Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or Sciences with marketing management knowledge. At least 3 years of related working experience in pharmaceutical, biomedical sciences or medical devices industry Innovative & resourceful person that thinks out of the box to deliver creative and cost-effective branding strategies Versatile, result-oriented, energetic / dynamic personality & passionate about branding Excellent communicator both verbally & in writing

description: About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  A key position in the Regional APAC sales team and has primary responsibility for achievement sales targets through the implementation of sales strategies driven from a local territory sales and go to market plan. This role is a Business Development Role, focused on New Business / Logo’s only.  Key Responsibilities  Achieve New Business sales wins to exceed target supported by local cross functional support teams and the Sales Director Provide insight and plan effective sales campaigns together with a skilled Pre-Sales team, Marketing and Inside Sales teams to operate successfully in competitive bid scenarios Proactively address the Indonesian market to expand the brand reach and achieve a high rate of meetings, demonstrations, workshops, quotes and proposals Maintain four times your Annual quota in Pipeline with New Business opportunities by working closely with Marketing, Inside Sales our In-country Partners by and Sales support teams by establishing relationships with primary alliance partners and identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline Skillfully negotiate profitable contract agreements for license, consulting and support services Provide leadership in client relations to set the company head and shoulders above the competition Leverage existing business relationships with decision makers, executives and key players in the banking and financial services sectors Provide leadership in client relationship management, address clients’ business needs and constraints. Build long-term relationships and referrals with senior managers and key opinion leaders in the banking and financial services sectors.  Skills & Experience  Proficient in both spoken and written English and local language i.e. Malay, Indonesian, Thai A high-caliber individual with the right breadth and depth of experience, strong credential, influence within the financial arena in Indonesia with the focus and acumen to cultivate profitable and lasting customer relationships Proven track record of leading and achieving “big ticket” sales to exceed targets in the banking and financial services software industry with substantial relevant experience within the same domain Minimum 7-10 years Sales and New Business Development experience in a banking software company or related companies (e.g. local Software Industry) Confident in operating at “C level” and can demonstrate strong sales and negotiating skills with key decision makers Must have the presence together with strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to establish interest, trust and credibility Has mastered technical and business skills required to accomplish the job Good general understanding of banking operations and relevant processes (front, middle, back office) with a reasonable understanding of IT infrastructures and implementation approaches from both functional and technical perspectives Self-motivated, ambitious, independent, organized, focused and able to multi-task Can work independently and in a collaborative nature Willing to travel on a frequent basis  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

jobTitle: Account Manager, Apps, E-Commerce, Entertainment, Large Customer Sales - Singapore
description: The area: Large Customer Sales (LCS)  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  The role: Account Manager, Apps, E-Commerce, Entertainment, Large Customer Sales - Singapore  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Additional Role Description  As an Account Manager, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions to some of Google's partners. You'll drive and grow new and existing business with Google’s advertisers by discussing and program managing the execution of Joint Business Plans across various Google products and services, regions and stakeholders. In this role, you will build strategic partnerships to help grow businesses. You’ll contribute to and execute on the team’s strategic annual plan.  Responsibilities Manage and develop relationships with our customers, including educating them on digital and Google’s products. Educate the market on Google’s advertising solutions. Contribute strategically to the growth and direction of Google’s products and services. Coordinate a cast of Google teams internally to deliver excellent service and information to help our customers achieve their business goals. Report on business figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical. Analyze data, trends and client performance, develop solid strategic plans, prepare and conduct strategic pitches and consultative presentations. Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities, provide campaign updates and ensure that advertisers are satisfied. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience in advertising business and media account management. Preferred Qualifications Online business and account management experience. Experience in advertising, digital marketing, consulting or media specific industry. Knowledge of traditional and digital media and its business landscape. Ability to work with evolving and emerging products. Ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment. Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Director of Sales (Position located in Singapore)
description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  To learn more about our team and office culture in Singapore, Singapore, visit the following links.  Careers Page: https://www.knowbe4.com/careers/locations/singapore  Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.com/Location/KnowBe4-Singapore-Location-EI_IE969384.0,7_IL.8,17_IC3235921.htm  The Director of Sales (Asia Pacific and Canary Islands) is responsible for managing, monitoring, debugging, and analyzing the statistics of Account Managers and Channel Managers. This position will make a direct impact on KnowBe4’s strategic success by driving the revenue-generating activities and identifying opportunities to improve sales techniques and process inefficiencies to increase productivity.  Responsibilities Hire, fire, discipline, and/or promote Account Managers and Channel Managers, when necessary Assist Account Managers in closing deals and pushing to get in closed deals Assist Channel Managers in building partner sales engagements and closing deals with partners Develop, implement, and manage sales strategies for the region Create and manage standing offers for the region Monitor and analyze team and subordinate employee statistics Maintain accurate reporting and pipeline management Partner with Sales Performance Coaches to set up coaching for team members who need coaching and implement strategy to improve sales performance and efficiency including drilling, daily task planning, etc. Prioritize workload and direct the activities of Account Managers Meet with reps for Monthly Pipeline Reviews to ensure forecast accuracy and sales goal achievement Issue Disciplinary and/or Coaching Actions needed to increase production Conduct onsite visits with Enterprise customers for Face to Face demonstrations Attend Company Marketing Events Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Preferred but not required 5+ years managing sales teams, developing sales and partner strategies, debugging sales statistics and sale reps Experience with Gmail and Google Docs Experience with MS Office (Word and Excel) Experience with web browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer, etc.) Experience managing and or coaching/training employees Experience in Enterprise level account sales Ability to read/review and interpret statistics of an area Strong verbal and written communications Excellent time management and organization skills Strong Sales skills Coaching abilities Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.
