description: Be part of something revolutionary We have a vision. Our Digital Brain, o9’s AI-powered platform, is being used by global enterprises to drive their digital transformations. The integrated planning and operational efficiencies we provide are helping businesses do more, be more and mean more to the world at large. Because businesses plan better, reduce waste, creating value for themselves and the planet.  But we also have a vision for our people. We want the most talented, committed, and driven people to power our transformative approach. In return, we’ll provide a nurturing environment where you can be a part of something special.  The ideal candidate will develop relationships with key accounts to maximize revenue and client retention. You act as a consultant by developing account strategies that provide the greatest opportunities to drive revenue.   Responsibilities Provide general sales support (needs analysis, data review, and product demonstrations) Serve as the customer advocate and liaison for product management and development Prepare periodic forecasts and progress updates toward sales goals  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business 3+ years' of sales consulting or business intelligence experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work  What we’ll do for you…   Competitive salary  Tech tools: Complementary laptop.  Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Friday Socials. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person.  Food and drink: Enjoy healthy snacks, fresh fruit, teas, and coffees on us.  Flat organization: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics).  Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day.  Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.   Employee Testimonial…  What I like most about o9 is that I get to work with some of the smartest people in the industry. Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow. At the same time, everyone is friendly, helpful, and fun to be around.   More about us… With its recent Unicorn status, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing AI-powered digital transformation companies in the world today. Our high energy environment drives us to grow and aim 10x. It’s this drive that has made us leaders of Gartner’s S& OP Magic Quadrant.  The o9 platform, or “digital brain”, is the premier AI-powered, the cloud-based platform behind the digital transformations of major global enterprises. These include Google, Walmart, and Starbucks, among others.  Our headquarters are located in Dallas, and we currently have offices in Amsterdam, Barcelona, London, Paris, Tokyo, and Seoul.  o9 is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Why You'll Love Cisco  We change the World, you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything. Here, that means we take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired!  What You'll Do  Cisco is seeking a Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive and address market opportunities with a proven track record of optimally driving the strategy, operation strategy, process consulting, high level architecture of sales in the market.  The BDM will bring expertise in leading and delivering sales growth in the Service  Provider market segment. You will possess deep knowledge and subject matter expertise in this area and will provide instant credibility - both internally and externally.  You will help transform customers' new business and technology architectures, and will be responsible for leading Cisco's drive into the marketplace, providing creative sales leadership and driving the expansion of the client base.  You will collaborate across global teams, and program manage complex, global initiatives. You are a problem solver with experience in risk and issue management, escalation, and resolution. You provide constructive coaching and feedback to all levels within the team as vital  You will have a variety of objectives and responsibilities to develop Cisco's Vertical Go To Market capabilities, including the following Lead service business proposals, especially for professional service and managed service, which needs cross architecture solutioning, detailed scoping, service level definition, and coordination with delivery members. Lead commercial scheme building, including quoting and SOW building with defined service scope and service level Build customer’s executive level relationships, jointly with the account team, understand the business priorities, and position the best Cisco service solutions to solve business challenges With holistic understanding of service providers system architecture, work with cross-functional groups (sales, product management, delivery, operations, marketing) to develop service strategy, lead opportunity creation, and support presales activities for service provider customer Actively engage global BDM community, to share standard methodologies and customer case study.  Who You Are You have more than 12 years of experience in business development/strategy/consulting, with an understanding of sales, with at least 5 solid years in the technology industry You are skilled at building presentation materials, proposals, case studies as well as at presenting towards external clients You are proficient in Service Provider, Data Center, Security and IT architecture (service providers platforms, networking, mobility, programmability, automation, virtualization, security, computing, endpoints, cloud services) You are an active learner, and a fantastic communicator You have strong performance as an individual contributor and are able to make a positive impact in a team environment You are ideally tuned in with Cisco’s product offering  Why Cisco  At Cisco, each person brings their different talents to work as a team and make a difference.  Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.  We connect everything - people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.  We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more.  We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Tech savvy. Existing network of sustainability e-stores. Proficiency with one or several SEA languages.

Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  ServiceNow is looking for a high achieving Commercial Inside Sales Representative ("Commercial ISR") to join our expanding Inside Sales team. You have a track record in new business pipeline generation through to close, over the phone. The Commercial ISR will produce new business sales revenue from software licenses within Small and Midsize Business (SMB) and Mid-Market accounts for clients with less than 1,000 employees in a defined geographic territory. This will be achieved through territory planning, including researching prospect customers, using business development strategies and completing field-based sales activities within an assigned territory.  Performers within the Inside Sales Team have gone on to excel in many different roles at ServiceNow.  What You Get To Do In This Role  The Commercial ISR builds relationships with clients while achieving quarterly and annual sales quotas for an assigned territory. Lead and nurture your sales opportunities and manage your territory Run sales from start to finish where the average sales cycle is 4-6 months Make a difference within a growing team and company Communicate accurate information to your management such as forecasting, territory plans, goals, etc. Build healthy business relationships to support customer adoption Partner with a team to collectively achieve success (solutions consultants, sales operations, field leadership and product line specialists) Qualifications  To be successful in this role you have: 1+ years of experience in a direct or support role on a software or solution sales team Experience in Business-to-Business sales (B2B) Experience establishing trusted relationships with current and prospective clients and other teams An understanding of the sales process, with the ability to progress and manage complex sales cycles Experience communicating with CxO personas Travel for training or meetings may occasionally be required FD21  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.  For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.  Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.

What will you do?  The Business Development Manager is a field sales position responsible for both capital equipment and consumable sales in Genetic Science Division (GSD) / Clinical Science Division (CSD). The position manages the sales of a strategic product portfolio in an assigned geography in accordance with approved sales and marketing plans. The Business Development Manager will comprehend and utilize product features, benefits and applications accompanied with selling and business building skills to successfully promote and consummate the sale of Company products and services to achieve or exceed the assigned territory/business area sales plan. The Business Development Manager will also be the primary focus driver and drive the strategic plan with local Technical Sales Specialist (TSS) or Sales Team to penetrate and grow the new business. The Business Development Manager will be recognized as a business development leader within the sales force that drives strategic objectives and adoption of new products.  This position is responsible for the Animal Health and Agrigenomics applications across the GSD and CSD product portfolios in SEATW.  Pre-sales support Develop the strategic plans for new business or focus area. Conduct the new business training and provide clear position of products for sales and support team Cooperate with local team to drive sales activities and opportunities identified by sales leadership to meet or exceed revenue goals. Develop and design the workflow selling strategies for new business. Set up the reference labs with local team to drive the incremental growth Demonstrate use of advanced selling skills in the field, such as making good opening statements, connecting with the customer, asking high gain questions, creating the value proposition and closing. Has proven solution and big deal selling skills. Cooperate with marketing team to drive new focus through events or workshops. Account, Products and Market management Establish the targeted numbers of KOLs or reference labs at assigned territories for the new business Consistently follow-up with local team to ensure the adoption of technology Timely gather feedbacks from the KOLs or reference labs to be able to fix with local team or escalation to global product management team Cooperate with marketing team to drive new focus through events or workshops. Constantly develop product knowledge through company literature and other independent sources of technical information. Obtain and report information of market trends, competitive promotions and other activities from the market that may aid the sales and marketing activity. Communication Provide comprehensive information on all activities to Sales leaders, Sales Representatives and TSS in supported territories and regions. Timely conduct calls with global product management team in order to fulfill the new business needs. Coordinate the regional calls or actively provide the oral and written communication of successes, failures, best practices etc to improve the overall operating efficiency of the team, region and sales organization. Meets with external customers in government, university, commercial and veterinary clinic laboratories. Meets with contacts within the veterinary and livestock industry to drive new business. How will you get here?  Education Bachelor Degree level or aboveBiotech, Vet Science is highly desirable) Experience 3+ years relevant industry experience NGS, qPCR/CE/Microarray experience preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Strategic selling and market development ability Well developed written and verbal communication skills Professional presentation Self-management Proven time management Strategic and tactical market development skills. Presentation skills that can be utilized internally and in the marketplace.

description: About The Company  StaffAny’s mission is to shape and empower the future of work. We provide our users with a remedy that streamlines and automates their painful Operations and HR processes. Our users rely on our superpowers to understand their frustrations, and we are here to empower them to make time for what they love.  About The Role  The VP of Sales is responsible for the company’s revenue growth goals and is accountable for building a high performing sales team that can consistently achieve its goals. As one of the key leaders in the sales department, you should be leading from the front and nurturing the sales leaders of tomorrow. You must want to build the best SAAS sales team in SEA. This position directly reports to the CRO.  You are Passionate in leading and proven leader and coach with experience in hiring, scaling and managing sales teams. A firm believer in data and predictability You are someone familiar with saas metrics and its benchmark, such as CAC, LTV, time to close, sales efficiency etc. You are able to measure, manage and improve such metrics to improve the overall unit economics of the company Hunger and desire to learn. Constantly be up to date with sales frameworks and management best practices. You have strong experience in consultative sales and can prospect and manage senior-level relationships. Experienced in building a sales team from 1 to 10 and 10 to 30 A proven sales hunter and closer with more than 7 years of experience in B2B Saas sales and a strong track record in exceeding personal targets. More than 3 years of experience in B2B sales leadership roles (Bonus) Experienced in growing teams in SEA (i.e. Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia) (Bonus) Experienced in HR/ Productivity solutions for the F&B/Retail/ blue-collar industry. You will find yourself Recruiting The hiring of key sales team talent, including talent career planning and talent pipeline. Developing and maintaining a strong sales culture focused on creating a world-class team aligned to StaffAny’s mission and values. Advising reps on their current deals Managing, coaching, training and inspiring the sales team in a consultative sales process to deliver individual and team targets. Coming up with incentive plans that align both the company and the individual Supporting team members in their day-to-day sales activity, ensuring effective win strategies, HubSpot forecasting and pipeline management. Overall management of sales team activity Team pipelines (weekly reviews, mentoring, and identify obstacles which you can help them overcome. Work to accelerate time to close) Ensure adoption of CRM (HubSpot) and that all reporting is done on time Regularly review individual performance, ensure everyone’s time is used properly Optimising the sales process and tactics Review sales funnel to develop and implement strategies to address key friction points in the sales process, enhance conversion rates and ensure pipeline coverage. Utilise CRM solution to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates along with predictable and precise sales forecasts Defining strategy Executing and refining existing sales strategies/models into new territories or markets. Partnering with Marketing and Country Launchers to refine the go-to-market strategy, including reviewing the territories and target account planning. Collaborate with Product to decide on the product roadmap Collaborate with Customer Success to expand accounts and minimise churn. Closing business Being an ambassador for StaffAny and building the StaffAny brand in Singapore, including representing StaffAny at HR events. Taking on negotiations and closing of key deals Accountable for personal sales quotas based on corporate revenue goals. The offer The opportunity to lay the foundations to scale a sales team to 20-30 The opportunity to set up processes and take charge of the entire shape of the Sales team. Craft and refine a multi-region sales playbook. A front-row seat at a hypergrowth startup as we scale to 5m in ARR. Work closely with the founders and other senior management as we craft our strategy and forge the future of hourly work. Be part of a fast-paced growth environment that always stretches you and forces you to be slightly uncomfortable. Work with talented, intense and motivated colleagues in a dynamic and vibrant environment. Apply to us here: https://www.staffany.com/careers

description: We are looking for Sales and Marketing Associates that can help tackle our client’s business problems, while learning the skills to grow your career. You’ll get to work in diverse and nimble team where you have a say and can make a difference. WHO YOU ARE (We like this!) Willing and Coachable. You’re open to new ideas and trying things out to see what works and what doesn’t.  You love feedback, make smart adjustments based off it, and realize that is the main way you can improve at what you do.  You are self-aware. Enjoys building relationships. You’ve been able to handle the jive and deal with all types of people. Passionate. Whatever you love, you can talk for hours on it. You get excited when someone mentions your favourite things. Optimistic and Resilient. You know after a “No” there could be a “Yes”, and negative responses don’t bring you down. You are the king/queen of follow up and always work hard. Creative. You challenge the way people think and look for better and more efficient ways of doing things Great Communicator. You are concise and can also explain intricate details in a simple and easy to understand way. Curious. You are a sponge and learning is fun to you. You ask lots of questions and want to develop your skill-set and knowledge base. WHO YOU ARE NOT (We don’t like this so much…) Someone who requires hand-holding. You should be able to think for yourself and be able to make decisions - even if they don’t have the outcome you were expecting. You learn from those mistakes. Rigid. You can adapt to whatever is thrown at you and think change is fun. You operate well in a fast-paced environment and are a self-starter. Someone who is not interested in sales for the foreseeable future. You are ready to grow your career, and while you may not be in sales for the rest of your life, you see this role as a stepping stone, not a placeholder. Average. You have grit. You set an internal quota higher than the one we give. You fail. A lot. But it’s because you set your goals high and push yourself hard. RESPONSIBILITY & OBJECTIVE (Prospect & Follow-up) Make a good first impression and be initial point of contact with prospects Generate interest, respond, engage, and qualify leads to create sales-ready opportunities Hold engaging conversations through face to face meetings, outbounds calls, email, and social mediums Be able to react to and overcome objections and competitive questions You’ll be expected to work your territory weekday business hours of 830am-5pm, but we’re flexible for those dentist appointments. We provide the opportunity to occasionally travel to attend networking events and workshops, so pack your bags. We promise to help you build your skills and foundation in sales to provide value for the rest of your career.  You’ll use our own tool to make you marketable and develop your talent for your next role.

jobTitle: Account Executive, Mid Market Sales - Slack
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For...  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales team and focus on our Mid Market customers in Singapore. This segment represents a huge opportunity for Slack and we want someone who is eager to do the best work of their lives while supporting others in doing the same.  You will be responsible for driving the sales process with prospective customers as well as the expansion of existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You’ll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback. If you enjoy working with customers from a variety of industries in a rapidly changing environment, then come and join us!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Manage multiple customers simultaneously at various stages of the Slack buying cycle Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to existing customers Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product Who You Are ... You have 3+ years relevant work experience in an account management or sales role, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions You have a proven track record of managing large scale accounts for the duration of the sales cycle and beyond You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have excellent written and verbal communication skills About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Joining GUAVA is an opportunity to build a meaningful career in a growing market leading organization that is creating scalable sustainable impact around the world. We believe in working together as team towards a positive betterment of all our stakeholders: clients, employees, partners, communities and the environment. Despite the ongoing pandemic, our company is still actively working and innovating to expand to new regions and territories.  Career Highlight Meaningful career in a fast growing market leader organisation, with opportunities to grow, develop and make a difference Dynamic and supportive team culture with work-life balance, working alongside some of largest and most prestigious names in the various fields we serve Attractive remuneration and new office environment with plenty of amenities nearby as well as good transport connectivity  Job Brief We are looking for confident individuals who are passionate and committed about helping our clients solve their problems with our solutions, believe in developing long term relationships with all our stakeholders, and willing to go the extra mile to demonstrate their commitment. Corporate Sales Executive responsibilities include discovering and developing new sales prospects, negotiating deals and maintaining customer satisfaction. If you are a good listener and pride yourself in establishing a good rapport with clients; feel comfortable reaching out to potential customers to demonstrate our services and products through email, phone and face to face meetings, we’d like to meet you.  Responsibilities Conduct market research to identify business opportunities and anticipate market needs Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking and social media Set up meetings with potential clients and listening to their needs and concerns Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services Ensure the availability of samples for sales meetings and demonstrations Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences Ensuring timely responses to enquiries & quotation requests, providing and maintain high clientele satisfaction Collaborate with team members to achieve target results Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal team Any other duties as assigned by Management.  Requirements Proven experience as a Corporate Sales Executive or relevant role Proficiency in English Excellent knowledge of MS Office Hands-on experience with CRM software is a plus Fast learner and passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach and attention to detail Preferably a Diploma or a Business Degree Holder
industries: Hospitality

jobTitle: Regional Key Account Manager, APAC - High Tech
description: The Regional Key Account Manager, APAC – High-Tech is responsible for leading the development of the assigned strategic Global Accounts in the High-Tech Market. He/she is also responsible for leading the Country Key Account Managers (KAMs) to drive business opportunities and support the assigned clients. The incumbent is also expected to work closely with the Global Account Managers to develop and grow the wallet share of business for GEODIS.  Roles and Responsibilities  1. Account Management Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Ensure increased consistency of services and pricing linked to “integrated solutions” Grow the share of business, as well as expand the relationships within the customer identifying influencers, gatekeepers, decision makers within the region of APAC but also to direct and align with Global and Regional KAM’s to further penetrate the client organization Deploy a strong consultative selling approach with assigned accounts to identify their supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for Geodis Proactively managed and resolved account issues using continuous improvement principles to enhance service levels Improve client satisfaction based on formal feedback and surveys of your customers  2. Business Development (BD) Determine the strategies for the selected Global Accounts Ensure development of cross selling in Asia Build the wallet share of business for GEODIS with this customer AND its subsidiaries or affiliates Provide support & leadership to APAC BDs to develop business within portfolio of assigned clients Participate to the VM Activities by supporting presentations to prospects and other clients and showcasing best practices & innovative solutions from your accounts Work with Regional VM manager to develop standardized offering from the customized solutions deployed on your customer Engage with Regional VM manager, product stakeholders, IT & management teams to create value adding service offerings that can be taken back to your clients  3. Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report management information Use CRM for all RFQ’s and Meetings Track key indicators such as volume, revenue, gross profit, manage yield Gather and provide to the company feedback on competitor information through your ongoing contact with strategic customers assigned to your care Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested  4. Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for assigned portfolio of accounts and strategic targets Manage pipeline size and quality  5. Leadership Steer, develop and motivate the country KAM’s to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients Regional and Country Customer cards in place and used to drive opportunities, innovations & growth strategy Hands on Management of the accounts across all APAC countries using all standardized tools: QBR deck, Issue Log, Communication and Escalation Matrix, Monthly report and ensuring same are maintained by country KAMs  *KPI for RKAM is accumulated result of the country KAMs  Education Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in related field  Work Experience Strong Sales or Business Development experience in Supply Chain Management and Freight Forwarding Minimum 10 years relevant experience in sales field with at least 3 years senior management position Experience in key account management role managing Retail or Retail sector customers Experience in working in regional role, with regional or sub-regional client scope is an advantage  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure? Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Sales, and Business Development
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Our Client: As one of the biggest SIs in Singapore, our client is a leader within ICT with a regional presence to help governments and enterprises to realise the business value through the innovative use of technology and digital transformation. With a diverse team of experts, they are harnessing the power of technology to deliver the latest technologies, develop new ideas, and drive transformation across their clients in APAC.  Job Responsibilities: • The Sales Lead (Public Sector) will be responsible for building and leading the team to handle the entire sales cycle which includes prospecting, account penetration, portfolio growth, supervising sales activity, planning, and closing sales opportunities in the assigned sector / industry. • You will be responsible for managing and building business relationships with clients, acting as a trusted advisor specializing in customized solutions and services. • You are required to work closely with different functional teams across the organisation in order to provide a one-stop experience for clients.  The Successful Applicant: • The successful candidate should have a degree in a related field in IT or engineering. • You should have a minimum of 10 years of experience doing business development in the IT or ICT services industry, and a minimum of 5 years of sales experience focusing on a key account in Education. • You should have a deep understanding of the industry to enhance client relationships. • The Sales Lead will be required to have a proven track record and good business acumen to exceed sales targets.  If you are looking for a role where you can contribute effectively, please apply below or contact Stefanie Fong at sfong@morganmckinley.com for a confidential discussion.  Morgan McKinley Pte Ltd Stefanie Fong EA Licence No: 11C5502 Registration No: R2199215

description: About The Company  An exciting opportunity for an APAC Sales Director with a privately owned US based enterprise software multinational has recently become available. Our client has its regional headquarter based in Singapore, they are a mid sized business, market leader in their segment and have been growing double digit year after year.  They have a great corporate culture, are agile, fast paced and entrepreneurial. Asia Pacific is a key investment focus area for them and are looking for a driven individual to lead their regional business.  About The Job  This position is the most senior role in the region, reports to the Global Head of Sales based in the US and you will be in charge of leading the commercial teams across Asia Pacific. They have an established business with presence across India, Japan, South East Asia and ANZ with country sales, presales and delivery teams that will be under your supervision.  This role’s major accountability is to grow their business by building a successful sales organization and support with business development activities.  You will also be responsible for their go to market strategy, alliances.  Skills & Experience Required The ideal candidate will have at least 10 years of sales leadership experience from an enterprise software multinational You should also have a proven track record of leading sales teams in small or mid sized corporations. You are familiar with the Asia Pacific region. You have excellent communication and critical thinking abilities. To apply online please use the apply function, alternatively you may contact Sharan Kaur at 6510 1464  (EA: 94C3609/ R2196967)

Within the Core Sales team, the Core Sales Digital Business Developer will work with business stakeholders to build and test PoCs across products and businesses, owning the development, implementation and evaluation process end to end. This role lends itself to the quick learner, strong coder and big dreamer. Where successful, propose and manage production level project Manage project lifecycle from planning, resourcing, implementation, and evaluation Work with internal resources (sales, technology, innovation labs, controls) to ensure that all projects are delivered on-time Work with internal data owners to increase data quality and availability for smaller clients Qualifications: Previous experience in data analysis Basic understanding of financial markets Preferred Qualifications: Beginner/Intermediate level understanding of one or more coding language (Python) Demonstrated understanding of applying Machine Learning techniques to real world challenges -------------------------------------------------  Job Family Group:  Institutional Sales  -------------------------------------------------  Job Family:  Investor Sales  ------------------------------------------------------  Time Type:  Full time  ------------------------------------------------------  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. description: LiveU is seeking to hire a sports business development manager to join our growing team in Asia to develop new business opportunities for LiveU products and solutions in the sports production market.  You will be responsible for growing LiveU business in the sports market in APAC by identifying new opportunities, developing and executing business plans, managing customer relations, meeting business goals, and coordinating the sales process with regional sales managers, sales engineers, support operations and marketing.  About LiveU  LiveU is market leader for live news and dynamic sports coverage, with flawless 5G, 4K HEVC live streaming and remote production. Together with its cloud-based management and next-gen IP distribution platforms, LiveU offers the most cost-effective end-to-end contribution, production and distribution solution.  The inventor and innovator of cellular bonding, the Company is synonymous with high-quality live video solutions, transmitted from anywhere in the world. LiveU creates a consistent bandwidth and a reliable connection so you can acquire, manage and distribute high-quality remote live broadcasts.  With over 3,000 customers in 130+ countries, LiveU’s technology is the solution of choice for global broadcasters, news agencies, sports and entertainment, streaming live video to TV, mobile, online and social media.  Location: Singapor  Reporting to: LiveU APAC GM  Responsibilities Hold the responsibility for LiveU sales quota for sports market in APAC Independently build a large pipeline of leads to drive sports sales cycle Drive sales and partnership efforts with sports customers and partners by providing information on the platform and technological capabilities including use cases, case studies and market potential Initiate and manage regional activities including seminars, webinars, training and roadshows to promote LiveU solutions to the relevant customers Iterate on product market-fit through detailed knowledge of the products, solutions and customer needs Design and drive Go-To-Market strategies in collaboration with the regional sales directors, product and marketing department Interact with the regional sales directors and partners to effectively manage client expectations and meet company sales targets. Requirements Degree in relevant field At least 5 years of experience selling solutions in the sports Broadcast, online video or Sports productions Possession of customer relationships in APAC are preferred Deep knowledge of the sports industry and broadcast markets in APAC Demonstrated history of sales achievements including growing sales and development of new business Good technical understanding and ability to explain complex solutions and discuss technical features in detail Excellent verbal, written, communication, and presentation skills in English. Additional Asian languages advantage Independent, self-driven, creative, initiator, “can-do!” attitude Ability and willingness to travel extensively
industries: Broadcast Media

Positive attitude and willingness to learn. Able to work independently in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision.

The prime responsibility of the director will be to increase company revenue and profit by developing and implementing long-term growth strategies. The ideal candidate has strong experience in B2C e-commerce, leading cross-functional teams, and exposure to working with various teams such as digital marketing, product management, and merchandising.  Responsibilities Develop long-term cross-functional growth strategies Analyze existing product usage to inform future growth plans. Take ownership of growth-oriented KPIs Developing and managing strategic partnerships to grow business. Work with the product team to devise strategies for product-led growth Conduct monthly and quarterly reviews to find sources for growth Assessing marketing and sales as well as supplier and vendor operations and recommending improvements as needed Lead and mentor other team members Researching emerging trends and devise new company offerings Requirements 5+ years experience in B2C e-commerce Proven record of driving revenue growth at scale Strong business acumen Exceptional leadership and management skills

description: Description  We are a growing group of 140+ talented people, spread over three continents and united by one common mission: To improve efficiency in shipping through transparency and data-driven decisions.  Being at the forefront of a movement that's leading to a new digital era for shipping, we continuously set ambitious goals that often produce complex challenges and drive us to constantly innovate.  Each day at MarineTraffic presents numerous opportunities to develop skills, share knowledge and have fun. We are an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, one that is fair and honest and gives our people the confidence to be bold, to try new things and to grow.  As a result of our significant growth we are looking to add a seasoned sales hunter to drive sales activity in APAC region as part of the Singapore sales team. It requires an entrepreneur and self-starter mentality, someone who can bring new logos across various key verticals.  We are looking for a competitive and trustworthy Territory Sales Manager to help us build up our business outbound activities. You will be responsible for managing new and existing customer sales requests and maintaining customer satisfaction. The goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth.  Responsibilities Of Your Role Managed an assigned territory with the associated revenue targets and commission structure. Able to develop and present a thorough territory plan within the first 90 days. Execute business development activity to strategically grow the customer base through prospecting and cold calling. Leverage a repeatable sales process to drive to closure. Be expert at selling to both commercial organizations and government across a range of industry verticals. Exceed activity, pipeline and revenue targets and lead contract negotiations. Keep accurate and complete information on the Salesforce CRM system including prospecting activity, closing, sales pipeline and forecasting, close ratios and market intelligence. Obtain in-depth knowledge of MarineTraffic’s products and services. Follow a consultative approach in order to understand client’s needs and business challenges. Accurately calculate quotations, handle invoices and license agreements. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Pre-Sales, Product, Engineering) regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns. Establish and maintain current and potential client relationships. To research and utilize industry tools to identify opportunities for business growth. Sharing Customer feedback, communicating product and services opportunities, with internal teams at MarineTraffic. Participate in marketing events, trade shows and company events. Approximately 30% to 40% travel. Report to the Regional Sales Manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results. It’s Essential That You Have  Requirements 3-5 years of prior sales experience working for a technology vendor selling Enterprise solutions (Data, Cloud, Software, SaaS). Previous experience of working at established and early-stage companies. A track record of developing a greenfield territory, adding net new logos. A hunting mentality with a very strong Sales DNA and demonstrated success. The ability to identify use cases and value propositions across a broad range of verticals. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent in English, knowledge of other languages is beneficial. Have strong numeracy and analytical skills. Have good IT skills: you are comfortable using Microsoft Office. The ability to work cross-culturally and cross-functionally. The right level of entrepreneurship, creativity, and commitment. Maritime domain experience is a plus. Have a prior experience in shipping or fleet operations will be an added advantage. A Bachelor’s degree or higher. Benefits Work in an international, dynamic and fun environment, at a growing company Attractive remuneration package Continuing education and training Pleasant and fun working environment Huge learning experience and room for experimentation. Remote work flexibility If you’ve read the description carefully and feel you are a genuine fit for this role, which is both challenging and fun, we would like to hear from you.  Get your career on course by joining a globally recognised industry leader. Apply now.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - Singapore, Korea & Philippines
description: The ideal candidate will prospect and close sales leads to help generate revenue for the company. They will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating the sales strategy. Expand sales of Kodak Alaris products and solutions into specified geographic territory, through mix of new resellers as well as existing resellers directing them towards new geographic, vertical and product focus.   Achieving Revenue and Profit Targets Work Independently to Meet or preferably exceed assigned sales objectives and Quarterly/Annual revenue and profit targets in respective countries Hunt Large Project Opportunities (LPOs) and create attack plan for the same based on winnability. Especially demonstrate effective control over competitive pricing, effective and right Reseller nomination and technology differentiation in the solution offering to ensure win for KA Implement Company’s Channel strategies and ensure balanced revenue contribution from Resellers in all major buying geographies Effectively implement Information Management Sales Plans to enter new market segments and/or to introduce new products for sale through current or newly developed channels Plan and run various marketing programs, sales campaigns, channel schemes, Brand promotion and channel motivation in respective Region in co-ordination with Marketing team to support annual sales objectives and unique channel opportunities Identify new potential markets and appoint new Resellers to meet the business plan Work closely with Industry Managers in their respective verticals and support to close large deals with them by introducing right channel partners in the value chain to win projects Work closely with Service to ensure smooth operations and minimize customer complaints. Partner Management Work out business plans with individual Resellers and execute them Identify the right Reseller strengths to fulfill company's business objectives Support Resellers to achieve and enhance sales, win LPOs and create brand strengths in the Reseller’s domain Daily hands-on contact with Resellers for pre-sales planning, forecasting pipeline, and dealing with competition. Evaluate Reseller’s performance, identify gaps and root causes and provide appropriate directions to achieve their targets Provide guidance to Resellers in recruitment and skill enhancement. Develop and implement performance improvement programs for non performing Resellers Sales presentations and field sales calls with Resellers Implement positive principles of channel management in resolving inter-Reseller conflicts. Prevent Customer Complaints and implement preventive steps to ensure such issues do not recur Ensure adherence by Resellers to company’s policies, processes and standards. Market Information Collect and analyze market data on current trends, competition activities and latest developments in the industry. Provide regular market related information/updates to the management to build future strategies, take timely corrective measures, new product development etc. Collect customer feedback on products and services.  Qualifications & Experience Graduate with Diploma in Sales/Post Graduate in Management (Marketing) 5-10 Years of Channel management sales experience Expertise with document scanners, software, support and services Must have experience managing a Reseller-led Sales team. Korean language - written & spoken Skills & Competencies Demonstrate a very good track record in achieving quota and sales growth. Strong sellout abilities. Executive presence, the ability to comfortably scale up and down the organization. Excellent presentation skills with the ability to present with all levels of management. Excellent relationship building skills and interpersonal skills Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Ability to logically plan, set priorities, identify and solve problems to produce measurable results. Should have sense of ownership and accountability. Bias for action, Speed and Responsiveness Performance/Results Oriented Team Oriented Strong negotiation skills.

description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: OneFootball is proud to offer our advertising partners a segmented and highly engaged audience of football fans across the world through a growing portfolio of products and services. Come join the world’s largest football platform, and be responsible for establishing long-lasting relationships with key clients and growing our revenue.  We are looking for a Sales and Operations Support to help our APAC commercial team located in Singapore.  You’ll support the team with go-to-market platform offer, lead generation and partake in all aspects of the commercial proposal and campaign execution process.  Your Role Support the team in preparation of go-to-market materials and deliverables Assist the team with lead generation across the APAC designated accounts Contribute to sales and marketing strategies Provide industry research with a focus on the sport and media industry to identify investment trends, commercial partnerships, competitor activity and key data analytics to identify commercial brand lead opportunities. Assist in develop analytical workbook and templates. Maintain Salesforce.com & slack with accurate customer and pipeline information Provide support to regional team in weekly / monthly reporting across commercial projects and platform performance Collaborate with the various content, product, tech and account management teams to aid the delivery of commercial tasks Promote our value proposition to prospective customers within a highly competitive market Your Profile You have a relevant university degree with a keen interest in media, technology, sports and commerce Ideally you have some client facing experience in a professional environment, from a previous internship Highly organized with excellent attention to detail, with the ability to work flexibly both independently and productively alongside our sales team, in a fast-paced environment where priorities can change quickly Proactive, conscientious, self-motivated and goal-oriented individual with excellent written and verbal communication skills You can find our Data Privacy Policy for recruiting here.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: To achieve the territory sales and milestones objectives within assigned territory and portfolio through: Increasing prescriptions of Sanofi products in accordance to sales and marketing activities and in compliance with company procedures and policies, HSE, Pharma Code/ SAPI requirements, Pharma code of conduct and ethical standards at all times.  Understanding organization mission/vision and demonstrate organization values through self. Achieve set targets sales (monthly, quarterly and annually) assigned by SM through execution of territory action plan (TAP) aligned with product/channel strategies in the territory. Effectively utilise all sales support materials, SFE tools (e.g. Electronic Territory Management System (ETMS), clinical papers (on-label indications), visual aids and other resources to maximise sales call quality and implement sales strategy. Assist in/ organize meetings, seminars, group- selling activities (GSA) and CMEs to promote company image and / or product awareness with the objective of achieving sales target.  At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

description: About Cove: Cove is the new way to rent your home! We’re a co-living start-up making it easier and more affordable for people to rent rooms. We provide our tenants with stylishly furnished properties, in the most awesome locations in Singapore and Jakarta and make the whole rental process seamless from end to end. Our contract terms are flexible like our tenant’s lives and our rental prices include everything from utilities and Wi-Fi and weekly cleaning. Our tenants get matched with great flatmates and also have access to our community events around the city. Check us out at cove. sg or cove.co.id. Job Title: Graduate Hire - Sales Development Program Job type: 1-year Traineeship  Reports to: Sales Manager Role Purpose:We’re looking for super-star and highly driven fresh graduates to join our sales traineeship program at Cove. We are a fast growing and highly dynamic start-up backed by Keppel Land, disrupting the real estate and rental market in Singapore for young professionals from all over the world. Strong initiative, optimism, and the courage to dream big and work for an eventual start-up unicorn are essential. You will be trained in best practices for consultative sales, and have direct, noticeable impact on the company’s revenue targets and occupancy rates. Weekly 1-1s and training sessions will be held to prepare you to manage a smaller team of your own, wherein you will be accountable for their performance, as well as creating sales processes that will set the foundation for Cove’s sales culture. If you’re interested in building something that will last, and leaving your footprint through initiatives and projects, do send in an application. Core Responsibilities: Work closely with the Sales Manager on sales initiatives Liaise with potential tenants to understand their requirements, share property information, arrange viewings, and onboard them as customers of Cove Leverage on sales best practices to convert leads during viewings and post viewing stage Work with data to analyze points for optimization and process improvements to ensure a more seamless, high conversion rate sales experience for the team as well as the leads Use your experience with Cove to launch projects that help to formalize our sales process, and solidify them in company manuals and playbooks Implement these SOPs to ensure the team are properly trained to exercise all our best practices on a consistent basis Experience and Qualifications Required: Completed an undergraduate degree in any field (business related is a bonus) Strong academic track record Experience in a sales/marketing/customer service role Prior leadership experience in extracurriculars or prior internships / roles Experience in managing leads or clients in a front facing role Core Skills / Competencies: Strong relationship building High level of fluency in English (written and spoken) Consumer empathy Hungry for success Ability to create structure in an ambiguous environment Emotional resilience What’s in it for you: Working for Cove gives you the opportunity to join an exciting young start-up incubated through Antler.co. There will be lots to learn as you’ll be working directly with the three co-founders Sophie, Luca and Guillaume and get to experience first-hand what it takes to get a new high-growth business off the ground. In your role, you’ll have the opportunity to hit the ground running and take ownership from day one. We will always welcome your inputs and ideas and actively encourage your development. The team is fast paced, hard- working and expects results but we also highly value our employee engagement and are committed to a human and empathetic environment with plenty of fun thrown in. You’ll be working out of our brand-new office in Chinatown.
industries: Real Estate

description: We welcome all people. We seek to recruit, develop and retain talented people from all backgrounds. You’ll be the first point of contact for your customers, as you get them excited, handle objections, and move them through the sales pipeline. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a growing sales team and develop your selling skills! You’re open to new ideas and trying things out to see what works and what doesn’t.

description: Job Description Summary  The Services Growth Manager, ASEAN is a key leadership role that will be responsible for driving growth and ensuring the financial performance of the Ultrasound Services segment, a high double-digit growth segment. In this role, you will lead product positioning, market segmentation, new offerings development and launch, as well as installed base marketing. To be successful in the role, you should demonstrate an ability to identify market trends and customer needs, as well as possess a track record in leading demand generation and funnel acceleration activities. The role reports to the ASEAN Services Growth Director. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Key Responsibilities  Product & Market Expertise Formulate and implement solid strategies and differentiation to secure profitable services business growth for the Ultrasound portfolio Plan the launch of new service offerings and solution, manage the cross-functional and wing-to-wing roll-out of the plan Lead new business initiatives – provide ASEAN input, develop business case justification for new service offerings and/or upgrades from concept stage, to test/prototype, launch planning and roll-out. This will be done in conjunction with collaboration with Global teams, Modality, commercial excellence and commercial operation team Responsible for ensuring country commercial teams have the right tools and training to sell -- interface with Global and regional counterparts to share and gain best practices, adapting training material, brochures and other sales tools to local market needs as necessary Own the success of Ultrasound Services portfolio Monitor and drive improvements for key metrics such as capture rates, profitability, installed base growth and $ per installed base, influencing countries to strive for improvement Own the growth of the Ultrasound Services Contract business by developing market suitable offerings including market opportunity prioritization, opportunity mining, market/competitive analysis Collaborate with Inside Sales Leader to drive towards alternative, more efficient way of contract renewal, conversion and win back Conceptualize and launch demand generation programs for on demand services leveraging digital ecommerce platform Drive the options and upgrades portfolio to drive potential lifecycle solutions to add value to customers Work closely with the product/modality teams to drive improvement in Point of Sale attachment for service contracts as well as support their market share gain programs Build and sustain relationships with key channel partners in the region and ensure execution of strategy via the partners including training, launching incentives and various marketing programs in collaboration with them. Own the short- and longer-term business planning activities related to the portfolio. Build the growth strategy story and engage in dialogues with senior leaders to share the same and drive alignment. Ensure suitable stocking/inventory management for portfolio Collaborate closely to launch key new 3rd party adjacent solutions in the portfolio & ensure strategic alignment to core portfolio for the GTM.  Preferred Qualifications    MBA or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field 7-10 years’ experience in marketing, product marketing or related field Proven commercial experience driving sales for a portfolio Channel partner management experience Healthcare product/industry acumen, ideally in related product segments Innovation – develop new ideas through collaboration and execute on creative ideas being comfortable with ambiguity Influencing skills – ability to motivate individuals and demonstrate organizational influence Excellent oral and written communications skills Team oriented – ability to motivate and work well with diverse, cross-functional Teams Strong analytical and process skills Strong in MS Office Suite especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Ourtotal rewardsare designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Macro (FX & Rates) Salesperson  Singapore  As a Barclays Macro (FX & Rates) Salesperson, you’ll be part of a dynamic Sales team in Singapore that delivers Barclays’ global and regional FX and Rates content, views, product offerings and services to its client franchise in Southeast Asia, which includes institutional clients, such as sovereign wealth funds, central banks & regional banks. You will have the opportunity to develop specialized skillsets and product knowledge in the relevant markets via both structured and on-the-job training.  This role will require the role holder to hold mandatory registrations with:  Financial Industry Regulatory Authority  Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.  What will you be doing?  Distribute timely and relevant macro related market updates and views to the various client segments based on in-house research, traders’ views and other relevant sources Work together with trading and structuring teams to identify and structure trading and investment ideas and to communicate and distribute those to the client franchise Price and execute the various FX and Rates instruments offered by Barclays, and ensure trades are booked correctly and settled in a timely basis Ensure trades are done is a proper manner with the relevant product and credit lines properly setup and clients are properly on-boarded in accordance to relevant regulations Escalate and report any risk related events in a timely fashion to the team lead and/ or senior management  What are we looking for?  Demonstrable working knowledge of FX/ Rates cash and derivative products, including interest rate swaps, cross currency swaps, FX/ Rates options, and asset swaps Good working knowledge in DM/ EM sovereign; supranational and agency bonds is also essential Deep understanding of the main drivers of key macro markets, and ability to engage clients on macro content and ideas exploration Proven track record in managing client relationships across various types of financial institutions and at various seniority levels  Skills That Will Help You In The Role  Excellent fundamental/ macro analytical and mathematical skills Good attention to detail and ability to follow through Ability to take ownership of tasks, work independently and adaptively in a fast paced/ changing environment Quick learner, an independent thinker and a good communicator with the ability to handle stress, persevere and work as part of a regional and global team environment  Where will you be working?  Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a “city in a garden”. Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you’re just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.  90287322
industries: Banking and Financial Services

description: Who We Are  Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we’ve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world’s largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter.  Sustainability is a top priority for our company. We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place.  Please visit and follow Johnson Controls Pacific linkedin for recent exciting activities.  Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/johnson-controls-australia-pty-ltd/  Career The Power Behind Your Mission  OpenBlue OpenBlue: This is How a Space Comes Alive  What You Will Do  The APAC Inside Sales Leader will be a customer champion. Strong belief in serving customers by managing their expectations and delivering what you promise. Responsible for leading overall implementation and development of a world-class Inside Sales team across the region which will increase the volume of qualified pipeline / leads and drive incremental growth from targeted campaigns. An entrepreneur at heart to enjoy the challenge of expanding new territory and executing a land-and-expand strategy. Keep Company leadership apprised of market / industry activity and trends, including new solutions, process improvements and technology which could empower the sales team.  How You Will Do It Lead the APAC Inside Sales program to build and develop world-class Inside Sales teams across APAC markets delivering against growth targets and key metrics on lead and pipeline development. Work with local Inside Sales Teams & Leaders together with in-country / regional leadership to optimize team structure, processes, and enabling tools / programs to maximize performance in targeted growth campaigns leveraging industry best practices. Identify and implement improvements / enhancements working with cross-functional teams across the enterprise. Provide coaching and development opportunities to Inside Sales Team Leaders / Reps in order to maximize both personal performance as well as development of their teams to drive growth. Establish and enhance strong performance management of Inside Sales teams through establishing clear targets and KPIs, leveraging data from multiple sources as well as driving operational cadence / reporting. Prepare and deliver regular updates to senior management as required. Monitor team productivity and motivate team to reach daily goals. Ensure accurate and complete information is captured in CRM system. Prepare cohesive procedures to capture new leads by using tools like install base mining. Establish and manage demand generation procedures and operations prepare or launch campaigns for lead generation. Conduct entire management activities inclusive of coaching, evaluating, training and monitoring performance. Motivate, establish sales quotas and provide education to target accounts as well as markets. Continue to develop new strategies on how to generate sales opportunities to further expand growth. What Are We Looking For Experience of at least 6 – 8 years in related position or organization leading an Inside Sales team, preferably within a multinational organization Experience in Six Sigma and/or similar process improvement & excellence discipline desired. Some experience or knowledge working in an HVAC/BMS/Building Technology field preferred. Ability to work with CRM platforms as well as Excel to analyze & drive performance. Managerial abilities. Multi-tasking ability; ability to be flexible enough to handle numerous tasks. Ability to work efficiently as part of a team. Ability to work with little or no supervision. Excellent presentation skills. Self-motivated and enthusiastic. Must be an excellent communicator, whether orally or on paper. Must possess good organizational leadership skills. Possess excellent decision making skills. Ability to meet up with deadlines. Good interpersonal skills. Ability to pay attention to details. Must possess people skills, and have the ability to be creative. JCI’s Diversity & Inclusion  Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers’ vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.  Our D&I mission elevates each employee’s responsibility to contribute to our culture. It’s through these contributions that we’ll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers’ missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands.  Job  Sales & Marketing  Primary Location  SG-South West-Singapore  Organization  Bldg Technologies & Solutions

The company is looking for a sales manager responsible for developing new CPG business in Singapore, including building relationships and driving sales with customers, brokers and distributors across the retail channel. The position will focus on strategic territories based on potential new business opportunities.  Responsibilities: Execute a sales plan consistent with Genki Forest’s overall offline retail sales plan and implement CPG sales strategies and policies aligned with organizational goals Manage sales pipeline from end-to-end and open up new accounts Work with the GM to develop sales forecasts and achieve sales objectives Build and develop relationships with key brokers and distributors within the relevant sales channels Maintain sales volume, product mix, and selling price to meet key objectives Track market trends, opportunities and competitors to develop relevant action plans Generate month-end sales report highlighting monthly accomplishments Collaboration with the marketing team on merchandising and product strategies to increase channel sales  Job Requirements: At least 3 years sales and business development experience within the CPG industry Absolute self-starter and team player Work 100% independently, multi-task, and execute follow through in all aspects of the position’s requirements.
