description: At Delta Air Lines, we are focused on building an organization operated by people with an unwavering commitment to superior customer experience to further position Delta as the world's most trusted airline in the eyes of our employees and customers.  As a Customer Experience Specialist, you will join a service and sales focused team in high energy call center environment, focused on listening to, caring for and connecting with customers. In this position, you will answer calls in an efficient, courteous and accurate manner, while assessing customer needs and offering solutions and additional products. Ideal candidates should demonstrate the desire to make our customer's travel not only superior but memorable.  This position is full-time with comprehensive health and wellness benefits, performance incentive programs, and Delta's industry-leading travel privileges. Successful candidates will form a hiring class scheduled as early as August 2021 in our Singapore Engagement Center.  Life At Our Singapore Customer Engagement Center Centrally located at the Singapore Post Center 2 minutes away from Paya Lebar MRT station, surrounded by 3 shopping malls, entertainment, and 24-hour food center 5-7 minutes away Modern break room offering snacks and beverage options and free Wi-Fi Local community engagement activities within Singapore as well as participation with Relay for Life and Day of Hope, Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF), and Family Fun Day Delta employees, spouse/children can take advantage of interline agreements that provide space available travel at a reduced rate on many other airlines from around the world. Discounts available to global attractions, hotels and cruises through Delta Perks! Job Summary  Customer Experience Specialists connect with customers via phone and create an experience where customers know they have been heard and understood and feel valued and important, which is accomplished by: Effective listening Quickly identifying and owning customer issues Actively search for solutions to problems Making quality decisions Interacting with a globally diverse group of customers and colleagues Specialists sell travel related services, including car rental and credit card vendor partner products. Customer Experience Specialists demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills, a professional attitude, excellent dependability, the ability to handle stressful situations, possess strong computer skills, flexibility in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to learn and react quickly. Specialists must understand and adhere to all Delta and U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) compliance requirements.  Employees will have future opportunities to progress to specialty teams that respond to customer escalations or resolve complex international ticketing issues. As Delta continues to offer new ways for our customers to connect with us, Specialists may also have opportunities to assist customers via Twitter, Facebook or other emerging social media platforms.  Compensation And Training  The starting pay for this position is SGD$1,983.00 per month, with an increase to SGD$2,045.00 after 6 months, and to SGD$2,138.00 after one year. The position is also eligible for performance-based incentive after 6 months’ probation, shift premium for PM shifts, monthly shared rewards if company meets KPIs and annual pay increases.  Successful candidates will participate in a comprehensive classroom and on-the-job training. Classroom training includes instruction, observation, exams and performance measures.  After training, we will assign new employees to a shift that may be significantly different than your training shift and will include two consecutive days off likely midweek. New employees will remain on that shift until the employee is eligible to bid on a shift they select. New hires are eligible to bid on a new shift during the first shift bid following completion of new hire training. Employees bid on preferred shifts every 3-4 months. New hires are often awarded PM shifts with midweek days off until they are able to hold different shifts based on seniority. Delta is a 24/7 operation, and we will always have customers that need us.  Your health and safety  Our values-based culture puts people at the heart of every decision. Since the beginning of the pandemic, protecting Delta people, their families, our customers, candidates and making your health and safety our first priority has been the driving force behind every decision we have made. We adhere to the latest Local Ministry of Health (MOH) Guidelines. Temperature checks/screenings are performed at every Delta facility before entry. In addition, Delta requires wearing a mask while in the office, staying 1 meter apart and practicing good hygiene. Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority Possess correct legal documentation to live and work in Singapore Be fluent written and verbally in English This role requires computer skills and comfort with navigating software applications, email, instant messaging, and internet searches. Must be able to demonstrate clear, pleasant, and courteous verbal and written communication using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation Must have a flexible schedule as this position will require you to work weekends, holidays and including night shift Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Preferred education requirement for this position is an A-Level, O-Level, or HS Diploma (equivalent accepted). Consideration will be given to candidates with an N-Level if they also have a Polytechnic Diploma (equivalent accepted), WSQ Level 7, or 6 years of work experience. At least one year of experience working in sales At least one year of experience providing customer service
industries: Airlines/Aviation and Consumer Services

jobTitle: Business Development Manager, Global Accounts & Solutions
description: About Asendia  Asendia empowers businesses to grow across borders with a range of international e-commerce and mail delivery services. Launched in 2012 by La Poste and Swiss Post, Asendia has the combined expertise of over 1,500 employees across 4 continents. With opera­tions across the world, we bring together a wealth of international and local expertise, and a network that delivers to over 200 countries and territories. Asendia’s heritage as a mail busi­ness is unrivalled, but today we are also at the forefront in providing e-commerce par­cel solutions for e-tailers selling internationally. We provide a number of value added services too, including returns, fulfilment and let­tershop, and we have acquired a number of companies to enhance our ser­vices, including eShopWorld a global e-commerce software business.  About The Role  Business Development Manager, Global Accounts & Solutions  As Business Development Manager, you will work for the Asendia Group as a member of the Global Accounts & Solutions. This is a key role with responsi­bility for retaining and developing some of our most important clients in the APAC region. You will support our end-to-end sales process by analysing business performance, forecasting, and assist with business planning and budgeting. This role will give you the opportunity to work with all of our global subsidiaries and several key stakeholders across a fast-growing business. Strong focus and permanent development on cross-border e-commerce market and logistics solutions shall strengthen the relationship with customers.  About Your Tasks You are the main representative of the GAS team in the APAC region and work closely with and also the key connector to the Global GAS Team in Europe Headquar-ters to set-up the new cross-border commercial products for the existing and new customers in the APAC region. With strong understanding of the European and Asian customers’ behaviours of eCommerce products, together with the respective Market Research teams in the Euro-pean Headquarters, to complete specific market researches and shape the commercial strategy of the Global Accounts & Solutions teams, that targets to attract potential customers in APAC countries, especially in Singapore, Southeast Asia, China and Hong Kong. You are the key contact to the local sales teams in Asendia APAC entities to deliver right service & propo-sitions to customers, and also responsible for onboarding new global accounts for the Group in APAC region. You build strong relationship with subsidiaries and key stakeholders across the business (e.g. finance, solutions and commercial functions) so that you are able to support on the account management of our global accounts. You will take ownership of the GAS team sales pipeline and ensure follow up is done on the opportunities to en-sure successful conversation. You are required to initiate new business opportunities together with the commercial GAS teams situated in different regions and bringing these opportunities between APAC countries and other regions. About Your Profile 5+ years experience in a sales or business development role, if possible in the cross-border transport / e-com-merce / logistics sectors. You have great experience in MS office (especially in Excel and Power Point) as well as strong process and data mapping skills & data analysis and market research experiences. Experience in Sugarcrm.com or a simi-lar CRM is a plus. You are a self-motivated, persistent, and flexible person with the capacity to listen and understand customers’ requirements. You are organised, and able to prio-ritise and manage time effectively. Your strong communication skills in English ensure the capability of working with people of various nationa-lities, on varying levels of hierarchy. Business fluency in English language. Additional business fluency in French, German or Dutch is a welcomed asset. Our Facts  Our mission is to excel in every interaction with our customers. Our values are trust, friendliness, ease of use and our commitment to sustainability. Employees wellbeing and corporate social responsibility are at the heart of our core values.  We wish to instill a strong culture of corporate social responsibility within every employee and hope to create a positive and productive environment where employees can thrive. If this sounds like the kind of place you would like to work and the sort of role you are looking for, then get in touch, we are waiting to hear from you. Please send your application in English to: apac.recruitment@asendia.com, reference number “Asendia 21-17”.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Accounting

Build and maintain strong sales pipeline and forecast, through discovery calls and meetings Build a compelling partner strategy for your key accounts, engage with the channel team and lead the joint sales approach Ability to expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Develop and execute outbound strategies to create opportunities  Qualifications and Experience  Experience in Enterprise Software Sales experience in a technology space. jobTitle: Key Account Business Development Manager, APAC
description: Role Purpose:   Responsible for sourcing and qualifying new accounts that have the potential growth and business use case match to Jumio’s service offerings. The Business Development Manager role will work closely with the Account Executive team to achieve business revenue targets from the identified key accounts.    Role Value:   The Key Account Business Development Manager plays a vital role in identifying and qualifying companies across the various industry sectors who are looking towards digital transformation of their business and would have a need for identity verification services to support their online customer acquisition strategies.    Responsibilities:  Prospecting, educating and qualifying contacts - build a solid understanding of the industry in order to spark meaningful conversations.  Research prospective company’s background and prepare Jumio business pitch Engage new prospective client account’s contacts to establish connection Research Industry news / development to identify new target accounts Build PPT / Messaging on Tailored Value Proposition Represent Jumio in Industry Associations to network for new business Maintain key accounts from list (In collaboration with Jumio Account Executive) Working alongside Marketing to support the Account Executives on outbound strategies. Providing detailed information to the Account Executives to enable more productive follow-up meetings. Helping to spread awareness of special events/ projects e.g. blog posts, webinars, press releases etc.   Experience and Qualifications:  Degree educated Experience selling into the APAC market - ideally including relevant verticals such as Financial Services, Gaming, Sharing Economy or Mobility  Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.  Hands on experience with multiple prospecting techniques e.g. videos, social outreach etc.  A solid grounding in technology or engineering - comfortable understanding and conveying technical concepts and information   Great to have Experience and Qualifications:   Experience using Outreach Existing industry knowledge would be a strong asset  Key Characteristics and Attitudes:  In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.   Friendly and supportive Adaptable and flexible Articulate and persuasive Industry Knowledge of Online Identity Verification Curious and coachable Commercially Aware Resilient and tenacious Big picture and the detail  Jumio Values:   IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountability, Leading Innovation  Progression:  This position offers lots of opportunities to learn and to gain experience in this field. After having gained a good understanding of this role, there are several ways to progress to other roles such as ISR and on to Account Executive or Management roles.   @Work:  Jumio Singapore office is located at Centennial Tower. It is the APAC headquarters comprising a small team of energetic, motivated staff members across sales, consulting, marketing functions. It is a friendly, social culture where everyone comes together to celebrate each other’s success and provide support in resolving challenges.  Honest Positive Knowledgeable Caring Listening Energy  Company:  Jumio is the future for online and mobile ID verification. We are the largest and fastest growing company in the ID verification space. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.   Equal Opportunities:  Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from all backgrounds and of all statuses.
industries: Computer Software

description: DataSpark is an innovative startup in the exciting space of Big Data and Analytics. As a newly formed organization, DataSpark has big ambitions to become a major regional player in the analytics software and consulting space. As part of our highly energetic, youthful and dynamic team, we are looking for a highly motivated, highly disciplined individual to drive and build the DataSpark business in the coming years as the enterprise & channels sales leader.  As a young organization, DataSpark is seeking to build an ecosystem of consulting and technology solution partners that will help promote and deliver cutting edge insights and solutions based on DataSpark offerings. Your primary objective is to engage C-suite buyers in new and innovative conversations around analytics and insights, create new initiatives, lead DataSpark presales & consulting team to progress opportunities till closure. In the process, you will also be required to identify, recruit and develop a set of partners by helping them driving new business based on DataSpark’s analytics offerings.  Resposibilities Engage C-suite and senior line of business buyers either directly or via business partners to evangelize the value of telco based insights & Dataspark’s offerings. Work with clients & partners to identify & create new funded projects. Lead the DataSpark pursuit team to articulate & demonstrate our value propositions through the engagement process. Understand & execute DataSpark’s channel strategy by identifying the recruiting suitable partners to support our growth strategy Develop business partners capabilities around DataSpark offerings and lead these partners in client engagements to build their selling competencies. Drive prospecting activity through channel routes to market so as to identify new clients & opportunities Providing sales leadership to support partners to qualify, create value for clients & progress sales opportunities to closure Work with other sellers, business partners, and units of within Singtel/NCS group to create an effective solution for the client Maintaining a thorough understanding of the client’s industry, including industry trends, industry business processes, industry financial measurements and performance indicators. Specific industries of focus will be Governments, Advertising, Retail/Property, Tourism & Events management, Responsible for monitoring & guiding the delivery of projects to ensure client satisfaction Meet & exceed quarterly and annual sales targets for contract signings & booked revenue. Requirements Bachelors/Masters or related degree business or engineering degree At least 3-4 years proven sales/channel sales record in software solutions market. At least 2 years of experience in building and managing a partner ecosystem Have extensive professional contacts with consulting firms, solution providers or Government agencies. Ability to excite identified partners and align their business to DataSpark’s strategy Proven channel business planning & management. As a Solution and Consultative seller you would have outstanding ability to understand business problems, create value propositions and articulate a corresponding solution. Ability to build and execute a GTM/ territory plan Has experience managing various levels of partners and external clients Strong EQ, collaborative and networking skills Self-motivated, resilient, ability to problem solve and work with ambiguity Strong reputation & trusted by clients and partners in the industryKnowledge of the analytics software industry & ecosystem

jobTitle: Regional Account Manager (Position located in Singapore)
description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  To learn more about our team and office culture in Singapore, visit the following links.  Careers Page: https://www.knowbe4.com/careers/locations/singapore  Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.com/Location/KnowBe4-Singapore-Location-EI_IE969384.0,7_IL.8,17_IC3235921.htm  The Regional Account Manager position is responsible for managing the customer accounts in their assigned territory and maximizing all sales opportunities within those accounts. More specifically, this position will be charged with promoting and selling KnowBe4’s products and services to small and medium sized businesses (organizations with 101 - 999 employees), with the objective to achieve and exceed monthly sales quota. This can be achieved by targeting new business as well as reactivating dark (lapsed) customer accounts.  Responsibilities Promote and sell KnowBe4’s range of products and services Identify and close net new customers in the assigned territory Build and maintain pipeline of potential customers by developing and managing relationships with prospects Forecast new business prospects that result in successful client relationships and sales Identify key decision makers while developing and qualifying new business opportunities within the targeted markets through cold calling, networking and high-level prospecting Articulate the value proposition of KnowBe4’s products and help the customer understand how it will improve their business’s security awareness training (and security overall) Achieve or exceed monthly quotas and/or targets established by KnowBe4 Be well versed in KnowBe4’s product offerings and promote the products and services at trade shows as requested Follow up on marketing leads to generate new sales opportunities and pipeline Act strategically in offering free templates or negotiating discounted pricing, in line with established policies and procedures Maintain accurate and thorough records for customer calls, emails, notes, tasks, demos and other relevant information in compliance with the Administration Policy Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree a plus Proven track record in sales 3 years selling software to Small Medium Enterprise Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the IT Security Field Experience with Salesforce and Gmail Network or Security Plus preferred Excellent verbal and written communications Stats driven business professional Motivated, energetic self-starter Strong collaborative and teamwork skills Must be able to work with minimum supervision Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.

description: The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. Responsibilities Meet and exceed sales targets Successfully create business from new and existing customer accounts Manage negotiations with potential clients Build rapport and establish long term relationships with customers Lead generation  Do not apply if... you are not self motivated you are always looking to only stay in your comfort zone you not willing to fit the system you are unwilling to learn and grow you are looking just to try out  Some perks you will enjoy Fully work from home (remote working welcomed) Flexible hours Uncapped income  Sales is a lifelong skill set that should you choose to hone it can bring you an abundance in all aspects of your life. Description  Job ID: 22-497  Come Join Our Passionate Team! At Barracuda, we make the world a safer place. We believe every business deserves access to cloud-enabled, enterprise-grade security solutions that are easy to buy, deploy, and use. We protect email, networks, data, and applications with innovative solutions that grow and adapt with our customers’ journey. More than 220,000 organizations worldwide trust Barracuda to protect them — in ways they may not even know they are at risk — so they can focus on taking their business to the next level.  We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.  Envision yourself at Barracuda!  Barracuda Networks is looking to expand its sales leadership in the APAC Region as the company moves to the next phase of its growth evolution.  The team comprises of End User Touch and Channel Sales combined with a Pre-Sales Engineering. The region has been growing for the last number of years and we require a Senior Leader to develop and drive the sales strategy to accelerate this growth and bring scale and leadership to the team.  We are looking for an individual that brings a combination of skills in developing and executing sales strategies that cover market segments from SMB to Mid Enterprise end user customers. Additionally, this person will bring experience in doing business, not only in a traditional perpetual license model but also has experience of SaaS solutions and monthly billing models.  The role is based in Singapore and you will have strong, proven leadership capabilities that demonstrate your ability to lead and motivate a team to exceed targets. You will report to the VP Sales, APAC and be a member of the APAC Sales Leadership Team.  What You Will Be Working On Act as a strong sales leader for Barracuda Networks in Southeast Asia to maximize revenue opportunities across the region and develop the region’s channel business. Drive, meet and exceed monthly and quarterly balanced business results while building a long-term sustainable business to deliver revenue and market share growth, while balancing short- and medium-term objectives. Generate new ideas and innovative approaches to accelerate the development of the business in the Region. Implement corporate and APAC strategies and objectives, adapting and building execution plans for the region. Ensure the region develops and maintains strong sales pipeline growth across all product and market segments. Drive operational excellence across Southeast Asia. Manage Talent: Recruit, hire, develop, retain top talent and build a strong talent pipeline. Establish strong relationships with key partners in the region, including channel partners and ISV partners. Work closely with marketing to develop programs and activities across the region to drive channel development and lead generation programs. Play a hands-on role with key relationships in both our partner and end-user eco-system. Remain current on medium- and long-term security marketplace trends. Monitor competitor activity and anticipates market changes. Manage forecasting activities, preparing internal reports for management, month-end bookings, develop understanding and strategies to minimise churn, setting strategy and tactical approaches for maximizing new business sales and renewals retention rates across the APAC Region. What You Will Bring To The Role A solid understanding and experience of the cybersecurity markets, with experience selling SaaS solutions. Demonstrable sales leadership with multimillion $ targets. Act as an integral part of the APAC Management Team, contributing with innovative ideas, sharing success cases and practices and leading by example. Proven track record as a sales leader with the ability to build, lead, motivate and manage both managers and sales reps. Deep Experience in managing a business of both End User Touch end user sales combined with a strong channel sales background. Must be willing to travel in the region. Ability to set stretching goals and manage deliverables and priorities. Provide performance management oversight, to ensure our teams are inspected, targeted, measured and held accountable for deliverables. Ability to lead on commercial negotiations, ensuring we profitably grow revenues and margins across all opportunities. Bring proven relationships with customers, partners and key market players. Inspiring & motivating others through well-executed communications and ability to lead and motivate a diverse team. Building strong partner and customer relationships, to increase Barracuda’s mindshare and establish Barracuda as one of their key business partners. Improve performance through a focus on people and organizational development, as well as talent attraction, succession planning and retention of RSA talent. You will be a strategic thinker, able to translate this into executable plans for your team and deliver a vision for the region. Strong Business Acumen and a clear track record of driving execution, delivering operational Excellence in the field. You will possess a clear Sales Presence and be an inspirational sales and people leader with strong influencing and skills What You Will Get From Us A great work environment, working as part of an international leadership team, , interacting with customers across the your Region. Autonomy to lead your team to achieve the best results. Uncapped Earnings, including bonus elements and accelerators on over-achievement of targets A thorough on-boarding program, enabling you to understand and learn the Barracuda product portfolio Career growth opportunities – we train and develop our team to grow within Barracuda A great social environment, with regular social events. We know a diverse workforce adds to our collective value and strength as an organization. Barracuda Networks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to equal employment opportunity and equitable compensation regardless of race, gender, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer & Network Security, and Security and Investigations

description: At Blackpanda, our sales team is the engine that drives our success. We are seeking a motivated Sales Analyst with a love for tech to help us drive growth across Asia. This is a role which will balance both strategic and operational responsibilities – you will think big picture and also roll-up your sleeves to drive execution of strategic initiatives.  The Sales Analyst will enable the driving of growth of a wide variety of cybersecurity proactive defense services and products as well as cyber resiliency solutions, while helping to position Blackpanda as the premier cybersecurity Digital Forensics and Incident Response team in Asia. The right candidate will possess excellent energy and enthusiasm with a desire to build business across a portfolio of accounts, as well as be capable to manage sales operations, assist in building forecasts, and meet target projections.  Applicants must be based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to reside and stay in the city.  Roles and Responsibilities Play a pivotal role in strategic initiatives to accelerate sales and growth, ensuring progress against business objectives Support new growth opportunities for Blackpanda and contribute to the development of associated business cases Set individual and company sales targets with the executive leadership team Track sales goals and report results to executive leadership Coordinate with Marketing on lead generation and service support Coordinate with the Revenue team on channel sales development Understand our ideal customers and how they relate to our product / services Represent the organization and its products / services Support other company personnel and projects, as necessary  Qualifications and Experience This is an entry level position, 2-3 years in tech preferred but not required Ability to learn CRM & connected planning systems, developing systems and process across the organization Knowledge of consulting business models and associated KPIs Ability to work within a multi-national sales team Extroverted, positive attitude with a drive to build relationships Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to remain in the region Bachelor’s degree in a related field Cantonese or Mandarin language skills a plus  Benefits Possible equity awards based on performance Annual bonus based on performance Sales commission program participation Future relocation opportunities to your office of choice Enrollment in the company health plan Future travel and training opportunities Due to the volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.  BLACKPANDA is Asia’s premier cyber security incident response group, hyper-focused on digital forensics and cyber crisis response. Our team consists of an elite cadre of risk and security experts from International military special forces, intelligence, forensics and law enforcement backgrounds. We are highly trained, ready to respond to and help manage crises on short notice, when and wherever needed.   www.blackpanda.com | hello@blackpanda.com

Sales & Business Development Intern [Full-Time/Part-Time]  This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-growing PropTech start-up. You will gain insight and great experience into an internet start-up, experience life as an entrepreneur, and get involved in all aspects of the company’s development.   The position covers mainly the Singapore market and will primarily consist of handling sales inquiries, managing and developing our space partners inventory in Singapore as well as provide occasional support to partnership teams across the region.  Responsibilities:  Account Management: Being the first point of contact for sales and operational queries from our merchants/ partners.  Sales: Making sure that business leads are properly taken care of.   Business Development: Be actively involved in finding new business.   Merchant Acquisition: Be actively involved in finding and acquiring new space partners which include event venues, coworking spaces, serviced offices, and other landlords.   Merchant Relationship: Develop and maintain merchant relationships, monitoring initiatives to improve merchant engagement, applying problem-solving skills to effectuate solutions. Be the first point of contact for all matters relating to space partners.   Market research: Monitoring up-to-date information, research on traditional real estate, and flexible office market.   Support the marketing team with partner-related content. - Minimum Education: Diploma (Bachelors and Masters Graduates are encouraged to apply as well).  - Availability from October 2021 for min. 6 months  - Males must have completed NS (unless exempt).  - All applicants must have their own visa or sponsorship with eligibility to work in Singapore for the entire duration of the internship.  - Previous experience in a start-up and/or corporate environment is ideal.   - Experience in real estate would be an added advantage.  - Outstanding communication skills and fluency in English.  - Natural sales instincts, driven attitude, and “rainmaking” mentality best describe the ideal candidate for the role.  - Hands-on mentality, excellent analytical skills, proactiveness is a must.  - The remuneration includes a salary of $800 - $1000/month (Full-time), commission, and CPF for eligible applicants.  You may also apply for this position by sending your CV to partnerships.sg@flyspaces.com and cc singapore@flyspaces.com

description: Because you belong at Twilio  The Who, What, Why And Where  Who?  Twilio is looking for a proven Enterprise Account Executive who is interested in growing their career in the fast-growing cloud communications platform market. You'll be responsible for net new logo acquisition of key Enterprise accounts in the Philippines market . You’ll be able to sell across all Twilio products and services to help businesses improve their Customer Engagement through communications and solve complex business problems.  As The Ideal Twilion, You Live The Twilio Magic , Have a Demonstrated Track Record Of Success In Sales As Well As 8+ years of Enterprise Sales experience and a track record of personally selling and closing complex technical solutions to Philippines enterprises and software companies in excess of $100K. Comfortable with selling sophisticated enterprise platform solutions, understanding of API value prop, and success on seven figure deals in the past. Demonstrated success by exceeding quota on a consistent basis. Responsibilities will span from driving the sales process from internal leads to qualifying new prospects and managing deals to closure. Native or Business level proficiency in Tagalog is a plus This role reports to the Senior Director, Enterprise Sales for Rest of Asia(RoA) and will be based in Singapore  What? BE AN OWNER : Responsible for new customer acquisition and driving new revenue for a specific territory while being assigned greater than $2M quota and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction. WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES: Mastered crafting pricing proposals, negotiating terms and managing the contract process. Ideally, you also have experience selling communications to a technical and business audience, building trust and mutual respect with technical customers and peers. DRAW THE OWL : Passionate about what you do and you are able to think outside of the box and have world-class interpersonal and communication skills to make complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple. RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE : Ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple project/deals at the same time. As an added bonus, you’ve previously sold cloud or enterprise software. Travel may be required Why?  The Enterprise Sales team is a strategic component to our go-to-market strategy. We bring incredible value to enterprise companies, and thrive on finding new use cases to optimize their customer engagement. With no vertical restraints, the sky's the limit to what we can accomplish.  Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed, and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation, and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.  Where?  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  About Us  Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing global communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.  Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

You will need a strong knowledge of how to navigate through a sales process, consultative selling skills and ability to manage and focus in a complex and dynamic environment.  We will help you learn how to navigate through a sales process, develop consultative selling skills and refine your ability to manage and focus in a complex and dynamic environment.  Responsibilities Manage all in-bound leads across the APAC region. Own prospecting activities into your account base. Assist in the development of best practices for lead generation. Qualify in-bound leads and arrange sales appointments. Track all qualification and lead management activity using SalesForce.com (including calls, prospect pipeline & account notes). Collaborate successfully with Field Sales to optimize team selling productivity. Provide market intelligence to the Sales, Product, and Customer Success teams. Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: Shown success delivering above expectation results in driving pipeline revenue opportunities for enterprise software level deals. Demonstrated ability to lead email and social media campaigns. Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Creative tactics to reach the executive management of enterprise IT. Great teammate with solid communication and presentation skills. Strong skills in data analysis & sales tools use. Ability to work independently & proactively in a dynamic and bold startup environment. Preferred Qualifications 1 + years plus experience in SaaS sales or telephone prospecting is a plus. Recent, IT industry and/or enterprise selling experience is helpful. With our cloud-based applications, IT leaders manage, plan and optimize their technology investments across on-premises and cloud. With Apptio, IT leaders become strategic partners to the business by demonstrating value of IT investments, accelerate innovation and shift their technology investments from running the business to digital innovation. Hundreds of customers, including more than 40 percent of the Fortune 100, choose Apptio as their business system of record for hybrid IT.  Apptio Inc. is not open to 3rd party solicitation or resumes for our posted FTE positions. Resumes received from 3rd party agencies that are unsolicited will be considered complimentary. companyName: The Green Collective SG Pte Ltd
description: About The Green Collective SG  We are Asia's first Collective concept providing retail as a service to early stage D2C brands curated based on the UN SDGs. As an impact driven business, since 2018, we have empowered over 120 brands, expanded and established our unique omnichannel approach and most importantly created a vibrant community of changemakers who have taken their first steps towards a sustainable lifestyle through us.  We are headquartered out of Singapore but have a regional team expanding with us as we expand into overseas markets.  Business Development Associate (Distribution)  Our distribution business involves developing new sales channels as well as servicing and increasing sales from existing channels. We already have made inroads into some large channels and are looking to expand our reach. The Business Development Associate will be someone who has an entrepreneurial mindset, a ‘can-do’ attitude and is prepared to lead strategic business growth and drive transformational change in our distribution business.  You will be reporting directly to one of the cofounders and eventually developing a team as the business scales up.   What are you expected to do?  Develop and strategize company’s business development strategy for distribution Conduct relevant market research or studies (if required) for distributing products Prospect for new clients and promote by networking, webinar, cold calling, or other means of generating interest from potential clients Set sales targets, develop rapport with new clients and provide support that will continually improve mutual relationships. Grow accounts’ revenue, market share and profit goals to meet objectives.  Develop and provide pre-sales technical assistance and product education to customers. Negotiate tenders and contract terms and conditions to meet both customers’ and company’s needs.  Maintain effective teamwork with members of the Sales Team and other functional teams Work closely with marketing and operations team to ensure achievement of targets  Who you are expected to be ?  Entrepreneurial mindset with at least 1-2 years of sales experiences Must have a good understanding of all aspects of retailing products Experience in driving revenues, collaborating with multiple brand/business stakeholders is key. Strong communication skills Excellent public relations skills Ability to understand the client base Analytical skills with a knack for dissecting market reports Prior experience of working in sustainability preferred  What do we provide you?  Opportunity to work in an international, small entrepreneurial set up Competitive compensation with huge chances to grow within the company, Being part of a high growth dynamic environment, Working directly with experienced co-founders and being part of driving the strategic direction for the Collective Flexible working environment with independence Free access to the Green Academy to upskill yourself  Discounts and benefits if you are looking to shop sustainably  This role is only open for Singaporeans and PRs. Please send your resume to hello@thegreencollective.sg

jobTitle: Business Development - Marketing and Commerce, ASEAN
description: Introduction  At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities  At IBM iX, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, let’s talk.  About IBM IX  We think bigger than an agency and more creatively than a consultancy with the power to integrate the whole system. We are IBM iX. We were in the leader’s quadrant in Gartner’s 2018 Magic Quadrant for Global Digital Marketing Agencies and rated by IDC as Leader in Digital Strategy in Asia Pacific. In 2019 Forrester Wave for Global Digital Experience Agencies salient quote “compared with other service providers we evaluated, IBM iX has higher customer adoption and ratings of its experience design, analytics, and artificial intelligence and machine learning services”. IBM iX  Your Role And Responsibilities  What You'll Do  Nurturing and building the partnership with Adobe and Magento in the region Work with customers to develop a mutual plan on how IBM iX can help them transform their digital business Partner closely with Service Line and Industry/Sector teams to ensure strong/ compelling customer proposals and recommendations Collaborate closely with local and CIC delivery teams to handle customer concerns and issue resolution Be a trusted advisor for clients in their Digital Transformation journey, and develop a strategic partnership between them and IBM.  What You Need To Succeed  10+ years’ prior experience in an enterprise-level software consulting or services sales role; with a consistent track record for attaining and exceeding annual sales targets. Digital Marketing and Commerce experience is essential, as is knowledge of SaaS and Cloud-based offerings. Experience with and success in Adobe products selling is highly preferred. Ability to build and scale relationships with customers across ASEAN region. Ability to quickly assess Customer environments from a business process, organizational and technological perspective Nurture and develop positive relationships with existing Customers and extend reach within their organizations. Excellent team-building, verbal, and written communication skills as well as reporting and presentation expertise  SG_hotjobs  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  As above  Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise  As above  About Business Unit  IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.  Your Life @ IBM  What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  About IBM  IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.  Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.  At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Location Statement  For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  Being You @ IBM  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description: Company Description  Twitter, Inc. is the best and fastest place to see what’s happening and what people are talking about all around the world. From breaking news and entertainment to sports and politics, from big events to everyday interests. If it’s happening anywhere, it’s happening first on Twitter. Twitter is where the full story unfolds with all the live commentary and where live events come to life unlike anywhere else. Twitter is available in more than 40 languages around the world. The service can be accessed at Twitter.com and on a variety of mobile devices. For more information, visit about.twitter.com  Job Description  Twitter is seeking an exceptional digital leader to lead the China Twitter Client Solutions business. This is a rare opportunity to lead one of the most exciting communication products ever invented as Twitter continues to the future of healthy conversations.  The Head of Greater China Sales will lead Twitter into its next horizon of growth and market impact. This role will lead revenue generation of $XXXM+ and client relationships across a portfolio of industries with the market’s most strategic accounts and their advertising agencies. In addition this position will continue to build a strong culture and be the spokesperson, both internally and externally for one of the most exciting communication products ever invented; during its period of development and expansion.  The ideal candidate will bring a combination of business leadership, strategic thinking, analytical problem solving and deep product knowledge all with a country-specific perspective. He/she will be a spokesperson for the company at external conferences and events as well as interactions with the press. He/she will also be expected to foster a creative, productive and innovative cultural aligned with Twitter overall.  Cross-functional collaboration will also be of paramount importance as this highly visible role must partner successfully with Marketing, Product Management, Finance, Engineering and Human Resources.  Critical Competencies for Success Strong collaboration, communication & Influencing skills In the context of a management team that succeeds through collaboration and teamwork, this person will introduce fresh thinking in a compelling, fact-based way without driving a personal agenda. This person will build trust by focusing on measurable results, adding value to the country & wider organization and identifying new ways to remove blockers to enable faster execution. Will have a reputation for partnering at all levels and constituencies within an organization. In the absence of direct reporting lines, this person must possess effective influencing skills to secure cross functional buy in collaboration. Driving country revenue and advertiser/partner satisfaction while fostering a cohesive environment and culture consistent with Twitter’s values. Being well recognized as an influential industry thought leader and spokesperson for Twitter to help shape the Company’s reputation and the direction of the country. Strong Leader and Builder of teams This person should have strong track record of building and leading great teams. This executive will be able to demonstrate a track record in hiring and developing talent who have gone on to be leaders in other organisations, or have followed this person to new roles and wanted to work for her/him again. This former team will attribute their success to their time working with her/him. Leading complex cross functional projects to successful outcome both in terms of meeting objectives and doing so in a way that is true to our Corporate Values. Business Acumen This leader will serve as coach, collaborator, facilitator and senior advisor. Like all executives at Twitter, she or he must demonstrate a track record of flexibility, innovation and engagement. She or he will operate like all other business leaders, in a thoughtful and metrics oriented fashion. Publically represents the company's interests and position to interest groups, journalists and policy makers etc. Qualifications  Qualifications 15+ years of demonstrated career progression and strong performance as a senior leader, ideally in digital content, platform sales or related business. A minimum of 10 years leading a sales or partnership development organization. Proven track record of successfully negotiating deals at senior levels of major brand and/or media companies; ideally brings deep relationships from the media and agency landscape. Knowledge of mobile and internet products and technologies; well-developed product sensibility and experience leading creative discussions regarding potentially innovative, unique and engaging context and product offerings Track-record of collaboration and influencing across a large organization to deliver to expectations. Management of a team across countries in a client-facing environment. Proven ability to use measurements and analytics to position data to illustrate impact. Bachelor’s degree with a strong academic record. Strong communication skills. Fluent English and Mandarin to support our business in the Greater China region. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia.  As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark.  If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us!  Job Responsibilities  Our Sales Team seats central in providing a seamless online-to-offline strategy for our Singapore Market – situated in our Showroom at Jit Poh Building, they are responsible for providing a great shopping experience in store as well as helping potential customers choose the right products for their dream home. As our Head of Sales, you will be taking on a leaderships position and overseeing the current Sales Team, as well as executing various strategic initiatives to scale the business. Your job responsibilities are as per below. Responsible to articulate and implement organisation’s strategy for selling products and to develop forecasts and strategies to achieve sales. Lead the team to motivate and ensure effective performance of Relationships Managers and Sales Consultants. Manage sales team individual performance – sales targets, leads conversion and customer engagement. Develop and maintain sales training program to train and retrain sales full timers and part-timers. Focusing on sales techniques, product knowledge, customer services and personal grooming. Set sales strategy, align sales structure with the strategy and manage staff to implement sales processes. Work closely with marketing in launching new collections to ensure best showroom exposure. Constantly seeking to increase average order value. Store operational excellence by ensuring general store maintenance, visual merchandising and monthly stocktake. Monitor closely in business intelligent (BI) to drive performance from various main categories to SKU level. Assist and influence the HQ team to provide insight to the wider team. Work closely with marketing and purchasing team to influence forecast demand and ensure consistent supply amidst seasonal trends. Work closely with marketing and demand team to execute exit strategies for unproductive inventory. Build staff hiring plan to fully execute business vision. Organise effective regular sales meeting with team and cross departments. Engage regularly with Castlery management and department heads to ensure continued alignment between brands and functions. Keeps abreast of Castlery’s product range, product applications, technical services, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends by consulting with various departments.  Requirements Strong track record in retail operations management and driving strategic growth. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Prior leadership/people management experience, taking care of a team of more than 5 sales representatives. Preferred university qualifications or professional equivalent. At least 8 to 10 Years of experience in a similar role, with a minimum of 5 years in a Managerial & Leadership level role. Be able to perform under volume workload and stress during peak season. A professional, pro-active and ‘can do' attitude with good attention to detail and a passion for providing outstanding customer service. Familiar with Freshworks or similar software is preferred. description: Company Description  SG Digital, a division of Scientific Games, leads the global gaming market, providing innovative software that powers the world’s most successful betting & gaming operators.  We pride ourselves on product innovation and technical excellence and are constantly adding new applications and new functionality to our product suite, used by billions of end users.  We pride ourselves on technical excellence and are constantly adding new applications and new functionality to our systems, used by a huge range of operators including Singapore Pools, William Hill, Ladbrokes, Sportsbet and TAB New Zealand.  Job Description  We are searching for a high-energy Sales Executive who can discover and recognize opportunities and turn leads into long lasting partnerships throughout the Asia Pacific region. With their product knowledge and understanding of industry trends, the Sales Executive will communicate directly with potential clients and prospects, understand their needs, and recommend new products and services that will help them grow their operations. The Sales Executive will also drive sales strategies and help establish commercial quotas. The Sales Executive will drive growth for the Sports Betting software business including sports platforms and sports betting content with new and existing customers.  Essential Job Functions Accelerate revenue and new customer acquisition to grow the sports betting software business Generate new sales leads and pipeline opportunities Engage the marketing and product teams to develop, customise and localise marketing and product support where new business opportunities exist. Develop a solid understanding of SG Digital’s Sport and Services offering as well as expertise knowledge of the sports betting industry Leverage business intelligence, industry research, and market analysis to drive commercial strategy and growth opportunities Support growth and performance of existing customers and accounts Report sales pipeline progress and contribute to budget planning International travel to customers and industry events as needed Qualifications 2+ years experience in sales, account management and/or business development University degree in commerce, business administration, or equivalent field of study Experience selling enterprise software systems and/or enterprise content Education: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Essential Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Strategic thinker with excellent business judgment Ability to network and build relationships including with C-level customers Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to condense complex analyses into executive-level insights and recommendations Data-driven decision making Possess the ability to collaborate across teams Self-directed with proven the ability to think independently Nice To Have Interest in sports or sports betting Experience of selling software in highly regulated environments Knowledge or experience of multiple APAC territories & business cultures Additional Information  Why would you enjoy working with us at SG Digital? Competitive benefits, an open and supportive environment as well as a modern and exciting workplace The opportunity to interact with global teams on a regular basis and the possibility to switch teams and projects as you and our business continues to develop and grow Tangible and genuine development - at SG Digital, you can take your career where you want it to go! Exposure to real work, business-critical projects and the chance to develop some of the world’s leading e-commerce sportsbooks whilst working on exciting client projects and interact with lots of code! And if that’s not enough; you will get to enjoy a stunning work location and flexible working whilst we provide you with the guidance and development skills you need to progress quickly and enhance your career.

description: A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.  Responsible for direct sale and application of the Bioprocessing technologies, products and services (such as cell culture media, single use technologies, filters, chromatography, etc…) for Singapore accounts. The Account Manager will efficiently develop strategic account plans with internal business partner and maintain effective business relationships at all levels within assigned accounts/customer segment to influence purchasing decisions.  Your Role: Grow and protect the sales of responsible product portfolio for identified accounts in Singapore. Seek out new accounts within emerging biotech space and develop relationships with growing accounts in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical field. Maintain effective and professional communication with both internal and external customers. Work with marketing team on activities for customer engagement and participate in trade shows, seminars and conferences. Develop profiles of assigned accounts to identify key decision makers, influencers and opinion leaders. Coordinate and/or prepare commercial proposals, technical reports and quotations. Work with supporting functions on inventory management for customers to ensure smooth and on time delivery of products. Work closely with global teams to ensure alignment in market strategies Submission of accurate quarterly forecasts and forecast updates as requested on a timely basis Who You Are: Good scientific credentials. Degree in Chemical engineering, Bio-chemical engineering, Life science or Chemistry. Requires one to three years of relevant sales / technical sales experience or equivalent, ideally in pharmaceutical or bio-manufacturing environment. Good interpersonal, communications, negotiation and presentation skills. Sales and project management experience especially in business-to-business is desirable. Good business acumen. Good time management skills is preferred. Experience working in matrixed global organization.  What we offer:  With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!  Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com

description: Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva’s software helps our customers bring medicines and therapies to patients faster.  We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation . As a PBC, we are committed to making the industries we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.  The Role  Our team is looking for a Sales Development Representative to support our growing commercial business in APAC. In this role, you’ll drive renewal sales and also have the opportunity to build foundational sales skills to support our new growth initiatives.  We’ll invest in your career growth, teaching you about the Life Sciences industry, SaaS technologies, and support you as you develop an authentic sales approach.  What You’ll Do Proactively manage the renewal sales for commercial accounts in Asia Pacific Manage activities and opportunities correctly in our CRM Support Account Executive’s as they close net-new add-on opportunities Work closely with Account Executives and ensure any account-specific risks are addressed proactively Generate and qualify new leads and opportunities in ASEAN Rapidly develop sales skills on the job and through training Requirements 2-3 years of professional experience in a fast-paced environment, preferably in sales, inside sales, sales development or demand generation Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills Ambitious and comfortable taking initiative Team player; able to take accountability and direction Ability to manage time and priorities Nice to Have Experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems Experience or demonstrated interest in Life Sciences, or Technology solutions Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.  Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi. As a part of Coursera’s APAC team, you will play a key role in increasing global access to world-class education in the Singapore Market. You will lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives. The Enterprise AE team drives revenue across Coursera’s Enterprise customers (5,000+ employees) in Singapore. The role also requires working across the organization (with marketing, inside sales, product, university partnerships, skills transformation, customer success, technical implementation and legal) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. This is a senior role that is expected to grow in remit with growth in the Singapore market. Reporting to the APAC Enterprise Director, the person fulfilling this role is expected to be a key senior leader in the region and play a significant contributing role in developing strategy and go to market execution in Singapore as well as input into APAC growth plans.  Responsibilities Driving your team’s success and delivering the team's opportunity creation and revenue goals in the Enterprise space Meet and exceed all team quarterly and annual sales quotas, drive pipeline growth across Singapore Enterprise accounts, ensure accurate reporting of leads, pipeline, activities and forecasts Partner with Customer Success to meet and exceed all quarterly and annual renewal quotas; partner with marketing & sales leadership on prospecting, campaigns, and other initiatives Improve time to productivity for new AEs while maintaining performance in existing team; develop experienced team members for promotion and internal mobility opportunities; coach team members on inbound/outbound techniques, sales process and Challenger sales Attend key prospect and client meetings to support sales opportunities; use knowledge of industry trends to consult and support the team with customers; provide analyses to inform the team on general trends, product, competitors and act as a senior leader for the business and play an active role in GTM strategy Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!  Basic Qualifications 15+ years of demonstrated success across sales and team leadership roles where enterprise selling is the core of revenue generation, delivering revenues of $10M+ Demonstrated history of driving revenue in an enterprise software environment, with ideally an experience of HR / LMS / Talent or education-based solutions Experience as a leader of customer functions, with a bias to sales, and ability to influence marketing and customer success Demonstrated history as a sales business manager capable of evaluating, building, and executing on a strategy to drive accelerated growth in Singapore & engage top C-level customers on their strategic talent transformation initiatives Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working as part of a team in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Preferred Qualifications Understanding of digital transformation imperatives & initiatives from customers of key Industries in Singapore Past experience in setting up Singapore operations of a global company and scaling them Business written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical and creative problem solving abilities, excellent interpersonal skills, organizational, and operational skills If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Foundations of Business Strategy  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.
