description: Responsibilities Work closely with the business development team Proactively generate and qualify sales lead opportunities Understand customer needs and requirements to match inLine offerings Secure quality meetings for the business development team to do a product demo and secure the sign up Maintain and expand pipeline of prospects  Qualifications Singaporeans / Permanent Resident only Fresh graduates are welcome to apply and telemarketing experience is a plus Preferably loves to discover more about the F&B industry Problem solving skills: target oriented, ability to think out of the box & enjoy challenges Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to persuasively communicate recommendations effectively Great collaborator and someone who proactively partners across teams while holding them accountable for business results Disciplined and organized Strong excel and data management skills  About InLine InLine is a software startup focused on maximizing restaurant efficiency managing tables and reservations. We have thousands of restaurants including leading chain brands, Michelin-starred restaurants, shopping malls, and busy brick-and-mortar restaurants. We also partner with food-tech platforms, social apps, and various media services to grow the exposure and business for inline restaurant customers. Our team is launching and exploring more global opportunities in key cities, including Tokyo, Osaka, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Kuala Lumpur, Vancouver, Melbourne, Sydney and the cities in the US. For people with solid professional skills and talent, who are highly motivated to expand their career and learn in a fast, flexible environment, we have several opportunities to build the business with our team and write the legend inLine for the next thousand partners at a rapid pace.  We are seeking for an Inside Sales Executive to be a part of a high performing team whose main focus will be prospecting, generating leads & setting new meetings for the business development team with the end goal of acquiring new customers. You will be responsible for discovering new opportunities, communicating with potential customers, understanding their needs, and setting a demo schedule. This position has a career path to Inside Sales Manager.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Job Description  Position: Enterprise Account Executive, Malaysia - BASED IN SINGAPORE  The Enterprise Account Executive maintains and expands relationships with strategically important and large enterprises. Assigned to a number of named customers, the enterprise account executive is responsible for achieving sales quota and assigned strategic account objectives as well as developing business within some white space accounts.  Responsibilities Establish professional and deep relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts Leads account planning process that develops account strategy, financial targets and critical milestones for 1-3 year period Leads cross functional team within Salesforce to meet customer accounts performance objectives and expectations Deep understanding of customer's business environment, proactively assesses, clarifies and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis. Leads solution development efforts that best address customer needs and generating pipeline for the Salesforce Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Co-Primes, Executives, Partners etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Accurate quarterly forecasting and revenue delivery. Requirements 10+ years relevant experience of solution selling within a major services or software vendor. Candidate must have extensive experience selling into the Malaysian market. Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets Credibility at all levels, including CxO. CRM application sales, relevant enterprise experience preferred. Must speak highly fluent Bahasa Malaysia as this person will be traveling regularly and selling to customers in Malaysia. Fluent English is also required. About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas—a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World’s Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Reporting to Senior Vice President of Worldwide Sales, you will play a critical role in building and executing the go-to-market strategy for ThycoticCentrify in Asia-Pacific, setting the company up for success long term in the region. Benefitting from having a market-leading product and strategic relationships in the region, you will be responsible for growing the company’s revenue in the region at this critical stage. Being resourceful and hunting down opportunities with a relentless customer focus and an approach aimed to build up sales channels in the region will set you up for success. In parallel, as the organisation scales, you will have significant influence over the shaping of the company’s broader go-to-market infrastructure. Immediately on joining the business, you will work with the management team to understand the current sales channels within the region, existing relationships, and new business opportunities upon which a pipeline to support near-term growth can be built and converted. You will help define the go-to-market strategy to meet market expectations and customer needs to drive faster adoption of the product. Simultaneously, you will begin developing key business strategies across Japan, Singapore, and Australia, leveraging the additional resources made available by the growing revenue base and institutional investment to support this. You will also be responsible for hiring and developing the team within the region to scale the business and continue to develop the local team to build a sales team with the primary focus of building the business regionally. Following a period of integration, you will conclude a series of customer wins, increase revenue velocity, and establish yourself as a senior leader in the organisation. You will then seek to accelerate revenue growth, taking the product and the business to market as a larger sales team, targeting new geographic markets, and partnering with a capable marketing organisation to drive exponential growth. You will look to scale the product’s footprint across the region and build the commercial performance to support an ultra-high growth business as a category leader. Ultimately, you will play a key role in significantly growing the company’s valuation through to the next funding round and beyond.  Key Responsibilities Execute and formulate a sales strategy within an assigned region, drive revenue growth by penetrating the current customer base, and develop a net new customer base. Work with the SVP to manage and control P&L within the region building a successful, sustainable and dynamic regional sales performance. Continually monitor the sales activity of the team and track the results; report on sales activity and forecast to the SVP. Provide market feedback to the leadership team influencing product strategy and positioning. Perform regular individual meetings with the sales team, as well as supporting client visits with sales reps where necessary. Work closely with the Senior Director of Channels, Director of Pre-Sales, Senior Marketing Director to inspire the local teams of Channel Sales, Pre-Sales Engineers, and Marketers to execute on regional strategy. Hire, train, and develop team members to align with company values, growth, and business objectives. Provide ongoing training and development of the sales team. Define new business campaigns into horizontals and verticals to generate new opportunities with a demonstrable Return on Investment. Support, manage and motivate the local team of Account Executives by participating in New Business and Existing customer meetings and helping the team reach the Company's goals. Build upsell/cross-sell strategies and reference programmes to develop and grow relationships with our current customer base. Identify the customer approvers, decision-makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase deal Growth & Scale beyond $10m ARR across the region ideal. Strong experience in building strong channel partner relationships across the Asia Pacific. Consistent record of exceeding annual team quotas and performance targets. Experience scaling and managing enterprise and strategic sales teams within a region. Prior experience in developing a high-performance culture. Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team. Evidence of contributing to the development of growth strategies and lead generation programmes as an executive leader. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to solve complex problems and articulate ideas and strategies effectively. A naturally curious, problem-solving self-starter with low ego and high self-awareness. Culturally sensitive and creative, versatile, and strategic thinker. High energy and attention to detail. Expert negotiation skills. Self-Awareness and a desire to learn from all those; above you, equal to you and below in role. Thorough knowledge of Salesforce.com to maintain a current and accurate pipeline. Skills  Must have at least 5+ years successful track record of managing a team of 8 or more individual contributors in SaaS, enterprise software company, or a security vendor. Growth & Scale beyond $10m ARR across the region ideal. Strong experience in building strong channel partner relationships across the Asia Pacific. Consistent record of exceeding annual team quotas and performance targets. Experience scaling and managing enterprise and strategic sales teams within a region. Prior experience of developing a high-performance culture. Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team. Evidence of contributing to the development of growth strategies and lead generation programmes as an executive leader. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to solve complex problems and articulate ideas and strategies effectively. A naturally curious, problem-solving self-starter with low ego and high self-awareness. Culturally sensitive and a creative, versatile, and strategic thinker.High energy and attention to detail. Expert negotiation skills. Self-Awareness and a desire to learn from all those; above you, equal to you, and below in role. Thorough knowledge of Salesforce.com to maintain a current and accurate pipeline.

About Us  WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. Today, we offer access to a desk, an office, a headquarters, or an entire building in hundreds of cities around the world; with over a third of the Fortune 500 companies being part of the WeWork community.  About The Opportunity  This is a key position within our Sales Team where the candidate will be responsible for the commercial success of a portfolio of small offices. This will include renewing existing members as well as sourcing and closing new business.  As a successful Inside Sales, Account Executive you will have the opportunity to:  Nurture, develop, and close renewal opportunities in a fast-paced and evolving environment. Source, nurture and close new business opportunities by ensuring that prospects’ needs are met and exceeded. Act as the owner of the commercial success of your portfolio, working with your colleagues in the Community team and the wider sales team.  Day To Day Responsibilities Include (but Not Limited To)  Maintain high activity through regular touch points with clients. Partner with Community Teams to ensure the successful placement of new members. Maintain our CRM to ensure you are showing an accurate view of your pipeline. Execute strategy and process implemented by Sales leaders, Marketing and Sales Operations. Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and confidently communicate our value proposition to members. Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience.  About You  We’d love to hear from you if you have:  A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualifications. Advanced verbal and written communication skills in English. Experience of the SEA Market as well as fluency in any other Asian language. Demonstrable experience in succeeding in fast-paced, KPI driven sales environment Two years or more of professional experience in sales, account management or related deal closing fields. Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating, renewing and closing sales (required). Excellent experience in customer service and relationship building. Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit. Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills.

description: About Us Wind is the leading financial data provider in China with over 90% of investment professionals in China and over 70% of QFII investors as our clients. Our headquarter is based in Shanghai and we have operations across the world such as in New York, San Francisco, London, Singapore, Taiwan, and Hong Kong.  The ideal candidate will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.   Responsibilities Develop and expand existing client relationships and ongoing communication to identify short- and long-term needs  Maintain frequent communication and identify opportunities and match those with Wind's product and functional expertise   Develop a pipeline of opportunities, assist in getting opportunities to the proposal, and ensure that full client needs are met, and assist in closing deals   Provide ongoing service to existing clients to ensure success and continuity of relationships Work day-to-day with product teams, client services teams, and subject matter experts   Qualifications Previous sales/business development/account management experience and a track record of success in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. At least Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or other business-related fields. Articulate and well accustomed to a client-facing role Work well with sales target and KPIs Business proficient in both English and Mandarin Willingness and ability to travel

WhyQ is Singapore's largest hawker food delivery service and is one of Singapore's fastest growing startups.  We have also launched a full service digital ecosystem enabling micro and small businesses to create an e-store and launch online, manage accounts, record transactions via a mobile-first POS system, improve customer retention with easy-to-use CRM tools and order supplies.   Business Development Executive We are looking for a motivated, sales-driven individual who can drive usage of our in-house Point-of-Sales system among hawkers and the wider F&B community in Singapore. Reporting to the Head of Business Development, the candidate will be responsible for the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing.  Roles & Responsibilities Pitch to small businesses for joining our app Onboard SMEs and push for high engagement /usage  Act as liaison with client for troubleshooting: investigate, analyze, and solve software problems Provide ongoing feedback from clients and work with the tech team to implement version upgrades Work self-directed and independently; act as subject matter mentor to more junior members, for example interns  Desired Skills & Experience Experience in sales/merchant acquisition role, with tenacity to achieve targets and resilience to handle rejections  Interest and motivation to disrupt Singapore’s SMESs industry and support them in their digitization journey  Ability to build rapport quickly and effectively with SMEs  Result-oriented and demonstrate adaptability, flexibility and resourcefulness Fresh graduates from Polytechnics and Universities with relevant skills and can-do spirit are welcome to apply  Working hours Official working hours from Monday to Friday, 9.30am to 6.30pm, with the flexibility to plan your own sales schedules    Expected Pay $4,000-$5,000 (based on experience) Plus bonuses & commissions

Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.  With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.  Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further!  Responsibilities Renewal and Cross Selling of Services Establish a trusted advisor relationship with new and existing clients to ensure adoption of Osome’s suite of services Address clients’ concerns in an appropriate and timely manner via our platform, over the phone, and face to face meetings Collaborate with cross functional teams to escalate any issues clients might be experiencing Updating of clients' details on the point of contact Identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities to ensure growth attainment Uphold excellent service standards, going above and beyond to ensure clients love us, stay with us and refer their friends to us. Help us to advance our technical lead by providing input into our software development process Any other ad-hoc responsibilities as required  Requirements  Requirements Recognized Diploma or Degree in relevant fields Having basic corporate secretary and/or accounting background is a plus Self-motivated and proactive, and able to work meticulously under tight deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills; independent yet be able to contribute in a team; fun and comfortable over the phone and face to face Positive attitude and willing to continuously develop, learn and be result driven Experience in a client facing role and/or sales background are desired  Benefits  Benefits Join a hyper fast growing company Experience the most exciting growth phase of a start-up first-hand – we are on an exponential growth path and providing each individual opportunity to change the way we do things Be on the forefront of development when it comes to accounting best practices Work closely with our tech team to help shape the face of corporate services in the future. International environment Competitive remuneration package Benefits : 18 days annual leave, study leave, cash incentives, medical benefits, etc.  Thank you for your interest in Osome. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

description: Sales Management Associate - (2000002J) Description  As one of Singapore’s 100 Leading Graduate Employers, we are constantly looking to work with the best and the brightest in our never-ending pursuit of excellence.  At Income, we are made different. Serving two million customers in Singapore, Income is one of the largest general and health insurance providers. We are truly dedicated in delivering the best customer experience – our latest accolade being the No. 1 digital insurer in Singapore that offers our customers choice and flexibility. Find out more about the programme here and you can register in our upcoming webinar!  Qualifications  The ideal SMA candidate is A graduate of any discipline from a University, Polytechnic or graduate with a full GCE A-level certificate Looking for a career change into Sales Someone who articulates well, with excellent written and communication skills Motivated, driven and a self-starter Quick-minded, open to change, and achievement-oriented Resilient and able to adapt in a fast-moving and dynamic environment If the above sounds like you, we want you! About The Company  Pixalate is a cross-platform digital advertising fraud intelligence company, offering the only system of coordinated invalid traffic (“IVT”) detection solutions across desktop, mobile web, mobile in-app, and OTT/CTV for better detection, diagnosis, and elimination of ad fraud.  We are under midst one of the biggest shifts in ad tech right now with overwhelming industry demand for greater transparency and protection against ad fraud. Concurrently, media spends are steadily shifting more towards newer channels like OTT/CTV which are poised to explode, yet present difficult challenges around measurement and fraud protection. Pixalate is uniquely positioned to capitalize on these industry trends by being the first fraud protection provider to offer MRC accredited omni-channel fraud protection solutions that are focused on actually reducing fraud, not just measuring it, and our explosive growth over the last quarters reflect that!  Position Overview  Pixalate is hiring an International Sales Director/Manager, to build new business and partnerships within brands, agencies, and the ad tech space as a whole. This candidate is based in Singapore and will be responsible for bringing in revenue within the Asia-Pacific (APAC) markets as well as working with our existing client base there. We are looking for a candidate that has many years of ad tech experience and reliable contacts within the mobile and digital advertising space and gets the details as well such as digital ad serving, ad targeting and measurement. The position will require one to be strategically collaborative, highly motivated, and have a passion for selling such as jumping on a plane to help close deals face to face!  What will you do? Create, identify, and execute new growth opportunities through creative partnership deals to drive client solutions and new revenue streams Develop sales strategy and execute plans to generate revenue within the Asia-Pacific region Build weekly revenue pipeline development through qualified meetings in the field with key prospects and stakeholders Meet and exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets Help further enhance our go to market strategy and share crucial feedback from the field. Collaborate closely with our Customer Success, Data Science, Ad Ops, Engineering, Legal, and Marketing teams to provide an exceptional end product to our clients. Travels as necessary in support of business objectives (prospect/client meetings, conferences, internal meetings)  What skills, education and experience should you possess? Bachelor's degree (BA or BS) from four-year college or university Fluent knowledge of ad tech, with bonus points for understanding various supply models, buying models across different channels like desktop, mobile in-app, OTT, video, etc. Ideally have also sold on a SaaS model before 3+ years of account management or account-based selling within ad tech or SaaS Strong industry knowledge and contacts within mobile in-app and OTT space Proven track record of meeting sales quota Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; ability to communicate well with people at all levels of an organization both internally and externally, both written and verbally Ability to prioritize initiatives, formulate action plans and execute initiatives Thorough working knowledge of sales tools, including Salesforce.com Strong technical aptitude Understand the necessity of being seen as a trustworthy consultant by clients and balance that effectively to transcend the typical “vendor” relationship. Self-motivated, organized, resourceful  Would you like working at Pixalate? Everyone’s a data addict and an analytical thinker Titles don’t mean much; you attain respect by producing results We appreciate small, highly-productive teams Slack is a way of life; short emails are encouraged A fearless attitude towards the industry does well, as well as bold ideas Chess players do well We revere collaboration, collaboration, collaboration!  What perks do we have to offer? We focus on doing things differently and challenge each other to be the best we can be, offering our employees: Experienced leadership and founding team Fun team events High performing team that wants to win and have fun doing it Extremely competitive compensation Opportunity for advancement (Pixalate will be what you make it) This job is paying over $20k a year  What does the media say about us? Pixalate expands its MRC Accreditations: Pixalate launches Video Seller Trust Index: Pixalate discovers a sophisticated mobile app fraud: For the most current news stories about Pixalate:  Powered by JazzHR  gqDn36BWCg

description: About Brightcove  Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We're hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world's most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.  As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When video is executed correctly, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of a global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.  Position Overview  This is a quota-carrying sales role responsible for delivering Brightcove customer licence signings and revenue targets for Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam preferably based in Singapore. The role develops, writes and owns the execution of the strategic territory plan. Provides direction and hands-on management of all the resources assigned to a sales pursuit in their region. The Territory Manager supports Brightcove's corporate goals of customer satisfaction and profitability within these three markets.  Job Responsibilities Directs selling activities within the region/territory, inclusive of resource deployment and customer interactions. Owns the financial sales performance for the territory - both bookings and revenue. Owns and manages all routes to market in the territory, direct & indirect in partners. Establishes an environment and business foundation for future sales growth. Coaches others on how to sell value to Brightcove customers. Prioritizes effectively and in accordance with given corporate objectives. Responsible for accurate region/territory forecasting and performance tracking. Works closely with other team leaders within Brightcove to build sales, resolve customer issues and enable high customer satisfaction. Continually identifies and communicates customer knowledge gaps and opportunities for Brightcove products and services. Evaluates market trends and gathers competitive information, identifying trends that impact current and future growth of regional sales and profitability. Disseminates information to regional sales teams, corporate marketing and sales operations. Helps to build the knowledge base in applicable Brightcove communities including lessons learned, best practices, tools, methods and product enhancements.  Qualifications/Experience 7+ years sales experience delivering or exceeding quota targets in related fields. Requires excellent understanding of Salesforce or a similar CRM system. Proven track record of success in selling and achieving targets; Proven ability to prioritise projects and deliverables driving accurate and timely decisions; Adaptable, highly driven, high energy. Ability to work in a sometimes stressful and constantly changing environment employing multi-tasking capabilities; Problem solver, demonstrate the ability to apply sound judgment and negotiate successful outcomes for customers and internal stakeholders; Attain and maintain a deep understanding of Brightcove products, training and adoption services needed to advise and enable customer success; Numerate, commercially astute, able to effectively manage budgets and forecast accurately; Detail oriented and analytical. Able to learn and effectively use analysis and reporting software to forecast future business; English and French at level of native fluency required Special Conditions Seasoned professional that can work without manager direction on day to day basis. Can make independent decisions mapped to territory account plans and channel programmes to achieve territory revenue and signings plans. Has ownership of the territory's strategic plan and coordinates all resources engaged in the territory to achieve the plan. Business travel of up to 50 percent of available time is expected for this position as and when the Pandemic allows. Job requires extensive customer/ team engagement and extensive periods of computer and telephone work.  Working at Brightcove  As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company's success. We offer competitive benefits and compensation packages.  Brightcove is headquartered in Boston with offices in New York, London, Guadalajara, Funchal, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, Mumbai and Chennai. This position is being offered as a fully remote role in France and, while you won't get to experience the in-office culture, you will feel it remotely and be able to participate actively. We have plenty of opportunities to meet your colleagues around the globe and we also celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!  If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.  Send us your resume if you are interested and want to learn more!  **Please submit your resume in English to be considered for this role.**

description: In line with pre-planned budget, the regional / sales manager shall be the first-line contact to develop customer accounts to market Phaos products in the designated area.  Phaos Technology, is an advanced microscopy technology company originated from NUS with patented Optical Microsphere Nanoscope (OMN) technology, developed with NRF grant, to be commercialized into super-resolution optical microscope products and business. With active engagement with product team, the sales manager shall be responsible for Market exploration and discovery and identifying sales leads; Developing and acquiring customers – both channel partners and end customers and managing customer accounts and full cycle of sales process from sales quotation, sales order execution through payment collection; Market and application discovery in the designated area through customer engagement towards productive and constructive feedback to product development.  - Bachelor's degree, preferred in engineering or science major. A diploma candidate with good working experiences can be considered as well. - Strong commitment in work ethics and team-work - Proficient in common office tools

There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake, the company that delivers the Data Cloud to Mobilize the World’s Data, is actively seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner based in Singapore to support the Asia Pacific Japan (APJ) segment.  In this role, which reports to the Director of Sales Best Practices and Enablement, you will be a key contributor to the vision and realization of our overall sales enablement strategy.  IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO: Serve as the voice of Global Sales Enablement in the APJ segment, leading communication and execution of the global enablement plan in the segment. Establish yourself with sales leadership and cross functional partners in marketing and sales operations as an extended member of their leadership teams. Connect with a broad range of stakeholders to identify enablement needs in the sales organization. Manage the intake process and prioritize segment specific enablement requests based on expected business impact. Lead and manage projects that produce segment specific selling and enablement assets. Where applicable, manage the process and resources (internal or external) to localize these assets to the needs of the sales team. Build strong partnerships and align with internal and cross functional SMEs on enablement content creation and delivery. Coordinate and schedule activities and people in support of new hire onboarding, Sales Kickoff and ongoing enablement. Keep the field informed on all things enablement - offerings, process, systems, due dates, progress reports, etc. - through active communication and awareness campaigns. Collaborate with your Global Sales Enablement peers to shape and continuously refine the onboarding program, quarterly enablement plan and on-demand enablement offerings based on the needs of the segment. Collaborate with your Sales Enablement Business Partner peers from around the world on common needs, and share content and other enablement assets to speed time to impact in your segment.  ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE: A minimum of 8 years of related experience with a focus in enterprise software, sales and enablement. Bachelor’s degree Strong project management skills. Highly organized with excellent communication skills. Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and producing quality deliverables. Business, technical and sales acumen. Understanding of complex sales cycles, processes and methodologies. Ability to lead through influence. Experience working in a fast-changing environment that requires strategic thinking, resourcefulness, agility, results-oriented decision making and commitment to excellence.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?
industries: Computer Software

description: Business Development Representative   Do you believe in the future of the creator economy? Do you love education and see its power to transform lives? We do, which is why we are building Nas Academy, an online education platform to empower creators to share their knowledge. https://nasacademy.com/  Nas Academy is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Business Development Representative to join our growing outbound sales team. You will be responsible for the development of the lead generation program and nurture outbound sales lead campaigns for Nas Academy products and services.   Key responsibilities include: Managing the top of the funnel and middle of the funnel leads generation  Collaboratively work with the Head of Outbound sales to develop lead generation strategies to generate lead opportunities with prospective customers Hands on experience with email marketing and running email sequence campaign  Providing consistent, concise, accurate and timely weekly/monthly sales lead gen activity reports to management Solving complex technical integration solutions and issues with the Lead generation tool  Achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas  Qualifications Minimum of 3 - 5 years of sales email marketing experience in an education, internet, or solutions selling environment.  Experience with lead generation and marketing automation software Must be an experienced successful prospector, and be able to independently develop new prospects in a highly competitive environment. Show a proven track record achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas Must have strong inner drive and self-discipline, proficiency in EXCEL, Word, PowerPoint and Lead Generation Tools   About Nas Academy Nas Academy is an Ed-tech platform for the creator economy founded by Nuseir Yassin (Creator of Nas Daily). Nas means people in Arabic, and as the peoples academy, we want to help every creator monetize their knowledge. We believe content creators on the Internet will be the future journalists, commerce sellers, and educators of the world. We are on a mission to turn creators into academy’s, empowering them to become the world's best educators. Think of it like Masterclass...but for everybody else.   With team members around the world, we are a global platform for creators founded by creators. We are passionate about being a force for good in the world, and providing a platform for voices that are not always heard. Our social media pages have more than 13 billion views and 38 million followers across the internet.  Content creators and storytelling are the future - and we want to help build that future. Our goal is to be the Global leader for online learning. So far, 10,000+ students from over 140 countries have already taken our courses and are part of our community for a lifetime! We aim to grow these numbers by 10x in 2021.  ** Remote position**
industries: E-Learning

description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, well-organized individual who has a deep understanding of prospecting and developing strong relationships with customers.   Responsibilities Develop and execute strategies to drive business in new and existing markets Partner with Talent Acquisition to identify and recruit top sales talent Mentor employees to help them achieve individual & team objectives Penetrate new account and grow customer base Achieve sales target by developing sales plan and strategy Understand customers' need and provide accurate solution to improve their business needs Have a good market overview Any other duties as assigned by superior  Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent required Experience in IT solutions / software selling Preferably strong in IT knowledge Good interpersonal and communication skill Required language : English

About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  As Riskified’s VP & GM of Sales for APAC, you will be charged with building out and driving alignment across regional GTM teams to meet the financial targets. You will build a GTM strategy for the APAC region that aligns with and delivers on the company’s expansion and revenue goals. You will work closely and collaboratively with business leaders to generate growth, build the regional company culture, and establish strong partner relationships.  The VP & GM of Sales is charged with leading and developing the APAC region driving the company’s expansion strategy, and for generating profitable growth for the company. The VP & GM of Sales will be tasked with driving adoption of Riskified’s solution in the wider enterprise markets. He/She/They will continuously strive to improve Riskified’s sales process, build and growth partners ecosystem, people and tools, in order to deliver the highest value to its customers. This individual should have proven success selling SaaS products to enterprise level clients and be comfortable with lengthy sales cycles in high-growth technology sectors.  What You'll Be Doing Collaborate across cross-functional teams and business leaders to develop and deliver on a holistic GTM strategy that aligns with the company’s revenue goals Build, lead and scale the high performing enterprise sales team in the APAC region and drive performance against the growth targets for the business Act as the regional point of contact to C-level and other senior executives, aligning on company goals and priorities, as well as communicating corporate messaging to regional team members Build a regional company culture aligned with the company’s operating principles, building a sense of team and driving engagement and effectiveness Build valuable relationships in our key verticals to grow the Enterprise business Forecast, track and report sales performance with our internal tools Develop sales processes Establish account strategy, set goals, and manage pipeline Build strong, long-lasting relationships with mid-to-large enterprise level clients Plan, implement and manage sales activities and pipeline to meet annual revenue targets and business goals Guide opportunities through to successful closure Develop, expand and leverage partner ecosystem to expand new routes to market Scope projects, shape engagements, and help define business solutions that best satisfy clients' needs and achieve their desired business outcomes Responsible for new business across developers, tech platforms and other key buyers of location based services inclusive of API, SDK and the Foursquare Places Database Clearly and precisely communicate up and across the organization Develop strong relationships across the organization, including the legal, finance, product, marketing and engineering organizations Qualifications Experienced sales executive, with a minimum of 10 years experience building and scaling successful Enterprise B2B sales teams Proven success navigating large organizations by identifying decision makers and necessary processes for SaaS investments Broad understanding of the general internet, software, fintech, payment, and B2B SaaS marketplaces, strong industry contacts, and the ability to respond quickly to critical business issues Consistent track record as a high velocity performer throughout his or her career, preferably with strong revenue growth experience Demonstrated ability to execute, to make things happen, and to create ubiquitous brand awareness is key A reputation for team building and a demonstrated track record managing a global team to high levels of performance and establishing effective and efficient processes Demonstrated experience using data and market insights to drive decision making A natural inclination to solve problems in a creative and resourceful manner An ability to develop a coherent, forward-looking strategies to create new business opportunities Strong leadership skills and superb written and verbal communication skills In The News  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Inc.com: 15 Israeli Startups You Need to Know

description: Designation : Sales Operations Executive, Asia  Global Cyber Security  Hire Type : Agency Contract (1 year contract under agency payroll)  Reporting Officer: Sales Support Associate, APJ  Description Of Role  The primary purpose of the position is to support the Sales Operations and Sales Administration functions within Business Operations & Planning Department. This include but are not limited to order raising, billing and payment escalations.  Typical Duties Include Ensure timely and accurate day to day order rising, order closing and billings across various entities that Cyber is supporting. Work closely with Sales Support Team, Sales Specialists and Account Management team for order raising, and order closing related matters. Work closely with Product on customized orders processing and providing recommendations where available. Manage storage, archival of Sales Operations documentations such as correspondences, operating processes, instructions, and procedures and various other data. Assembles, and distributes information as required. Support the team in terms of escalations investigations, coordinate with internal stakeholders to expedite order processing, delivery, order closure and billing. Requirements Minimum A level or at least 2-3 years of relevant experience in order processing or billing Must have eye for details and ability to multitask Independent, good time management and sensitive to numbers Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to work with all levels Salary Range: $2,000 to $2,200

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.  About The Job Reporting to the Sales Manager, you lead your team in developing the IKEA business and your respective HFB (Home Furnishing Business). You come up with business and action plans for your responsible areas, and manage resource effectively. You optimize sales and profitability, by taking ownership of the range and actively promoting the IKEA commercial priorities and volume commitments. You act quickly on commercial opportunities and customer feedback, keeping an active eye on competition and take appropriate action when necessary and communicate with your matrix partner in the Service Office. You secure and develop our customer base through effective range presentation and sales steering, thereby ensuring an inspiring and enjoyable shopping experience for all IKEA visitors. As a leader, you are also to lead and develop your team by providing coaching and regular engagement. Qualifications You have at least 5 years of experience in a fast-paced retail industry and in a commercial environment. You have an interest in home furnishing and people’s everyday life at home You are self-motivated, analytical, and good at implementing commercial strategies, and guiding your team towards sales maximization. You have a proven ability to work as part of a team and actively selling through understanding your customers and their needs. You are a problem solver and decision maker, good at prioritizing and organizing your work and the work of others efficiently in a fast-paced retail environment. You are a strong and effective communicator; multi-tasking is second nature to you in the course of working with co-workers of all levels, both within and outside IKEA. You have strong leadership capabilities and able to guide, coach and lead a team of co-workers to excel as Sales Associates.
industries: Retail, Furniture, and Consumer Goods

description: About us: Zoho Corporation is a leading technology company with over 9000+ employees worldwide with customers in over 180+ countries. With more than 50 million business users around the globe, Zoho is excited to be driving innovation in every aspect of business software and is now looking for the right candidate to join our team. If you are interested to be associated with a global leader in cloud and business solutions, please read on.  Job Description: We are looking for a Regional Sales Director who would be responsible for all sales in the region. The regional role includes a broader ASEAN region including all countries from Hong Kong to Sri Lanka.  This role will work in collaboration with the sales, technical team and solution experts to deliver a compelling value proposition that helps win deals.  Responsibilities: Provide regional sales leadership and guidance to help grow revenue (direct and via partners) from new and existing customers. Mentor a regional sales, technical and partner team. Orchestrate internal teams to build collaboratively and present right solutions to customers Help, guide and mentor the team to meet the quarterly sales target set. Close complex sales deals and ensure customer success. Create presentations and proposals and meet with and talk to C-level executives as needed to close deals. Manage sales and partners.  Role Requirements: Proven 12+ years experience in software sales with the knowledge of handling direct and channel sales. You should be familiar with the region. Exceptional team leadership and people-management skills and the ability to work with multiple internal teams to close complex deals. You should have excellent communication skills. Being a thought leader, you will provide the right context and recommendations  to decision makers through extensive business and product knowledge You will have proven experience servicing Singapore and other countries in South East Asia as this is a must for job success. Collaborate with Zoho product teams and update product knowledge constantly. Experience in engaging with SI Partners/ Tier 1 resellers in the SaaS space would be an added advantage Experience with other CRM or relevant SaaS vendors would be an added advantage.  Qualifications: Degree or equivalent experience in relevant area. Years of experience : 12+ years experience in a sales role in software. Ability to write and communicate in fluent English and one local language. Salary includes variable Pay and will be based on experience & outcomes. This role is based out of our office in Singapore and will require you to travel for product  team interactions to our international headquarters in Chennai, India (~ yearly once) when the overall situation is favourable for travel.

At Evooq, we are building an ecosystem of solutions that combine data, technology and investment expertise.  Wealth and asset managers use our solutions to rapidly identify investment opportunities, make informed decisions and manage the risk and the lifecycle of the investments.  Description  You are a talented and driven candidate who will thrive in a fast paced sales environment. Ideal for an energetic and ambitious candidate who is looking for a career move into sales and is passionate about technology.  You will work alongside our sales team mentored by a Sales & Relationship Manager with more than 7+ years of track record and 10+ years of experience in banking and Fintech. You will learn firsthand how to identify the right targets, how to approach them, how to present our products, how to engage in procurement processes and discussions as well as in contract negotiations. By a mix of self-driven curiosity and willingness to learn about our products and services as well as mentoring you will become a specialist in B2B financial technology sales.  Scope  Your role is to seek out and speak to leads, carefully understand their needs, qualify opportunities, qualify out when necessary, then proceed to making recommendations to the sales team. Your focus will be on prospecting and approaching potential clients and partners, on leveraging partner contacts and your own network, and on managing the relationship with existing contacts. You will initiate the marketing effort by setting up meetings with key decision makers and by coordinating subsequent client meetings, presentations and workshops, while enhancing the required marketing material. We expect you to develop sustainable relationships with our clients and partners to be able to gain and translate their insights as input for the further development of our product and service offerings and identification of new market opportunities.  Qualifications Must be a self-motivated and positive person, accountable and resourceful Strong listening, verbal and written communications skills to be able to build relationships with clients and internal partners to gain buy-in and commitment Confidence in having 1-to-1 conversations that focus on unlocking opportunities Ability to prioritise tasks and manage time effectively Some experience in finance Bonus Education in finance Experience in sourcing new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails Exposure to Private banking and Wealth management domain Established network to key decision makers  About Us  Evooq is a global provider of technology-driven solutions for wealth and asset managers. We aim to radically simplify the investment process and make investments more accessible and more understandable for professional investors and their clients.  Our clients include some of the world’s largest banks, as well as wealth management companies and pension funds across Europe and Asia.  We have offices in Switzerland and Singapore.
industries: Financial Services

description: We are representing our client, MSAB for appoint a Area Sales Manager/ regional sales manager, based in Singapore.  Client info: MSAB is the global leader in forensic technology for mobile device examination, headquartered in Stockholm Sweden and with offices in Europe, USA, China and Australia, as well as a network of distributors across the globe. The company has been involved with mobile communications since 1984 and now has a focus on the forensic recovery, analysis and management of data from mobile devices. MSAB’s products have been used by Police, Law Enforcement, Military, Government Intelligence Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in over 100 countries worldwide to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.  In order to develop the business in Southeast Asia, Taiwan, South Korea, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, they have appointed us with the search and selection of a brilliant Area Sales Manager. The role will report directly to the VP Sales based in Stockholm.   Position Summary: As an Area Sales Manager, you should be results-driven and help the company to achieve its business goals. You have a strong communication skill and a customer service attitude. The Area Sales Manager should achieve sales and profitability objectives by effectively managing new, and existing accounts. The successful person will play a key role in increasing income and revenue by managing and negotiating with customers, generating leads and qualifying prospects.  Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities: ·      Set and monitor sales targets ·      Identify potential customers and set approach strategies ·      Develop strong and long-term client relationships ·      Act as the liaison between customers and the company ·      Resolve issues and handle complaints quickly and effectively ·      Negotiate contracts and close agreements ·      Support clients with new features and product launches ·      Get feedback and suggest ways to increase customer engagement ·      Collaborate with team to achieve better results ·      Set up meetings with potential customers and listen to their wishes and concerns ·      Continuous market and competition analysis, as well as the development and implementation of effective measures to exploit market potential. ·      Contribute to global sales efforts, marketing and product development of leading edge mobile forensic software and solutions. ·      Work with Marketing to design communication on new features/functions/products to expand ·      Strategic partner communication to see where we have gaps ·      Monthly calls or face-to-face meetings to ask how we can do better  Primary Objectives: Work with customer support team to resolve client’s “support cases”, needs/challenges/problems and ensure customer success Manage defined sales territory and create business plan on how to grow business for region: Prospect for and acquire new customers in your Region Manage, expand and deepen existing client relationships Generate new sales from license renewals, services and product portfolio  Responsible for attending industry trade shows in region, coordinating marketing resources and delivering presentations. Identify new areas to penetrate and expose to company portfolio  Job requirements: A bachelor’s degree or significant relevant work experience At least 4 years of regional SEA/APAC market working experience Good experience in managing distributors Solid experience with CRM software and MS Office (particularly MS Excel) Strong analytical and negotiation skills Self-motivated and driven Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude Prior government or law enforcement sales experience Software or hardware sales experience Ability to learn a technical product High degree of autonomy, results orientation and negotiation skills with the aim of establishing contacts with relevant contact persons and decision-makers at a high communicative level Ability to travel regularly within your territory
industries: Security and Investigations, Computer Software, and Public Safety

description: , Singapore  Job Family Group  Commercial and Retail  Worker Type  Regular  Posting Start Date  September 15, 2021  Business Unit  Downstream  Experience Level  Experienced Professionals  Job Description  Are you a bottom-line, results driven individual that prioritizes the customer in every decision? Do you enjoy growing/strengthening customer relationships by developing win-win value propositions with them? Are you a seasoned professional sales in Polyurethane or Polyol industry? If so, then the Senior Sales Manager position is a highly impactful position managing customer accounts in the Chemicals and Products portfolio.  What's The Role  Customer’s needs are rapidly changing especially with respect to sustainability. The Senior Sales Manager will manage complex customer relationships to understand their needs and, with the GM Commercial for the region and Marketing, deliver value propositions that meet their requirements. Traditional sales accountabilities such as HSSE, negotiating and managing contracts, and relationship management are table stakes for this role. Within Shell, the Sales Manager is expected to be the ‘voice of the customer and be responsible for delivering a customer centric environment to the relationships they manage.  The Key Accountabilities Of This Roles Executing the commercial HSSE Plan in partnership with Site and Supply Operations colleagues Deliver the Sales plan Volume & Margin targets agreed in the annual Business Plan Day-to-day management of customer relationships to maximize value for Shell with a customer centric focus Lead large, strategic negotiations that deliver win-win value propositions to our customers Complete ownership of all your customer contracts, including ensuring full contract value delivery through the Contract Performance Management process Expectation that the Sales Manager is aware of all aspects of the customer relationship and defines connections to increase customer centricity Develop/strengthen strategic customer relationships to help enable Chemical + Product business growth ambitions Help GM Commercial and Marketing develop and execute Commercial Contracting Strategy Develop and deliver sales related Integrated Performance Management tactics Support Marketing organization by gathering market intelligence, including supply/demand changes, competitive market pricing and movement in overall market dynamics Liaise closely with Shell Product Stewardship, Supply, and HSSE teams for commercial contract delivery What We Need From You  We are looking for results driven and customer centric individuals that have the following skills: Proven relationship management experience in a B2B setting Existing working experiences and knowledge in the Polyurethane or Polyol industry, especially chemical product and product application knowledges 3D Negotiation skills Strong collaboration skills Excellent communication skills Financial and business acumen Company Description  Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.  An innovative place to work  There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.  Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.  An inclusive place to work  To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential. We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there. We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology. We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application. A rewarding place to work  Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.  We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.  Disclaimer  Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Oil & Energy

description: Who are we?  Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.  We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.  A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.  Responsibilities  Pre-Sales Administration and Transactions Coordination Coordinates all pre-sales activity for small- and medium-size customers Collects complete and correct data upfront Validates data for accuracy Keeps systems up-to-date with customer information and legal documents Manages cases according to regional Case Management guidelines Oversees quote approval process Assists with New Customer set up Handles escalation between Sales Support and other internal groups Operates in the optimized case load range Works on small projects in addition to everyday role Customer Engagement Follows up with customer on required documents and missing information Ensures Customer PO compliance Follows up on orders Assists with customer questions via email or phone Assists with gathering preliminary QBR info Complex Deal Support Project manages single country, large, complex deals Manages all changes and keeps the quote and documents up to date Engages cross-functional teams to coordinate requirements against deadlines Data Integrity Handles Internal Service Tickets to resolve Credit and Billing issues Executes Data corrections in Siebel based on fall out report Facilitates SFDC opportunity management by cleaning up opportunities based on guidelines Process and Policy adoption and reinforcement Trains Sales reps on new tools, processes, and policies Delivers refresher trainings to address knowledge gaps Communicates process improvements and enhancements to Sales Team Job Requirements Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience, preferably in a computer-related field At least 1 year of experience in Project Management/ Quote Support / Customer Support Organization/Telco Siebel, Salesforce, Excel knowledge/experience beneficial English written and speaking proficiency level-high You can also check out our YouTube page to find out more about us: https://careers.equinix.com/jobs/search  This Job Description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties to meet the ongoing organisational needs.  Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

description: We welcome all people. We seek to recruit, develop and retain talented people from all backgrounds. If you are not sure that you’re 100% qualified, but up for the challenge - we want you to apply. Your Impact In this role you will work to prospect and generate leads for our top brands to increase their brand presence and market share. You’ll be the first point of contact for your customers, as you get them excited, handle objections, and move them through the sales pipeline. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a growing sales team and develop your selling skills! Your Role You will have the opportunity to work, collaborate and grow across a wide array of projects, including: Prospecting and generating leads Collaborating closely with our clients to develop strategies for target employers, prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Starting and establishing exciting new relationships, opportunities, and meetings with prospective customers Qualifying new opportunities and handling complex objections Creating significant outbound activity via prospecting, targeted cold-calling and emailing Always improving your approach by using data-driven solutions to track your results Meeting - and exceeding! - your weekly quota to help hit your own growth objectives Your Experience Energetic and self-motivated with the ability to work independently within a collaborative team environment Highly dependable with excellent time management skills You’re personable, professional and genuine Willing and coachable.  You’re open to new ideas and trying things out to see what works and what doesn’t.

description: This role is responsible for working with management (country and regional) to lead, shape and build Sales Force Effectiveness capabilities and standards across APAC. Develop Salesforce Consultation toolkits, selling processes and standards, enabled by Sales Force Platform, focused on transforming sell-in to sell-out customer propositions. Develop and implement customer segmentation based selling framework, sales force deployment, salesforce performance and incentives in line with customer and channel strategy. Lead and develop coaching capabilities and processes of sales leaders to raise standards in business consultation and competitive selling skills. Shape and implement Sales Force Effectiveness and Coaching data capture and performance goals through a newly designed launch and expansion of Sales Force platform.  Partners with the Commercial and country sales leads in the development and preparation of Sales Force Effectiveness and Sales Force Training plans, ensuring the consistency of those plans with the broader business requirements. Ensures the timely integration of defined objectives and expectations. Prepares specific business plans for new products and/or service lines. Participates in the planning, evaluation and execution of key business alliances. Develops and implements a system of monitoring and reporting progress on established strategic and tactical objectives; evaluates and reports on alternatives when course corrections are needed. Implements new business technology opportunities to meet evolving business and market requirements. Monitors expenses from and the implementation of an annual operating budget and capital budgets.  Sales Force Effectiveness (SFE), APAC (excluding Japan) Co-create strategic SFE vision, strategies, and initiatives, in close collaboration with markets, and in support of the customer and channel strategies for the business, to create a world class sales force Shape the deployment of Salesforce software platform for CRM. Lead, shape, and build SFE capabilities, standards, and processes, deployed in accordance with local nuance Lead, and develop selling framework (including selling toolkits & customer selling proposition), rooted into customer segmentation framework, to disproportionately grow the priority customers Lead and shape SFE & coaching enablers/metrics through a newly designed launch & expansion of Sales Force Platform Drive continuous improvement through management of data, leveraging of technology, and the redesign of business processes, creating business sustainability across the organization. Implement SFE performance dashboards for ongoing monitoring and course correction, as needed Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital  Sales Training, APAC (excluding Japan) Leads development and implementation of a sales training program, rooted in the competency framework and in support of the commercial strategy Co-create, in partnership with markets, a sales training curriculum to dial up the critical skills (i.e. data literacy) to aid in successful implementation of the commercial strategy to win with customers Leverage technology for ongoing monitoring of training effectiveness and ROI Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital  Qualifications Master's Degree or Equivalent. Generally requires 8-10 years related experience of successful commercial management, such as marketing, sales and business development. Prior experience in commercial excellence and/ or sales force effectiveness in a regional setting preferred. Strong experience in design and implementation of Salesforce software platform for CRM. Strong and proven track record in Sales Management & Processes, Coaching, Customer Engagement & Account Management, Competitive Selling Skills, and end-to-end Order Flow Management. Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with all relevant stakeholders like customers, partners, suppliers and employees, driving collaboration across multiple functions, teams and geographies. Strong executional focus with a keen eye for details Proven ability to deliver results in challenging and complex environments. Strong Project Management.  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-  Organization  Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105951875W
