description: The Sales Planning & Reporting Executive is responsible for supporting all sales planning and reporting activities across the relevant Brands and channels to drive effective and efficient sales execution. This includes periodic reporting and analysis, preparation of sales targets, order management, incentive programs / reporting, and general reporting, and analytical activities to support sales activities across the relevant channels.  Key Responsibilities Prepares weekly / monthly sales reports for the relevant Brands / channels, including analytics and insights to determine opportunities for improvement Manages monthly / annual sales target data for the relevant doors (FSS, FSF, DS etc) Develops monthly door retail programs and orders products through sales analysis Sets monthly sales target by category and develops short-term incentive programs to drives sales in partnership with Brand Marketing and Commercial Sales Partners with Brand Marketing and Education (Brand and Commercial) to develop retail programs to support effective in-market execution for ACEs and drive sales improvement Analyzes sales data post-implementation of key door programs and provide insights for improvement Places and manages orders for the relevant channels Manages monthly sales budget and people costs for the relevant Brand Clusters Supports with the relevant information, data and analytics for sales incentive programs and payments Provides data and analytics to support new door openings and closures Performs other ad hoc planning and reporting activities for Brand Marketing and Commercial Sales team as requested Qualifications Degree in Sales & Marketing/ Business Management or equivalent Minimum 3-4 years of experience in the retail / beauty industry preferred IT savvy and good working knowledge on computer software (eg. Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint & Word) Good coordination and communication skills and fluent in both written and oral English Analytical and enjoys working with numbers and presentation slides Highly adaptable team player Well-organized and proactive in following up Experience with SAP is preferred

description: Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!  Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.  What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!  Who We Are  Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.  Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 2,400 global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 130 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!  With over 500 global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.  The Opportunity  We, at Flywire, are seeking a Senior Sales Manager who will spend most of their time with prospective clients! Flywire is seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Sales Manager to join our growing team in Singapore for the Asia market (Less Japan & ANZ). This position is accountable for the full sales cycle from start to getting them onboard, pursuing new business and opportunities in order to effectively acquire, lead, and profitably grow our client database. This person will convert client conversations into qualified, developed, proposed, and closed sales opportunities. Focus on developing strategic education accounts Work autonomously to meet and exceed sales targets Investigate and solve problems for clients by tailoring plans which addresses their needs Develop in-depth knowledge of the business product offering and value proposition Work with internal teams to engage audiences and develop business strategies Be involved in Presentations, Demos and events to build up a robust client base Here’s What We’re Looking For: At least 8 years of experience in selling across APAC Experience in sourcing prospects - including account development and cold calling Experience in the Education or payments industry will be advantageous Experience in planning and implementing sales strategies Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office/ Google Workspace What We Offer Competitive compensation, including stock options Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams) Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!) Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!) Submit today and get started!  We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect 4-5 rounds of interviews with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a homework assignment (don’t worry - this is the fun part!) your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.  Additional Information  Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.
industries: Financial Services

description: We are currently looking for skilled, proactive, and motivated individuals who can play an integral role in our current project in Singapore. This is a great opportunity for candidates seeking a challenging and rewarding role, with opportunities to develop themselves further in Project and People Management. Key responsibilities and expectations: Being able to deliver an above-and-beyond sales experience in-person Set proper expectations for our prospects to have an incredible first impression of our client’s products and services Learn and understand the system and process inside and out. Duplicate the sales process by utilizing the system and structure Go through sales training including consistent 1:1s with our sales leaders Candidate Qualifications: Positivity!  You'll be working in a highly demanding and fast-paced, ever evolving work environment Resilient. You can withstand rejection and will work tirelessly to improve A record breaker. You like to know what the top achievements are so you can break them and place yourself there. A coachable person who isn’t looking to reinvent the wheel. You want to learn from those who have spent years developing best practices surrounding this sales process Strong track record of doing your best whether in school, extracurriculars, internships, military, or other job experiences With the above said, we always encourage people of all backgrounds, and all experiences, to apply. More than anyone else, we understand that job requisitions don't always allow your unique work history to shine, and we invite you to show us what you know!

description: As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for building strong customer relationships in the field and ensuring an outstanding customer experience with existing and potential customers.  You Will Develop an understanding of customers’ business and solution requirements Gain share of spend across Dell Technologies portfolio of technology solutions: client, server, storage, networking, software, security and led services Run territory and or accounts, including account planning, sales forecasting, engaging cross-functional resources and working with the virtual teams to ensure alignment across the organizations Regularly engage with decision makers at client facilities in performing primary duties Provide sales leadership and experience on large, sophisticated opportunities Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: 8 to 12 years of experience selling technology solutions Extraordinary customer management and strategic selling skills Aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions tackle business problems Strong communication, collaboration and executive presentation skills, and the ability to provide insight and thought leadership to senior management Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s degree (BS/BA)

description: Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.  Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?  Binance is looking for an experienced forex/institutional sales professional or account manager from the traditional finance or crypto industry to spearhead our growth in this space and provide leadership to the sales team.  This role will leverage relationship development, process creation and management ability in order to educate, introduce and inspire new investment into the world of cryptocurrency from major institutional clients and high-net-worth individuals from a global market.  Responsibilities Manage a large portfolio of clients including institutions, HNW individuals, private bank customers, brokers, futures institutions, commercial banks, etc. Acquire and develop trust relationships with institutional clients globally Originate new institutional clients and identify new business opportunities in the crypto industry Understand the challenges of our clients and assess the activities of our competitors to proactively satisfy and retain our clients Provide thought leadership for Binance with a customer-focused, regulatory-awareness attitude Educate new and existing clients on the exciting world of cryptocurrency Requirements At least 3 years of working experience in sales and client services with an international financial background in banking, investment services, custody, etc. Detail-oriented, results focused individual who can work with minimal supervision Passionate about the crypto industry Industry experience would be advantageous but not essential Excellent oral and written communication skills Conditions Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career Competitive salary Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

description: SalesTribe is exclusively partnered with Asia Market Entry; a modern business who help international software companies that want to land and expand into the Asia Pacific region. Without the heavy upfront investment.  Established in 2012, Asia Market Entry has worked with a number of up and coming technology vendors to build out Asia expansion strategies, drive partner and channel programs, build government relations and incorporate in Singapore.  The team enjoy extreme client loyalty and are now looking to accelerate the business through the rest of 2021 and beyond.  As a Business Development Advisor, you will be a critical cog in the wheel for their success.  What will you do? Work closely with partner organisations to position enterprise software solutions to the Asia Market. Following up on incoming leads received in the region on behalf of AME customers. Channel development on behalf of AME customers, including researching, pitching, and securing an ecosystem of partnerships to complement AME customers, including system integrators, resellers, and consultants. Managing existing accounts, including increasing AME revenue from existing accounts through the upsell of additional services, offerings and markets. Take a strategic approach to prospecting within new industries and targeting new companies Partnering with marketing to plan and organise marketing campaigns and initiatives, including webinars, seminars, whitepapers, and trade events.  What do you have? Experience in the technology world, in a customer facing role. A hunger and drive to get into a full cycle sales role. Organisational skills, able to manage multiple priorities. A can-do, high-energy attitude, driven to exceed goals A passion for helping people and an understanding An ability to self-motivate and work within a start-up environment  Asia Market Entry is a wonderful entry to the world of technology sales. Giving you exposure to a wide technology landscape, incredible mentors and a career path that sets you up for success. The future is very bright.  If you would like to discuss this role further, please apply or contact Peter Dowling on 97980122 or by sending your CV to peter@salestribe.com

description: Be part of a growing impact e-commerce platform working with Fortune 500 clients  Grow and learn from an experienced team, and feel great knowing that your work is meaningful and creates impact.  Market for Good is the first online B2B marketplace for sustainable impact supporting the United Nations Social Development Goals. This unique platform helps companies to implement their ESG goals, and measure their impact in every purchase and over time.  The Primary Roles Of The Account Manager Are To Position Market for Good as the leading platform for sustainable impact, top provider of gifts, products and, services with a social cause for corporates capture new business accounts and maintain existing customers nurture them into long-term business relationships with some targeted as key accounts develop these key accounts into sustainable high revenue annuity businesses Other Roles And Responsibilities Include  Roles & Responsibilities  Business Development Know the market and environment – trends, opportunities, competition, government regulations on the environment and sustainability etc Identify and target selected potential customers as agreed with Dagiz management Know the targeted accounts – their business needs for corporate gifts and services Identify the targeted accounts as key accounts Develop business plan for each key account and update / calendarize the plan on an-going basis of the customers’ requirements, events, CSR and HR programs for corporate gifts Engage key accounts on a regular basis to build customer intimacy Manage and update the CRM system Participate actively in the ecosystem – customers, beneficiaries, business partners, relevant government agencies, suppliers of services etc Sales Engage with the customers to convert their needs into sales Be creative and agile in meeting customers’ requests especially for special events Work and communicate with the internal team and business partners to make the sales happen, including cross-selling and up-selling and any challenges faced Ensure end-to-end sales completion from order to cash with on-time delivery and quality service Capture the sales into the CRM system Perform sales analysis to gain insights, trends to protect and enhance the company’s reputation You will be assigned any other responsibilities as required in carrying out your work Requirements Excellent communication skills Personable, creative, resourceful and strong problem-solving skills Proven sales track record Proficiency in English Relevant market knowledge Communication and negotiation skills Ability to build rapport

description: About The Role: Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‘APAC’) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC. In this role, you’ll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel’s indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements. This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities: Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers’ needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're looking for someone who has: Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region. Preferred Qualifications: 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred.
industries: Computer Software

description: Company Overview: Digital Consulting Pte Ltd is a one-of-a-kind consulting agency that provides SMEs with a completely custom, step-by-step plan to “go digital” that they can implement at their own pace and convenience. Our concept will help SMEs understand how to transform their business to become more attractive to their customers, lower their costs, and improve the quality of their products and services.  Job Description: Seeking a highly motivated and energetic candidate for the position of Sales Account Manager to join the Digital Consulting team. The ability to work in a fast paced environment, under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism is crucial to this role. Reporting directly to the company director and regional lead, you will be a key strategic member of the sales team. This role would extend our reach through exploration of new and untapped business opportunities and relationships.  Job Highlights: Competitive basic pay with high sales commissions Career growth opportunities  Friendly work environment  Responsibilities:  Responsible for prospecting, managing & maintaining good relationships with customers.  Developing new accounts and working with relevant parties for lead flow generation.  Understand and keep abreast of market trends, relaying the information to management.  Submit regular reports covering sales activities, performance and plans.  Has the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality is crucial to this role.  Good communication skills and attention to detail are equally important.  Work closely with the company director and regional lead to brainstorm and execute new strategies  Continuously analyse individual and team performance and take necessary steps to ensure growth. Meet rigorous weekly reporting requirements  Requirements:  Sales & Marketing with minimum 1 to 2 years sales experience.  Out-going, sociable and ability to work independently. Self-motivated with a strong affinity for problem solving.  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.  Please send your CV and starting date to: application@digital-consulting.co  We look forward to meeting you!

This Job is supported by SGUP.  Sanford C. Bernstein wishes to recruit an Institutional Equity salesperson to  work closely with its existing sales team in Singapore, and to focus on both Long Only and Hedge Fund clients. He/she will participate in continuing to build a regional presence in Asia for Bernstein.  As An Institutional Sales Associate, You Will Acquire expertise in multiple equity products and industries while working with our leading global research product, senior sales people, and best-in-class trade execution teams. Interact directly with key investment decision makers at institutional clients including mutual funds, hedge funds, and advisors managing pensions and endowments. Have a high level of responsibility and be empowered to make an important contribution to a sales group organized around geography and investment mandate. While our culture is intellectually rigorous, it is also very collegial and fun. Associates participate in a range of activities including philanthropy, social events, mentoring and annual on- and off-sites.  Qualification  Our Sales Associates Typically Possess Graduated on or before 2019 Track records of outstanding academic performance Breadth of interests and a cosmopolitan outlook Excellent analytical skills Intellectual curiosity Extracurricular activities and leadership Strong interpersonal skills Strong communicators Comfortable in a quantitative environment with a high level of attention to detail Committed to client service We want consummate team players who seek a highly rigorous and challenging environment for their career development. Some Institutional Sales Associates will advance to more senior, producing positions, while others may go on to graduate school.  Sanford C. Bernstein is widely recognized as Wall Street's premier sell-side research and brokerage firm, with a global equity trading platform that spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia. Our firm was founded in the U.S. in 1967 and in the U.K. in 1999. Our research and trading capabilities are sought out by leading investment managers around the world, and we are annually ranked at the top of our industry by acknowledged arbiters. In independent surveys of major institutional clients, Bernstein's research is ranked #1 for overall quality, industry knowledge, most trusted, best detailed financial analysis, major company studies, most useful valuation frameworks and best original research. In Institutional Investor’s latest annual client survey, the leading survey by which research analysts in our industry are evaluated, over 90% of our U.S. analysts and the majority of our European Analysts were recognized as among the best in their respective fields – more than any other firm in our industry. We began operations in Hong Kong in 2010, and now cover a range of sectors across Asia. Our European research team is also home to Extel's #1-ranked analyst across Europe. We are a wholly-owned subsidiary of our buy-side parent, AllianceBernstein.  Singapore
